BT1-001.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate in battles against Security Digimon?

BT1-001.answer: A: No, if you declared an attack against your opponent, this card's effect doesn't activate, even if they use another Digimon to block it.[1]
BT1-001.question: Q: I attack my opponent using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

BT1-002.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if it is being given ＜Piercing＞ by the effect of an Option card or Tamer?

BT1-003.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't checked by this effect.[1]
BT1-003.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?

BT1-004.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't checked by this effect.[1]
BT1-004.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect apply if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in the breeding area?

BT1-007.answer: A: No. Since it doesn't specify "in the breeding area," the effect doesn't check the breeding area. Thus, it can't meet the requirements of this card's effect.[1]
BT1-007.question: Q: If I've digivolved in the breeding area during the current turn, does that meet the requirements of "If you've digivolved this turn"?
Q: If I've digivolved during the current turn using the effect of [BT1-078 Jagamon], that meet the requirements of "If you've digivolved this turn"?

BT1-010.question: Q: Can I use this Digimon's effect to add Tamer cards to my hand that aren't red?

BT1-010.answer: A: Yes, you can. You reveal as many cards as possible from your deck.[1]
BT1-010.question: Q: Can I activate this card's effect when I have 4 or fewer cards in your deck?

BT1-011.question: Q: Does this Digimon's effect count cards that have "Agumon" in their card names, even if it's not a perfect match?

BT1-011.answer: A: "Your recycle bin" is another word for "your trash" -- it's where cards go when they're deleted or trashed.
BT1-011.question: Q: What does "your recycle bin" refer to?

BT1-012.answer: A: It lasts until the end of the turn you activated it.[1]
BT1-012.question: Q: How long does the 2000 DP boost from this card's inherited effect last?

BT1-012.answer: A: Yes, the +2000 DP boost ends.[1]
BT1-012.question: Q: I activate this card's inherited effect to boost its DP. Later, this digivolution card is trashed. Does the DP boost go away?

BT1-012.answer: A: No. If your opponent doesn't block, the effect doesn't activate.  Regardless of what the target of attack is, the effect activates when a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards attacks an opponent's Digimon and has its attack target changed to a blocking opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT1-012.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when attacking an opponent's Digimon?

BT1-012.answer: A: No, as it does not specify "for the turn" it loses the boost as soon as the inherited effect was lost.[2]
BT1-012.question: Q: If after activating this effect, the Digimon is hit by ＜De-Digivolve＞ so that it becomes this card again. Does the Digimon keep the boost if it digivolves into a new Digimon?

BT1-017.question: Q: I use this card's effect to give one of my other Digimon ＜Security A. +1＞. If this Digimon is then removed from my battle area later in the turn, does the ＜Security A. +1＞ effect also go away?
Q: Can I use this Digimon's effect to target [Birdramon] itself?
Q: I use this card's effect to give one of my other Digimon ＜Security A. +1＞. If that Digimon digivolves, does it retain ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT1-018.answer: A: No. When your memory drops to 2 or less, it loses the ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card's effect, preventing you from performing the second check.[1]
BT1-018.question: Q: I have 3 memory, and use this card's effect to gain ＜Security A. +1＞ and attack my opponent. During the check, [ST2-13 Hammer Spark] is flipped over, and its -2 memory security effect reduces my memory to 1. Can I perform a second check?

BT1-021.answer: A: The effect has already activated, so you lose 3 memory at end of turn.[1]
BT1-021.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If this Digimon is deleted as a result of the attack, do I still lose 3 memory at end of turn?

BT1-021.answer: A: Announcing the pass moves the memory counter to 3 on your opponent's side. Since it's the end of the turn, you then lose an additional 3 memory, moving the memory counter to 6 on your opponent's side.[1]
BT1-021.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If I then announce that I'm passing, how much memory do I lose?

BT1-022.answer: A: No. If your opponent doesn't block, the effect doesn't activate. Regardless of what the target of attack is, the effect activates when a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards attacks an opponent's Digimon and has its attack target changed to a blocking opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT1-022.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when attacking an opponent's Digimon?

BT1-023.question: Q: My opponent has used an Option card or other effect to give one of their Digimon ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's effect to delete that Digimon?

BT1-025.answer: A: Since the security effect didn't activate, the card goes to the trash.[1]
BT1-025.question: Q: This card performs a security check, flipping over an Option card with a security effect. What happens to the Option card if its effect didn't activate?

BT1-030.answer: A: Yes, after all effects and attacks resolve, it becomes your turn.[1]
BT1-030.question: Q: During my opponent's turn, a Digimon with this digivolution card is deleted, and this card's inherited effect moves the memory gauge to 1 on my side. Is it now my turn?

BT1-030.answer: A: Yes, it does. Turns only switch after all attacks and effects activate and finish, so it becomes your turn after the ＜Piercing＞ check is performed and the attack finishes.[1]
BT1-030.question: Q: One of my Digimon with this digivolution card is deleted after blocking an opponent's Digimon with ＜Piercing＞. As a result, I gain 1 memory, moving the memory gauge to 1 on my side. Does my opponent's ＜Piercing＞ effect activate?

BT1-033.answer: A: It ends as soon as your opponent no longer has any Digimon with no digivolution cards.[1]
BT1-033.question: Q: During my turn, all of my opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards are deleted. What happens to this card's inherited effect?

BT1-033.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't checked by this effect.[1]
BT1-033.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?

BT1-034.answer: A: If you have a Digimon with this inherited effect, your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards can't block this Digimon's attack.[1]
BT1-034.question: Q: "This Digimon can't be blocked by your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards." How does this effect work, exactly?

BT1-035.answer: A: Yes, after all effects and attacks resolve, it becomes your turn.[1]
BT1-035.question: Q: This card is deleted during my opponent's turn. Its effect moves the memory gauge to 1 on my side. Is it now my turn?

BT1-039.answer: A: No, you can't. This effect can only be activated after declaring an attack, before your opponent's reaction timing window.[1]
BT1-039.question: Q: Can I activate this card's effect after I attack with it and resolve all battles and checks?

BT1-039.answer: A: No, you can't. This effect can only be activated after the attack declaration and before the counter timing.[1]
BT1-039.question: Q: Can I activate this card's effect after I attack with it and resolve all battles and checks?

BT1-039.answer: A: No. The effect is voluntary.[1]
BT1-039.question: Q: Do I have to use this card's effect when I attack with it?

BT1-040.answer: A: Yes, the effect has already activated, so you lose 3 memory at end of turn.[1]
BT1-040.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If this Digimon is deleted as a result of the attack, do I still lose 3 memory at end of turn?

BT1-040.answer: A: Announcing the pass moves the memory counter to 3 on your opponent's side. Since it's the end of the turn, you then lose an additional 3 memory, moving the memory counter to 6 on your opponent's side.[1]
BT1-040.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If I then announce that I'm passing, how much memory do I lose?

BT1-041.answer: A: No, you only gain 1 memory, regardless of how many Digimon your opponent has with no digivolution cards.[1]
BT1-041.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to gain 1 memory for each Digimon my opponent has with no digivolution cards?

BT1-041.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't checked by this effect.[1]
BT1-041.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?

BT1-042.answer: A: Yes. This card's Japanese name (ローダーレオモン) has "Leomon" (レオモン) in its name.
BT1-042.question: Q: Does this card have [Leomon] in its name?

BT1-043.answer: A: No, if you use this card's effect on an opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards, nothing happens.
BT1-043.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete an opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards?

BT1-044.answer: A: No, Digi-Egg cards aren't Digimon cards, so they can't be played with this effect.[1]
BT1-044.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to play a Digi-Egg in its digivolution cards to my battle area?

BT1-044.answer: A: No, it's treated as a separate Digimon, and enters play unsuspended.[1]
BT1-044.question: Q: I suspend this card as I declare its attack. If I use its effect to play a Digimon card from its digivolution cards, does that Digimon enter play suspended?

BT1-044.answer: A: No, it's treated as a separate Digimon, and doesn't receive any effects that currently apply to the original Digimon.[1]
BT1-044.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon card from its digivolution cards, does that Digimon carry over any effects currently applied to this Digimon?
Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon card with an [On Play] effect, does that effect activate as the Digimon enters play?

BT1-044.answer: A: It activates immediately after the card enters play. Even if there are other [When Attacking] and "when one of your Digimon attacks" effects waiting to be activated, the [On Play] effect was just triggered, so it activates first.[1]
BT1-044.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon card with an [On Play] effect, when does that effect activate?

BT1-044.answer: A: No, it's considered to have just entered play, so it can't attack.[1]
BT1-044.question: Q: I use this card's effect to play a Digimon card. Can it attack this turn?

BT1-044.answer: A: Yes, as long as you are able to.[1]
BT1-044.question: Q: If this Digimon has a level 4 or lower Digimon card in its digivolution cards, do I have to activate this card's effect?

BT1-047.answer: A: No, it's considered to have just entered play, so it can't attack.[1]
BT1-047.question: Q: I use [BT1-056 Petermon]'s effect to play this Digimon. Can it attack this turn?

BT1-048.answer: A: Yes, you can. When you do, reveal as many cards from your deck as is possible.[1]
BT1-048.question: Q: Can I activate this card's effect when I have 3 or fewer cards in my deck?

BT1-049.answer: A: No, if multiple Digimon are deleted at the same time, you can only draw 1 card.[1]
BT1-049.question: Q: Two of my opponent's Digimon reach zero DP and are deleted simultaneously. Can I draw 2 cards?

BT1-049.answer: A: No, the deletion of multiple Digimon using [BT2-041 ShineGreymon]'s skill is treated as occurring at the same timing, so you only draw 1 card.[1]
BT1-049.question: Q: I use BT2-041 [ShineGreymon]'s [When Digivolving] effect to delete 2 or more of my opponent's Digimon simultaneously. Does this mean I can draw 2 cards?

BT1-053.question: Q: I use an effect to play a Digimon while this Digimon is suspended. Can I trigger ＜Draw 1＞?

BT1-053.answer: A: No, moving a Digimon between areas is different from playing it, so you can't draw a card.[1]
BT1-053.question: Q: During my breeding phase, I move a level 3 Digimon from my breeding area to my battle area. Can I draw a card off this card's effect?

BT1-054.answer: A: No battle occurs, and the attack ends. If there are other When Attacking effects, "when one of your Digimon attacks" effects, and/or effects activated at blocker timing, they activate, and then the attack ends.[1]
BT1-054.question: Q: I use this Digimon to attack an opponent's Digimon, then use this Digimon's effect to reduce the opponent's Digimon to 0 DP. What happens to the attack?

BT1-054.answer: A: No, the effect has already activated, so the -2000 DP lasts until the end of the turn. [1]
BT1-054.question: Q: After I use this Digimon's effect to give an opponent's Digimon -2000 DP, my memory drops to 2 or less. Does my opponent's Digimon revert to its original DP?

BT1-056.answer: A: No, you can't. You can only play 1 copy from either your hand or trash.[1]
BT1-056.question: Q: When using this card's effect to play [BT1-047 Tinkermon], can I play 1 each from my hand and trash?

BT1-056.answer: A: No, it's considered to have just entered play, so it can't attack.[1]
BT1-056.question: Q: I use this card's effect to play a Digimon card. Can it attack this turn?

BT1-056.answer: A: "Your recycle bin" is another word for "your trash" -- it's where cards go when they're deleted or trashed.
BT1-056.question: Q: What does "your recycle bin" refer to?

BT1-058.answer: A: Yes, the effect has already activated, so you lose 3 memory at end of turn.[1]
BT1-058.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If this Digimon is deleted as a result of the attack, do I still lose 3 memory at end of turn?

BT1-058.answer: A: Announcing the pass moves the memory counter to 3 on your opponent's side. Since it's the end of the turn, you then lose an additional 3 memory, moving the memory counter to 6 on your opponent's side.[1]
BT1-058.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If I then announce that I'm passing, how much memory do I lose?

BT1-060.answer: A: Because the effect grants +1000 DP for every 3 security cards you have, no DP bonus is granted when you have 2 or fewer security cards.[1]
BT1-060.question: Q: I have 2 or fewer security cards left. What happens to this card's inherited effect?

BT1-061.answer: A: No. Choose as many Digimon as you can. The only time you can choose 1 Digimon is when your opponent only has 1 Digimon in play.[1]
BT1-061.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to only choose 1 of my opponent's Digimon?
Q: Can I use this card's effect to give 1 Digimon -6000 DP?

BT1-063.answer: A: No. It only grants ＜Security A. +1＞, no matter how many security cards you have.[1]
BT1-063.question: Q: I have 6 security cards. Does this card's effect give this Digimon <Security Attack +2>?

BT1-066.answer: A: [When Attacking] happens before ＜Blocker＞. So you cannot negate the block, but you can prevent it from suspending itself to block. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT1-066.question: Q: My opponent declares a block with one of their Digimon. Can I use this card's inherited effect to suspend that Digimon, negating the block?

BT1-067.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to add a level 4 Digimon card that isn't green to my hand?

BT1-072.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if this Digimon's attack effect causes your memory to move to 1 or greater on your opponent's side, it doesn't become your opponent's turn until the end of the attack.[1]
BT1-072.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack when I have 2 or less memory?

BT1-074.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to add a level 5+ Digimon card that isn't green to my hand?

BT1-075.answer: A: Yes, the effect has already activated, so you lose 3 memory at end of turn.[1]
BT1-075.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If this Digimon is deleted as a result of the attack, do I still lose 3 memory at end of turn?

BT1-075.answer: A: Announcing the pass moves the memory counter to 3 on your opponent's side. Since it's the end of the turn, you then lose an additional 3 memory, moving the memory counter to 6 on your opponent's side.[1]
BT1-075.question: Q: I attack with this card, and gain 3 memory from the card's attack effect. If I then announce that I'm passing, how much memory do I lose?

BT1-076.answer: A: No, you only gain 1 memory, no matter how many suspended Digimon your opponent has.[1]
BT1-076.question: Q: My opponent has 4 suspended Digimon. Does this card's inherited effect gain me 2 memory?

BT1-077.answer: A: No, this effect doesn't activate during battles with Security Digimon.[1]
BT1-077.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate during battles with my opponent's Security Digimon?

BT1-077.answer: A: Yes, it activates when your opponent's Digimon is attacked and deleted during the block, even if it wasn't the target of attack.[1]
BT1-077.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate during battles where my opponent blocks the attack?

BT1-078.answer: A: No, the card text says "you can," so you can choose not to digivolve.[1]
BT1-078.question: Q: If I reveal a green level 6 Digimon card with this card's effect, do I have to digivolve into it?
Q: I reveal 2 or more green level 6 Digimon cards with this card's effect. Can I choose which card to digivolve into?

BT1-078.answer: A: No, you can't. Even if you meet the digivolution requirements, this card's effect only allows you to digivolve into green level 6 Digimon cards.[1]
BT1-078.question: Q: I reveal a level 6 Digimon card that isn't green with this card's effect. Can I digivolve into that card?

BT1-078.answer: A: Yes, you can. When you do, reveal as many cards from your deck as is possible.[1]
BT1-078.question: Q: Can I activate this card's effect when there are 2 or fewer cards in my deck?

BT1-081.answer: A: Yes, it becomes your opponent's turn after the attack ends.[1]
BT1-081.question: Q: I lose 3 memory from this card's effect, causing the memory gauge to move to 1 or greater on my opponent's side. Does it become my opponent's turn?

BT1-081.answer: A: No, you can choose not to use it.[1]
BT1-081.question: Q: Do I have to activate this card's End of Attack effect when I attack with it?

BT1-081.answer: A: Yes, you can activate it. The effect of [End of Attack] effect can be resolved even if no battle occurs. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT1-081.question: Q: My [BT1-081 HerculesKabuterimon] attacks a Digimon and the attack target gets deleted by a card effect before the battle occurs. Does the [End of Attack] still activate even if no battle occurred?

BT1-082.answer: A: The player who controls this card chooses.[1]
BT1-082.question: Q: Which player chooses the Digimon to suspend with this card's skill?

BT1-082.answer: A: Yes, it does.  If your opponent attacks you with a Digimon, if this Digimon is suspended, its effect can be activated at counter timing even if it it was unsuspended when the attack was declared.[1]
BT1-082.question: Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon that has a When Attacking effect that suspends an opponent's Digimon, and uses it to suspend one of my unsuspended Digimon. When they do, does this card's effect activate?

BT1-082.answer: A: No, you can't. This Digimon's [Opponent's Turn] effect triggers at counter timing, before a block can be declared with ＜Blocker＞ at blocker timing. So, if this Digimon is not suspended during the counter timing, you can't activate this Digimon's [Opponent's Turn] effect.[1]
BT1-082.question: Q: This Digimon has ＜Blocker＞ and is currently unsuspended when my opponent attacks with a Digimon. If I suspend this Digimon to block the opponent's Digimon, can I activate this card's effect to suspend one of my opponent's Digimon?

BT1-084.answer: A: You can digivolve into this card from a red or blue level 6 Digimon by paying its digivolve cost.[1]
BT1-084.question: Q: How can I digivolve into this card?

BT1-084.answer: A: Yes. The chosen Digimon and all Digimon with the same name as that Digimon are deleted.[1]
BT1-084.question: Q: I use this card's When Digivolving effect to choose one of my opponent's Digimon. Is that Digimon deleted?

BT1-084.answer: A: Just [Greymon]. Only Digimon with names that completely match the specified name are deleted.[1]
BT1-084.question: Q: I choose [Greymon] with this card's When Digivolving effect while my opponent has a [Greymon], [MetalGreymon], and [WarGreymon] in play. Are all of them deleted, or just [Greymon]?

BT1-084.answer: A: Yes. The card numbers may be different, but the names match. All of your opponent's [MetalGreymon] cards are deleted.[1]
BT1-084.question: Q: My opponent has [ST1-09 MetalGreymon], [BT1-021 MetalGreymon], and [BT1-114 MetalGreymon] in play in their battle area. I use this card's When Digivolving effect to choose [ST1-09 MetalGreymon]. Are all of my opponent's [MetalGreymon] cards deleted?

BT1-084.answer: A: No, you can choose not to.[1]
BT1-084.question: Q: If I attack with this Digimon when it has a level 6 Digimon card in its digivolution cards, do I always have to activate this card's When Attacking effect?
Q: Can I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to return a level 6 digivolution card to my hand but choose to not unsuspend this card?

BT1-085.answer: A: You can resolve their effects in any order. For example, if you're starting the turn at 1 memory, you can resolve this card's effect first to go up to 3 memory, then activate [ST2-12 Matt Ishida]'s effect to go to 4 memory and above.[1]
BT1-085.question: Q: I have both this card and [ST2-12 Matt Ishida] in play. How do I activate their effects?

BT1-085.answer: A: Yes. Each card's effect activates individually: ＜Security A. +1＞ gets applied twice, allowing you to check two extra cards.[1]
BT1-085.question: Q: If I have two copies of this card in my battle area, does my Digimon with 4 or more digivolution cards gain ＜Security A. +1＞ twice?

BT1-085.answer: A: Your Digimon loses ＜Security A. +1＞, and the second check isn't performed.[1]
BT1-085.question: Q: I use this card's effect to give one of my Digimon ＜Security A. +1＞, which I use to attack my opponent. The card revealed from the first check has a security effect that reduces my Digimon's digivolution cards to 3 or fewer. Does it still have ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT1-086.answer: A: You can resolve their effects in any order. For example, if you're starting the turn at 1 memory, you can resolve this card's effect first to go up to 3 memory, then activate [ST2-12 Matt Ishida]'s effect to go to 4 memory and above.[1]
BT1-086.question: Q: I have both this card and [ST2-12 Matt Ishida] in play. How do I activate their effects?

BT1-086.answer: A: Yes, it does. Unless otherwise specified, cards don't lose effects when suspended.[1]
BT1-086.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect activate if it's suspended?

BT1-086.answer: A: Yes, [BT3-040 Shakkoumon]'s effect allows it to be played as a Blue Digimon.[2]
BT1-086.question: Q: If I play [BT3-040 Shakkoumon], does this card's effect activate?

BT1-087.answer: A: You can resolve their effects in any order. For example, if you're starting the turn at 1 memory, you can resolve this card's effect first to go up to 3 memory, then activate [ST2-12 Matt Ishida]'s effect to go to 4 memory and above.[1]
BT1-087.question: Q: I have both this card and [ST2-12 Matt Ishida] in play. How do I activate their effects?

BT1-087.answer: A: It allows you to look at all of the cards in your security stack without revealing them to your opponent. You then pick one of those cards, reveal it, and add it to your hand.[1]
BT1-087.question: Q: This card's On Play effect says "Look at your security stack." What does this mean, exactly?

BT1-087.answer: A: Shuffle your deck without triggering <Recovery +1 (Deck)>.[1]
BT1-087.question: Q: What happens if I use this card's On Play effect to add a card from my security stack to my hand that isn't yellow?

BT1-088.answer: A: Like Main effects on Option cards, you can activate these effects at any time during your main phase. However, you can't activate them to interrupt an attack or another effect.[1]
BT1-088.question: Q: What timing does [Main] occur at?

BT1-088.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't checked by this effect.[1]
BT1-088.question: Q: Can I use this card's Main effect if I have a level 5 or higher green Digimon in my Breeding Area?

BT1-089.answer: A: You can resolve their effects in any order. For example, if you're starting the turn at 1 memory, you can resolve this card's effect first to go up to 3 memory, then activate [ST2-12 Matt Ishida]'s effect to go to 4 memory and above.[1]
BT1-089.question: Q: I have both this card and [ST2-12 Matt Ishida] in play. How do I activate their effects?

BT1-089.answer: A: Like Main effects on Option cards, you can activate these effects at any time during your main phase. However, you can't activate them to interrupt an attack or another effect.[1]
BT1-089.question: Q: What timing does [Main] occur at?

BT1-089.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't checked by this effect.[1]
BT1-089.question: Q: Can I use this card's Main effect if I have a level 5 or higher green Digimon in my Breeding Area?

BT1-089.answer: A: Yes, it does. Unless otherwise specified, cards don't lose their effects when suspended.[1]
BT1-089.question: Q: Does this card's Start of Your Turn effect activate if it is suspended?

BT1-089.answer: A: Yes, you can. Hatching Digimon and moving them to the battle area doesn't count as playing them, so you can attack with them immediately.[1]
BT1-089.question: Q: During my breeding phase, I hatch a level 2 Digimon from my Digi-Egg deck. I then digivolve that Digimon into a level 3 Digimon during my main phase. If I use this card's effect to move that Digimon to my battle area, can I attack with it immediately?

BT1-089.answer: A: While it is possible, this can only be done if you have a Level 2 Digimon in your Breeding Area. If you have a Digimon that can be moved out from the Breeding Area it must be moved out. If you have no Digimon in your Breeding Area and cards in your Digi-Egg deck, you must hatch.[2]
BT1-089.question: Q: Is it possible to suspend this tamer with its [Main] effect and not use its effect?

BT1-090.answer: A: When you pass the turn the memory counter is set to 3 and "end of turn" effects will now resolve giving your opponent 2 additional memory and moving the memory counter to 5. (See more in End of Turn Procedures)
BT1-090.question: Q: I pass turn after using [BT1-090 Gravity Crush]. How much memory does my opponent have?

BT1-092.answer: A: You have to both draw 2 cards and give a Digimon +2000 DP if possible.[1]
BT1-092.question: Q: Can I choose to only trigger ＜Draw 2＞ or give one of my Digimon +2000 DP? Do I have to do both?

BT1-093.answer: A: You have to give the Digimon both +2000 DP and ＜Security A. +1＞ if possible.[1]
BT1-093.question: Q: Can I choose to give one of my Digimon only +2000 DP or ＜Security A. +1＞? Do I have to do both?

BT1-094.question: Q: My opponent has used an Option card or other effect to give one of their Digimon ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's effect to delete that Digimon?

BT1-095.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to give one of my originally unsuspended Digimon ＜Blocker＞?

BT1-099.answer: A: Nothing happens, but the game still treats it as if you used the Option card.[1]
BT1-099.question: Q: What happens if I activate this card's effect against a Digimon with no digivolution cards?

BT1-100.question: Q: I use this card's effect when my opponent's Digimon has no digivolution cards. If that Digimon later gains digivolution cards, can it attack?

BT1-102.answer: A: Nothing happens, but the game still treats it as if you used the Option card.[1]
BT1-102.question: Q: What happens when I use this card while I have 1 or fewer cards in my security stack?

BT1-102.answer: A: No, you would draw 1. Cards turned over by the security check are not included in the number of security cards.[2]
BT1-102.question: Q: I have 4 security cards. My opponent attacks me and I flip [BT1-102 Blade of the True] as the security check. Do I draw 2 cards with the [Security] effect because it is still in the security stack?

BT1-104.question: Q: If one of my Digimon digivolves after I use this card, does that Digimon still receive this card's effect?
Q: After activating this card's effect, I use [BT1-089 Mimi Tachikawa]'s effect to move a Digimon from my breeding area to my battle area. Does this card's effect also apply to that Digimon?

BT1-104.answer: A: No battle occurs, and the attack ends. If there are other When Attacking effects, "when one of your Digimon attacks" effects, and/or effects activated at counter timing, they activate, and then the attack ends. If it's then blocked at blocker timing, start a battle with the blocking Digimon.[1]
BT1-104.question: Q: I attack an opponent's Digimon with a Digimon that's gained the When Attacking effect from this card. The When Attacking effect reduces my opponent's Digimon to 0 DP, deleting it. What happens next?
Q: I play this card, then play a Digimon. Does it receive this card's effect?
Q: I use 2 copies of this card. When I attack with a Digimon, can I activate its When Attacking effect twice in a single attack, giving an opponent's Digimon -4000 DP?

BT1-104.answer: A: Yes, you can still use BanchoStingmon's effect if the attack target's DP decreases before BanchoStingmon's effect activates as long as it was 12000 DP when it was targeted for the attack.[2]
BT1-104.question: Q: I have activated [BT1-104 Golden Ripper] and attack with [BT3-058 BanchoStingmon]. If I use this card's effect to decrease the attack of the attack target from 12000 DP to 10000 DP before I use BanchoStingmon's effect, can I give it +7000 DP?

BT1-105.answer: A: The DP value printed on a card is its original DP. This card's effect temporarily allows you to treat the DP value printed on an opponent's Digimon as if it were 3000.[1]
BT1-105.question: Q: What does "original DP" refer to?

BT1-105.answer: A: Yes, when a Digimon's DP becomes 0, it's deleted.[1]
BT1-105.question: Q: I use this card's effect to change the original DP of an opponent's Digimon to 3000. I then use [ST3-11 Seraphimon]'s effect to give an opponent's Digimon -4000 DP. If the opponent's Digimon drops to 0 DP, is it deleted?

BT1-105.answer: A: Yes, effects that increase or decrease DP work as normal, raising the Digimon's DP to 6000.[1]
BT1-105.question: Q: This card's effect has set a Digimon's original DP to 3000. If [ST1-13 Shadow Wing] is used to give that Digimon +3000 DP, is its DP now 6000?

BT1-105.answer: A: No, its original DP becomes 3000. 3000 DP and 1000 DP (from the effect) add up to 4000 DP.[1]
BT1-105.question: Q: If I use this card's effect on a Digimon that's already getting +1000 DP from an effect, does its DP become 3000?

BT1-105.answer: A: Even after digivolving, the Digimon's DP is treated as 3000 until the end of the turn.[1]
BT1-105.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon while this card's effect is active. What happens to the Digimon's DP?

BT1-105.answer: A: The effect that was used last takes precedence.[2]
BT1-105.question: Q: If I set a Digimon's original DP with this card, and then use another card to set its original DP again. What happens?

BT1-105.answer: A: Yes, the effect prevents the reduction of DP. But it does not prevent its original DP from being set to another number.[3]
BT1-105.question: Q: Can I use [BT1-105 Blast Fire] to decrease the DP of a Digimon with "DP cannot be reduced"?

BT1-105.answer: A: No, the Level 2 Digimon has no DP and so its DP can't be changed and it will still be trashed.[4]
BT1-105.question: Q: If after using this card's effect to set my opponent's Digimon's DP to 3000 and it gets ＜De-Digivolve＞ and becomes a Level 2 Digimon with no DP. Does this card's effect set the Level 2 Digimon's DP to 3000 and stop it from being trashed?

BT1-107.answer: A: Yes, they continue by checking the card that was added to your security stack.[1]
BT1-107.question: Q: I have 1 card in my security stack. My opponent attacks me with a Digimon with ＜Security A. +1＞, and flips over this card during the security check. Its <Recovery +1 (Deck)> activates, adding a card to my empty security stack. Does my opponent continue the security check?

BT1-109.answer: A: No, digivolution costs can't be reduced to less than zero. You can digivolve the card for free, but you can't gain memory with effects that reduce digivolution costs.[1]
BT1-109.question: Q: I have a level 6 Digimon with a digivolution cost of 3, and use this card's effect to reduce that cost by 4, to -1. Can I digivolve into that Digimon by gaining a memory?

BT1-109.answer: A: No, it doesn't. Since the card doesn't specify breeding areas, the effect doesn't apply to Digimon there.[1]
BT1-109.question: Q: Does activating this card's effect also reduce the digivolution cost of cards in my breeding area?
Q: After using this card, can I reduce the digivolution cost of my level 5 green Digimon digivolving to level 6 when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

BT1-110.answer: A: No, if your opponent's Digimon has ＜Blocker＞, it can't be suspended with this card's effect.[1]
BT1-110.question: Q: My opponent uses an Option card or other effect to give one of their Digimon ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's security effect to suspend that Digimon?

BT1-111.answer: A: No. You can either suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon, regardless of DP, or 2 of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less. You can't mix and match.[1]
BT1-111.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to suspend both 1 of my opponent's Digimon, and 2 of my opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less?

BT1-111.answer: A: Yes, this card's effect allows you to pick 1 Digimon and suspend it, regardless of DP.[1]
BT1-111.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to suspend 1 of my opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less, and no other Digimon?

BT1-112.answer: A: Yes. The effect has no limit to the number of times it can be used. As long as you keep deleting your opponent's Digimon, you can keep using the effect to unsuspend this card.[1]
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. Can I unsuspend it over and over again every time I use it to delete an opponent's Digimon in battle?

BT1-112.answer: A: No, the effect doesn't activate in battles with Security Digimon.[1]
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. If it deletes an opponent's Security Digimon in battle, can I unsuspend it?

BT1-112.answer: A: Yes, if your Digimon deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives, you can unsuspend it, even if the opposing Digimon had ＜Blocker＞.[1]
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. I attack with it, and my opponent blocks it. If my Digimon deletes the opponent's blocking Digimon and survives, can I unsuspend it?

BT1-112.answer: A: No. You can only unsuspend the Digimon with this effect if it deletes the Digimon it's currently attacking. Other Digimon don't count.[1]
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. I attack an opponent's Digimon with it, and an effect causes one of my opponent's other Digimon to be deleted during the battle. Do I still get to unsuspend my attacking Digimon?

BT1-113.question: Q: I use this card's effect on one of my opponent's Digimon, which they then digivolve. Can it now attack and block?

BT1-113.answer: A: No, this card's security effect only affects Digimon. Your opponent's Tamers unsuspend as normal.[1]
BT1-113.question: Q: Does this card's security effect also prevent my opponent's suspended Tamers from unsuspending during their unsuspend phase?

BT1-114.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if this Digimon's attack effect causes your memory to move to 1 or greater on your opponent's side, it doesn't become your opponent's turn until the end of the attack.[1]
BT1-114.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack when I have less than 5 memory?

BT1-115.answer: A: Yes, it does. This card's When Attacking effect doesn't depend upon the color of your Tamers.[1]
BT1-115.question: Q: Does this card's When Attacking effect activate when I have a Tamer that isn't blue in play?

BT1-115.answer: A: No. No matter how many blue Tamers you have in play, the effect only grants +1000 DP.[1]
BT1-115.question: Q: I have 2 blue Tamers in play. During my turn, does this card's inherited effect grant +2000 DP?

BT1-115.answer: A: No, you cannot because it was already used. [Once Per Turn] effects are per card.[2]
BT1-115.question: Q: After unsuspending itself with its [When Attacking] [Once Per Turn] effect, I digivolve into a new Digimon and attack with it. The security check reveals a card that ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ it back into [BT1-115 Veedramon]. Can I use the [Once Per Turn] effect of Veedramon again?

BT1-115.answer: A: Yes, you can use the [Once Per Turn] effect of the new [BT1-115 Veedramon] again. [Once Per Turn] effects are per card.[2]
BT1-115.question: Q: After unsuspending itself with its [When Attacking] [Once Per Turn] effect, it got ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ into a level 3. I evolve it back into [BT1-115 Veedramon]. Can I use its effect?

BT10-001.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  A red 2-color card isn't considered a "non-red card."[1]
BT10-001.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect give this card +1000 DP when it has a red 2-color card as a digivolution card?

BT10-004.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when an effect suspends one of my Digimon?

BT10-006.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even when this card is trashed from digivolution cards by my own effect and not my opponent's?

BT10-008.question: Q: Is it true that both the Digimon card and the Tamer card must have the [Xros Heart] trait in order for this card's effect to be able to add them to my hand?

BT10-008.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a Digimon card with the [Xros Heart] trait or a Tamer card with the [Xros Heart] trait is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT10-008.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 3 cards. If the cards revealed only include either a Digimon card or a Tamer card with the [Xros Heart] trait, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT10-008.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 Digimon card and 1 Tamer card [...] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT10-008.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 3 cards. If both Digimon and Tamer cards with the [Xros Heart] trait are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining cards at the bottom of my deck?

BT10-009.question: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [End of Attack] effect by not performing "placing all digivolution cards from under this Digimon under 1 of your Tamers", thus preventing this Digimon from being deleted?

BT10-009.answer: A: No, it doesn't activate unless you can perform "placing all digivolution cards from under this Digimon under 1 of your Tamers."[1]
BT10-009.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [End of Attack] effect if this Digimon doesn't have any digivolution cards?
Q: If I activate this card's [End of Attack] effect, can I unsuspend a different Tamer than the Tamer under which I placed the digivolution cards?

BT10-011.answer: A: No, even if multiple Tamers suspend at the same time, this effect will only give +2000 DP.[1]
BT10-011.question: Q: If more than 1 of my Tamers suspend at the same time, does this card's "+2000 DP" effect activate multiple times?

BT10-011.answer: A: Yes, if the memory gauge is now at 1 or greater on your opponent's side, you can activate ＜Blitz＞.[1]
BT10-011.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon with [Gammamon] and a [When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞ effect into this card. Can I activate the [When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞ effect through this card's [All Turns] effect and attack?

BT10-011.answer: A: No, you can't. If this card is added to digivolution cards by [BT8-084 Kimeramon]'s [When Digivolving] effect, you get [BT8-013 BetelGammamon]'s ＜Blitz＞ effect through this card, but the time to trigger ＜Blitz＞ has already passed, so ＜Blitz＞ doesn't activate.[1]
BT10-011.question: Q: I digivolve a [BT8-013 BetelGammamon] into a [BT8-084 Kimeramon] and place this card as one of [BT8-084 Kimeramon]'s digivolution cards with its [When Digivolving] effect. Can I now activate [BT8-013 BetelGammamon]'s [When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞ effect through this card's inherited effect and attack?

BT10-011.answer: A: Yes, you gain all the effects from every applicable card, even if there are multiple of them.[1]
BT10-011.question: Q: If I have multiple digivolution cards with [Gammamon], does this card's [All Turns] effect and inherited effect give me all of their effects?

BT10-011.answer: A: No, this card's [All Turns] effect and inherited effect don't affect the inherited effects of digivolution cards with [Gammamon].[1]
BT10-011.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect and inherited effect allow me to activate the inherited effect of a digivolution card with [Gammamon] as an effect of this card?

BT10-011.answer: A: This card's effect and inherited effect mean that this Digimon gains [BT8-008 Gammamon]'s effects twice, so ＜Draw 1＞ is activated twice and you draw a total of 2 cards.[1]
BT10-011.question: Q: Due to an effect, this Digimon has another [BT10-011 Canoweissmon] and a [BT8-008 Gammamon] under it as its digivolution cards. If I play a red Tamer, how exactly does [BT8-008 Gammamon]'s "When you play a red Tamer, ＜Draw 1＞ (Draw 1 card from your deck)" effect work in this situation?

BT10-016.answer: A: No, they only get +2000 DP from this effect.[1]
BT10-016.question: Q: I have a [Jesmon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards, and one of my Digimon has [Sistermon]. Do my Digimon get +4000 DP from this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT10-016.answer: A: Yes, it does. However, Digimon affected by this effect still can't ignore the rule "Digimon can't attack on the turn that they were played".[1]
BT10-016.question: Q: This card's [When Digivolving] effect reads "all of your Digimon may also attack unsuspended Digimon and get +2000 DP." Does this also affect my Digimon that enter the battle area in the same turn after I've digivolved into this card?

BT10-019.answer: A: Yes, you can choose one or the other.[1]
BT10-019.question: Q: If I have a [Kiriha Aonuma] in play, do I get to choose either "Reveal 4 cards from the top of your deck. Add 2 cards with [Blue Flare] in their traits among them to your hand. Place the rest at the bottom of your deck in any order" or "return 1 [MetalGreymon] from your trash to your hand" for this card's [On Play] effect?

BT10-019.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT10-019.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to add a card to my hand when only 1 card with the [Blue Flare] trait is among the 4 revealed cards?

BT10-023.answer: A: Yes, that's right. ＜Draw 2＞ does not activate if you have 7 or more cards in your hand after drawing the digivolution bonus.[1]
BT10-023.question: Q: In order to ＜Draw 2＞ from this card's [When Digivolving] effect, do I need to have 6 or fewer cards in my hand after drawing the digivolution bonus card?

BT10-024.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect target the opponent's Digimon that don't have digivolution cards?

BT10-024.answer: A: No. As long as the number of digivolution cards that Digimon had was less than or equal to this Digimon's at the time this effect was activated, this effect stays and it can't attack or block?even if it later gains more digivolution cards.[1]
BT10-024.question: Q: An opponent's Digimon was targeted by this card's [On Play] effect, and after that it gained more digivolution cards than this Digimon has, can it now attack and block again?

BT10-027.answer: A: No. If you choose to play cards with the [When Attacking] effect, you must play as many cards as possible?so if cards of both levels are in the digivolution cards, you can't play just 1 of them.[1]
BT10-027.question: Q: If this Digimon has both level 3 and level 4 Digimon cards in its digivolution cards, can I choose to play just 1 of them with this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT10-030.answer: A: No. As long as it was level 5 or lower when this effect was activated, the effect remains and it still has <Security Attack -1>?even if it later becomes level 6 or higher.[1]
BT10-030.question: Q: An opponent's Digimon is targeted by this card's [On Play] effect. If it later becomes level 6 or above, does it lose the <Security Attack -1> gained from this effect?

BT10-032.answer: A: Yes, as long as either an Option card with [Plug-In] or a yellow Tamer is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT10-032.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 4 cards. If the cards revealed only include either an Option card with [Plug-In] or a yellow Tamer, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT10-032.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 Option card [...] and 1 yellow Tamer among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT10-032.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 4 cards. If both an Option card with [Plug-In] and a yellow Tamer are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining card at the bottom of my deck?

BT10-032.answer: A: Yes, as long as the Option card you use has a cost of 2 or more, this card's inherited effect activates regardless of the actual cost paid. However, if some effect (like [BT2-099 Glorious Burst]'s "Reduce the memory cost of this card in your hand by 1 for each yellow Tamer you have in play" effect) reduces the Option card's actual cost instead of just the cost you pay when using it, then this card's inherited effect doesn't activate.[1]
BT10-032.question: Q: If I activate an effect that reduces the cost of an Option card with a cost of 2 or more and I only pay a cost of 1, or if I do not pay the cost at all by activating an effect that allows me to use an Option card without paying the cost, does this card's inherited effect activate?

BT10-032.answer: A: No, this card's inherited effect only activates if you use an Option card from your hand or by activating an effect that specifies that you "use" an Option card.[1]
BT10-032.question: Q: If I activate a ＜Delay＞ effect on an Option card with a cost of 2 or more that was already placed in the battle area, does this card's inherited effect activate?
Q: If there's no target for the Option card when I use an Option card with a cost of 2 or more, does this card's inherited effect activate?

BT10-034.answer: A: Yes, they get -2000 DP even when checked by some other Digimon than the one that has this in its digivolution cards.[1]
BT10-034.question: Q: While this card is in the digivolution cards of a Digimon with [Shoutmon], do my opponent's Security Digimon get -2000 DP from this card's inherited effect even when they are checked by some other Digimon?

BT10-040.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -5000 DP for the turn" effect and the "gain 2 memory" effect when activating this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT10-041.answer: A: [BT9-103 Kongou]'s effect prevents cards from being added to your security stack, so the card is placed in your trash.[1]
BT10-041.question: Q: If I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect and use an Option card while my opponent has activated [BT9-103 Kongou]'s effect, what happens when that Option card's effect has finished activating?

BT10-041.answer: A: You place this card in your battle area. You can't trash it due to the Option card's own effect, so "Place the Option card used with this effect on top of your security stack face down instead of placing it in your trash" doesn't activate.[1]
BT10-041.question: Q: What happens if I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect to use an Option card that has a "Then, place this card in your battle area" effect?

BT10-041.answer: A: Yes, the effect of this card has already activated, so you still place [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] on top of your security stack.[1]
BT10-041.question: Q: I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect to use [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] and choose this card itself as the target, so I place this card on top of my security stack face down. Does this card's effect still place [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] on top of my security stack after it has finished activating, even though this card has now been removed from the battle area?

BT10-042.answer: A: Yes, all of your opponent's Digimon with either <Security Attack +X> or <Security Attack -X> are affected by "can't attack this Digimon and can't activate [When Attacking] and [When Digivolving] effects."[1]
BT10-042.question: Q: Does "can't attack this Digimon and can't activate [When Attacking] and [When Digivolving] effects" in this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect apply to opponent's Digimon with <Security Attack +X> as well as those with <Security Attack -X>?

BT10-042.answer: A: No, it has ＜Security A. +1＞ as soon as the digivolution is complete, so this card's effect prevents the [When Digivolving] effect from activating.[1]
BT10-042.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play, and I digivolve one of my Digimon into a Digimon card that has ＜Security A. +1＞ and a [When Digivolving] effect. Does that Digimon activate its [When Digivolving] effect?

BT10-042.answer: A: It refers to Digimon affected by <Security Attack +> or <Security Attack -> effects.[1]
BT10-042.question: Q: What kind of Digimon does this effect's "Digimon with <Security Attack>" refer to?

BT10-042.answer: A: No, <Security Attack> is not canceled even if a Digimon has both ＜Security A. +1＞ and <Security Attack -1>. The Digimon is considered to have <Security Attack>, so the effect applies to this Digimon.[1]
BT10-042.question: Q: If an opponent's Digimon has both ＜Security A. +1＞ and <Security Attack -1> so the values cancel each other out, is the Digimon treated as not having <Security Attack>, and is it unaffected by "Digimon with <Security Attack> can't attack this Digimon and can't activate [When Attacking] and [When Digivolving] effects"?

BT10-042.answer: A: Yes, it activates. [BT9-015 MetalGreymon (X Antibody)] gains ＜Security A. +1＞ from the [When Digivolving] effect, so after that effect has activated, this card then prevents further [When Attacking] and [When Digivolving] effects from activating.[1]
BT10-042.question: Q: I digivolved one of my [MetalGreymon] into [BT9-015 MetalGreymon (X Antibody)]. It gets <Security Attack+1> and +3000 DP with its [When Digivolving] effect, but does that effect activate when my opponent has this Digimon in play?

Q: If a Digimon has a <Security Attack> effect that is only active when certain conditions are met, such as "While this Digimon has X or more digivolution cards, it gains ＜Security A. +1＞," does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect apply when these conditions aren't met?

BT10-042.answer: A: The attack continues. This effect doesn't end or cancel an attack if the attacking Digimon gains <Security Attack> after the attack has been declared. It prevents Digimon with <Security Attack> from declaring the attack.[1]
BT10-042.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. One of my Digimon that doesn't have <Security Attack> attacks it, and then the attacking Digimon gains <Security Attack> from a [When Attacking] effect or an effect such as "when one of your Digimon attacks".  What happens to the attack?

BT10-042.answer: A: No, "When... attacks" effects are not [When Attacking] effects, so this card's effect can't stop them from activating.[1]
BT10-042.question: Q: When a Digimon with <Security Attack> attacks, does this card's effect stop "when this Digimon attacks" effects of those Digimon, such as ＜Raid＞?

BT10-046.question: Q: Can this card's effect add cards that have the trait [Ancient Plant] or [Carnivorous Plant], etc.?

BT10-046.answer: A: Yes, as long as at least 1 card with [Vegetation] or [Plant] in one of its traits or with the [Fairy] trait is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT10-046.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 4 cards. If the cards revealed only include 1 card with [Vegetation] or [Plant] in one of its traits or with the [Fairy] trait, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT10-046.answer: A: No. This card's effect does not feature language that would make it optional, so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT10-046.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 4 cards. If both a card with [Vegetation] or [Plant] in one of its traits and a card with [Fairy] in one of its traits are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the other at the bottom of my deck?

BT10-048.answer: A: No, you can't. The Digimon is suspended by <Digisorption> before the digivolution is complete, so the inherited effect cannot be triggered yet.[1]
BT10-048.question: Q: I digivolve this card into a card that has <Digisorption> in my hand, and suspend 1 of my Digimon with the <Digisorption> effect. Can I activate this card's inherited effect and ＜Draw 1＞?

BT10-052.answer: A: Yes, you can choose to do so.[1]
BT10-052.question: Q: If this Digimon is suspended, can it itself become the target when its [Opponent's Turn] effect switches the target of an opponent's Digimon's attack?

BT10-052.answer: A: Yes, this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect triggers in the reaction step of the attack, so you would switch the attack target after the effect of the opponent's [BT9-055 GrandisKuwagamon] has activated.[1]
BT10-052.question: Q: One of my opponent's Digimon attacks and activates its [When Attacking] effect to digivolve into [BT9-055 GrandisKuwagamon].  After the [When Digivolving] effect switches the target of the attack to one of my suspended Digimon, can I then switch the target of the attack again to another suspended Digimon with this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect?

BT10-053.question: Q: Can I suspend this card itself to activate this card's [Main] effect?

BT10-053.answer: A: No, suspending to declare an attack is not the same as being suspended by an effect even when attacking via ＜Blitz＞, so the inherited effect does not activate.[1]
BT10-053.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if 1 of my Digimon attacks with ＜Blitz＞ and I suspend it?

BT10-056.question: Q: If this Digimon and one of my other Digimon with [Vegetation], [Plant], or [Fairy] in one of its traits are deleted at the same time during the opponent's turn, does the [On Deletion] effect gained from this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate?

BT10-057.question: Q: If I have a suspended Digimon with [Vegetation], [Plant], or [Fairy] in one of its traits, can I choose to suspend this Digimon itself with this card's [When Digivolving], gain 2 memory, then unsuspend this Digimon and gain ＜Piercing＞?
Q: If I have 4 suspended Digimon, does this Digimon gain +4000 DP and ＜Security A. +1＞ twice?

BT10-057.answer: A: Yes, this Digimon counts if it's suspended.[1]
BT10-057.question: Q: Does this card itself count as a suspended Digimon for this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT10-058.question: Q: What happens to the cards that weren't added to my hand from among the cards revealed by this card’s effects?

BT10-058.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you add as many cards to your hand as possible.[2]
BT10-058.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 4 cards. If the cards revealed only include 1 card that is either black with [Knightmon] or 1 card with the [Twilight] trait, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT10-058.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 2 cards [...] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible. However, if you have a black card with [Knightmon] and the [Twilight] trait among the revealed cards and there are no other cards with [Knightmon], you can treat that card as your card with the [Twilight] trait and add it to your hand. Any other cards that have the [Twilight] trait will then be returned to the bottom of your deck. In such a case, it can be possible to add just 1 of the cards.[2]
BT10-058.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 4 cards. If 2 cards that are either black with [Knightmon] and/or the [Twilight] trait are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining card at the bottom of my deck?

BT10-059.question: Q: If my opponent does not have any Digimon in play so there is no target for ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.), can I still place this card under 1 of my Digimon that has the [Legend-Arms] or [Xros Heart] trait when activating this card's [On Play] effect?

BT10-061.question: Q: I play this card while DigiXrosing with 2 cards, but there are no cards with [Knightmon] in their name, [DeadlyAxemon], or [Nene Amano] among the cards revealed by the [On Play] effect. Does the "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 4 or less" effect still activate?

BT10-061.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that always treats it as if it also has the [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] names.[2]
BT10-061.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "The name of this card/Digimon is also treated as [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon]" has been changed to "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon].")

BT10-066.question: Q: When this Digimon would be deleted, if neither [SkullKnightmon] or [DeadlyAxemon] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, can I still return 1 level 4 or lower black Digimon card from this Digimon's digivolution cards to my hand when activating this card's [All Turns]?

BT10-068.answer: A: Its original DP is restored by "can't [...] reduce their DP," and it additionally gets +2000 DP from this effect.[1]
BT10-068.question: Q: This card's [When Digivolving] effect reads "all of your Digimon get +2000 DP and your opponent's effects can't return them to hands or decks or reduce their DP." If one of my Digimon's DP is reduced before this effect activates, what happens to that Digimon's DP?

BT10-069.question: Q: If [DarkKnightmon] or [X Antibody] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards but I can't delete a Tamer because neither I nor my opponent have any, does this card's [When Digivolving] effect unsuspend this Digimon?
Q: If [DarkKnightmon] or [X Antibody] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards but only I have a Tamer, can I choose to not delete my Tamer with this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT10-070.answer: A: Only if it has 3 digivolution cards, but the check will ignore the [On Play].
BT10-070.question: Q: If this Digimon has [BT5-014 OmniShoutmon], does this Digimon gain ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT10-070.answer: A: No, you can't. This card's [Opponent's Turn] effect triggers in the counter timing of the attack after [When Attacking] effects have already activated.[1]
BT10-070.question: Q: When one of my opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon attacks, can I delete that Digimon with this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect before its [When Attacking] effects activate?

BT10-070.answer: A: Yes, it can activate.  This card's [On Play] effect activates ＜Blitz＞ if there are 3 or more digivolution cards.[1]
BT10-070.question: Q: If this Digimon has 4 or more digivolution cards when I play this card, does ＜Blitz＞ activate?

BT10-071.answer: A: No. You didn't have 10 cards in your trash until after the deletion already took place, so this Digimon's inherited effect could not be active at the time of the deletion.[1]
BT10-071.question: Q: I have 9 cards in my trash and a Digimon with this card as a digivolution card is deleted in battle. The deleted cards, including this one, are sent to my trash, and now I have over 10 cards in my trash. Does ＜Retaliation＞ in this card's inherited effects activate and delete my opponent's Digimon it battled?

BT10-073.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a Digimon card with the [Bagra Army] trait or a [Yuu Amano] is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT10-073.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 4 cards. If the cards revealed only include 1 card with the [Bagra Army] trait or a [Yuu Amano], can I still add a card to my hand?

BT10-073.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 card [...] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT10-073.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 4 cards. If both a card with the [Bagra Army] trait and a [Yuu Amano] are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining card at the bottom of my deck?

BT10-077.answer: A: No, you can only trash cards equal to the number of cards added by one effect. Even if they were triggered at the same time, different effects are still separate from each other, and you can only activate this effect for one of them, so in this case you can count only one of the ＜Draw 1＞ and only 1 card in your opponent's hand will be trashed.[1]
BT10-077.question: Q: One of my opponent's Digimon attacks, ＜Draw 1＞ activates twice from both a [When Attacking] effect and an inherited effect, and their hand increases by 2 cards. Will this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect trash 2 of my opponent's cards in their hand?

BT10-077.answer: A: Yes, it activates. This card's effect trashes the number of cards that were drawn. In the example given in the question, after trashing 2 cards from their hand, your opponent would trash an additional 2 cards, for a total of 4 cards trashed.[1]
BT10-077.question: Q: Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate after an effect that adds and trashes cards in your opponent's hand so that the result is net 0 total cards gained, like "＜Draw 2＞. Then, trash 2 cards in your hand"?

BT10-080.question: Q: This card was trashed from my hand by one of my effects during my turn. Can I use this card's effect to digivolve one of my Digimon into this card from my trash?

BT10-081.question: Q: I have 9 cards in my trash when this Digimon is deleted. If this results in my having 10 cards in my trash, does this card’s [On Deletion] effect activate?

BT10-084.question: Q: Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate when an opponent's effect trashes one of my Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT10-084.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you do, trash as many of this card's digivolution cards as possible.[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: A "trash 2 digivolution cards" effect activates on 1 of my Digimon with 2 or more digivolution cards when this Digimon has only 1 digivolution card. Can I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect?

BT10-084.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you do, trash the total number of digivolution cards that would have been trashed from each of the Digimon that you replaced with this Digimon.[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: If a "trash 1 digivolution card" effect activates on 2 of my Digimon, can I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect and trash just this Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT10-084.answer: A: Trash 2 cards. If this card has 1 or fewer digivolution cards, trash as many as possible.[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: If a "Trash 2 digivolution cards" effect activates on 1 of my Digimon with only 1 digivolution card, can I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect and trash this Digimon's digivolution cards, and if so, how many do I trash?

BT10-084.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you do while this Digimon has no digivolution cards, digivolution cards will not be trashed. If there are effects that activate when digivolution cards are trashed, such as "By trashing a digivolution card," the effect will not activate because digivolution cards were not trashed.[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: A "trash digivolution cards" effect targets one of my Digimon when this Digimon has 0 digivolution cards. Can I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect?

BT10-084.answer: A: Yes, it is. If you can trash the number of digivolution cards specified by the effect from this Digimon, your Digimon with 0 digivolution cards can indeed activate such an effect.[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: Is it possible for one of my Digimon with 0 digivolution cards to activate an effect that reads "By trashing X of this Digimon's digivolution cards" by way of activating this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect and trashing those cards from this Digimon?

BT10-084.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you trash 1 digivolution card for each of your Digimon, you do not have to trash your other Digimon's digivolution cards.[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: My opponent activates a "Trash the bottom digivolution card of all of your opponent's Digimon" effect. Can I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to trash just this 1 Digimon's digivolution cards without trashing my other Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT10-086.answer: A: The player that activated this effect chooses.[1]
BT10-086.question: Q: Which player chooses which of my opponent's security cards is trashed by this card's [When Digivolving][When Attacking] effect?

BT10-086.answer: A: Yes, you can activate it. When a revealed card is trashed from the deck or security stack, it is not considered to be trashed from the deck or security stack, but it is considered that a card was removed from the security stack, so [BT4-097 Kari Kamiya]'s effect can be activated.[1]
BT10-086.question: Q: My security cards were revealed due to the [When Digivolving] effect of this opponent's card, and 1 of them was trashed. Can I treat this as "when a card is removed from your security stack" and activate [BT4-097 Kari Kamiya]'s effect?

BT10-087.answer: A: When you play a Digimon card with DigiXros requirements, normally you can only DigiXros with Digimon from your hand or battle area. However, this effect also allows you to DigiXros with Digimon cards placed under a Tamer.[1]
BT10-087.question: Q: What does this card's "by suspending this Tamer, you may place cards from under your Tamers as digivolution cards for a DigiXros" effect do, exactly?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect also allow me to DigiXros with cards placed under a Tamer other than this Tamer?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect also allow me to DigiXros using the digivolution cards of a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer?

BT10-087.answer: A: No, this card's effect reads "when you would play 1 Digimon with DigiXros requirements", so if you play 2 or more Digimon cards at the same time, the effect cannot be activated.[1]
BT10-087.question: Q: If I play 2 or more Digimon cards with DigiXros requirements at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-087.answer: A: No, you can't. This card's effect can be activated when you would play 1 Digimon card with DigiXros requirements only.[1]
BT10-087.question: Q: If I play 1 Digimon card with DigiXros requirements and 1 card without DigiXros requirements at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-088.answer: A: When you play a Digimon card with DigiXros requirements, normally you can only DigiXros with Digimon from your hand or battle area. However, this effect also allows you to DigiXros with Digimon cards placed under a Tamer.[1]
BT10-088.question: Q: What does this card's "by suspending this Tamer, you may place cards from under your Tamers as digivolution cards for a DigiXros" effect do, exactly?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect also allow me to DigiXros with cards placed under a Tamer other than this Tamer?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect also allow me to DigiXros with the digivolution cards of a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer?

BT10-088.answer: A: No, this card's effect reads "when you would play 1 Digimon with DigiXros requirements", so if you play 2 or more Digimon cards at the same time, the effect cannot be activated.[1]
BT10-088.question: Q: If I play 2 or more Digimon cards with DigiXros requirements at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-088.answer: A: No, you can't. This card's effect can be activated when you would play 1 Digimon card with DigiXros requirements only.[1]
BT10-088.question: Q: If I play 1 Digimon card with DigiXros requirements and 1 card without DigiXros requirements at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-089.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect play a [Dorulumon] card from the digivolution cards of a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer?

BT10-090.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect play a [Ballistamon] card from the digivolution cards of a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer?

BT10-092.answer: A: You place them at the bottom of your deck in any order.[1]
BT10-092.question: Q: What happens to the cards that weren't added to my hand from among the cards revealed by this card’s effects?

BT10-093.question: Q: If I play a Digimon and want to place cards under it with DigiXros, can this card's [Your Turn] effect also place purple cards from under my Tamers in that Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT10-093.answer: A: No, this card's effect reads "when you would play 1 level 4 or higher Digimon with [Bagra Army] in one of its traits", so if you play 2 or more Digimon cards at the same time, the effect cannot be activated.[1]
BT10-093.question: Q: If I play 2 or more level 4 Digimon cards with [Bagra Army] in its traits at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-093.answer: A: No, you can't. This card's effect can be activated when you would play 1 level 4 Digimon cards with [Bagra Army] in its traits only.[1]
BT10-093.question: Q: If I play 1 level 4 Digimon cards with [Bagra Army] in its traits and 1 Digimon card without it at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-096.question: Q: If [Taiki Kudo] is among the cards revealed by this card's [Security] effect, can it be played?

BT10-096.answer: A: Yes, you can play [Taiki Kudo] even if there isn't a Digimon card with the [Xros Heart] trait.[1]
BT10-096.question: Q: If there is no Digimon card with the [Xros Heart] trait among the three revealed cards, can I still play [Taiki Kudo] from among the revealed cards?

BT10-096.answer: A: No, if you perform any of this effect you must perform as much of it as possible, so if both a Digimon card with the [Xros Heart] trait and a [Taiki Kudo] are among the 3 cards revealed, you must perform both "add [...] to your hand" and "play 1 [Taiki Kudo]," or you must choose to perform neither.[1]
BT10-096.question: Q: This card's [Security] effect reveals 3 cards. If both a Digimon card with the [Xros Heart] trait and a [Taiki Kudo] are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only activate the effect that adds the Digimon to my hand and not play [Taiki Kudo], or the other way around?

BT10-097.question: Q: If [Kiriha Aonuma] is among the cards revealed by this card's effect, can it be played?

BT10-097.answer: A: Yes, you can add 1 card if only 1 card is revealed.[1]
BT10-097.question: Q: Can this card's effect add fewer than 2 cards to my hand if it reveals fewer than 2 cards with the [Blue Flare] trait among the 6 revealed cards?

BT10-097.answer: A: No. For this card's effect you reveal cards, add 2 cards with the [Blue Flare] trait among them to your hand, then play 1 [Kiriha Aonuma] among them. Therefore, if there are 2 or fewer cards with the [Blue Flare] trait including [Kiriha Aonuma] among the revealed cards, you can't play [Kiriha Aonuma] because you would have to add it to your hand.[1]
BT10-097.question: Q: If there aren't 2 other Digimon cards with the [Blue Flare] trait among the six revealed cards, can I still play [Kiriha Aonuma] from among the revealed cards?

BT10-097.answer: A: No, if you perform any of this effect you must perform as much of it as possible, so if both cards with the [Blue Flare] trait and a [Kiriha Aonuma] are among the 3 cards revealed, you must perform both "add [...] to your hand" and "play 1 [Kiriha Aonuma]," or you must choose to perform neither.[1]
BT10-097.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 6 cards. If both cards with the [Blue Flare] trait and a [Kiriha Aonuma] are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only activate the effect that adds the cards to my hand and not play [Kiriha Aonuma], or the other way around?

BT10-100.question: Q: Can I place this card in my battle area even if I don't have a [Pulsemon] in my hand?

BT10-101.question: Q: I have exactly 3 security cards. Do I activate both this card's "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -12000 DP" effect and "place 1 of your opponent's Digimon face down on top of their security stack" effect?

BT10-101.answer: A: Yes, it's considered to have 3 cards. Cards revealed by a security check are not considered part of your security stack.[1]
BT10-101.question: Q: My opponent checked my security when I had 4 security cards, and this card was flipped over. This card's [Security] effect activates, but is my security stack considered to have 3 cards?

BT10-103.question: Q: After suspending 1 of my opponent's Digimon with this card's [Main] effect, can I return some other Digimon than the one I suspended to the bottom of their deck?

BT10-105.answer: A: No, the "can't be deleted by your opponent's effects" part of this card's effect still applies whether the target of the option is now a Tamer or a Digimon.
BT10-105.question: Q: If I use this option on a Digimon which is later de-digivolved into a Tamer, will my opponent be able to delete that Tamer with an effect on their turn?

BT10-108.answer: A: No, you can't. Trashing revealed cards from your deck does not count as "trashed from your deck."[1]
BT10-108.question: Q: When this card is trashed by a "Reveal the top X cards of your deck. [...] Trash the rest" effect, can I return it to my hand with this card's effect?

BT10-110.answer: A: No. Because [Jesmon GX]'s [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking] effects cannot be activated due to your opponent's [BT10-042 Venusmon], even this card can't activate those effects in these circumstances.[1]
BT10-110.question: Q: I have a [Jesmon GX]  that has <Security Attack> in play, while my opponent has a [BT10-042 Venusmon] in play. If I use this card and target my [Jesmon GX], can this card's effect activate [Jesmon GX]'s [When Digivolving] effects?

BT10-111.answer: A: When you would DigiXros, this effect allows you to replace 1 of the cards in that Digimon's DigiXros requirements. For example, when you would play a card with [Shoutmon X4] × [Beelzemon] in its DigiXros requirements, you may place this Digimon for the DigiXros instead of [Shoutmon X4] or [Beelzemon].[1]
BT10-111.question: Q: What does "When you would DigiXros this turn, this Digimon may replace 1 of the DigiXros requirements" mean?

BT10-111.answer: A: No, you can't. This card can only replace 1 card in the DigiXros requirements when DigiXrosing, not add to the DigiXros requirements.[1]
BT10-111.question: Q: When DigiXrosing, can I place all of the cards listed in the DigiXros requirements in the digivolution cards, then additionally DigiXros this card?

BT10-111.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that always treats it as if it also has the [Mamemon] name.[2]
BT10-111.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "The name of this card/Digimon is also treated as [Shoutmon]" has been changed to "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [Shoutmon].")

BT10-112.answer: A: It activates immediately after you place the card with [Royal Knight] in its traits and a play cost of 13 or less as the bottom digivolution card. The placed card's [When Digivolving] effect activates as part of this card's effect, and after its processing has completed, you can declare an attack for this card's ＜Blitz＞.[1]
BT10-112.question: Q: This card's [When Digivolving] effect reads "You may place 1 card with [Royal Knight] in its traits and a play cost of 13 or less from your hand or trash under this Digimon as its bottom digivolution card. Activate 1 of that card's [When Digivolving] effects as an effect of this Digimon." At what timing does that [When Digivolving] effect activate?

BT10-112.answer: A: [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc] is treated as a card played by this card's [When Digivolving] effect, so it is triggered at the same time as the [When Attacking] effect that was triggered by the attack declaration for ＜Blitz＞. The player may choose the activation order for this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect and [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc]'s [On Play] effect.[1]
BT10-112.question: Q: This card's [When Digivolving] effect placed a [BT10-016 Jesmon (X Antibody)] as a digivolution card, then that card's [When Digivolving] effect played a [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc], then I activated ＜Blitz＞ in this card's [When Digivolving] effect to attack. When does [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc]'s [On Play] effect activate?

BT10-112.answer: A: No, it doesn't. [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc]'s [On Play] effect is triggered, but it doesn't activate because the card is deleted before it activates.[1]
BT10-112.question: Q: This card's [When Digivolving] effect placed a [BT10-016 Jesmon (X Antibody)] as a digivolution card, then that card's [When Digivolving] effect played a [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc], then I activated ＜Blitz＞ in this card's [When Digivolving] effect to attack, and when the [When Attacking] effect deleted one of my opponent's Digimon, my [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc] was deleted by the [On Deletion] effect of the opponent's Digimon. [BT6-082 Sistermon Blanc]'s [On Play] effect hasn't activated yet, so does it activate?

BT11-005.question: Q: If both this Digimon with [Greymon] and an opponent's Digimon are deleted at the same time, will this card's inherited effect activate?

BT11-006.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even when a card is trashed from my hand by my my opponent's effect?

BT11-006.answer: A: No. It doesn't activate in such cases because [BT7-112 Susanoomon] is trashed by the rules, not an effect.[1]
BT11-006.question: Q: I used [BT7-112 Susanoomon]'s effect to return 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with the [Hybrid] trait to the bottom of my deck, then I chose to trash [BT7-112 Susanoomon] instead of digivolving it.  Does this card's inherited effect still activate in such cases?

BT11-007.answer: A: No, even if it does not have the [Vaccine] trait, you can add 1 red Tamer card to your hand. However, you can't add a red Digimon card to your hand if it doesn't have the [Vaccine] trait.[1]
BT11-007.question: Q: If the red Tamer cards among the cards revealed from my deck do not have the [Vaccine] trait, does that mean I can't add any cards to my hand?

BT11-007.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a red Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait or a red Tamer card is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
