BT11-007.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 3 cards. If the cards revealed only include either a red Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait or a red Tamer card, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT11-007.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 red Digimon card [...] and 1 red Tamer card among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT11-007.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 3 cards. If both a red Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait and a red Tamer card are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining cards at the bottom of my deck?
Q: If both a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and my red Tamer are deleted at the same time, does the "gain 1 memory" effect activate?

BT11-008.answer: A: Yes. Blocking causes the attack target to be switched, so the effect activates.[1]
BT11-008.question: Q: If I attack my opponent using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and my opponent blocks, does this card's inherited effect activate?

BT11-009.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that always treats it as if it also has the [Shoutmon] and [Starmons] names.[1]
BT11-009.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "This card/Digimon is also treated as if its name is [Shoutmon] and [Starmons]" has been changed to "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [Shoutmon] and [Starmons].")

BT11-010.answer: A: Yes. Blocking causes the attack target to be switched, so the effect activates.[1]
BT11-010.question: Q: If I attack my opponent using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and my opponent blocks, does this card's inherited effect activate?

BT11-012.answer: A: Yes, you can. In such cases, you add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT11-012.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] effect to add a card to my hand when only 1 card with the [Xros Heart] trait or [Blue Flare] trait is among the revealed cards?

BT11-016.answer: A: No, it doesn't. This effect is triggered "When a card is removed from your opponent's security stack," so even when you check multiple cards in your opponent's security stack, it is triggered upon the first check, then you choose whether to activate it or not. Also, this is a [Once Per Turn] effect, so if you activate this effect when a card is removed from their security stack upon the first check, you can't activate the effect again upon the next check.[1]
BT11-016.question: Q: Does this card's [My Turn] effect allow this card's [On Deletion] effect to be activated twice when I use one of my Digimon with ＜Security A. +1＞ to check 2 cards in my opponent's security stack?

BT11-016.answer: A: Yes. Other than [Sea Animal], all traits with [Avian], [Bird], [Beast], [Animal] or [Sovereign] are applicable regardless of other words or pluralizations.[1]
BT11-016.question: Q: Does "with [Avian], [Bird], [Beast], [Animal] or [Sovereign] in one of its traits (other than [Sea Animal])" mean that all traits with the [Avian], [Bird], [Beast], [Animal] or [Sovereign] text other than [Sea Animal] are included regardless of other words or pluralizations?

BT11-016.answer: A: It means that you can use this card's [On Deletion] effect to play "1 red Digimon with [Avian], [Bird], [Beast], [Animal] or [Sovereign] in one of its traits (other than [Sea Animal]), and 3000 DP or less," and if you have a red Tamer when this effect is activated, you add 2000 to the maximum DP for the "3000 DP or less" restriction. For example, you can play 1 Digimon card with 5000 DP or less if you have 1 red Tamer, and you can play 1 Digimon card with 7000 DP or less if you have 2 red Tamers.[1]
BT11-016.question: Q: What does "For each red Tamer you have in play, add 2000 to the maximum DP of the card you can play by this effect" on this card mean?

BT11-016.answer: A: No, you can't. It only affects the [On Deletion] effect on this card itself.[1]
BT11-016.question: Q: Can I use this card's "For each red Tamer you have in play, add 2000 to the maximum DP of the card you can play by this effect" effect to add 2000 to the maximum DP of my Digimon played with effects other than this card's effects?

BT11-017.answer: A: Yes. Blocking causes the attack target to be switched, so the effect activates.[1]
BT11-017.question: Q: If I attack my opponent using this Digimon and my opponent blocks, does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT11-107.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's effect only allows you to attack a player.[1]

You can't trash past level 3 cards.) effect?

BT11-111.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area" refers to when this Digimon is placed in the trash, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]

BT11-111.answer: A: Yes, you can activate it when this Digimon is affected by effect that moves it to one of those areas.[1]

BT11-111.answer: A: No, it doesn't activate if it becomes your opponent's turn before your main phase.[1]

BT11-112.answer: A: Yes you can. In such cases, even if there's no [When Digivolving] effect to target with this effect, this card still becomes suspended.[1]

If the card it digivolved into has a [When Digivolving], if I suspend this card with this card's [All Turns] effect, can I activate the [When Digivolving] effect of the card it digivolved into?

BT12-001.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[1]
BT12-001.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

BT12-001.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[1]

BT12-024.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]

BT12-024.answer: A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]

BT12-057.answer: A: Count the total number of you and your opponent's suspended Digimon and suspended Tamers, then gain 1 memory for every 2. BT12-065.question: Q: Can I choose an opponent's Digimon with a "can't attack" effect as the target when I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT12-065.answer: A: At the start of your opponent's main phase, the effects gained from this card's effect are triggered at the same time, and your opponent determines which one activates first. After effects such as [When Attacking] have activated, and before the counter timing occurs, it is time to activate the effect of the 2nd Digimon that was pending activation. However, since the 1st Digimon is already attacking, the effect ends without an attack made. As a result, only the Digimon whose effect was activated first can attack.[1]

BT12-065.answer: A: You can still choose a "this Digimon isn't affected by your opponent’s effects" Digimon as a target for the effect. As soon as it becomes your opponent's turn, that opposing Digimon loses the "this Digimon isn't affected by your opponent’s effects" effect and is affected by this card's effect. As a result, the attack occurs at the start of the main phase.[1]
