BT12-088.answer: A: No. If the DP is not 10000 or more when the effect activates, you can't gain 2 memory.[1]
BT12-088.question: Q: A Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards attacked the player while it had 10000 DP, then a security check was performed. If the [Security] effect on the flipped card reduces the DP to 9000 or less, do I still activate this card's "gain 2 memory" inherited effect?

BT12-088.answer: A: "When this Digimon checks an opponent's security" is triggered when the Digimon with the effect makes a security check on the opponent due to attacking them or after ＜Piercing＞, for example. "When a card is removed from your opponent's security stack" does trigger from security checks, but it also triggers when security cards are removed for other reasons, such as effects that trash the opponent's security cards.[1]
BT12-088.question: Q: How is the "When this Digimon checks an opponent's security" effect gained from this card's inherited effect different from "When a card is removed from your opponent's security stack"?

BT12-088.answer: A: No, this card's inherited effect activates after [Security] effects but before battling against the Security Digimon.[2]
BT12-088.question: Q: A Digimon with this card as a digivolution card attacks a player and is deleted in battle against a Security Digimon. At that moment, can I activate this card's inherited effect to gain 2 memory?

BT12-089.answer: A: Yes, you can. In such cases, the cards placed in [Guilmon]'s digivolution cards stay there.[1]
BT12-089.question: Q: After I activate this card's [Main] effect and place [Growlmon] and [WarGrowlmon] in my [Guilmon]'s digivolution cards. Can I choose to not digivolve it into [Gallantmon] in my hand?
Q: Can I digivolve one of my [Guilmon] to a [Gallantmon] in my hand when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon other than this card's is activated?

BT12-090.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [Your Turn] effect when I attack with a 2-color green/blue (in that specific order) Digimon or with a Digimon that is blue and green because of an effect?

BT12-090.answer: A: No, you can't. Since this card's effect specifies "one of your 2-color blue and green Digimon", you can't activate this card's [Your Turn] effect if your Digimon has 3 or more colors, even if those colors include blue and green.[1]
BT12-090.question: Q: Can I also activate this card's [Your Turn] effect when my 3-color Digimon with blue and green attacks?

BT12-092.answer: A: This Tamer can perform attacks just like Digimon, and it can also be affected by effects that target Digimon. It can also be deleted in battle with a Digimon or Security Digimon.[1]
BT12-092.question: Q: This card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect allows this Tamer to be treated as a Digimon. What does this mean, exactly?
Q: When the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect has this card also be treated as a Digimon, does this card get deleted when an opponent's effect reduces its DP to 0?

BT12-092.answer: A: Yes, it is met. If this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect is activated, this card is treated as both a Digimon and a Tamer, so the "When this Tamer becomes suspended" condition is considered to be met when this card is suspended.[1]
BT12-092.question: Q: When the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect has this card also be treated as a Digimon and then this card is suspended, does that meet the "When this Tamer becomes suspended" condition in this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT12-092.answer: A: No, it's not. This card's effect has the Tamer be treated as a Digimon. As soon as it is placed in another Digimon's digivolution cards, it is treated as just a Tamer card and any activated effects are lost.[1]
BT12-092.question: Q: When the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect has this card also be treated as a Digimon and then this Digimon is placed in another Digimon's digivolution cards by a "place 1 Digimon as another Digimon's digivolution card" effect, is this card treated as "a Digimon card in digivolution cards" during that turn?

BT12-098.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a Digimon card with ＜Save＞ in its text or a card with the [Hunter] trait is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT12-098.question: Q: This card’s [On Play] effect reveals 3 cards. If the cards revealed only include a Digimon card with ＜Save＞ in its text or a card with the [Hunter] trait, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT12-098.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 Digimon card [...] and 1 card [...] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT12-098.question: Q: This card’s [On Play] effect reveals 3 cards. If both a Digimon card with ＜Save＞ in its text and a card with the [Hunter] trait are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining card at the bottom of my deck?

BT12-099.answer: A: No, it doesn't. This card's effect doesn't let you attack with a Digimon that's in a state where it can't attack.[1]
BT12-099.question: Q: Does this card's [Main] effect let me attack with a suspended Digimon or with a Digimon that was played that turn?
Q: When I use this card's [Main] effect to attack, does the attacking Digimon's [When Attacking] effect activate?

BT12-100.answer: A: No, it doesn't. This card's effect doesn't let you attack with a Digimon that's in a state where it can't attack.[1]
BT12-100.question: Q: Does this card's [Main] effect let me attack with a Digimon that was played that turn?
Q: When I use this card's [Main] effect to attack, does the attacking Digimon's [When Attacking] effect activate?

BT12-102.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to place a blue Digimon as the bottom digivolution card of another Digimon, what happens to that Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT12-102.answer: A: It's not being trashed by the effect, it's being trashed because of the rules, so [BT9-109 X Antibody] does still get trashed.[1]
BT12-102.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to place a blue Digimon as the bottom digivolution card of another Digimon, what happens if that Digimon has [BT9-109 X Antibody] in its digivolution cards?

BT12-104.question: Q: If I have a 2-color yellow/red Tamer, can I count it as 2 Tamers for this card's [Main] effect?

BT12-104.answer: A: 3 of your opponent's Digimon get -4000 DP. This card's effect only targets 3 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT12-104.question: Q: If I have a 2-color yellow/red Tamer, does this card's [Main] effect give 6 of my opponent's Digimon -2000 DP for the turn or 3 of my opponent's Digimon -4000 DP for the turn?

BT12-105.answer: A: Yes, in such cases you win the game.[1]
BT12-105.question: Q: If my Digimon attacks my opponent who has 1 security card, and I've used this card so its [Main] effect has given an opponent's Digimon the [On Deletion] effect, then delete that Digimon with a [When Attacking] effect, do I win the game by trashing the security card before the check and making it so I am attacking an opponent with 0 security cards?

BT12-106.answer: A: No, it doesn't unsuspend. This card reads "Your opponent's cards don't unsuspend during their next unsuspend phase," and this also affects cards that were later played or moved to the battle area.[1]
BT12-106.question: Q: My opponent played a suspended Digimon by an effect after I activated this card's [Main] effect. Does my opponent's Digimon unsuspend in my opponent's next unsuspend phase?

BT12-107.answer: A: Yes, you can. However, in such cases the "can't attack" effect prevents making the attack.[1]
BT12-107.question: Q: Can I choose an opponent's Digimon with a "can't attack" effect as the target when I activate this card's [Main] effect?

BT12-107.answer: A: At the start of your opponent's main phase, the effects gained from this card's effect are triggered at the same time, and your opponent determines which one activates first. After effects such as [When Attacking] have activated, and before the counter timing occurs, it is time to activate the effect of the 2nd Digimon that was pending activation. However, since the 1st Digimon is already attacking, the effect ends without an attack made. As a result, only the Digimon whose effect was activated first can attack.[1]
BT12-107.question: Q: What happens if this card's effect activates twice and 2 of my opponent's Digimon gain the "[Start of Your Main Phase] Attack with this Digimon" effect?

BT12-107.answer: A: You can still choose a "this Digimon isn't affected by your opponent’s effects" Digimon as a target for the effect. As soon as it becomes your opponent's turn, that opposing Digimon loses the "this Digimon isn't affected by your opponent’s effects" effect and is affected by this card's effect. As a result, the attack occurs at the start of the main phase.[1]
BT12-107.question: Q: What happens if this card's effect is activated on an opponent's Digimon with an "[Opponent's Turn] This Digimon isn't affected by your opponent’s effects" effect?

BT12-110.answer: A: When this card is in your trash, the effect can activate when one of your Digimon digivolves into [Beelzemon (X Antibody)]. [Trash] means that the card needs to be in your trash for the effect to activate.[1]
BT12-110.question: Q: When exactly is the timing for "[Trash] [Your Turn]"?

BT12-110.answer: A: When activating the effect from your trash, it's not considered to be using an Option card, so there are no color requirements and no cost to be paid.[1]
BT12-110.question: Q: What happens to the color requirements and cost when I activate this card's [Trash] effect?

BT12-110.answer: A: No. Activating an effect from your trash isn't considered to be using an Option card, so they don't trigger.[1]
BT12-110.question: Q: Are "when using an Option card" effects triggered if I activate this card's [Trash] effect?

BT12-112.answer: A: No, it can't. The effect only allows you to place a [Shoutmon] from the battle area in its digivolution cards.[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: When playing this card, can the [Shoutmon] I place in its digivolution cards for its effect come from my hand, breeding area, or trash?
Q: When I activate the "When this card would be played" effect and place [Shoutmon] in this card's digivolution cards, what happens to [Shoutmon]'s digivolution cards?

BT12-112.answer: A: It's not being trashed by the effect, it's being trashed because of the rules, so [BT9-109 X Antibody] does still get trashed.[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: When this card's effect places [Shoutmon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards, what happens if [Shoutmon] has [BT9-109 X Antibody] in its digivolution cards?

BT12-112.answer: A: No, you can't. DigiXros is performed after all ""would be played"" effects have activated. Therefore, you must first place [Shoutmon] in its digivolution cards for the effect and then place cards under the [Shoutmon] digivolution card for the DigiXros.[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: When I activate the "When this card would be played" effect and place [Shoutmon] in this card's digivolution cards, can I first place cards for DigiXros and only then place [Shoutmon]?

Q: [Shoutmon]'s digivolution cards are trashed when I place it in this Digimon's digivolution cards for the "When this card would be played" effect. Can I DigiXros with those trashed cards and place them in this Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT12-112.answer: A: It means that you can DigiXros with as many cards as you like, as long as all the cards have the [Xros Heart] or [Blue Flare] trait and different card numbers.[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: What does "∞ Digimon cards w/[Xros Heart] or [Blue Flare] trait & different card numbers" in this card's DigiXros requirements mean?

BT12-112.answer: A: No, it's not DigiXros if you don't place any cards.[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: This card's DigiXros requirements say "∞ Digimon cards," but is it still considered DigiXros if I place 0 cards?

BT12-112.answer: A: Yes, you can. A [Shoutmon] placed as a digivolution card for this card's ""When you would play this card"" effect is not treated as placed by the DigiXros, so it is not included in this card's ""different card numbers"" DigiXros condition.[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: If I place [Shoutmon] as a digivolution card for this card's "When you would play this card" effect, can I place another card with the same number as that [Shoutmon] as a digivolution card under this Digimon for this card's DigiXros?

BT13-004.question: Q: "While my opponent has no suspended Digimon, I attack with a Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards, then my opponent's Digimon blocks and suspends.  Does this card's inherited effect activate upon the battle with the opponent's Digimon that blocked?"

BT13-006.answer: A: Yes, you can. You can't delete an opponent's Digimon, but you can trash a card in your hand.[1]
BT13-006.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Deletion] inherited effect to trash 1 card in my hand even if my opponent has no level 3 Digimon when the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards is deleted?

BT13-007.answer: A: That's correct, such digivolutions are also not possible.[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: Does this card's [Breeding] [Your Turn] effect also prevent my Digimon from DNA digivolving or burst digivolving?

BT13-007.answer: A: No, they can't be digivolved.[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: Does this card's 1st [Breeding] [Your Turn] effect allow my Tamers to digivolve using a "you may digivolve as if your Tamer is a level 3 Digimon" effect?

BT13-007.answer: A: Yes, they can be digivolved.[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: Does this card's 1st [Breeding] [Your Turn] effect allow my Tamers to digivolve using digivolution requirements for digivolving from Tamers?

BT13-007.answer: A: This effect additionally increases the numerical value of the play cost reduction in "when a [Royal Knight] trait Digimon card would be played, you may reduce the play cost by 4" in this carad's 2nd [Breeding] [Your Turn] effect.  For example, if this Digimon has 1 digivolution card, the numerical value of the play cost reduction will be 5.[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: What does "further reduce it by 1 for each of this Digimon's digivolution cards" in this card's 2nd [Breeding] [Your Turn] effect mean, exactly?

BT13-007.answer: A: No, you must perform as much of the processing as possible.[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: Can I choose to not reveal the top card of my Digi-Egg deck and not place my [Royal Knight] trait Digimon as this Digimon's bottom digivolution cards for this card's [Breeding] [Start of Your Main Phase]?

BT13-007.answer: A: The player that activated the effect chooses the order of the bottom digivolution cards that are placed.  Note that the cards placed by this effect must be placed under any already placed digivolution cards.[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: If multiple cards are placed as the bottom digivolution cards for this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, what order are the cards placed?

BT13-007.answer:
A: No, it isn't processed.  
Overflow is processed when a card is sent from the area or from under a card to another area.  In this case, 
Overflow isn't processed because a card from the area is placed under another card.[2]
BT13-007.question: Q: When I use this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect to place a BT17-078 [Omnimon ACE] under this card as a digivolution card, is BT17-078 [Omnimon ACE] processed?

BT13-007.answer: A: No, they can't be reduced. [BT8-071 Psychemon]'s effect does not target Digimon, so even if your opponent's [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6] is in the breeding area, its effect to reduce play costs can't be activated.[3]
BT13-007.question: Q: Can the play cost of a Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait be reduced due to the [Your Turn] effect of my opponent's [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6] if [BT8-071 Psychemon] is in play?

BT13-007.answer: A: No, using and activating [BT10-110 Seiken Meppa]'s [Main] effect does not cause a card to be "placed" in the Battle Area, so this card's inherited effect does not trigger.[4]
BT13-007.question: Q: Does using [BT10-110 Seiken Meppa] trigger this card's inherited effect to gain memory?

BT13-008.answer: A: The DP is overwritten by the effect that activated afterward, therefore the card is treated as a Digimon with 3000 DP.  The ＜Rush＞ gained from [BT13-020 ShineGreymon: Burst Mode]'s effect remains because it isn't overwritten by anything.[1]
BT13-008.question: Q: What happens if this card's effect activates for my [Marcus Damon] that's treated as a 12000 DP Digimon with ＜Rush＞ due to [BT13-020 ShineGreymon: Burst Mode]'s effect?
Q: If [Marcus Damon] is treated as a Digimon by this card's effect and then its DP is reduced to 0 by an effect, is it deleted?

BT13-009.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the player chooses the activation order.[1]
BT13-009.question: Q: When I play a Digimon with [Sistermon], which effect activates first, that Digimon's [On Play] effect or this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT13-010.question: Q: Can I use this card’s [On Play] effect to return my [Kristy Damon] to my hand even if I don't have a [Garudamon] in my hand?

BT13-012.answer: A: It means you can look at all of the cards in your security stack, without revealing them to your opponent. If a card that can be played by the effect is among them, you may reveal that card and play it.[1]
BT13-012.question: Q: What does "You may search your security stack" in this card's [When Digivolving] effect mean, exactly?

BT13-012.answer: A: <Security +1 (Deck)> doesn't occur. Shuffle your security stack, and the effect ends.[1]
BT13-012.question: Q: What happens for this card's effect if there are no cards in my security stack that I can play or want to play?

BT13-013.answer: A: No, you can't.  Your Digimon with [Sistermon] was played before the inherited effect could activate by digivolving this Digimon, therefore the inherited effect isn't triggered.[1]
BT13-013.question: Q: "I play a Digimon with [Sistermon] and use this card's [Your Turn] effect to digivolve this Digimon into [SaviorHuckmon] in my hand.   Can I gain 1 memory from this card's inherited effect at this time?"

BT13-013.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the player chooses the activation order.[1]
BT13-013.question: Q: When I play a Digimon with [Sistermon], which effect activates first, that Digimon's [On Play] effect or this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT13-015.question: Q: When one of my red or yellow [Marcus Damon] is deleted, can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to place the deleted [Marcus Damon] card from my trash on top of my security stack?

BT13-016.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the player chooses the activation order.[1]
BT13-016.question: Q: When I play a Digimon with [Sistermon], which effect activates first, that Digimon's [On Play] effect or this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT13-018.question: Q: If [Marcus Damon] is treated as a Digimon by this card's effect and then its DP is reduced to 0 by an effect, is it deleted?

BT13-019.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect to play [BT5-111 Omnimon X Anti-body], [BT10-068 Gankoomon (X Antibody)], and [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)] from the digivolution cards of my Digimon in the breeding area?

BT13-020.question: Q: If [Marcus Damon] is treated as a Digimon by this card's effect and then its DP is reduced to 0 by an effect, is it deleted?

BT13-020.answer: A: No, you can't.  You can only return your own Tamer to the hand for Burst Digivolve.[1]
BT13-020.question: Q: Can I return an opponent's Tamer to its owner's hand for this card's Burst Digivolve?

BT13-029.answer: A: In addition to ＜Blocker＞, this effect prevents the attack target from being switched due to effects such as "you may switch the target of attack to this Digimon."[1]
BT13-029.question: Q: How is the "this Digimon's attack target can't be switched" effect on this card different from "This Digimon can't be blocked"?

BT13-030.answer: A: No, you can't.  This effect only targets 1 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT13-030.question: Q: If I have 2 total cards consisting of Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait and/or blue Tamers, can I use this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect to trash the top 2 digivolution cards of 2 different opponent's Digimon?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate when this card itself is played?

BT13-030.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the player chooses the activation order.[1]
BT13-030.question: Q: When this card is played, in what order does its [On Play][When Digivolving] effect and [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT13-033.answer: A: No, you can't.  You can only return your own Tamer to the hand for Burst Digivolve.[1]
BT13-033.question: Q: Can I return an opponent's Tamer to its owner's hand for this card's Burst Digivolve?

BT13-033.answer: A: The player that activated this card's effect. The player chooses the cards in their opponent's hand until there are only 8 left and the order they are returned to the deck before returning them to the bottom of the deck.[1]
BT13-033.question: Q: Which player chooses the cards in my opponent's hand to return to the deck with this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT13-033.answer: A: Yes, you can.  After your opponent activates this effect, they select cards without looking at them, therefore they can't check the cards before they are returned to the bottom of the deck. However, the owner of the returned cards may look at them before returning them to the bottom of the deck.[1]
BT13-033.question: Q: When using this card's [When Attacking] effect to return cards from my hand to the bottom of my deck, can I check what cards I am returning to my deck?

BT13-034.answer: A: It means the total number of cards in both you and your opponent's security stacks. For example, if you have 3 cards in your security stack and your opponent has 2 cards in their security stack, the total security cards will be 5 cards.[1]
BT13-034.question: Q: What does "the total cards in both players' security stacks" in this card's inherited effect mean?

BT13-036.answer: A: It means the total number of cards in both you and your opponent's security stacks.  For example, if you have 3 cards in your security stack and your opponent has 2 cards in their security stack, the total security cards will be 5 cards.[1]
BT13-036.question: Q: What does "the total cards in both players' security stacks" in this card's inherited effect mean?

BT13-037.answer: A: It means the total number of cards in both you and your opponent's security stacks.  For example, if you have 3 cards in your security stack and your opponent has 2 cards in their security stack, the total security cards will be 5 cards.[1]
BT13-037.question: Q: What does "the total cards in both players' security stacks" in this card's inherited effect mean?

BT13-038.answer: A: It means the total number of cards in both you and your opponent's security stacks.  For example, if you have 3 cards in your security stack and your opponent has 2 cards in their security stack, the total security cards will be 5 cards.[1]
BT13-038.question: Q: What does "the total cards in both players' security stacks" in this card's inherited effect mean?

BT13-040.answer: A: No, "When this Digimon would leave the battle area" does not trigger for DNA Digivolution.[1]
BT13-040.question: Q: If I attempt to DNA digivolve this Digimon and another Digimon, can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect to prevent the digivolution?

BT13-046.answer: A: It means the total number of cards in both you and your opponent's security stacks.  For example, if you have 3 cards in your security stack and your opponent has 2 cards in their security stack, the total security cards will be 5 cards.[1]
BT13-046.question: Q: What does "the total cards in both players' security stacks" in this card's effect mean?

BT13-046.answer: A: No, you can't. If the total cards in both players' security stacks is 6 or less, you must perform the rest of the effect to the best of your ability.[1]
BT13-046.question: Q: Can I choose to not use this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect to reveal 1 card from my hand if I don't have any yellow cards or I don't want to add cards to my security stack?

BT13-046.answer: A: You place it on top of your security stack because the card's colors include yellow. You can't return it to your hand.[1]
BT13-046.question: Q: If I use this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect to reveal a 2-color yellow card from my hand, do I place it on top of my security stack or return it to my hand?

BT13-052.question: Q: I attack with a Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards when my opponent has just 1 Digimon with ＜Blocker＞, and my opponent's Digimon blocks. If this means my opponent no longer has any unsuspended Digimon, does this card's inherited effect give my Digimon +1000 DP upon a battle?

BT13-053.question: Q: Can I choose different Digimon for the Digimon to suspend and the Digimon that doesn't unsuspend until the end of my opponent's turn for this card's [On Play] effect?

BT13-053.answer: A: Yes, you can.  However, this effect only prevents the target Digimon from unsuspending until the end of your opponent's turn. It doesn't suspend the target Digimon.[1]
BT13-053.question: Q: Can I choose one of my opponent's unsuspended Digimon for "until the end of your opponent's turn, 1 of your opponent's Digimon doesn't unsuspend" in this card's [On Play] effect?
Q: Can I choose a Digimon other than a Digimon with 7000 DP or less when choosing the Digimon that doesn't unsuspend until the end of my opponent's turn for this card's [On Play] effect?

BT13-055.answer: A: This card’s inherited effect activates first. After trashing the top card of your opponent's security stack, perform the security check for ＜Piercing＞.[1]
BT13-055.question: Q: Which comes first, trashing the top card of my opponent's security stack from this card's inherited effect or the security check from the ＜Piercing＞ effect?

BT13-056.answer: A: No, you can't.  This effect is a [Once Per Turn] effect, therefore it can't activate again during the same turn that it activated for [When Digivolving], even if the timings are different.[1]
BT13-056.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s [When Digivolving][Main] effect both for a digivolution into this card and for the main phase in the same turn?

Q: When I use this card’s [When Digivolving][Main] effect to play a card with the [Royal Knight] trait, can I activate both this card's effect and my [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6]'s effect to reduce the play cost according to each respective effect?

BT13-056.answer: A: Yes, it does.  Note that this effect applies to ""all of your Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait and all your green Digimon,"" therefore any applicable Digimon that are placed in the battle area after this effect activates will also receive ＜Blocker＞.[1]
BT13-056.question: Q: When I play a card with the [Royal Knight] trait or a green Digimon card, does this card's [All Turns] effect also give ＜Blocker＞ to that played Digimon?

BT13-057.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to suspend 1 of my opponent's Digimon or Tamers even when this Digimon was originally unsuspended?

BT13-058.answer: A: Yes, you must activate it.[1]
BT13-058.question: Q: Do I have to activate this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT13-060.answer: A: No. A single suspended Digimon or Tamer will count as long as the total suspended cards is 2 or more.[1]
BT13-060.question: Q: Does my opponent have to have a combination of 2 suspended Digimon or a combination of 2 suspended Tamers in order for them to count toward "every 2 of your opponent's suspended Digimon and Tamers" in this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT13-060.answer: A: No, you can't.  You can only return your own Tamer to the hand for Burst Digivolve.[1]
BT13-060.question: Q: Can I return an opponent's Tamer to its owner's hand for this card's Burst Digivolve?

BT13-064.answer: A: Yes, it includes this card itself.[1]
BT13-064.question: Q: Does "Digimon card with [Chessmon] in your trash" in this card's [On Deletion] effect also include this card itself?

BT13-065.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect delete an opponent's [Sukamon] to prevent itself from being deleted?

BT13-065.answer: A: No, it can't be activated.  Until the processing for the 1st activation has resolved, only 1 activation is possible for each immediate-type effect.  In your case, until the deletion of the 1st only [Sukamon] A is resolved, only 1 activation is possible for each "when [...] would" effect, therefore the effect that has already activated for [Sukamon] A can't be activated again.[2]
BT13-065.question: Q: I have [Sukamon] A and [Sukamon] B with this card in their digivolution cards in the battle area.  When [Sukamon] A would be deleted, I attempted to delete [Sukamon] B using this card's inheriated effect.  On the other hand, when [Sukamon] B would be deleted, I attempted to delete [Sukamon] A using this card's inherited effect.  At such times, can [Sukamon] A activate this card's inherited effect again?

BT13-069.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect delete an opponent's [Sukamon] to prevent itself from being deleted?

BT13-069.answer: A: No, it can't be activated.  Until the processing for the 1st activation has resolved, only 1 activation is possible for each immediate-type effect.  In your case, until the deletion of the 1st only [Sukamon] A is resolved, only 1 activation is possible for each "when [...] would" effect, therefore the effect that has already activated for [Sukamon] A can't be activated again.[2]
BT13-069.question: Q: I have [Sukamon] A and [Sukamon] B with this card in their digivolution cards in the battle area.  When [Sukamon] A would be deleted, I attempted to delete [Sukamon] B using this card's inherited effect.  On the other hand, when [Sukamon] B would be deleted, I attempted to delete [Sukamon] A using this card's inherited effect.  At such times, can [Sukamon] A activate this card's inherited effect again?

BT13-073.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's [All Turns] effect is triggered when one of your Digimon with [Chessmon] is deleted, therefore it won't trigger if such a Digimon isn't deleted.[1]
BT13-073.question: Q: If an effect such as ＜Decoy (nocategory)＞ (When your other nocategory Digimon would be deleted by an opponent's effect, you may delete this Digimon to prevent 1 of those Digimon's deletion.) prevents deletion when this suspended Digimon would be deleted, can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to unsuspend this Digimon?

BT13-075.question: Q: When my opponent activated this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect, my Digimon with a play cost of 9 or less digivolved in my next turn and became a Digimon with a play cost of 10 or more. Can I attack with this Digimon?

BT13-075.answer: A: The attack has already been declared, so the attack will continue.[1]
BT13-075.question: Q: A Digimon with a play cost of 9 or less attacked a player, digivolved using a [When Attacking] effect, and became a Digimon with a play cost of 10 or more in a state where this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect was activated for my opponent. What happens to the attack in such cases?

BT13-076.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also trigger when one of my opponent's Digimon with [Etemon] is deleted?

BT13-077.answer: A: Yes, it can be blocked.  ＜Blocker＞ is an effect that allows for the Digimon to block, so it isn't affected by ""isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon"" effects.[1]
BT13-077.question: Q: If this Digimon attacks when this card's [On Play][When Attacking] effect prevents it from being affected by the effects of my opponent's Digimon, can it be blocked by my opponent's Digimon?

BT13-077.answer: A: No, you don't have to choose an opponent's Digimon.[2]
BT13-077.question: Q: Do I have to choose an opponent's Digimon for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect?

BT13-077.answer: A: No, they can't attack using a Digimon that can't attack.[2]
BT13-077.question: Q: If I choose an opponent's Digimon that can't attack for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect, does my opponent attack with that Digimon?

BT13-077.answer: A: No, your opponent can't attack using that Digimon. A new attack declaration can't be made during an attack.  In such cases, even if you choose an opponent's Digimon for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect when there is already an attacking Digimon, your opponent can't attack with the chosen Digimon.[2]
BT13-077.question: Q: An opponent's Digimon is attacking using an effect at the end of their turn.  If I choose an opponent's Digimon for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect, does my opponent attack with that Digimon?

BT13-077.answer: A: Yes, you can choose a Digimon that isn't affected by effects for this and have it attack.  Such Digimon aren't affected by effects, but they can be chosen.  In addition, "your opponent attacks with the chosen Digimon" in this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect affects a player, therefore your opponent must attack with the chosen Digimon if it can attack.[2]
BT13-077.question: Q: Can I choose a Digimon that isn't affected by effects for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect and have it attack?

BT13-077.answer: A: Yes, it isn't affected.  [Security] effects on Security Digimon are treated as Digimon effects, so the "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effect prevents such effects from affecting this Digimon.[2]
BT13-077.question: Q: Does this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect prevent [Security] effects on my opponent's Security Digimon from affecting this Digimon?

BT13-079.question: Q: Do I or my opponent choose the card to be trashed from their hand when I activate this card's inherited effect?

BT13-079.answer: A: Yes. It activates because the Digimon is deleted by the ＜Retaliation＞ effect, not by battle.[1]
BT13-079.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is deleted by ＜Retaliation＞ on a battled opponent's Digimon?

BT13-080.answer: A: Yes it can. Placing a card in digivolution cards isn't digivolution.[1]
BT13-080.question: Q: This Digimon can't Digivolve, but can it be placed in another Digimon's digivolution cards by a card effect?
Q: Can I use this card's [On Deletion] effect to return this card itself from my trash to the bottom of my deck?

Q: When I only have 2 cards with [Gizmon] including this card in my trash, can I use this card's [On Deletion] effect to return those 2 cards to the bottom of my deck but not play [Gizmon: AT] from my trash?

BT13-082.question: Q: Do I or my opponent choose the card to be trashed from their hand when I activate this card's inherited effect?

BT13-082.answer: A: Yes. It activates because the Digimon is deleted by the ＜Retaliation＞ effect, not by battle.[1]
BT13-082.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is deleted by ＜Retaliation＞ on a battled opponent's Digimon?

BT13-083.answer: A: Yes it can. Placing a card in digivolution cards isn't digivolution.[1]
BT13-083.question: Q: This Digimon can't Digivolve, but can it be placed in another Digimon's digivolution cards by a card effect?
Q: Can I use this card's [On Deletion] effect to return this card itself from my trash to the bottom of my deck?

Q: When I only have 2 cards with [Gizmon] including this card in my trash, can I use this card's [On Deletion] effect to return those 2 cards to the bottom of my deck but not play [Gizmon: XT] from my trash?

BT13-085.answer: A: Yes. It activates because the Digimon is deleted by the ＜Retaliation＞ effect, not by battle.[1]
BT13-085.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is deleted by ＜Retaliation＞ on a battled opponent's Digimon?

BT13-087.answer: A: No, the 2 cards you add to your hand are cards that fulfill either of the conditions: a card with [Lucemon] or a card with the [Royal Knight] trait. Therefore, in addition to the combinations from your question, you can also add 1 card with [Lucemon] and 1 card with the [Royal Knight] trait to your hand.[1]
BT13-087.question: Q: Do I have to choose 2 cards with [Lucemon] or 2 cards with the [Royal Knight] trait among the revealed cards to add to my hand for this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect?

BT13-087.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT13-087.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to add a card to my hand when only 1 card with [Lucemon] or the [Royal Knight] trait is among the 5 revealed cards?

BT13-089.answer: A: The effect triggers simultaneously with your opponent's [End of Your Turn] effects, therefore your opponent's [End of Your Turn] effects and any derived effects will activate first because your opponent is the turn player.[1]
BT13-089.question: Q: At what timing do I play [Ravemon] from my trash at the end of my opponent's turn for this card's effect?

BT13-089.answer: A: No, you can't.  At the end of your turn, [BT13-092 Ravemon: Burst Mode] is still placed, so this card's [End of Your Turn] effect isn't triggered.[1]
BT13-089.question: Q: This card Burst Digivolved into [BT13-092 Ravemon: Burst Mode]. At the end of my turn, the [BT13-092 Ravemon: Burst Mode] that was placed for the Burst Digivolve is trashed, but then can I activate this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT13-092.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card’s [When Digivolving] effect can only be used to search your opponent's hand for the card you choose to trash from their hand.[1]
BT13-092.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to look at the card that my opponent adds to their hand from their security stack?

BT13-092.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's [When Attacking] effect reads ""your opponent's Digimon that share a name with the returned card,"" therefore if you return your opponent's [Greymon] to their deck, you can only delete your opponent's Digimon with the [Greymon] name.[1]
BT13-092.question: Q: If I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to return my opponent's [Greymon] to the bottom of their deck from their trash, can I delete my opponent's cards such as [MetalGreymon] and [WarGreymon]?

Q: If I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to return my opponent's card with "This card/Digimon is also treated as [XX]" to the bottom of their deck from their trash, can I delete both my opponent's Digimon with the same name as that card and my opponent's Digimon with the [XX] name?

BT13-092.answer: A: No, since the card was not revealed by a security check, its [Security] effect can't be activated.[1]
BT13-092.question: Q: If the card that my opponent adds to their hand from their security stack by this card's [When Digivolving] effect has a [Security] effect, does that effect activate?

BT13-093.answer: A: No. The cards in your hand count as private information, so you don't have to place that card.[1]
BT13-093.question: Q: If I have a Digimon card with the [Royal Knight] trait in my hand, do I have to place it under my [Yggdrasill_7D6] in the breeding area as its bottom digivolution card for this card's [On Deletion] effect?

BT13-095.question: Q: If I have [Agumon] or [Greymon] but my opponent has no Digimon when this Tamer becomes suspended, can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to gain 1 memory without 1 of my opponent's Digimon getting -3000 DP?

BT13-096.question: Q: When I played a blue Digimon, its DP became 0 by an opponent's effect that had already activated, so the Digimon was deleted at the same time it was played. Does this Tamer's [All Turns] effect still trigger in such cases?

BT13-097.answer: A: Yes, you must draw 1 card from your deck if possible.[1]
BT13-097.question: Q: Do I have to draw 1 card from my deck when my opponent activates this Tamer card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT13-098.answer: A: No, it means if the total sum of cards in your security stack and the cards in your opponent's security stack is 6 or less.[1]
BT13-098.question: Q: Does "If the total cards in both players' security stacks is 6 or less" mean 6 or less cards in either me or my opponent's security stacks?

BT13-098.answer: A: No, it doesn't. A card revealed from your security stack and then trashed isn't considered "When this card is trashed from a security stack."[1]
BT13-098.question: Q: If this card is revealed from my security stack and trashed by [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)]'s effect, does this card's “When this card is trashed from a security stack by an effect” effect activate?

BT13-099.answer: A: No, it means if the total sum of cards in your security stack and the cards in your opponent's security stack is 6 or less.[1]
BT13-099.question: Q: Does "If the total cards in both players' security stacks is 6 or less" mean 6 or less cards in either me or my opponent's security stacks?

BT13-101.answer: A: Yes. The order of the colors doesn't matter, so the effect will activate for either yellow and black or black and yellow.[1]
BT13-101.question: Q: Can I also activate this card's [All Turns] effect when I play a 2-color yellow and black Digimon?

Q: When I played a 2-color black and yellow Digimon, its DP became 0 by an opponent's effect that had already activated, so the Digimon was deleted at the same time it was played. Does this Tamer's [All Turns] effect still trigger in such cases?

BT13-102.answer: A: The player that activated this card's effect.  This card's effect gives you 1 memory and ＜Draw 1＞ if the opponent player doesn't trash 1 Tamer card or Option card from their hand.[1]
BT13-102.question: Q: Which player gains 1 memory and ＜Draw 1＞ from this card’s [On Play] effect?
Q: Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate when either my Digimon or my opponent's Digimon is played by an effect?

BT13-102.answer: A: No. DigiXros itself is not an effect, so the effect doesn't activate for a card played by a DigiXros as a main phase action.  The effect will activate if a DigiXros is performed when a Digimon is played by an effect.[1]
BT13-102.question: Q: Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate when a Digimon is played by a DigiXros?

BT13-105.answer: A: The player that uses this card gains memory.[1]
BT13-105.question: Q: Which player gains memory from this card's effect?

BT13-106.answer: A: This card's effect activates before the security check.[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: If my opponent's Digimon attacks a player and this card is trashed from the security stack by a [When Attacking] effect, which comes first, the security check from the attack or this card's “When this card is trashed from a security stack by an effect” effect?

BT13-106.answer: A: No, it means if the total sum of cards in your security stack and the cards in your opponent's security stack is 6 or less.[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: Does "If the total cards in both players' security stacks is 6 or less" mean 6 or less cards in either me or my opponent's security stacks?

BT13-106.answer: A: No, the Digimon's security check is zero. No checks are performed.[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon attacks a player and this card is trashed from the security stack by a [When Attacking] effect. If this card's [Main] effect gives all of my opponent's Digimon <Security Attack -1> and the attacking Digimon now has a security check number of 0, is a security check performed?

BT13-106.answer: A: Yes. It activates because "When this card is trashed from a security stack by an effect" isn't a [Security] effect.[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: Does this card's [Main] effect activate if this card is trashed from the security stack when my opponent has activated a "your opponent doesn't activate [Security] effects" effect?

BT13-106.answer: A: No, it doesn't. A card revealed from your security stack and then trashed isn't considered "When this card is trashed from a security stack."[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: If this card is revealed from my security stack and trashed by [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)]'s effect, does this card's “When this card is trashed from a security stack by an effect” effect activate?

BT13-107.answer: A: No. A card doesn't have cards stacked under it if it doesn't have digivolution cards, therefore you can't use this card's effect to return the card to your hand, and the effect that unsuspends all of your Digimon doesn't activate, either.[1]
BT13-107.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to return my [Leopardmon: Leopard Mode] without digivolution cards to my hand and unsuspend all of my Digimon?

BT13-107.answer: A: Yes, you can.  However, a level 2 Digimon doesn't have DP, so it will be trashed by the rules after effect activation.[1]
BT13-107.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to return my [Leopardmon: Leopard Mode] with only a level 2 Digi-Egg card in its digivolution cards to my hand and unsuspend all of my Digimon?

BT13-108.answer: A: No, it isn't affected by [Security] effects, either.[1]
BT13-108.question: Q: My Digimon is affected by this card's "This Digimon isn't affected by your opponent's Option cards" effect. Is it affected by the [Security] effect of my opponent's Option cards?

BT13-108.answer: A: No, they can't.  The "When this Digimon is suspended, delete all of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost less than or equal to this Digimon" effect from this card is a Digimon effect. It isn't considered to be an Option card effect.[1]
BT13-108.question: Q: Can "isn't affected by your opponent's Option cards" effects prevent the "When this Digimon is suspended, delete all of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost less than or equal to this Digimon" effect given to an opponent's Digimon by this card?

BT13-109.answer: A: No. You can't ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve a Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements or special digivolution requirements into [Belphemon: Sleep Mode] from your trash.[1]
BT13-109.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to digivolve any 1 of my Digimon into a [Belphemon: Sleep Mode] from my trash without paying the cost?

BT13-111.answer: A: No, it means every 5 cards in yours and your opponent's trashes combined.  For example, if you have 12 cards in your trash and your opponent has 8 cards in theirs, that makes a total of 20 cards, so the play cost is reduced by 8.[1]
BT13-111.question: Q: Does "for every 5 cards in both players' trash" mean for every 5 cards in either mine or my opponent's trash?

BT13-111.answer: A: No. "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 6000 DP or less" becomes "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 7000 DP or less," but 13000 DP isn't the maximum for "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 13000 DP or more," therefore it isn't affected and remains as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 13000 DP or more."[1]
BT13-111.question: Q: When an "Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect has activated, does this card's [On Play][When Digivolving][When Attacking] effect become "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 7000 DP or less. If no Digimon was deleted by this effect, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 14000 DP or more"?

BT13-112.answer: A: No, this effect plays 1 of each Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait and different names from among the digivolution cards.  For example, if the target digivolution cards are [Omnimon], [Alphamon], [Alphamon], [Gallantmon], and [Gallantmon (X Antibody)], you would leave 1 [Alphamon] since it has the same name, then play[Omnimon], [Alphamon], [Gallantmon], and [Gallantmon (X Antibody)].  Note that the [Omnimon] where this effect activated isn't a digivolution card, therefore you can use this effect to play 1 [Omnimon] from among the target cards.[1]
BT13-112.question: Q: Does "you may play 1 of each Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait and a different name from the digivolution cards of Digimon in the breeding area without paying the costs" in this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect mean that I can play a Digimon card with the [Royal Knight] trait without the name [Omnimon]?

BT13-112.answer: A: No, you can't.  You must play all of the Digimon that you can play or play no Digimon.[1]
BT13-112.question: Q: When I use this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect to play Digimon, can I choose just the cards I want to play from among the cards I can play?

BT13-112.answer: A: The digivolution cards are also trashed.[1]
BT13-112.question: Q: This card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect reads "trash your Digimon in the breeding area" for when a Digimon is played by this effect, but what happens to the remaining digivolution cards under this Digimon?

BT13-112.answer:
A: Yes, it's processed.  
Overflow is processed when a card is sent from the area or from under a card to another area.  In this case, 
Overflow is processed because a card is placed in the trash from under another card.[2]
BT13-112.question:
Q: I used this card's [On Play] effect to trash a BT13-007 [King Drasil_7D6] with a BT17-078 [Omnimon ACE] in its digivolution cards. Is BT17-078 [Omnimon ACE]'s 
Overflow processed at such times?

BT14-006.answer: A: No, it cannot. Digimon in the Breeding Area cannot be targeted by this effect.[1]
BT14-006.question: Q: Can the inherited effect of this card allow a Digimon in the Breeding Area to digivolved to a Digimon card with "Monster Type"/"SoC" on the trait that was trashed from the hand?

BT14-006.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[2]
BT14-006.question: Q: When a Digimon card with the [Dark Animal] or [SoC] trait is trashed from my hand, can I use this card's inherited effect to digivolve into that card regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT14-006.answer: A: No, you must pay the digivolution cost.[2]
BT14-006.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to digivolve without paying the digivolution cost?

BT14-007.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT14-007.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to digivolve into [Greymon] in my hand, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT14-009.answer: A: Yes. Such effects can activate.[1]
BT14-009.question: Q: Does this card's effect allow activation of effects that reduce play costs when Digimon are played other than by an effect?

BT14-013.answer: A: Yes, the digivolution cost is reduced by 1. This effect continues until the end of the turn, therefore the digivolution cost will be reduced by 1 for every digivolution that occurs during that time and meets the requirements.[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: When digivolving into a Digimon that meets the requirements and then digivolving into another Digimon that meets the requirements in the same turn, can this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] reduce the digivolution cost by 1 again?

BT14-013.answer: A: No, you can't. This card's inherited effect does not allow you to attack with Digimon that are in a state where they can't attack.[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to attack using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards even when it's suspended?

BT14-013.answer: A: No, you can't. Because the turn didn't switch the first time the turn ended, the [Once Per Turn] restriction still applies. In addition, the [Once Per Turn] restriction doesn't reset even for digivolutions. Therefore, you can't use this card's inherited effect to attack twice.[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: At the end of my turn, I used this inherited effect to attack, then an effect changed my memory to 0 or more and my turn continued. After that, if a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards digivolved and the end of my turn came again while it was unsuspended, can I use this inherited effect to attack again?

BT14-013.answer: A: No, you can't. At the end of your turn, the inherited effects on these cards activate, the activation order is decided, and then the attack occurs for the 1st Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. After activation of effects that are triggered upon attack declaration such as [When Attacking] effects and "when one of your Digimon attacks" effects but before the counter timing, the next activation would occur for the other inherited effect that was pending activation, but because the 1st Digimon is still attacking, you can't make a new attack declaration, and the 2nd activation fails.[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: When I have 2 Digimon with this card in their digivolution cards, can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to attack using these 2 Digimon?

BT14-017.answer: A: Yes, it can't be played. If your opponent has this Digimon, "While your opponent has 1 or more memory" from your opponent's perspective means while you have 1 or more memory.[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect prevent me from playing a Digimon card with 6000 DP or less when my opponent has this Digimon while I have 1 or more memory?

BT14-017.answer: A: Yes, it can't be played. [1]
BT14-017.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect prevent playing a Digimon card with 6000 DP or less even from effects that play a card?

BT14-017.answer: A: Yes, it can't be played.[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also prevent playing a token that is treated as a Digimon card with 6000 DP or less?

BT14-017.answer: A: Yes, it can't be played.[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: If I have a Digimon card with an original DP of 6000 or less and its DP would increase to more than 6000 by an effect upon playing it into the battle area, does this card's [All Turns] effect allow that card to be played?

BT14-017.answer: A: No, it can't be played. At the timing of the play declaration, if "While your opponent has 1 or more memory" from your opponent's perspective applies (in other words, if you have 1 or more memory), this card's [All Turns] effect doesn't allow you to play such Digimon.[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect allow me to play a Digimon card with 6000 DP or less if paying the play cost would cause the memory to change to 0 or 1 or more on my opponent's side when my opponent has this Digimon?

BT14-017.answer: A: No, it doesn't. You aren't allowed to declare playing a 6000 DP or lower Digimon card.[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: When my opponent has this Digimon, does this card's [All Turns] effect allow me to just pay the play cost for a Digimon card with 6000 DP or less without playing it while I have 1 memory or more?

BT14-018.answer: A: Tokens are special cards that some effects put into play to represent Digimon or Tamers. This card's effect, for example, plays tokens that are treated as Digimon named [Amon of Crimson Flame] and [Umon of Blue Thunder]. For a more detailed explanation of how tokens work, check the official rule manual.[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: What's a token?

BT14-018.answer: A: No, they can't. The [Amon of Crimson Flame] and [Umon of Blue Thunder] tokens played by this card's effect can't become targets for effects with requirements related to play cost or level because these tokens don't have a play cost or level.[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: Can [Amon of Crimson Flame] and [Umon of Blue Thunder] tokens played by this card's effect become targets for "Digimon with play costs of X or less" effects or "level X or higher/lower Digimon" effects?

BT14-018.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if you have only 1 [Amon of Crimson Flame] or [Umon of Blue Thunder] token, it will be deleted and <Recovery +1 (Deck)> will activate.[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: Can this card's [All Turns] effect activate <Recovery +1 (Deck)> and delete my [Amon of Crimson Flame] or [Umon of Blue Thunder] when I only have one or the other?

BT14-018.answer: A: No, it only activates once. No matter how many [Amon of Crimson Flame] and/or [Umon of Blue Thunder] you delete at one time with this effect, <Recovery +1 (Deck)> will only activate once.[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: If this card's [All Turns] effect deletes 2 of my [Amon of Crimson Flame] and/or [Umon of Blue Thunder], does <Recovery +1 (Deck)> activate twice?

BT14-018.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area" refers to when this Digimon is placed in the trash, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: What does this card's "When [...] would [...] leave the battle area" mean, exactly?

BT14-020.question: Q: Does "This Digimon can't be blocked" in this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect activate even when my opponent can't trash a digivolution card?

BT14-020.answer: A: No, you can't activate it. This card’s inherited effect reads "When this Digimon would be deleted," so it interrupts the deletion when it activates. Therefore, the [Gomamon] with the [On Deletion] effect is removed from the digivolution cards before the [On Deletion] effect can be triggered.[1]
BT14-020.question: Q: I have both this card and another [Gomamon] with an [On Deletion] inherited effect in the digivolution cards of the same one of my Digimon. When that Digimon is deleted, can I activate this card's inherited effect, play the other [Gomamon] from the digivolution cards, and activate that [On Deletion] inherited effect?

BT14-023.answer: A: No, it can't. If the number of digivolution cards under the target opponent's Digimon is less than or equal to those of this Digimon or the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards at the timing when this effect activates, the target Digimon can't attack until the effect ends at the end of your opponent's turn, even if the number of its digivolution cards later increases.[1]
BT14-023.question: Q: If the digivolution cards under the target opponent's Digimon increase to become more than those under this Digimon after this card's [When Attacking] effect/inherited effect activate, can my opponent's Digimon now attack?
Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect trash 1 digivolution card each from 2 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT14-026.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect trash 1 digivolution card each from 2 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT14-027.answer: A: Yes, you must return your level 3 Digimon to your hand.[1]
BT14-027.question: Q: Does this card's effect also return my level 3 Digimon to the hand?

BT14-028.answer: A: Yes, it prevents that deletion.[1]
BT14-028.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect prevent deletion even when I lose a battle with my opponent's Security Digimon?

BT14-028.answer: A: Yes, it's deleted. ＜Retaliation＞ is deletion by an effect, not by battle.[1]
BT14-028.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] delete this Digimon when my opponent's Digimon activates ＜Retaliation＞ after battling this Digimon?

BT14-029.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect trash 1 digivolution card each from 3 of my opponent's Digimon or trash 2 digivolution cards from 1 of their Digimon and 1 digivolution card from another?
Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect unsuspend this Digimon when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-030.answer: A: Yes, you can return your Digimon of any level to the hand.[1]
BT14-030.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect return any level Digimon when it returns my Digimon to the hand?
Q: Can this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect return my Digimon to the hand even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-030.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If your [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] is chosen as the target to return to the hand for this card's effect, it will ultimately be placed at the bottom of the Digi-Egg deck instead of the hand according to the rules, but it meets this card's "by returning 1 of your Digimon to the hand" condition. A card isn't actually added to the hand, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the hand" don't trigger.[1]
BT14-030.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to return my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] from the battle area to the hand?

BT14-030.answer: A: [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] is a Digimon without a level, therefore your opponent can't return a Digimon to the hand.[1]
BT14-030.question: Q: If I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to return my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] from the battle area to the hand, what happens for "return 1 of your opponent's Digimon whose level is less than or equal to the returned Digimon's level to the hand"?

BT14-030.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If your token is chosen as the target to return to the hand for this card's effect, it will ultimately be removed from the game instead of being returned to the hand according to the rules, but it meets this card's "by returning 1 of your Digimon to the hand" condition. A card isn't actually added to the hand, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the hand" don't trigger.[1]
BT14-030.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to return my token that was played as a Digimon from the battle area to the hand?

BT14-032.answer: A: You can't add a card to the hand because you have 0 cards in your security stack, but you may perform "place 1 card with [Sukamon] from your hand on top of your security stack."[1]
BT14-032.question: Q: How does this card’s effect work if it activates when I have 0 cards in my security stack?

BT14-032.answer: A: No, there are no requirements for the card you add to your hand with this effect, so you don't have to reveal it to your opponent.[1]
BT14-032.question: Q: When I use this card's [On Play] effect to add 1 card from my security stack to the hand, do I have to reveal the added card to my opponent?

BT14-033.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT14-033.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to digivolve it into a yellow Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait in my security stack, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?
Q: Can I use an effect that digivolves my Digimon to digivolve this card into a security card with the [Vaccine] trait?

BT14-033.answer: A: Yes. <Recovery +1 (Deck)> added a card to your security, so you gain 1 memory.[1]
BT14-033.question: Q: I have a Digimon in play with this card in its digivolution cards. [BT1-087 T.K. Takaishi]’s effect adds a yellow card from my security stack to my hand, and <Recovery +1 (Deck)> adds a card to my security stack. The number of cards in my security stack ultimately remained the same, but can I still gain 1 memory from this card’s inherited effect?

Q: I used this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect to digivolve from a security card, then place a card from my hand at the bottom of the security stack.  Do "when a card is added to the security stack" and "when a card is removed from the security stack" effects trigger simultaneously at such times?

BT14-037.answer: A: Yes. Even if you have 6 or more cards, they get -1000 DP for each security card.[1]
BT14-037.question: Q: Does this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] give 1 of my opponent's Digimon -1000 DP for each card in my security stack even if I have 6 or more cards in my security stack?

BT14-037.answer: A: No, it can't. The effect only targets 1 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT14-037.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] give 2 of my opponent's Digimon -1000 DP each when I have 2 cards in my security stack?

BT14-038.answer: A: This is a [Security] effect, so it happens before the battle.  The battle with your Security Digimon happens after the activation of [On Play] effects on played Digimon or "When you play a Digimon" effects.[1]
BT14-038.question: Q: Does this cards [Security] effect play 1 level 6 Digimon card with [Etemon] from my hand before or after the battle with my Security Digimon?

BT14-041.answer: A: Yes. A card was added to your security stack with <Recovery +1 (Deck)>, therefore 1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -7000 DP and this Digimon gains ＜Security A. +1＞.[1]
BT14-041.question: Q: [BT1-087 T.K. Takaishi]’s effect adds a yellow card from my security stack to my hand, and <Recovery +1 (Deck)> adds a card to my security stack. The number of cards in my security stack ultimately remained the same, but does 1 of my opponent's Digimon still get -7000 DP and does this Digimon still gain ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card’s effect?

BT14-043.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect suspend my Digimon even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-047.answer: A: No, it doesn't unsuspend. This card's effect targets "all of your opponent's Digimon," therefore even your opponent's Digimon that later had their DP reduced to 5000 DP or less don't unsuspend.  On the other hand, even if one of your opponent's Digimon has 5000 DP or less upon activation, that Digimon will unsuspend if its DP later increases to 6000 DP or more.[1]
BT14-047.question: Q: If a Digimon has 6000 DP or more when this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect activates, then its DP is reduced to 5000 or less by an effect, does that Digimon unsuspend during the unsuspend phase?

BT14-048.answer: A: No, you can't. This card's [When Attacking] effect is an effect that activates before your opponent blocks, therefore the activation timing has already passed by the time of the block timing.[1]
BT14-048.question: Q: This Digimon attacked the opponent player and was blocked by an opponent's Digimon that has more DP than this Digimon. Can I use this card's effect to digivolve into a level 6 Digimon card with [Leomon] in my hand, ignoring its digivolution requirements?

BT14-048.answer: A: No, it can't. Only when this Digimon attacked a Digimon with higher DP at the time of the attack declaration can this card's [When Attacking] effect digivolve into a level 6 Digimon card with [Leomon] in your hand, ignoring its digivolution requirements.[1]
BT14-048.question: Q: This Digimon gained ＜Rush＞, it attacked the opponent player, and I used the ＜Rush＞ effect to switch the target of attack to an opponent's Digimon with higher DP than this Digimon. In such cases, can this card's [When Attacking] effect digivolve into a level 6 Digimon card with [Leomon] in my hand?

BT14-051.answer: A: Yes, you can. In that case, you add as many as possible to the hand.[1]
BT14-051.question: Q: Can I still add to the hand with this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect if I only reveal 1 green Digimon card among the top 5 cards of my deck?

BT14-052.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that treats it as a card that has [Leomon]. This is a rule and not an effect, therefore this card is treated as having [Leomon] when the card is in your hand, breeding area, or any other area.[1]
BT14-052.question: Q: What does this card's "(Rule) Name: Treated as having [Leomon]" mean, exactly?

BT14-052.answer: A: No, it can't. This card's name is treated as having [Leomon], but it is not treated as [Leomon].[1]
BT14-052.question: Q: Can this card be selected as the target of an effect that targets exactly [Leomon] due to the text "(Rule) Name: Treated as having [Leomon]"?

BT14-054.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect unsuspend this Digimon even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-054.answer: A: No, you can't. At the end of your turn, these cards' [End of Your Turn] effects trigger at the same time, the activation order is decided, and then the attack occurs for the 1st Digimon. After activation of effects that are triggered upon attack declaration such as [When Attacking] effects and "when one of your Digimon attacks" effects but before the counter timing, the activation would next occur for the other [End of Your Turn] effect that was pending activation, but because the 1st Digimon is still attacking, you can't make a new attack declaration, and the 2nd effect activation fails.[1]
BT14-054.question: Q: When I have 2 copies of this Digimon, can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to attack using these 2 Digimon?

BT14-054.answer: A: No, you can't. This effect does not allow you to attack with Digimon that are in a state where they can't attack.[1]
BT14-054.question: Q: Can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to attack even when this Digimon is suspended?

BT14-056.question: Q: If one of the cards revealed from my deck by this card's [On Play] effect is a Tamer card or Option card with the [D-Brigade] or [DigiPolice] trait, can I add that card to my hand?

BT14-056.answer: A: Yes, it can. This effect can interrupt the removal of a card from the battle area, therefore by deleting 1 of your other Digimon with the [D-Brigade] trait, this card will be prevented from being placed in your other Digimon's digivolution cards.[1]
BT14-056.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect activate when an opponent's effect would place a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards in another of my Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT14-056.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area" refers to when this Digimon is placed in the trash, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]
BT14-056.question: Q: What does this card's "When [...] would [...] leave the battle area" mean, exactly?

BT14-060.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that treats it as a card that has the [Commandramon] name. This is a rule and not an effect, therefore this card is treated as having the [Commandramon] name when the card is in your hand, breeding area, or any other area.[1]
BT14-060.question: Q: What does this card's "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [Commandramon]" mean, exactly?
Q: Can this card be selected as the target of an effect that targets exactly [Commandramon] due to the text "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [Commandramon]"?
Q: If one of the cards revealed from my deck by this card's [When Attacking] effect is a Tamer card with the [D-Brigade] or [DigiPolice] trait and a play cost of 3 or less, can I play that card?

BT14-060.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area" refers to when this Digimon is placed in the trash, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]
BT14-060.question: Q: What does this card's "When [...] would [...] leave the battle area" mean, exactly?

BT14-061.answer: A: The player that activated this effect chooses.[1]
BT14-061.question: Q: Which player chooses the card to return from my opponent’s trash to the deck by this card's effect?

BT14-062.answer: A: This effect prevents deletion when this Digimon is the target of an effect with "delete" in its card text. Deletion will still occur if you lose a battle, both players lose a battle, or if this Digimon's DP is reduced to 0.[1]
BT14-062.question: Q: This card’s [All Turns] effect reads "This Digimon can't be deleted by your opponent's effects." How does this effect work, exactly?

BT14-063.answer: A: Yes, you can add 1 card or play it even if only 1 card is revealed.[1]
BT14-063.question: Q: If the 3 cards revealed with this card's [On Deletion] effect don't include both a card with [Monzaemon] and a Digimon card with [Numemon], am I allowed to play one of the cards or add it to my hand, or do both cards have to be present?

BT14-063.answer: A: No, it can't. You must play or add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT14-063.question: Q: When the 3 cards revealed from my deck with this card's [On Deletion] effect include both a card with [Monzaemon] and a Digimon card with [Numemon], am I allowed to add just one card to my hand or play it?

BT14-064.question: Q: If one of the cards revealed from my deck by this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect is a Tamer card with the [D-Brigade] or [DigiPolice] trait and a play cost of 4 or less, can I play that card?

BT14-065.answer: A: No. ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) activates 3 times, not ＜De-Digivolve  3＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 3 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.).  The difference is that ＜De-Digivolve  3＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 3 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) allows you to trash 1 to 3 cards, but ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) trashes 1 card three times, meaning that you always trash 3 cards (or until there are no more digivolution cards or until the Digimon is reduced to level 3).[1]
BT14-065.question: Q: If my opponent reveals 3 Digimon cards from their deck by this card's effect, does it ＜De-Digivolve  3＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 3 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) 1 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT14-065.answer: A: The player that activated this effect chooses.[1]
BT14-065.question: Q: When this card’s effect returns revealed cards to my opponent's deck, which player decides the order the cards are placed in and whether the cards are placed on the top or bottom of the deck?

BT14-067.answer: A: No. If the chosen card has a play cost of 5, choose a number of your opponent's Digimon whose total play cost add up to 5 or less and delete them.[1]
BT14-067.question: Q: If the card chosen with this card's effect has a play cost of 5, can it delete up to 5 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT14-067.answer: A: The player that activated this effect chooses.[1]
BT14-067.question: Q: When this card’s effect returns revealed cards to my opponent's deck, which player decides the order the cards are placed in and whether the cards are placed on the top or bottom of the deck?

BT14-068.question: Q: If one of the cards revealed from my deck by this card's [End of Your Turn] effect is a Tamer card with the [D-Brigade] or [DigiPolice] trait, can I play that card?

BT14-072.answer: A: You can't return a card from your trash to the hand, but you must perform "trash 1 card in your hand."[1]

BT14-073.answer: A: No. This card isn't in the battle area upon the timing when it's trashed, so the [Your Turn] effect doesn't trigger and you don't gain 1 memory.[1]
