BT14-074.answer: A: No, you don't gain 1 memory. The effect reads "By..." Therefore, the rest of the effect won't activate if you don't trash a card in your hand.[1]
BT14-074.question: Q: If I don't trash 1 card in my hand, do I gain 1 memory from this card's [When Attacking] effect when [Eiji Nagasumi] is still in this Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT14-075.answer: A: No, the the trashed card is public information. "Trash [...] without looking" means that you must choose a card to trash from your opponent's hand without looking at the front of the cards in their hand.[1]
BT14-075.question: Q: Is the card trashed by this card's [On Deletion] effect also private information?

BT14-076.answer: A: Yes, it deletes this Digimon. However, this effect reads "By trashing 1 card in your hand," therefore you can choose to not activate the effect by not trashing a card in your hand.[1]
BT14-076.question: Q: Does this card's [When Digivolving] effect delete this Digimon when I only have this Digimon?
Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to trash 1 card in my hand even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-078.answer: A: You must activate "Delete this Digimon and ＜Draw 2＞." "Then, you may return 1 [Loogamon] from your trash to the hand" uses "you may return," therefore it is optional.[1]
BT14-078.question: Q: Do I have to activate this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT14-081.answer: A: Normally, the turn will end and switch when the memory moves to 1 or more on your opponent's side. But while this effect is activated, the turn won't end unless the memory moves to 3 or more on your opponent's side. Your turn will continue when your opponent's memory is at 1 or 2.[1]
BT14-081.question: Q: What does this card's [Your Turn] effect mean?

BT14-081.answer: A: No, this effect only applies during your turn. Your opponent's turn continues until the memory moves to 1 or more from your perspective.[1]
BT14-081.question: Q: If the memory moves to 2 or less on my opponent's side during my opponent's turn, does the turn switch to my turn with this card's [Your Turn] effect?

Q: The memory moved to 3 or more on my opponent's side and the turn ended while this card's [Your Turn] effect was activated. If the memory moves to 1 or 2 on my opponent's side due to an [End of Your Turn] effect, does my turn continue?

BT14-081.answer: A: No. ＜Blitz＞ still requires the memory to be at 1 or more on your opponent's side for attacking.[1]
BT14-081.question: Q: When the memory moves to 3 or more on my opponent's side while this card's [Your Turn] effect is activated, does ＜Blitz＞ allow for attacking?

BT14-081.answer: A: No, you can't. This effect is a "You may play" effect, but it doesn't include "up to," therefore you must choose to either play no cards or as many as possible.[1]
BT14-081.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to play just 2 of the target cards from my trash when [Eiji Nagasumi] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards and I have 3 or more level 4 or lower cards with the [Dark Animal] or [SoC] trait in my trash?

BT14-081.answer: A: The memory will move to 3 on your opponent's side, and the turn will end if there are no other effects pending activation, etc.[1]
BT14-081.question: Q: What happens if I declare a "pass" when I have this Digimon?

BT14-082.answer: A: After activation of the [Security] effect on the card revealed by the security check. If the card is a Digimon card, then the timing will come before the battle with the Security Digimon.[1]
BT14-082.question: Q: When is the activation timing for this card's [Your Turn] effect when a player is attacked and a security check is performed?

BT14-084.question: Q: I used this card's [On Play] effect to return 1 card from my security stack to the hand, then I placed 1 yellow card with the [Vaccine] trait from my hand at the bottom of my security stack. At such times, is a card considered to be added to my security stack, allowing this card's [Your Turn] effect to activate?

BT14-084.answer: A: No, there are no requirements for the card you return to your hand with this effect, so you don't have to reveal it to your opponent.[1]
BT14-084.question: Q: When I use this card's [On Play] effect to return 1 card from my security stack to the hand, do I have to reveal the returned card to my opponent?

BT14-085.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [Your Turn] effect even when an opponent's effect suspends an opponent's Digimon?

BT14-086.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT14-087.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT14-088.answer: A: Yes, you can add just 1 card to your hand when only 1 or the other is revealed.[1]
BT14-088.question: Q: If the cards I reveal with this card's [On Play] effect don't contain both a level 3 Digimon card and a non-white Tamer card, do I still get to add a card to my hand?

BT14-088.answer: A: No, you can't. You must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT14-088.question: Q: When the cards revealed from my deck with this card's [On Play] effect contain both a level 3 Digimon card and a non-white Tamer card, am I allowed to add just one card to my hand?

BT14-088.answer: A: It can't move level 2 Digimon or cards like [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6] because cards without DP can't be moved to the battle area. It can move [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] because it has DP.[1]
BT14-088.question: Q: Can this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect move a level 2 Digimon or cards like [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] or [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6] from the breeding area to the battle area?

Q: When I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to move a Digimon from the breeding area to the battle area during the counter timing, can I then <Blast Digivolve> that Digimon into a Digimon ACE card in my hand?

BT14-089.answer: A: No, you can't. If you have a Digimon with [Greymon], delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with the lowest DP.[1]
BT14-089.question: Q: When I have a Digimon with [Greymon] and my opponent has 1 Digimon with 6000 DP and 1 with 4000 DP, can I choose the target to delete with this card's effect from these 2 Digimon?

BT14-090.answer: A: Yes, you can. This effect reads "may digivolve into [WarGreymon] in your hand," therefore you can choose to not digivolve after placing [Greymon] and [MetalGreymon] from your trash under [Agumon].[1]
BT14-090.question: Q: Can I use this card to place 1 [Greymon] and 1 [MetalGreymon] from my trash under [Agumon] but choose to not digivolve into [WarGreymon] in my hand?

BT14-092.answer: A: No, it can't. If the number of digivolution cards under the opponent's Digimon targeted by this effect is less than or equal to those of your chosen Digimon at the timing when this card's effect activates, the effect will continue, even if the target's number of digivolution cards later increases.[1]
BT14-092.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon was targeted by this card's effect, then it digivolved and now has more digivolution cards than my chosen Digimon. Can my opponent's Digimon now attack and block?

BT14-093.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT14-093.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to digivolve it into a yellow Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait in my security stack, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT14-093.answer: A: You place it after shuffling.[1]
BT14-093.question: Q: When using this card's effect to digivolve a security card and I have a Tamer with [T.K. Takaishi], do I place 1 card in my security stack for <Recovery +1 (Deck)> before or after I shuffle my security stack?

BT14-093.answer: A: No, you can't. Since you have 3 cards in your security stack [BT8-024 Angemon]'s effect will trigger, but effects that add or remove cards from the security stack aren't allowed while looking at a security stack, so the effect won't activate.[1]
BT14-093.question: Q: I use this card's effect to digivolve my [BT8-024 Angemon] into a level 5 yellow Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait in my security stack when my security stack has 4 cards. Can I activate my [BT8-024 Angemon]'s [Your Turn] effect to <Recovery +1 (Deck)> if it were to digivolve when my security stack has 3 cards?

BT14-094.question: Q: Can this card's effect delete 1 of my [Angemon] even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-096.answer: A: No, it can't. If you have a Tamer with [Mimi Tachikawa] at the timing when this effect activates, your opponent's Digimon that was affected by the "doesn't unsuspend" effect doesn't unsuspend even if your Tamer with [Mimi Tachikawa] is later removed from the battle area.[1]
BT14-096.question: Q: I used this card when I had a Tamer with [Mimi Tachikawa]. If my Tamer with [Mimi Tachikawa] is removed from the battle area by an effect after activating this card, can my opponent's Digimon that was affected by the "doesn't unsuspend" effect now unsuspend?

BT14-097.question: Q: Can this card's effect digivolve any level Digimon into a Digimon card with [Sukamon] in my hand as long as it is a non-white Digimon?

BT14-097.answer: A: No, it can't. This effect doesn't target Digimon in breeding areas.[1]
BT14-097.question: Q: Can this card's effect digivolve a Digimon in the breeding area into a Digimon card with [Sukamon] in my hand?

BT14-097.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that treats it as a card that has [Sukamon]. This is a rule and not an effect, therefore this card is treated as having [Sukamon] when the card is in your hand, trash, or any other area.[1]
BT14-097.question: Q: What does this card's "(Rule) Name: Also treated as having [Sukamon]" mean, exactly?

BT14-097.answer: A: No, it can't. This card's name is treated as having [Sukamon], but it is not treated as [Sukamon].[1]
BT14-097.question: Q: Can this card be selected as the target of an effect that targets exactly [Sukamon] due to the text "(Rule) Name: Also treated as having [Sukamon]"?

BT14-097.answer: A: No, it can't. This card is an Option card, therefore it can't become a target for an effect that targets Digimon.[1]
BT14-097.question: Q: Can this card become a target for effects that activate for Digimon with [Sukamon]?

BT14-097.answer: A: It changes into a white card with 3000 DP and an original name of [Sukamon]. In addition, it is also treated as the Digimon whose name is specified in (or specified to be included in) "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [XX]" or "(Rule) Name: Treated as having [XX]."[1]
BT14-097.question: Q: What happens when this card's [Security] effect activates for a Digimon with "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [XX]" or "(Rule) Name: Treated as having [XX]"?

BT14-097.answer: A: It remains as a white Digimon with 3000 DP and an original name of [Sukamon]. The gained effect is carried over even if the Digimon digivolves or one or more of its top cards are trashed.[2]
BT14-097.question: Q: If a card has changed to a white Digimon with 3000 DP and an original name of [Sukamon], then it digivolves or its top card is trashed by a ＜De-Digivolve＞ effect, what happens to that card's information?
Q: Can the effect of this card evolve from any Digimon of any Lv. to a Digimon card with "Sukamon" in its name in my hand, as long as it is not white?

BT14-097.answer: A: No, you cannot. Digimon in the Breeding Area are not targeted for the effect.[3]
BT14-097.question: Q: Can the effect of this card evolve from a Digimon in the Breeding Area to a Digimon card with "Sukamon" in its name in my hand?

BT14-097.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that also treats this card as containing "Sukamon" in its name. Since it is a rule, not an effect, this card will also be treated as containing "Sukamon" in its name, whether in hand, trash, or elsewhere.[3]
BT14-097.question: Q: This card's <Overflow X> name: "Also treats as containing 'Sukamon'." What does this mean?

BT14-097.answer: A: No, it cannot. This card is also treated as containing "Sukamon" in its name, but is not considered a "Sukamon".[3]
BT14-097.question: Q: <Overflow X> name: "Also treated as containing 'Sukamon'." can I select "Sukamon" as the target of an effect that targets only "Sukamon"?

BT14-097.answer: A: No, it does not. This card is an option card, so it cannot be targeted by effects that target Digimon.[3]
BT14-097.question: Q: Is this card targeted for the effect it activates on Digimon with "Sukamon" in its name?

BT14-097.answer: A: This effect changes the original name of one opponent's Digimon to "Sukamon", its original color to white, and its original DP to 3000.[4]
BT14-097.question: Q: "Change an opponent's Digimon to its original name "Sukamon", White, DP 3000." What is the effect?

BT14-097.answer: A: The information of the card you have is also changed by <Rules>. For example, the original name of "BT15-035 Gelemon" is "Gelemon/Numemon" by <Overflow X>, but if the information of the original card is changed by this effect, the original name will be "Sukamon" only.[4]
BT14-097.question: Q: What happens if a card such as "BT15-035 Geremon", which has card information in <Overflow X>, is changed to the original name "Sukamon", white, DP3000 by the effect of this card?

BT14-097.answer: A: The information on the card obtained by the effect remains the same. For example, if the information on the original card EX1-005 Tyrannomon is changed, the original color will be white and the color will be white and green because the effect of EX1-005 Tyrannomon also treats it as green.[4]
BT14-097.question: Q: What happens to a card such as "EX1-005 Tyrannomon" that has been given card information by the effect of this card, but is changed to the original name "Sukamon", white, DP3000 by the effect of this card?

BT14-097.answer: A: The card also retains its original name "Sukamon", white, DP 3000. The effect given is carried over even if that one digivolved or the stacked cards are trashed.[4]
BT14-097.question: Q: If a card whose original name is changed to "Sukamon", white, DP3000 is digivolved or stacked cards are trashed by <De-Digivolve>, what happens to the card's information?

BT14-097.answer: A: The original name "Sukamon" - White - remains changed to DP3000, but the information on the card that it originally did not have cannot be changed. If the card becomes a tamer or a Digitama card and does not originally have DP, it will remain without DP.[4]
BT14-097.question: Q: What happens if a card with the original name "Sukamon", white, DP3000 is stacked cards are trashed by <De-Digivolve>, etc. and become tamers or Digitama cards?

BT14-098.question: Q: Can this card's effect return the target cards to the top of the deck even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-101.question: Q: While I have a Tamer with [Tai Kamiya] and my opponent has a Digimon with 10000 DP or more, can I use an effect that digivolves my Digimon to digivolve my [Agumon] in the battle area into this card in my hand?

BT14-102.question: Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect delete this Digimon even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT14-102.answer: A: No, you can't. You can't hatch a new Digi-Egg when you have another Digimon in your breeding area.[1]
BT14-102.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Deletion] effect to hatch in my breeding area when I have a Digimon in my breeding area and a Tamer?
Q: Can I use this card's [On Deletion] effect to place this card in my security stack when I have a Digimon in my breeding area and a Tamer, even if I can't hatch in my breeding area?

BT14-102.answer: A: No, you don't have to place it. If there are requirements for the target card and that card is in a private area, performing the action is optional.[1]
BT14-102.question: Q: If I have a yellow card with the [Vaccine] trait in my hand when this card's inherited effect activates, do I have to place it at the bottom of my security stack?

BT15-002.question: Q: My Digimon's effect gave me ＜Draw 1＞ and trashed 1 card in my hand. The number of cards in my hand was the same before and after the effect activated, so does this card's inherited effect activate?

BT15-004.answer: A: No, you can't.  This effect does not allow you to attack with Digimon that are in a state where they can't attack.[1]
BT15-004.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to attack using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards even when it's suspended?

BT15-004.answer: A: No, you can't.  At the end of your turn, the inherited effects on these cards activate, the activation order is decided, and then the attack occurs for the 1st Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. After activation of effects that are triggered upon attack declaration such as [When Attacking] effects and "when one of your Digimon attacks" effects but before the counter timing, the next activation would occur for the other inherited effect that was pending activation, but because the 1st Digimon is still attacking, you can't make a new attack declaration, and the 2nd Digimon's effect activation fails.[1]
BT15-004.question: Q: When I have 2 Digimon with this card in their digivolution cards, can I use this card's inherited effect to attack using these 2 Digimon at the end of my turn?

BT15-008.answer: A: Yes, it activates.  This card's effect activates before your opponent blocks, therefore it can't be canceled even if a block is performed after activation.[1]
BT15-008.question: Q: My red Digimon attacked the opponent player and was blocked by an opponent's Digimon. Does this Digimon's effect activate in such cases?

BT15-010.answer: A: Yes, it activates.  This card's effect activates before your opponent blocks, therefore it can't be canceled even if a block is performed after activation.[1]
BT15-010.question: Q: My Digimon attacked the opponent player and was blocked by an opponent's Digimon. Does this Digimon's effect activate in such cases?

BT15-011.answer: A: Yes, even if you only reveal one of the applicable cards, you can still add it to your hand.[1]
BT15-011.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck for this card's [On Play] effect include only either a Digimon card or a Tamer card with the [SoC] trait, can I only add 1 card to my hand?

BT15-011.answer: A: Yes. If the Tamer card doesn't have the [SoC] trait, you can't add it to your hand.[1]
BT15-011.question: Q: If the Tamer card revealed for this card's [On Play] effect doesn't have the [SoC] trait, does that mean I can't add it to my hand?

BT15-011.answer: A: No. If you have cards that are targets of this effect, you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT15-011.question: Q: If the cards revealed for this card's [On Play] effect include both a Digimon card and Tamer card with the [SoC] trait, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining cards at the bottom of my deck?

BT15-015.answer: A: No, you can't.  This effect does not allow you to attack with Digimon that are in a state where they can't attack.[1]
BT15-015.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to attack even when this Digimon is suspended?
Q: I activated this card's effect and paid 2 cost. This moved the memory to 1 or more on my opponent’s side. Can this Digimon attack?

BT15-015.answer: A: No, ＜Security A. +1＞ isn't negated.  Even if the memory moves to 1 or more on your opponent's side, while this effect is activating or if there are any effects that are pending activation, the end of turn timing doesn't come until they finish activating.[1]
BT15-015.question: Q: If this effect moved the memory to 1 or more on my opponent’s side, is the ＜Security A. +1＞ gained for the turn negated for attacks with this effect?

BT15-016.answer: A: It means that the condition for "if your opponent has 4 or less memory" is fulfilled when the memory is at 1 through 10 on your side, 0, or 1 through 4 on your opponent's side at the timing when this effect activates.  Similarly, the condition for "if they have 4 or more" is fulfilled when the memory is at 4 through 10 on your opponent's side at the timing when this effect activates.[1]
BT15-016.question: Q: What do this card's "if your opponent has 4 or less memory" and "if they have 4 or more" mean, exactly?

Q: If my opponent has 4 memory when this effect activates, do both the effect where 1 of my opponent's Digimon with 8000 DP or more can't attack until the end of their turn and the effect where I delete 1 of their Digimon with 6000 DP or less activate?

BT15-018.answer: A: It means that the condition is fulfilled when the memory is at 4 through 10 on your opponent's side at the timing when this effect activates.[1]
BT15-018.question: Q: What does this card's "if your opponent has 4 or more memory" mean, exactly?

BT15-018.answer: A: It means that the condition is fulfilled when the memory is at 1 through 4 on your side, 0, or 1 through 10 on your opponent's side at the timing when this effect activates.[1]
BT15-018.question: Q: What does this card's "if you have 4 or less memory" mean, exactly?

BT15-019.question: Q: Does this card’s [On Play] effect activate when my opponent has no Digimon in their battle area?

BT15-021.answer: A: No, it can't.  If the number of digivolution cards under the target opponent's Digimon is less than or equal to those of the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards at the timing when this effect activates, the target Digimon can't attack until the effect ends at the end of your opponent's turn, even if the number of its digivolution cards later increases.[1]
BT15-021.question: Q: If the digivolution cards under the target opponent's Digimon increase to become more than those under this Digimon after this card's inherited effect activates, can my opponent's Digimon now attack?

BT15-023.question: Q: Does this card’s [On Play] effect activate when my opponent has no Digimon in their battle area?

BT15-026.question: Q: I used this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to ＜Draw 1＞, then I had 5 or more cards in your hand and trashed 1 card in my hand. The number of cards in my hand was the same before and after the effect activated, so does this card's [All Turns] effect activate?

BT15-027.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT15-027.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] effect to add a card to my hand when only 1 level 6 or higher card is among the revealed cards?

BT15-027.answer: A: No, the effect doesn’t activate for Digimon in breeding areas.[1]

BT15-027.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't referenced by effects, so they don't trigger.[1]
BT15-027.question: Q: Do "when a Digimon is played" effects trigger for Digimon played into the breeding area by this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT15-027.answer: A: No. It can't attack because the "Digimon can't attack the turn they came into play" rule still applies to Digimon played into the breeding area.[1]
BT15-027.question: Q: I used this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to play a Digimon into the breeding area, and another effect moved the memory to 0 or more, and my turn continued.  If the Digimon that was played into the breeding area is then moved to the battle area by an effect, can that Digimon attack?

BT15-027.answer: A: No, you can't.  A "can't be played by effects" effect affects a player when it activates, therefore the act of playing a Digimon itself won't be possible, whether in the breeding area or the battle area.[1]
BT15-027.question: Q: Can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to play a Digimon into the breeding area when it's affected by a "Digimon can't be played by effects" effect?

BT15-031.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate.  It won't activate because the trigger timing for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect has already passed when [BT15-052 Puppetmon], [BT15-066 Machinedramon], or [BT15-079 Piedmon]'s [End of Opponent's Turn] effect is used to play this card, so it won't trigger until the end of your opponent's next turn.[1]
BT15-031.question: Q: If I use [BT15-052 Puppetmon], [BT15-066 Machinedramon], or [BT15-079 Piedmon]'s [End of Opponent's Turn] effect to play this card from my hand, does this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect activate?

BT15-035.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that treats it as a card that has the [Numemon] name.  This is a rule and not an effect, therefore this card is treated as having the [Numemon] name when the card is in your hand, breeding area, or any other area.[1]

BT15-037.answer: A: No, it doesn’t. This card is in the trash upon the timing when a card is removed from your security stack, so the [All Turns] effect doesn't trigger and you don't gain 1 memory.[1]
BT15-037.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect activate if this card itself is removed from your security stack when its effect trashes it from the security stack and plays it?

BT15-037.answer: A: Yes, it activates. The timing when this card is played into the battle area and the timing when a card is removed from your security stack are the same, so the [All Turns] effect triggers and you gain 1 memory.[1]
BT15-037.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect activate when this card in my security stack is played into the battle area by an effect that plays a Digimon card from the security stack, such as [BT15-092 Revelation of Light]'s [Main] effect or [ST10-06 Mastemon]'s [When Digivolving] effect?

BT15-039.answer: A: Yes, your opponent loses 1 memory.[1]
BT15-039.question: Q: If this card’s [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect activates on an opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less, then its DP is reduced to 0 and it's deleted, does the "[On Deletion] Lose 1 memory" effect given to my opponent's Digimon at the same time cause my opponent to lose 1 memory?

BT15-039.answer: A: Yes, they activate.  This card's "This Digimon gains all effects of cards with [Gammamon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards" effect is an [All Turns] effect, so it will activate as soon as the digivolution is confirmed. Therefore, [When Evolving] effects are gained and will trigger.[1]
BT15-039.question: Q: When digivolving into this card, do the [When Digivolving] effects on digivolution cards with [Gammamon] activate?

BT15-039.answer: A: Yes, if the memory gauge is now at 1 or greater on your opponent's side, you can activate ＜Blitz＞ .[1]
BT15-039.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon with [Gammamon] and a [When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞ effect into this card. Can I activate the [When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞ effect through this card's [All Turns] effect and attack?

BT15-039.answer: A: No, this card's [All Turns] effect and inherited effect don't affect the inherited effects of digivolution cards with [Gammamon].[1]
BT15-039.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect and inherited effect allow me to activate the inherited effect of a digivolution card with [Gammamon] as an effect of this card?

BT15-040.answer: A: No, you can't. The effect only targets 1 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT15-040.question: Q: I have 2 Digimon in play. Can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to give -2000 DP each to 2 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT15-047.answer: A: Yes. It's no longer affected by your opponent's effects as soon as it's suspended, so it can now unsuspend.[1]
BT15-047.question: Q: If this Digimon is unsuspended, then it's suspended by an opponent's "Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. That Digimon can't unsuspend during your opponent's next unsuspend phase" effect, are effects that prevent unsuspending during the unsuspend phase negated?

BT15-058.answer: A: No. As long as the conditions were met at the time you activated the effect, the effect will persist and it can't unsuspend until the end of your opponent’s turn, even if the conditions are no longer met at a later point.[1]

BT15-069.question: Q: What does this card's "[On Deletion] If your opponent has 1 or less memory, ＜Draw 1＞" mean, exactly?
Q: If this card's [On Deletion] effect activates when my opponent has 1 memory, do both the ＜Draw 1＞ and "gain 1 memory" effects activate?

BT15-071.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  If you don't perform the action specified for "by X" in such an effect, the rest of the effect won't activate.[1]
BT15-071.question: Q: Can I activate the "if a Tamer card with the [SoC] trait is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, ＜Draw 1＞" effect in this card's [When Attacking] effect even if I don't perform "by trashing 1 card in your hand, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less"?

Q: If I perform "by trashing 1 card in your hand," does "if a Tamer card with the [SoC] trait is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, ＜Draw 1＞" effect in this card's [When Attacking] effect activate even if my opponent doesn't have a Digimon with 3000 DP or less?

BT15-072.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area" refers to when that Digimon is placed in the trash, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]
BT15-072.question: Q: What does this card's "when [...] would leave the battle area" mean, exactly?

BT15-074.question: Q: Which player chooses whether or not a card is trashed and chooses the card to trash for this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving]effect?
Q: When an effect plays an opponent's Digimon into the breeding area, does this card's inherited effect activate?
Q: Does this card's inherited effect also activate when one of my effects plays an opponent's Digimon?

BT15-075.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  If you don't perform the action specified for "by X" in such an effect, the rest of the effect won't activate.[1]
BT15-075.question: Q: Can I activate the "if a Tamer card with the [SoC] trait is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, ＜Draw 1＞" effect in this card's [When Digivolving] [When Attacking] effect even if I don't perform "by trashing 1 card in your hand, this Digimon gets +2000 DP for the turn"?

BT15-077.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT15-077.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] effect to add a card to my hand when only 1 level 6 or higher card is among the revealed cards?

BT15-077.answer: A: No, the effect doesn’t activate for Digimon in breeding areas.[1]
BT15-077.question: Q: Do [On Play] effects activate for Digimon played into the breeding area by this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT15-077.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't referenced by effects, so they don't trigger.[1]
BT15-077.question: Q: Do "when a Digimon is played" effects trigger for Digimon played into the breeding area by this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT15-077.answer: A: No. It can't attack because the "Digimon can't attack the turn they came into play" rule still applies to Digimon played into the breeding area.[1]
BT15-077.question: Q: I used this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to play a Digimon into the breeding area, and another effect moved the memory to 0 or more, and my turn continued.  If the Digimon that was played into the breeding area is then moved to the battle area by an effect, can that Digimon attack?

BT15-077.answer: A: No, you can't.  A "can't be played by effects" effect affects a player when it activates, therefore the act of playing a Digimon itself won't be possible, whether in the breeding area or the battle area.[1]
BT15-077.question: Q: Can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to play a Digimon into the breeding area when it's affected by a "Digimon can't be played by effects" effect?

BT15-078.answer: A: Because nothing can be played from their trash, you can't switch the target of this card's attack, and the attack will continue using the target that was specified upon the attack declaration.[1]
BT15-078.question: Q: What happens for this card’s [When Attacking] effect if my opponent doesn't have any level 4 or lower Digimon cards in their trash?
Q: When an effect plays an opponent's Digimon into the breeding area, does this card's [All Turns] effect activate?
Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also activate when one of my effects plays an opponent's Digimon?

BT15-079.answer: A: No, it doesn’t.  It won't activate because the trigger timing for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect has already passed when [BT15-031 MetalSeadramon], [BT15-052 Puppetmon], or [BT15-066 Machinedramon]'s [End of Opponent's Turn] effect is used to play this card, so it won't trigger until the end of your opponent's next turn.[1]
BT15-079.question: Q: If I use [BT15-052 MetalSeadramon], [BT15-052 Puppetmon], or [BT15-066 Machinedramon]'s [End of Opponent's Turn] effect to play this card from my hand, does this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect activate?
Q: Can this card digivolve into a 2-color Digimon that includes white?

BT15-081.question: Q: When an effect plays an opponent's Digimon into the breeding area, does this card's [All Turns] effect activate?
Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also activate when one of my effects plays an opponent's Digimon/Tamer?

BT15-081.answer: A: No, you can't. You must delete as many as possible.[1]
BT15-081.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to delete just 1 of my opponent's Digimon if my opponent has level 3, level 5, and level 7 Digimon?

Q: When this card was in the trash, my [Leviamon] attacked a player, and a Digimon or Tamer was played by a [Security] effect upon the security check.  In such cases, can I use this card's [Trash] [All Turns] effect to digivolve the attacking [Leviamon] into this card?

BT15-081.answer: A: No, it only gets 1 additional security check.  [EX5-063 Leviamon]'s ＜Security A. +1＞ is lost upon the digivolution but it gains ＜Security A. +2＞, so the total possible security checks will be 3.  In the situation from your question, you have already performed 2 security checks, so you have 1 security check remaining.[1]
BT15-081.question: Q: My [EX5-063 Leviamon] with ＜Security A. +1＞ attacked a player, and a Digimon or Tamer was played by a [Security] effect upon the 2nd security check. This caused the [EX5-063 Leviamon] to digivolve into this card from the trash.  This card has ＜Security A. +2＞, but does it get 2 additional security checks?

Q: I have this card and [Leviamon] in my trash, then my [[[EX5-069|EX5-069 Biting Crush was placed in the battle area.  If my opponent's Digimon is played by an effect at this time, this card and [EX5-069 Biting Crush] will trigger simultaneously, but can I activate [EX5-069 Biting Crush]'s effect first to play [Leviamon]]] from my trash and then use the effect to digivolve that [Leviamon] into this card?

BT15-082.answer: A: It means that when you use this effect to play a Digimon card, you must choose one with the DP reduced from the maximum shown by 2000 for each each card in your opponent's security stack. The fewer cards in your opponent's security stack, the greater the DP can be for the Digimon card played.  For example, if your opponent has 3 security cards, the 13000 DP maximum is reduced by 6000, meaning that you can play a Digimon card with 7000 DP or less.[1]
BT15-082.question: Q: What does this card's "for each of your opponent's security cards, remove 2000 from this effect's playable card's DP maximum" mean, exactly?

BT15-083.question: Q: My Digimon's effect gave me ＜Draw 1＞ and trashed 1 card in my hand. The number of cards in my hand was the same before and after the effect activated, so does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT15-084.answer: A: Yes, you can. The timing when this card is played into the battle area and the timing when a card is removed from your security stack are the same, so the [All Turns] effect can trigger and activate.[1]
BT15-084.question: Q: Can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to give 1 of my opponent's Digimon ＜Security A. -1＞ when this card is played by [BT13-012 GeoGreymon]'s [When Digivolving] effect?

BT15-086.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT15-087.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT15-088.question: Q: If I use this card's [Main] effect to play a Tamer card with [Sora Takenouchi], does the "return 1 red Digimon card from your trash to the hand" effect activate?

BT15-089.answer: A: It means that when you use this effect to delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon, you must choose one with the DP reduced from the maximum shown by 2000 for each each card in your opponent's security stack. The fewer cards in your opponent's security stack, the greater the DP can be for the Digimon card you delete.  For example, if your opponent has 3 security cards, the 15000 DP maximum is reduced by 6000, meaning that you can delete an opponent's Digimon with 9000 DP or less.[1]
BT15-089.question: Q: What does this card's "for each of your opponent's security cards, remove 2000 from this DP deletion effect's maximum" mean, exactly?

BT15-090.answer: A: No, you can't.  If you have a Digimon with [Gabumon], you must return 1 of your opponent's Digimon with the lowest DP to the hand.[1]
BT15-090.question: Q: When I have a Digimon with [Gabumon] and my opponent has 1 level 3 Digimon and 1 level 4 Digimon, can I choose the target to return to the hand for this card's effect from these 2 Digimon?

BT15-091.answer: A: Yes, you can.  This effect reads "may digivolve into [MetalGarurumon] in your hand," therefore you can choose to not digivolve after placing [Garurumon] and [WereGarurumon] from your trash under [Gabumon].[1]
BT15-091.question: Q: Can I use this card to place 1 [Garurumon] and 1 [WereGarurumon] from my trash under [Gabumon] but choose to not digivolve into [MetalGarurumon] in my hand?

BT15-093.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to give -6000 DP twice to the same Digimon for a total of -12000 DP?

BT15-095.answer: A: No. As long as the conditions were met at the time you activated the effect, the effect will persist and will last until the end of your opponent’s turn, even if the conditions are no longer met at a later point.[1]
BT15-095.question: Q: When I had a Tamer with [Izzy Izumi], I used this card to give 1 of my opponent's Digimon "[On Deletion] Trash the top card of your security stack."  If I later lose my Tamer with [Izzy Izumi], will my opponent's Digimon no longer be affected by that effect?

BT15-096.question: Q: Can I only trash cards with the [Machine] or [Cyborg] trait from among the cards revealed from my deck for this card's [Main] and [Security] effects?

BT15-096.answer: A: When only 1 of such cards is revealed, it's added to the hand according to the effect's processing order. You can't trash a card.[1]
BT15-096.question: Q: What happens when I use this card's effect and only 1 card with the [Machine]/[Cyborg]/ trait is among the cards revealed from my deck?

BT15-097.answer: A: No, you can't.  You must delete the card with the lowest play cost from among all your opponent's Digimon and Tamers for this effect.  In the example given in the question, you would delete the Digimon with a play cost of 3 as the card with the lowest play cost.[1]
BT15-097.question: Q: If I use this card when my opponent has a Digimon with a play cost of 3 and a Tamer with a play cost of 4, can I delete my opponent's Tamer with a play cost of 4 as the Tamer with the lowest play cost?

BT15-098.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  If you don't perform the action specified for "by X" in such an effect, the rest of the effect won't activate.[1]
BT15-098.question: Q: If I don't delete 1 of my Digimon for this card's [Main] effect, can I activate the part of the effect after "then"?

BT15-099.answer: A: No, you can't.  "Lv.-" Digimon and Digimon cards without a level can't be targeted by effects that have levels in their conditions.[1]
BT15-099.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to trash a Lv.- Digimon card in my hand, can I delete my opponent's Lv.- Digimon?

BT15-100.answer: A: No, you can't. You must delete as many as possible.[1]
BT15-100.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete just 1 of my opponent's Digimon if my opponent has both level 4 and level 6 Digimon?

BT15-101.question: Q: While I have a Tamer with [Matt Ishida] and my opponent has a Digimon with 10000 DP or more, can I use an effect that digivolves my Digimon to digivolve my [Gabumon] in the battle area into this card in my hand?

BT15-102.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  When placing cards from the battle area under this card, you can only choose the top cards.[1]
BT15-102.question: Q: When this card would be played, can the [Dark Masters] trait cards I place under this card be from the digivolution cards of Digimon or under Tamers in my battle area?

BT15-102.answer: A: No, you can't.  If you don't perform the action specified for "by X" in such an effect, the rest of the effect won't activate.[1]
BT15-102.question: Q: If I don't place 1 level 6 or lower card from my trash as this Digimon's bottom digivolution card for this card's [End of Your Turn] effect, can I activate the part of the effect after "then"?

BT16-005.question: Q: I have a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, and another of my Digimon with ＜Collision＞ is attacking.  I used the ＜Collision＞ effect to give ＜Blocker＞ to an opponent's Digimon that didn't originally have ＜Blocker＞, and it blocks.  At such times, if both Digimon have the same DP, they both lose the battle, and they're deleted, does this card's inherited effect trigger?

BT16-005.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  The Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is deleted before this card's inherited effect activates, therefore it can't be activated.[1]
BT16-005.question: Q: A Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards battled an opponent's Digimon, and both Digimon lost the battle and were deleted.  Can I activate this card's inherited effect at such times?

BT16-005.answer: A: It triggers once.  If both Digimon lose a battle, both are deleted at the same time.[2]
BT16-005.question: Q: I have a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, other Digimon battled, and both Digimon lost the battle and were deleted.  At such times, if both Digimon have ＜Blocker＞, how many times does this card's inherited effect trigger?

BT16-007.answer: A: It references the Digimon after it digivolves.[1]
BT16-007.question: Q: Does this card's effect reference the card for the Digimon before or after it digivolves?

BT16-010.question: Q: Can this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect delete this Digimon even when my opponent has no Digimon?

BT16-013.question: Q: Does this card’s [All Turns] effect activate when a security card is removed from my security stack by one of my own effects?
Q: After gaining ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card's [All Turns] effect during my opponent's turn, can this Digimon gain ＜Security A. +1＞ again from this card's [All Turns] effect during my next turn?

BT16-013.answer: A: No, you can't.  This effect is triggered "when a card is removed from your opponent's security stack," so even when you check multiple cards in your opponent's security stack, it is triggered and activates upon the first check. Also, this is a [Once Per Turn] effect, so this effect activates when a card is removed from their security stack upon the first check, and you can't activate the effect again upon the next check.[1]
BT16-013.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect twice when I use one of my Digimon with ＜Security A. +1＞ to check 2 cards in my opponent's security stack?
Q: If the [All Turns] effect gives this Digimon ＜Security A. +1＞ when this card attacks and I check my opponent's security stack, do I get an additional security check?

Q: An opponent's Digimon with ＜Security A. +1＞ and 8000 DP or less attacked and a security check occurred. If I use this card's [All Turns] effect to delete my opponent's attacking Digimon before the 2nd security check is performed, can I prevent the 2nd security check?

BT16-013.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate.  The effect triggers when a card is removed from a security stack, but this card is removed from the battle area before it can activate.[1]
BT16-013.question: Q: My Digimon attacked a player and a security check occurred. If this card leaves the battle area due to the revealed card's [Security] effect, does this card’s [All Turns] effect activate?

BT16-014.answer: A: Yes, it activates.  This card's "this Digimon gains all effects of [Goldramon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards"  effect is an [All Turns] effect, so it will activate as soon as the digivolution is confirmed. Therefore, [When Evolving] effects are gained and will trigger.[1]
BT16-014.question: Q: This card digivolved from [BT14-018 Goldramon]. This Digimon gains all effects of [Goldramon] in digivolution cards, but does [BT14-018 Goldramon]'s [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect activate?

BT16-014.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If this card's [All Turns] effect is used to gain a [When Digivolving] effect, this card's [When Digivolving] effect and the [When Digivolving] effect gained from the [All Turns] effect will trigger simultaneously upon the digivolution timing, therefore you may choose the activation order.[1]
BT16-014.question: Q: This card digivolved from [EX3-035 Goldramon]. This Digimon gains all effects of [Goldramon] in digivolution cards, but after [EX3-035 Goldramon]'s [When Digivolving] effect activates and I return [EX3-069 Trial of the Four Great Dragons] from the trash to the hand, can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to use [EX3-069 Trial of the Four Great Dragons] from my hand?

BT16-015.answer: A: No. The effect will trigger, but it can't be activated because its conditions aren't met.[1]
BT16-015.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Your Turn] effect to activate an [On Deletion] effect at the end of an attack if the effect has conditions for activating, such as [EX4-053 Falcomon]'s inherited effect?

BT16-015.answer: A: No, it cannot be activated. If it no longer has a trigger condition before it can be activated, it cannot be activated.[2]
BT16-015.question: Q: By the [Your Turn] effect of this card, I have [End of Attack] added to the inherited effects of [BT16-011 Garudamon (X Antibody)] and [BT13-014 Garudamon]. If I attack with this card, and at the end of the attack delete an opponent's [BT13-065 PlatinumSukamon] with the inherited effect of [BT13-014 Garudamon], then this card's [Your Turn] effect is lost because of <De-Digivolve>, can I activate [BT16-011 Garudamon (X Antibody)]'s inherited effect?

BT16-017.answer: A: It references the Digimon after it digivolves.[1]
BT16-017.question: Q: Does this card's effect reference the card for the Digimon before or after it digivolves?

BT16-018.question: Q: Does this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect prevent deletion in battles against Security Digimon?

BT16-023.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "unsuspend 1 of your Digimon" effect and the "return 1 of your opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to the bottom of the deck" effect when activating this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

BT16-024.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT16-024.question: Q: When I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve it into a Digimon card with the [Angel] or [Three Great Angels] trait in my security stack, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?
Q: Can I use an effect that digivolves my Digimon to digivolve this Digimon into a Digimon card with the [Angel] or [Three Great Angels] trait in my security stack?

Q: I used this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve into a card with the [Angel] or [Three Great Angels] trait in my security stack, then I placed 1 Digimon card with the [Angel], [Archangel] or [Three Great Angels] trait from the hand at the bottom of my security stack.  The number of cards in my security stack remained the same, but do "when a card is removed from a security stack" or "When a card is added to a security stack" effects trigger?

BT16-025.answer: A: The "suspend all of your opponent's Digimon with as many or fewer digivolution cards as this Digimon" part activates even if not DNA digivolving.  The "none of their Digimon can unsuspend until the end of their turn" part only activates if DNA digivolving.[1]
BT16-025.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect activate when performing a non-DNA digivolution?

BT16-028.answer: A: They trigger simultaneously, so the turn player activates their effect first.[1]
BT16-028.question: Q: Which effect activates first, an [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect on an opponent's Digimon that was played/digivolved, or this card's [All Turns] effect?

BT16-028.answer: A: It will trigger at times such as when a Digimon is played by [BT5-092 Nokia Shiramine] or when a Digimon digivolves by [P-103 Offense Training]'s effect.  It won't trigger for effects that aren't digivolution effects, such as [BT4-011 Agunimon]'s effect that treats a Tamer as a level 3 red Digimon or [BT6-060 Deputymon]'s effect that allows digivolution requirements to be ignored.[2]
BT16-028.question: Q: What kinds of effects activated by my opponent will trigger this card's [All Turns] effect?

BT16-029.answer: A: No, you can't.  You can only add 1 [Night Claw] trait or 1 2-color card to the hand.[1]
BT16-029.question: Q: If the cards I reveal for this card's [On Play] effect include only two types of cards, one being a [Night Claw] trait card and one being a 2-color card, can I add both types to the hand?

BT16-030.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT16-030.question: Q: When I use this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] [On Play] effect to digivolve it into a level 4 Digimon card with the [Holy Beast] or [Free] trait in the trash, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT16-032.answer: A: No, it doesn't occur.  When the [All Turns] effect is used to end an attack, the end of attack timing occurs without a battle.[1]
BT16-032.question: Q: When this card's [All Turns] effect is used to end an attack, does a battle occur?

BT16-032.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  This effect forces the attack to end, therefore the end of attack timing occurs as soon as the effect activates. If activation occurs before the counter timing, the counter timing and following procedures aren't performed.[1]
BT16-032.question: Q: If this card's [All Turns] effect is used to end an attack when a ＜Raid＞ effect has switched the target of attack, does the counter timing occur?

BT16-033.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate.  The effect triggers when a card is removed from a security stack, but this card is removed from the battle area before it can activate.[1]
BT16-033.question: Q: This Digimon attacked a player and a security check occurred. If this card leaves the battle area due to the revealed card's [Security] effect, does this card’s [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT16-034.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -4000 DP until the end of their turn" effect and the "1 of their Digimon gains ＜Security A. -2＞ until the end of their turn" effect when activating this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

BT16-036.answer: A: Yes, it activates.  In such cases, only the player with 1 or more security cards trashes the top card of their security stack.[1]
BT16-036.question: Q: Does this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect activate when a player has 0 cards in their security stack?

BT16-039.answer: A: Yes, even if you only reveal one of the applicable cards, you can still add it to your hand.[1]
BT16-039.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck for this card's [On Play] effect include only either a card with [Pulsemon] in its text or a card with the [Abadin Electronics] trait, can I only add 1 card to my hand?

BT16-039.answer: A: No. If you have cards that are targets of this effect, you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT16-039.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck for this card's [On Play] effect include both a card with [Pulsemon] in its text and a card with the [Abadin Electronics] trait, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining cards at the bottom of my deck?

BT16-040.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT16-040.question: Q: When I use this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] [On Play] effect to digivolve it into a level 4 Digimon card with the [Insectoid] or [Free] trait in the trash, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT16-043.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon" effect and the "gain 1 memory" effect when activating this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

BT16-044.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. It can't unsuspend during your opponent's next unsuspend phase" effect and the "gain 2 memory" effect when activating this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

BT16-045.question: Q: When my Digimon with the [Insectoid] trait and this card in its digivolution cards is suspended, can this card's inherited effect switch the target of an opponent's Digimon's attack to that Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards?

BT16-046.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect suspend 1 each of my opponent's Digimon and Tamers?

BT16-047.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "trash the top card of your opponent's security stack" effect and the "gain 2 memory" effect when activating this card's [All Turns] effect?

BT16-048.answer: A: Yes, it isn't affected.  [Security] effects on Security Digimon are treated as Digimon effects, so the "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effect prevents such effects from affecting this Digimon.[1]
BT16-048.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect prevent [Security] effects on my opponent's Security Digimon from affecting this Digimon while it's suspended?

BT16-049.answer: A: It references the Digimon after it digivolves.[1]
BT16-049.question: Q: Does this card's effect reference the card for the Digimon before or after it digivolves?

BT16-051.answer: A: It means that this Digimon can no longer leave the battle area by processing other than deletion. Such processing includes "return to the hand/deck," "place in the security stack," and "place under another Digimon or Tamer."  It only leaves the battle area by deletion.[1]
BT16-051.question: Q: What does "this Digimon can't leave the battle area other than by deletion" in this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect mean, exactly?

BT16-051.answer: A: No, the card is trashed.  Digimon without DP can't be in the battle area according to the rules, therefore upon the rule check timing, the card is considered a card that doesn't belong in the battle area and is trashed.  This is why that card is trashed even if that Digimon is affected by this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect.[2]
BT16-051.question: Q: If a Digimon that's affected by this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect would be trashed because it has no DP, is it still prevented from leaving the battle area?

BT16-055.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "until the end of your opponent's turn, 1 of your Digimon can't have its DP reduced by your opponent's effects and isn't affected by ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) effects" effect and the "1 of your Digimon gains ＜Blocker＞ and ＜Reboot＞ until the end of your opponent's turn" effect when activating this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

BT16-056.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  Even if an effect activates and increases your opponent's security stack, their security stack must have 3 or more cards when the effect finishes activating.[1]
BT16-056.question: Q: When my opponent had 2 cards in their security attack, they activated [ST10-06 Mastemon]'s [When Digivolving] effect, and the effect that places a card from their trash in their security stack and the effect that plays a level 5 or lower Digimon card activated. My opponent temporarily has 3 cards in their security stack, then it becomes 2 cards. Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect?

BT16-059.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) 1 of your opponent's Digimon" effect and the "delete 1 of their Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less" effect when activating this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

BT16-060.answer: A: No, it doesn't. The minimum value is 0, the resulting play cost can't be negative.[1]
BT16-060.question: Q: If I use the "reduce the play costs of all of your opponent's Digimon by 1" effect and all of my opponent's Digimon have their play costs reduced by 3, does an opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 2 now have a play cost of -1?

BT16-060.answer: A: No, it isn't. This card's effect only reduces the play costs of Digimon in your opponent's battle area.[1]
BT16-060.question: Q: If I use the "reduce the play costs of all of your opponent's Digimon by 1" effect, is the play cost also reduced for Digimon cards in areas other than the battle area (such as my opponent's hand or trash)?

BT16-061.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT16-061.question: Q: When I use this card's [All Turns] effect to digivolve it into a Digimon card with the [Beast Dragon], [Undead] or [SoC] trait in the hand, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT16-062.answer: A: Yes, they activate.  This card's "This Digimon gains all effects of cards with [Gammamon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards"  effect is an [All Turns] effect, so it will activate as soon as the digivolution is confirmed. Therefore, [When Evolving] effects are gained and will trigger.[1]
BT16-062.question: Q: When digivolving into this card, do the [When Digivolving] effects on digivolution cards with [Gammamon] activate?

BT16-063.answer: A: The "until the end of your opponent's turn, this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of their Digimon" part activates even if not DNA digivolving.  The "place 1 of your opponent's Digimon with as high or lower a level as the number of cards in your or their security stack at the bottom of their security stack" part only activates if DNA digivolving.[1]
BT16-063.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect activate when performing a non-DNA digivolution?

BT16-063.answer: A: No, this effect places 1 of your opponent's Digimon with as high or lower a level as the number of cards in either your or their security stack at the bottom of their security stack, not the total number of cards.[1]
BT16-063.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect place 1 of my opponent's Digimon with as high or lower a level as the total number of cards in my or their security stack at the bottom of their security stack?

BT16-063.answer: A: No, you can't.  If your opponent has a Digimon with as high or lower a level than the number of either your or your opponent's security cards, you must place those Digimon at the bottom of their security stack for this card's [When Digivolving] effect.[2]
BT16-063.question: Q: I have 5 security cards, and my opponent has 1 security card.  Can I refer to the number of my opponent's security cards for this card's [When Digivolving] effect so I don't place their Digimon at the bottom of the security stack?

BT16-065.question: Q: Does the "when this card would be played" effect also activate when my opponent has a Digimon with the [Boss] trait?
Q: このカードを登場させるとき、特徴に「バンチョー」を持つデジモンがいて、自分のトラッシュから、特徴に「D-ブリガード」を持つカード6枚をデッキの上に戻すことができる場合、支払う登場コストを合計で-12できますか？

BT16-070.question: Q: Can I choose my [LM-020 Quantumon] that isn't affected by Digimon effects as the target of this card's [When Digivolving] effect, then delete just my opponent's Digimon without deleting my [LM-020 Quantumon]?

BT16-071.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT16-071.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to digivolve it into a Digimon card with [Leomon] in my hand/trash regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT16-072.question: Q: 2 copies of this Digimon are deleted at the same time, and their [On Deletion] effects triggered simultaneously. Can I play 1 Tamer card with [Myotismon] in its text when the 1st effect activates, then use the 2nd effect to play a Tamer card with the same name as the Tamer card played by the 1st effect?

BT16-073.question: Q: 2 copies of this Digimon are deleted at the same time, and their [On Deletion] effects triggered simultaneously. Can I play 1 Tamer card with [Myotismon] in its text when the 1st effect activates, then use the 2nd effect to play a Tamer card with the same name as the Tamer card played by the 1st effect?

BT16-074.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "＜Draw 2＞ and trash 1 card in your hand" effect and the "you may play 1 Digimon card with [Pulsemon] in its text and 6000 DP or less from your trash without paying the cost. At the next end of your opponent’s turn, delete it" effect when activating this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT16-076.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT16-076.question: Q: When I use this card's [All Turns] effect to digivolve into [Fenriloogamon] in my trash, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT16-077.question: Q: Does "1 of your Digimon gains ＜Rush＞ for the turn and may attack a player" in this card's [When Digivolving] effect activate if not DNA digivolving?

BT16-077.answer: A: Because [BT16-077 Dinobeemon] is already using [BT16-091 Beastly Storm Dance of Affection]'s effect to attack, a played Digimon can gain ＜Rush＞, but it can't use this card's effect to attack.[2]
BT16-077.question: Q: I used [BT16-091 Beastly Storm Dance of Affection]'s effect to DNA digivolve into this card, then I used [BT16-091 Beastly Storm Dance of Affection]'s effect to attack. At such times, can a Digimon played using this card's [When Digivolving] effect gain ＜Rush＞ and attack?

Q: Does the [When Attacking] effect of this card [End of Your Turn] activate "Until the end of Your Turn, one of your Digimon gains "Quick Attack" and can attack a player with that Digimon" even if it has not been digivolved?

BT16-077.answer: A: Since "BT16-077 Dinobymon" is attacking under the effect of "BT16-091 Jiayoi no Beast Body Storm Dance," the Digimon played can gain "Quick Attack," but cannot attack under the effect of this card.[4]
BT16-077.question: Q: I digivolved DNA digivolved to this card under the effect of "BT16-091 Compassionate Beast Body Storm Dance" and attacked it under the effect of "BT16-091 Compassionate Beast Body Storm Dance". At this time, can the Digimon played by this card's [When Attivolving] effect get "Quick Attack" and attack?

BT16-077.answer: A: No, it cannot. Digimon that are given "Quick Attack" by this effect will attack as much as possible.[5]
BT16-077.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to give a Digimon of mine a "Quick Attack" and then not attack with that Digimon?

BT16-078.question: Q: If only I have a level 4 or lower Digimon, can I choose to not activate this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect and not delete my level 4 or lower Digimon?

BT16-080.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both the "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -7000 DP for the turn" effect and the "delete 1 of their unsuspended Digimon" effect when activating this card's [When Digivolving] [End of Attack] effect?

BT16-080.answer: A: If you have 2 or fewer cards in your security stack when the effect activates, repeat <Recovery +1 (Deck)> until there are 3 cards in your security stack. You don't have to do anything when the effect activates if you have 3 or more cards in your security stack.[1]
BT16-080.question: Q: How exactly do I perform "<Recovery +1 (Deck)> until there are 3 cards in your security stack" in this card’s [On Deletion] effect?

BT16-082.question: Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate when this Digimon itself moves from the breeding area to the battle area?

BT16-082.answer: A: It activates during the breeding phase. If effects trigger during the breeding phase, the main phase will come after all effects have activated.[1]
BT16-082.question: Q: When one of my Digimon moves from the breeding area to the battle area during the breeding phase, does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate during the breeding phase or main phase?

Q: I moved one of my Digimon from the breeding area to the battle area when all of my Digimon's DP is reduced by an effect. The moved Digimon's DP becomes 0 and is deleted due to the DP-reducing effect, but does this card's [All Turns] effect activate?

BT16-082.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  When a card with an effect that's pending activation leaves an area while activation is pending, the effect can no longer be activated.  In this case, the effect triggers when this card is moved, but because the DP becomes 0 before activation, this card is deleted and removed from the battle area, and the effect can't be activated.[2]
BT16-082.question: Q: I moved this card from the breeding area to the battle area when all of my Digimon's DP is reduced by an effect. At such times, if this card's DP becomes 0 and is deleted due to the DP-reducing effect after it's moved, can I activate this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT16-083.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Deletion] effect to play 1 Tamer card from my hand without paying the cost even when I don't have [Ukkomon] in my trash?
Q: Do [On Play] effects activate for Digimon played into the breeding area by this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?
Q: Can I perform a DigiXros when a Digimon with DigiXros requirements is played into the breeding area by this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT16-084.answer: A: Yes, it's returned. In such cases, only the top card is returned to the hand and all digivolution cards are trashed.[1]
BT16-084.question: Q: The Digimon played using this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect digivolved. Is that Digimon returned to the hand at the end of my opponent's turn?

BT16-084.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate.  The rest of the effect won't activate if you don't perform the specified action in effects with "by X" conditions.[1]
BT16-084.question: Q: When one of my Digimon DNA digivolves into a red or yellow Digimon, does the "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -3000 DP for the turn" effect activate even if I don't suspend this Tamer?

BT16-085.answer: A: Yes, it's returned. In such cases, only the top card is returned to the hand and all digivolution cards are trashed.[1]
BT16-085.question: Q: The Digimon played using this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect digivolved. Is that Digimon returned to the hand at the end of my opponent's turn?

BT16-085.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate.  The rest of the effect won't activate if you don't perform the specified action in effects with "by X" conditions.[1]
BT16-085.question: Q: When one of my Digimon DNA digivolves into a blue or green Digimon, does the "trash any 3 digivolution cards under your opponent's Digimon" effect activate even if I don't suspend this Tamer?

BT16-086.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT16-087.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT16-088.answer: A: Yes, it's returned. In such cases, only the top card is returned to the hand and all digivolution cards are trashed.[1]
BT16-088.question: Q: The Digimon played using this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect digivolved. Is that Digimon returned to the hand at the end of my opponent's turn?

BT16-088.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate.  The rest of the effect won't activate if you don't perform the specified action in effects with "by X" conditions.[1]
BT16-088.question: Q: When one of my Digimon DNA digivolves into a black or yellow Digimon, does the "＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) 1 of your opponent's Digimon" effect activate even if I don't suspend this Tamer?

BT16-089.question: Q: The Digimon played using this card's [On Deletion] effect digivolved. Is that Digimon deleted at the end of my opponent's turn?

BT16-090.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Digi-Egg cards in the battle area and breeding area are treated as Digimon, so they can be trashed.[1]
BT16-090.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to trash 1 Digi-Egg card in the breeding area?

BT16-090.answer: A: No, you can't.  You must perform both "deleting 1 of your [Ukkomon] and trashing 1 of your Digimon in the breeding area" to play a [BigUkkomon] into the breeding area.[1]
BT16-090.question: Q: Can I perform just "deleting 1 of your [Ukkomon]" or "trashing 1 of your Digimon in the breeding area" to play a [BigUkkomon] into the breeding area for this card's [Main] effect?

BT16-090.answer: A: Yes, the effect reads “you may play."[1]
BT16-090.question: Q: After performing "deleting 1 of your [Ukkomon]" and "trashing 1 of your Digimon in the breeding area," can I choose to not play a [BigUkkomon] into the breeding area for this card's [Main] effect?

BT16-090.answer:
A: Yes, it's processed.  
Overflow is processed when a card is sent from the area or from under a card to another area. In this case, it's processed because a card from the area is placed in the trash.[2]
BT16-090.question:
Q: Is 
Overflow processed when this card's [Main] effect trashes a Digimon with 
Overflow in the breeding area?

BT16-090.answer:
A: Yes, it's processed.  
Overflow is processed when a card is sent from the area or from under a card to another area. In this case, it's processed because it's placed into the trash from under a card.[2]
BT16-090.question:
Q: Is 
Overflow processed when this card's [Main] effect trashes a Digimon in the breeding area that has a card with 
Overflow in its digivolution cards?

Q: Can I choose to not play Digimon for this card's [Main] effect but DNA digivolve using 2 of my Digimon that were already in the battle area?

BT16-091.answer: A: No, you can't.  You must choose to gain ＜Security A. +1＞ and attack a player or choose to neither gain ＜Security A. +1＞ or attack.[1]
BT16-091.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to give the DNA digivolved Digimon ＜Security A. +1＞ without attacking?
