BT16-098.question: Q: Can I activate the part after "then" in this card's effect if I don't have a Digimon with [Dorugoramon] ?

BT16-100.question: Q: I have 5 cards in my security stack. Can I use this card’s "when this card would be used" effect to only trash 1 security card and reduce the cost by 2?

BT16-101.answer: A: No, you can't.  An attack declaration can't be made during an attack.[1]
BT16-101.question: Q: My Digimon attacks and digivolves into this card by an effect during the attack. Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to attack again?

BT16-102.answer: A: Yes, it can.  A "switch the target of attack" effect such as ＜Raid＞ affects the attacking Digimon itself, therefore the target of attack can be switched to a Digimon that isn't affected by effects.[1]
BT16-102.question: Q: When "isn't affected by your opponent's effects" is gained from this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can the target of attack be switched to this Digimon using a "switch the target of attack" effect such as ＜Raid＞ on an opponent's Digimon?
Q: Does this card’s [All Turns] effect activate when a security card is removed from my security stack by one of my own effects?
Q: Does the "then" part of this card's [When Digivolving] effect activate even if [Magnamon (X Antibody)] or an [Armor Form] trait card isn't in this Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT17-002.answer: A: No, you can't.  You can play multiple Digimon from digivolution cards, but they are played at the same time during a single timing, therefore you can only ＜Draw 1＞ once.[1]
BT17-002.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to ＜Draw 1＞ twice if 2 of my Digimon are played from digivolution cards at the same time?

BT17-003.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to gain 1 memory when I activate ＜Mind Link＞ to 1 of your Digimon. (Place this Tamer as that Digimon's bottom digivolution card if there are no Tamer cards in its digivolution cards.) on a digivolution card of a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and place a Tamer card?

BT17-006.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to digivolve when I activate ＜Mind Link＞ to 1 of your Digimon. (Place this Tamer as that Digimon's bottom digivolution card if there are no Tamer cards in its digivolution cards.) on a digivolution card of a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and place a Tamer card?

BT17-006.answer: A: No, this card's inherited effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT17-006.question: Q: When I use this card's inherited effect to digivolve into a Digimon card with the [SoC] trait in the trash, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT17-007.answer: A: No, you can't.  Even if you have multiple Tamers with [Tai Kamiya], you can only return 1 card to the hand.[1]
BT17-007.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect to return 2 cards with [Garurumon], [Greymon], or [Omnimon] from my trash to the hand when I have 2 Tamers with [Tai Kamiya]?

BT17-007.answer: A: At the end of your turn, this effect allows you to DNA digivolve a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, along with one of your other Digimon, into a Digimon in your hand that has [DNA Digivolution]. Note that this happens before it becomes your opponent’s turn.[1]
BT17-007.question: Q: How does this card’s inherited effect work, exactly?

BT17-007.answer: A: No. You can’t ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn’t have [DNA Digivolution].[1]
BT17-007.question: Q: With this card's inherited effect, can I DNA digivolve into a Digimon card in my hand that doesn’t have [DNA Digivolution]?

BT17-007.answer: A: No. You can’t ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve using Digimon that aren’t specified in [DNA Digivolution].[1]
BT17-007.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect allow me to DNA digivolve into a card other than the Digimon specified by [DNA Digivolution] in the hand?

BT17-008.answer: A: No. If there's a valid target, you must choose it when you activate the effect. You can't choose to not activate the effect when there is a valid target.[1]
BT17-008.question: Q: When my opponent has a Digimon with 3000 DP or less, can I activate this card's effect and gain 1 memory but choose not to delete my opponent’s Digimon?

BT17-008.answer: A: Yes. You can choose your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less as a target, even if the chosen Digimon has an effect that prevents it from being deleted, in order to get the “if this effect didn't delete” part of the effect.[1]
BT17-008.question: Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 3000 DP or less and an effect that reads, “This Digimon can't be deleted by your opponent’s effects,” and another Digimon with 3000 DP or less but no effect. Can I intentionally have this card’s effect target the Digimon with the effect preventing deletion and gain 1 memory?

BT17-008.answer: A: This inherited effect's condition is fulfilled if the memory is at 0 through 10 on your opponent's side when a DP-based deletion effect activates on a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards.[1]
BT17-008.question: Q: What does "while you have 0 or less memory" in this card’s inherited effect mean, exactly?

BT17-008.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[2]
BT17-008.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

BT17-008.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[2]
BT17-008.question: Q: If "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activating, can the maximum be increased for an effect such as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP" that references a Digimon's DP for deletion?

BT17-009.answer: A: Yes, even if you only reveal one of the applicable cards, you can still add it to your hand.[1]
BT17-009.question: Q: If the 3 cards I reveal from my deck for this card's effect include only either a card with the [Hybrid] or [Ten Warriors] trait or a Tamer card with an inherited effect, can I just add that 1 card to my hand?

BT17-009.answer: A: No. If you have cards that are targets of this effect, you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.[1]
BT17-009.question: Q: If the 3 cards I reveal from my deck for this card's effect include both a card with the [Hybrid] or [Ten Warriors] trait and a Tamer card with an inherited effect, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining cards at the bottom of my deck?

BT17-009.answer: A: It means a Tamer card with "Inherited Effect" in its lower text.  A Tamer card with a [Security] effect in its lower text isn't a "Tamer card with inherited effects."[1]
BT17-009.question: Q: What does this card's "Tamer card with inherited effects" mean, exactly?

BT17-010.answer: A: No. If there's a valid target, you must choose it when you activate the effect. You can't choose to not activate the effect when there is a valid target.[1]
BT17-010.question: Q: When my opponent has a Digimon with 4000 DP or less, can I activate this card's effect and gain 3000 memory but choose not to delete my opponent’s Digimon?

BT17-010.answer: A: Yes. You can choose your opponent’s Digimon with 4000 DP or less as a target, even if the chosen Digimon has an effect that prevents it from being deleted, in order to get the “if this effect didn't delete” part of the effect.[1]
BT17-010.question: Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 4000 DP or less and an effect that reads, “This Digimon can't be deleted by your opponent’s effects,” and another Digimon with 4000 DP or less but no effect. Can I intentionally have this card’s effect target the Digimon with the effect preventing deletion and have this Digimon get 3000 DP?

BT17-010.answer: A: This inherited effect's condition is fulfilled if the memory is at 0 through 10 on your opponent's side when a DP-based deletion effect activates on a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards.[1]
BT17-010.question: Q: What does "while you have 0 or less memory" in this card’s inherited effect mean, exactly?

BT17-010.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[2]
BT17-010.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

BT17-010.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[2]
BT17-010.question: Q: If "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activating, can the maximum be increased for an effect such as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP" that references a Digimon's DP for deletion?

BT17-011.answer: A: No, [Takuya Kanbara] digivolves as a Tamer.[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: Does this card's "[Takuya Kanbara]: Cost 2" digivolution requirement mean that [Takuya Kanbara] is treated as a Digimon when it digivolves?

BT17-011.answer: A: No, they don’t trigger.  "When a Digimon digivolves" effects don't trigger when a Tamer digivolves.[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: If I use this card's "[Takuya Kanbara]: Cost 2" digivolution requirement to digivolve, do "when a Digimon digivolves" effects trigger?

BT17-011.answer: A: No, they don’t trigger.  "When a Digimon digivolves" effects don't trigger when a Tamer digivolves.[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: If I use this card's "[Takuya Kanbara]: Cost 2" digivolution requirement to digivolve, do "when a Digimon would digivolve" effects trigger?

BT17-011.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Because you're digivolving from a Tamer, it isn't considered an unsuspended Digimon.[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: My opponent activates EX3-053 [Metallicdramon]'s [On Play] effect. Can I digivolve an unsuspended [Takuya Kanbara] using this card's "[Takuya Kanbara]: Cost 2" digivolution requirement in the next turn?

BT17-011.answer: A: No, you can't.  P-103 [Offense Training]'s ＜Delay＞ effect digivolves 1 Digimon. It doesn't digivolve Tamers.[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: Can I activate P-103 [Offense Training]'s ＜Delay＞ effect and digivolve using this card's "[Takuya Kanbara]: Cost 2" digivolution requirement to digivolve?

BT17-011.answer: A: Digimon carry over effects after digivolving or de-digivolving, therefore it's deleted at the end of the turn.[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: If I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve into [AncientGreymon], then it digivolves or is affected by ＜De-Digivolve＞, what happens to the "delete this Digimon at the end of this turn" effect?

BT17-011.answer: A: No, it isn't deleted because it's no longer considered a Digimon.[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: This Digimon has a Tamer card in its digivolution cards, and I used its [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve into [AncientGreymon], then it was affected by a ＜De-Digivolve＞ effect and became a Tamer. Does the "delete this Digimon at the end of this turn" effect delete this Tamer at such times?

BT17-011.answer: A: Digimon carry over effects after digivolving, therefore it plays [AncientGreymon].[1]
BT17-011.question: Q: I used BT3-109 [Back for Revenge!] on this Digimon, then I used this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve into [AncientGreymon]. BT17-051.answer: A: No, you can't.  "Lv.-" Digimon don't have a level, therefore they can't be chosen as targets for an effect that deletes up to 4 levels' worth of Digimon.[1]
BT17-051.question: Q: When I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to delete up to 4 levels' worth of Digimon, can I delete my opponent's "Lv.-" Digimon?

BT17-051.answer: A: If a card is removed from the trash before a triggered [On Deletion] effect activates, that [On Deletion] effect can't be activated.[1]
BT17-051.question: Q: BT17-048 [Argomon] was deleted while it had an [Argomon] with an [On Deletion] effect in its digivolution cards. I first used BT17-048 [Argomon]'s [On Deletion] effect to play this card. At such times, if I use this card's [On Play] effect to place [Argomon] in digivolution cards before activating the [On Deletion] effect, what happens to that effect?

BT17-055.answer: A: No, it can't.  Even if a target Digimon of this card's [When Digivolving] effect becomes a level 9 or higher Digimon, it can't attack players.[1]
BT17-055.question: Q: I chose 1 opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 8 or less as the target for "can't attack players" in this card's [When Digivolving] effect.  If that opponent's Digimon digivolves during their next turn and becomes a Digimon with a play cost of 9 or more, can it now attack players?

BT17-057.answer: A: 1 card.  Unless specified otherwise, you can only place 1 of each of the cards shown in the DigiXros requirements.[1]

BT17-057.answer: A: Yes, that's correct. In addition to Digimon from the hand or battle area, you may also place cards from the trash for the DigiXros.[1]
BT17-057.question: Q: Does "cards from your trash may also be placed for this card's DigiXros" mean that I can place cards from my hand, battle area, and/or trash for the DigiXros?

BT17-057.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area" refers to when this Digimon is placed in the trash, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]
BT17-057.question: Q: What does this card's "when [...] would leave the battle area" mean, exactly?

BT17-059.answer: A: Yes, you can.  This effect reads "you may play," so if you perform the conditions specified for "by X," you may choose whether or not to activate the effect shown in text.[1]
BT17-059.question: Q: If I use this card’s [When Digivolving] effect to place [Doomsday Clock] from my hand or trash as a digivolution card, can I choose to not play [Diaboromon] Tokens?

BT17-059.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  You can play 2 [Diaboromon] Tokens, but they are played at the same time during a single timing, therefore the effect only triggers once.[1]
BT17-059.question: Q: Does the inherited effect on a card like BT2-059 [Kurisarimon] or BT2-053 [Keramon] trigger twice when I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to play 2 [Diaboromon] Tokens?
Q: Can I also use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to switch the attack target to my unsuspended Digimon with [Diaboromon]?

BT17-064.answer: A: Because your opponent's Digimon was the target of the battle and is no longer in play, a battle doesn't occur. However, the counter timing and end of attack timing still exist, therefore any applicable effects will trigger.[1]
BT17-064.question: Q: When I use this Digimon to attack an opponent's Digimon without digivolution cards, and this card's [Your Turn] effect deletes that Digimon, what happens to the attack?

BT17-065.answer: A: It triggers at the timing when this card is in the trash and your [Dorugamon] would be deleted.  [Trash] means that an effect can trigger and activate when the card is in the trash.[1]
BT17-065.question: Q: When exactly is the timing when this card's [Trash] [All Turns] effect triggers?

BT17-065.answer: A: Yes, you can.  However, the DP-reducing effect will be carried over after the [Trash] effect activates and digivolution occurs, therefore deletion will occur again if the DP is still 0 after the effect activates and digivolution occurs.[1]
BT17-065.question: Q: If I use this card's [Trash] effect to digivolve when my [Dorugamon] would be deleted by its DP becoming 0, can I prevent that deletion?

BT17-065.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  The Digimon is deleted before the [When Digivolving] effect activates.[1]
BT17-065.question: Q: I used this card's [Trash] effect to digivolve when my [Dorugamon] would be deleted due to its DP being reduced by 10000. Its DP became 0 due to the DP-reducing effect, but can I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect after it digivolves at such times?

BT17-065.answer: A: No, it activates instead of "Then, ＜Draw 1＞."[1]
BT17-065.question: Q: Does "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 4 or less instead" in this card's [When Digivolving] effect activate instead of "Trash 1 card in your hand. Then, ＜Draw 1＞"?

BT17-067.answer: A: It triggers at the timing when this card is in the trash and your [DoruGreymon] would be deleted.  [Trash] means that an effect can trigger and activate when the card is in the trash.[1]
BT17-067.question: Q: When exactly is the timing when this card's [Trash] [All Turns] effect triggers?

BT17-067.answer: A: Yes, you can.  However, the DP-reducing effect will be carried over after the [DoruGreymon] effect activates and digivolution occurs, therefore deletion will occur again if the DP is still 0 after the effect activates and digivolution occurs.[1]
BT17-067.question: Q: If I use this card's [Trash] effect to digivolve when my [DoruGreymon] would be deleted by its DP becoming 0, can I prevent that deletion?

BT17-067.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  The Digimon is deleted before the [When Digivolving] effect activates.[1]
BT17-067.question: Q: I used this card's [Trash] effect to digivolve when my [DoruGreymon] would be deleted due to its DP being reduced by 10000. Its DP became 0 due to the DP-reducing effect, but can I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect after it digivolves at such times?

BT17-067.answer: A: No, it activates instead of "Then, ＜Draw 1＞."[1]
BT17-067.question: Q: Does "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less instead" in this card's [When Digivolving] effect activate instead of "Trash 1 card in your hand. Then, ＜Draw 1＞."?
Q: Can I use this card’s inherited effect to choose my Digimon with a "can't be deleted by effects" effect and only delete an opponent's Digimon with as high or lower a level as that Digimon?

BT17-068.answer: A: This effect means that this card is also treated as a level 6 card while it's flipped over from the deck by a "reveal cards from the deck" effect.  If the effect is an effect such as "add 1 level 6 Digimon card from the revealed cards," you can use that effect to add this card to the hand.[1]
BT17-068.question: Q: What does this card's "while this card is revealed from your deck, this card is also treated as level 6" mean, exactly?

BT17-068.answer: A: Yes, you can.  The effect reads "also treated as level 6," therefore this card can be treated as both level 5 and level 6, so you can add 2 copies to your hand.[1]
BT17-068.question: Q: If I reveal 2 copies of this card using BT3-051 [Dokugumon]'s [On Play] effect, can I add both copies to my hand?

BT17-068.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate. This Digimon is deleted by the rules, not the DP-reducing effect. Therefore, it doesn't meet the "if deleted by an effect" condition.[1]
BT17-068.question: Q: Does the "if deleted by an effect" effect activate when this Digimon's DP becomes 0 and is deleted due to a DP-reducing effect?

BT17-068.answer: A: This effect targets a level 5 or lower card with [Dark Masters] in its text from your trash.  This card's inherited effect has been changed to "[When Attacking] [Once Per Turn] By placing 1 level 5 or lower card with [Dark Masters] in its text from your trash as this Digimon's bottom digivolution card, this Digimon gets +2000 DP for the turn."    Please see the notices regarding changes to the rules/rulings on the official website.[1]
BT17-068.question: Q: What cards does "level 5 or lower card with [Dark Masters] in its text" in this card's inherited effect refer to?

BT17-069.answer: A: Yes, it's returned. In such cases, only the top card is returned to the hand and all digivolution cards are trashed.[1]
BT17-069.question: Q: The Digimon played using this card's [When Digivolving] effect digivolved. Is that Digimon returned to the hand at the end of my opponent's turn?

BT17-069.answer: A: Normally, the turn will end and the turn will switch when the memory moves to 1 or more on your opponent's side. But while this effect is activated, the turn won't end unless the memory moves to 3 or more on your opponent's side.  Your turn will continue when your opponent's memory is at 1 or 2.[1]
BT17-069.question: Q: How does this card’s inherited effect work, exactly?

BT17-069.answer: A: No, this effect only applies during your turn. Your opponent's turn continues until the memory moves to 1 or more from your perspective.[1]
BT17-069.question: Q: If the memory moves to 2 or less on my opponent's side during my opponent's turn, does the turn switch to my turn with this card's inherited effect?

Q: The memory moved to 3 or more on my opponent's side and the turn ended while this card's inherited effect was activated. If the memory moves to 1 or 2 on my opponent's side due to an [End of Your Turn] effect, does my turn continue?

BT17-069.answer: A: No. ＜Blitz＞ still requires the memory to be at 1 or more on your opponent's side for attacking.  Attacking is possible when your opponent's memory is at 1 or more.[1]
BT17-069.question: Q: When the memory moves to 3 or more on my opponent's side while this card's inherited effect is activated, does ＜Blitz＞ allow for attacking?

BT17-070.question: Q: Can I use this card’s [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to place 1 level 5 card with [Dark Masters] in its traits as a digivolution card even when my opponent doesn't have a level 5 or lower Digimon?

BT17-070.answer: A: Yes, you can.  However, if a Digi-Egg card is the target of an effect that places it at the bottom of the deck, it will be placed at the bottom of the Digi-Egg deck.[1]

BT17-071.answer: A: Yes, you can.  This effect reads "you may play," so if you perform the conditions specified for "by X," you may choose whether or not to activate the effect shown in text.[1]

BT17-073.answer: A: It triggers at the timing when this card is in the trash and your [Dorugoramon] would be deleted.  [Trash] means that an effect can trigger and activate when the card is in the trash.[1]
BT17-073.question: Q: When exactly is the timing when this card's [Trash] [All Turns] effect triggers?

BT17-073.answer: A: Yes, you can.  However, the DP-reducing effect will be carried over after the [Dorugoramon] effect activates and digivolution occurs, therefore deletion will occur again if the DP is still 0 after the effect activates and digivolution occurs.[1]
BT17-073.question: Q: If I use this card's [Trash] effect to digivolve when my [Dorugoramon] would be deleted by its DP becoming 0, can I prevent that deletion?

BT17-074.question: Q: Does this card's [When Digivolving] effect allow me to pay a cost of 2 even when I play a white Tamer card with a play cost of 4 or less?
Q: Can I also use this card's inherited effect to switch the attack target to an unsuspended [Eosmon]?

BT17-075.question: Q: Can I also use this card's inherited effect to switch the attack target to an unsuspended [Eosmon]?

BT17-075.answer: A: Yes, you do.  You perform the part of the effect after "then" regardless of whether or not a Tamer was played.[1]
BT17-075.question: Q: If both players don't play a Tamer for this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, do I still perform ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.)?

BT17-076.answer: A: Yes, you can.  The information on [Eosmon] is referenced at the time it's played, therefore you can perform deletion even if that [Eosmon] is removed from the battle area before the effect activates.[1]
BT17-076.question: Q: If the played [Eosmon] is removed from the battle area before this card's [All Turns] effect activates, can I still delete 1 of my opponent's Digimon with as much or less DP as the played [Eosmon]?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect trigger when this card itself is played?

BT17-076.answer: A: 5000 DP or less.  If the same reference to an "X" trigger condition being performed isn't being made for an effect when it has a "when X" trigger condition, the state when the effect has triggered will be referenced.  In this case, processing was performed when your BT6-083 [Eosmon] had 5000 DP, therefore you can delete a Digimon with 5000 DP or less.[2]
BT17-076.question: Q: My BT6-083 [Eosmon] was played, then this card's [All Turns] effect and another effect triggered simultaneously.  If another effect activates and the DP of my played BT6-083 [Eosmon] changes from 4000 to 5000, then I activate this card's [All Turns] effect, what is the DP of Digimon I can delete?

BT17-076.answer: A: No, you can't.  If the same reference to an "X" trigger condition being performed isn't being made for an effect when it has a "when X" trigger condition, the state when the effect has triggered will be referenced.  In this case, because the Digimon that could be referenced by this card's [All Turns] effect was removed, you can't delete a Digimon.[2]
BT17-076.question: Q: Another of my [Eosmon] was played, then this card's [All Turns] effect and another effect triggered simultaneously. I activated the other effect, then my played [Eosmon] was removed from the battle area.  If I then activate this card's [All Turns] effect, can I delete an opponent's Digimon?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect trigger when this card itself plays?

BT17-076.answer: A: DP5000 or less. If the triggering condition is "when you do 00" and the effect does not have the same reference as the triggering condition of "when you do 00," then it refers to the situation at the time the effect is being processed. In this situation, the DP of your "BT6-083 Eosmon" is 5000 at the time it is being processed, so you can delete Digimon with DP 5000 or less.[3]
BT17-076.question: Q: My "BT6-083 Eosmon" appeared and this card's [All Your Turns] effect and another effect triggered simultaneously. If the DP of my "BT6-083 Eosmon" that played after the other effect is activated goes from 4000 to 5000, which DP or less can be deleted by the [All Your Turns] effect of this card that was triggered after that?

BT17-076.answer: A: No, it cannot be deleted. If the triggering condition is "when you do 00" and the effect does not have the same reference as the triggering condition of "when you do 00," then the situation at the time the effect is processed is referenced. In this situation, the card cannot be deleted because there are no more Digimons that can be referenced by the card's [All Turns] effect.[3]
BT17-076.question: Q: Other your "Eosmon" appeared and this card's [All Your Turns] effect and other effects triggered at the same time. My "Eosmon" which appeared and activated from the other effect has left the Battle Area. Can I delete my opponent's Digimon with this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activated after that?

BT17-077.answer: A: If a Digi-Egg card is affected by an effect that places it at the bottom of the deck, it will be placed at the bottom of the Digi-Egg deck.[1]
BT17-077.question: Q: What happens to Digi-Egg cards in the trash when this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect activates?

Q: Does "if this effect returned level 7 white cards" in this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect mean that it will activate even if I return a card such as BT12-112 [Shoutmon X7: Superior Mode] that has 2 or more colors including white?
Q: Do I gain 6 memory if I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to return 2 level 7 white cards?

BT17-078.answer: A: If DNA Digivolving, you choose 1 of your opponent's Digimon and return all of your opponent's Digimon with the same level to the bottom of the deck.  For example, if you use this effect to choose a level 3 Digimon, you return all of your opponent's level 3 Digimon to the bottom of the deck.  Then, you delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT17-078.question: Q: What does this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect do, exactly?

BT17-078.answer: A: Yes, you may still delete one of the opponent's Digimon.[2]
BT17-078.question: Q: If this card didn’t DNA digivolve, can its [On Play] / [When Digivolving] effect still delete one of the opponent’s Digimon?

BT17-079.answer: A: Yes, you can.  ＜Piercing＞ activates as soon as your opponent's Digimon is deleted in battle, therefore you can still perform a security check even if the effect is lost after activation.[1]
BT17-079.question: Q: My Digimon that gained ＜Security A. +1＞ and has this card in its digivolution cards was deleted in battle with an opponent's Digimon when my Digimon had 10000 DP, then I performed a security check using ＜Piercing＞.  If the [Security] effect on the checked card reduces the DP of the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards to 9000 or less, can I still perform the 2nd security check using this card's ＜Piercing＞?

BT17-080.answer: A: Yes, you can.  The effect reads "may digivolve," so you can choose whether or not to digivolve.[1]
BT17-080.question: Q: Can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to place this Tamer and 1 [Growlmon] and 1 [WarGrowlmon] from my trash as the bottom digivolution cards of 1 of my [Guilmon], but choose to not may digivolve into [Gallantmon]?

BT17-080.answer: A: ＜Blitz＞ can activate as long as your opponent has 1 or more memory when you would activate the effect.[1]
BT17-080.question: Q: If the [Gallantmon] digivolved by this card's [End of Your Turn] effect has ＜Blitz＞, can I activate it?

BT17-081.question: Q: Can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to gain 2 memory if I have a Digimon with [Greymon] and a Digimon with [Garurumon]?

BT17-081.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Even if the played Digimon is removed before the effect activates, it triggers because the "when [...] Digimon is played" condition is met, then the effect can activate. However, the "if you have a Digimon with [XX]" condition is no longer met once the Digimon is removed, therefore you don't gain 1 memory.[1]
BT17-081.question: Q: When I play a Digimon with [Greymon], then its DP becomes 0 and is deleted upon play due to a persistent effect, can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect?

BT17-081.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's [End of Your Turn] effect does not allow you to attack with Digimon that are in a state where they can't attack.[1]
BT17-081.question: Q: Can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to attack using my Digimon with [Omnimon] even when it's suspended?

BT17-081.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If BT5-086 [Omnimon] digivolves during the main phase, you can use the [End of Your Turn] effect to attack again after the attack from ＜Blitz＞ ends.[1]
BT17-081.question: Q: I attacked using BT5-086 [Omnimon]'s ＜Blitz＞ and unsuspended it using the other [When Digivolving] effect. After the attack ends, can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to attack again?

BT17-081.answer: A: No, you can't.  The effect will trigger on both copies, but after the attack declaration is made for the 1st [Omnimon] and effects such as [When Attacking] effects have finished activating, the effect on the 2nd copy of this card that was pending activation will activate before the counter timing. However, a new attack declaration can't be made during an attack, and only the 1st [Omnimon]'s attack can be performed as a result.[1]
BT17-081.question: Q: When I have 2 copies of this Tamer and 2 unsuspended Digimon with [Omnimon], can I activate the [End of Your Turn] effect on both copies of this card and attack using both of the Digimon with [Omnimon]?

BT17-083.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect also activate if a single effect such as "＜Draw 1＞. Then, trash 1 card in the hand" trashes the same number of cards as the number that were added from the draw?

BT17-084.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Even if the part after the conditions specified with "by X" in an effect can't be resolved, the effect can still activate.[1]
BT17-084.question: Q: Can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to suspend this Tamer when my level 5 or higher [Free] trait Digimon would be deleted in battle, even if I don't have any level 4 or lower Digimon cards in that Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT17-084.answer: A: No, you can't.  The card is removed from digivolution cards before ＜Retaliation＞ can activate.[1]
BT17-084.question: Q: When my level 5 or higher [Free] trait Digimon would be deleted in battle, I used this card's [All Turns] effect to play a level 4 or lower Digimon card with ＜Retaliation＞ in its inherited effects from that Digimon's digivolution cards. Can I use ＜Retaliation＞ to delete the battled opponent's Digimon at such times?

BT17-084.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's [End of Your Turn] effect does not allow you to attack with Digimon that are in a state where they can't attack.[1]
BT17-084.question: Q: Can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to attack even when the [Free] trait Digimon is suspended?

BT17-084.answer: A: No, you can't.  The effect will trigger on both copies, but after the attack declaration is made for the 1st Digimon and effects such as [When Attacking] effects have finished activating, the effect on the 2nd copy of this card that was pending activation will activate before the counter timing. However, a new attack declaration can't be made during an attack, and only the 1st Digimon's attack can be performed as a result.[1]
BT17-084.question: Q: When I have 2 copies of this Tamer and 2 unsuspended [Free] trait Digimon, can I activate the [End of Your Turn] effect on both copies of this card and attack using both of the [Free] trait Digimon?

BT17-085.answer: A: Yes, you can.  The effect reads "may digivolve," so you can choose whether or not to digivolve.[1]
BT17-085.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to place this Tamer and 1 [Kyubimon] and 1 [Taomon] from my trash as my [Renamon]'s bottom digivolution cards, but then choose to not digivolve into [Sakuyamon]?

BT17-085.answer: A: No, you can't.  EX4-030 [Kuzuhamon] is treated as if it has [Sakuyamon]. This effect doesn't treat it as if it has the name [Sakuyamon], therefore digivolution isn't possible.[1]
BT17-085.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to digivolve 1 of my [Renamon] into EX4-030 [Kuzuhamon]?

BT17-086.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT17-087.question: Q: If [Marcus Damon] is treated as a Digimon by this card's effect and then its DP is reduced to 0 by an effect, is it deleted?

BT17-088.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Your Turn] effect to digivolve a Digimon other than the played Digimon?

BT17-089.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  Suspending from an attack declaration is due to the rules, therefore it doesn't trigger "when an effect suspends X" effects.[1]
BT17-089.question: Q: Does "when an effect suspends" in this card's [Your Turn] effect trigger when an attack declaration is made for a Digimon and it's suspended using an effect such as ＜Blitz＞ or an "attack using X" effect?

BT17-090.answer: A: No, this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT17-090.question: Q: Can I use this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect to digivolve into a Digimon card with [Dex] in the trash regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT17-091.question: Q: Can I use the [End of All Turns] effect in this card's inherited effect to play this card itself when this card is in a Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT17-092.answer: A: No, they can activate.  This card's [All Turns] effect only prevents effects from activating at the [On Play] timing. Effects can still activate at the [Main] timing.[1]
BT17-092.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also prevent [Main] effects from activating if they have multiple activation timings such as [On Play] [Main]?

BT17-092.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area" refers to when that Digimon is placed in the trash, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]
BT17-092.question: Q: What does this card's "when [...] would leave the battle area" mean, exactly?

BT17-093.question: Q: Is this card's [All Turns] effect triggered by "play into an empty space in your breeding area without paying the cost" effects?

BT17-093.answer: A: No, you can't.  When this card is newly played, the [End of Your Turn] timing has already passed, and the effect can't activate.[1]
BT17-093.question: Q: If I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to play a copy of this card, can I activate the [End of Your Turn] effect on the newly played copy of this card?

BT17-094.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to play 1 Digimon card with the [Ten Warriors] trait or 1 Tamer card with inherited effects without returning 1 Digimon card from my trash to the hand?

BT17-094.answer: A: It means a Tamer card with "Inherited Effect" in its lower text.  A Tamer card with a [Security] effect in its lower text isn't a "Tamer card with inherited effects."[1]
BT17-094.question: Q: What does this card's "Tamer card with inherited effects" mean, exactly?

BT17-095.answer: A: "When [...] would leave the battle area other than by battle" refers to when that Digimon is placed in the trash other than as a result of a battle, returned to the hand/deck, placed in the security stack, moved to the breeding area, or placed under another card.[1]
BT17-095.question: Q: What does this card's "when [...] would leave the battle area other than by [...] a battle" mean, exactly?

BT17-095.answer: A: No. You can’t ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn’t have [DNA Digivolution].[1]
BT17-095.question: Q: With this card's ＜Delay＞ effect, can I DNA digivolve into a Digimon card in my hand that doesn’t have [DNA Digivolution]?

BT17-095.answer: A: No. You can’t ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve using Digimon that aren’t specified in [DNA Digivolution].[1]
BT17-095.question: Q: Does this card's ＜Delay＞ effect allow me to DNA digivolve into a card other than the Digimon specified by [DNA Digivolution] in the hand?

BT17-095.answer: A: No, they do not leave the Battle Area. DNA digivolves digivolve as a new Digimon, so it is a different Digimon than the one that leaves.[2]
BT17-095.question: Q: If two Digimon including the leaving Digimon digivolved by the "Delay" effect of this card, does the Digimon that digivolved DNA digivolves leave the Battle Area?

BT17-095.answer: A: When a Digimon leaves the Battle Area other than as a result of a Battle is when it is "placed in trash," "returned to hand or deck," "placed in security," "moved to the Breeding Area," or "placed under another card" other than as a result of a Battle.[3]
BT17-095.question: Q: What exactly does this card mean "when leaving the Battle Area outside of a battle"?

BT17-095.answer: A: No, you cannot ignore the digivolution requirements, so you cannot DNA digivolve to a Digimon card that does not have "digivolves".[3]
BT17-095.question: Q: Can I use the "Delay" effect of this card to digivolve DNA digivolution to a Digimon card that does not have "Jogress" in my hand?

BT17-095.answer: A: No, you cannot ignore the digivolution requirements, so you cannot digivolve DNA digivolves with a Digimon that is not designated as a "digivolution" digivolution.[3]
BT17-095.question: Q: Can I use the "Delay" effect of this card to perform DNA digivolves with a Digimon not designated as a "digivolve" in my hand?

BT17-096.answer: A: No, this card's ＜Delay＞ effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT17-096.question: Q: When I use this card's ＜Delay＞ effect to digivolve into a Digimon card with [Gallantmon] in the hand, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT17-097.answer: A: No, this card's [Main] effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT17-097.question: Q: When I use this card's [Main] effect to digivolve into a level 5 or higher Digimon card with the [Free] trait in the hand, can it digivolve regardless of its digivolution requirements?

BT17-097.answer: A: No, this card's ＜Delay＞ effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]

BT17-097.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> and this card's ＜Delay＞ effect will trigger simultaneously, but if you use this card's effect to digivolve first, the triggered <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> on BT16-025 [Paildramon] will be negated and won't activate.No, you can't activate it.  <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> and this card's ＜Delay＞ effect will trigger simultaneously, but if you use this card's effect to digivolve first, the triggered <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> on BT16-025 [Paildramon] will be negated and won't activate.[2]
BT17-097.question: Q: When BT16-025 [Paildramon] would be deleted by an opponent's effect, can I activate BT16-025 [Paildramon]'s <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> effect after using this card's ＜Delay＞ effect to digivolve?

BT17-097.answer: A: No, you can't activate it.  BT16-025 [Paildramon]'s <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> inherited effect can't be activated because it doesn't trigger when the Digimon is deleted by an opponent's effect.[3]
BT17-097.question: Q: When BT16-025 [Paildramon] is deleted by an opponent's effect, can I activate BT16-025 [Paildramon]'s <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> inherited effect after using this card's ＜Delay＞ effect to digivolve?

BT17-097.question: Q: When a Digimon with BT16-025 [Paildramon] in its digivolution cards is deleted by an opponent's effect, can I activate BT16-025 [Paildramon]'s <Partition (blue Lv.4 + green Lv.4)> inherited effect after using this card's ＜Delay＞ effect to digivolve?

BT17-097.answer: A: No, you can't.  1 digivolution can only be performed on 1 Digimon. You can't perform separate digivolutions on multiple cards at the same time.  Therefore, when multiples of your Digimon with the [Free] trait would be deleted other than by one of your effects, you can only use this card's effect to digivolve 1 of those Digimon.  In addition, only the digivolved Digimon is prevented from being deleted.[2]
BT17-097.question: Q: If I activate this card's [All Turns] effect when multiples of my Digimon with the [Free] trait would be deleted at the same time other than by one of my effects, can I digivolve all of those Digimon and prevent them from being deleted?

BT17-097.answer: A: No, you can't.  Only the turn player can attack.  In this case, your EX3-063 [Imperialdramon: Dragon Mode] can't attack because it isn't your turn.[2]

BT17-098.answer: A: No, you can't.  "Top card" refers to 1 or more cards with cards underneath it.[1]

Please see the notices regarding changes to the rules/rulings on the official website.[1]

BT17-102.answer: A: Yes. "This Digimon gains all the names..." means that it also gains the names from (Rule) on digivolution cards.[1]

BT18-004.answer: A: They become face-up security cards that remain revealed.  Other than rules that specify face-up security cards, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security cards.[1]

BT18-004.answer: A: The check is performed with the card left revealed.  Other than rules for cards left revealed, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security checks.[1]

BT18-079.answer: A: No, it isn't considered a Digimon that would digivolve.  When a Tamer would digivolve using this card's digivolution requirement, "when a Digimon would digivolve" effects don't trigger.[1]

BT18-079.answer: A: No, it isn't considered a Digimon that digivolves.  When a Tamer digivolves using this card's digivolution requirement, "when a Digimon digivolves" effects don't trigger.[1]

BT18-079.answer: A: 3 cards.  In this case, there are 3 colors (red, blue, and yellow) in your opponent's Digimon and Tamers, therefore you trash 3 cards from the tops of both players' decks.[1]

BT18-081.answer: A: Effects with the [Hand] icon can activate when their card is revealed from the hand.  This effect can activate during the main phase when you reveal this card from the hand and process the effect.[1]

BT18-081.answer: A: No, you can't.  A "by doing X" condition can't be met if only some of the required actions are performed.  In order for the conditions for this card's [Hand] [Main] effect to be met, you must place 1 [Beetlemon] and 1 [MetalKabuterimon] under your Tamer.[1]

BT18-082.answer: A: Digimon that aren't affected by effects aren't affected by this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect.  Because this effect didn't delete, you can process the part of the effect after "if this effect didn't delete."[1]

BT18-086.answer: A: This effect prevents all of your 0 DP Digimon from being deleted.  It prevents deletion from effects as well as deletion from the rules (including the rules that delete 0 DP Digimon upon a rule check and deletion upon losing a battle).[1]

BT18-088.answer: A: You may choose 1 card with a combination of having the [Hybrid] trait and a different name from your trash and place it under this Tamer. For example, if you have 1 Tamer other than this Tamer, you can choose up to 3 cards with the [Hybrid] trait and different names from your trash and place them under this Tamer.[1]

BT18-088.answer: A: No, it can't attack. A new attack declaration can't be made during an attack. BT18-096.answer: A: From the battle area.  When text doesn't specify an area, it means that it specifies, references, or affects the battle area.[1]

BT18-098.answer: A: No, you can't.  If the "by trashing your top security card" condition isn't performed, the rest of the effect isn't processed. In this case, you can't process this effect unless you trash your top security card.[1]

BT2-077.question: Q: Do I have to activate this card's effect?
Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete a Digimon in my breeding area?

BT2-078.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete a Digimon in my breeding area?

BT2-079.answer: A: Since the effect of [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon] and [When Attacking] would be resolved at the same time, the opponent's effect will be resolved first, and then VenomMyotismon's effect will be resolved.
BT2-079.question: Q: [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]'s effect is "[Opponent's Turn] When the opponent's Digimon suspends". The opponent's Digimon is rested to attack. Which comes first [When Attacking] or the [Opponent's Turn] effect of VenomMyotismon to increase memory by 1? Is it the same timing as [When Attacking]?

BT2-079.answer: A: No, it is triggered as soon as the opponent declares an attack suspending the Digimon. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT2-079.question: Q: Is [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]'s [Opponent's Turn] effect considered a [Reaction] effect?

BT2-079.answer: A: No, you cannot. The effect of this card was not triggered when the attack was declared (which caused the Digimon to suspend), so it cannot be activated. (See more in Effect Resolution)
BT2-079.question: Q: My opponent attacks and activates an effect that ＜De-Digivolve＞ on my Level 7 Digimon that becomes a [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]. Can I use VenomMyotismon's effect?

BT2-079.answer: A: No, you cannot. Even though the effect of [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon] was triggered, the Digimon has lost the [Opponent's Turn] effect of VenomMyotismon so it cannot be activated. (See more in Effect Resolution)
BT2-079.question: Q: My opponent attacks and activates an effect that ＜De-Digivolve＞ on my [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]. Can I use VenomMyotismon's effect?

BT2-082.answer: A: Tokens are special cards that some effects put into play to represent Digimon or Tamers. This card's effect, for example, plays a token that's treated as a Digimon named [Diaboromon]. For a more detailed explanation of how tokens work, check the official rule manual.[1]
BT2-082.question: Q: What's a token?
Q: Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect by deleting a [Diaboromon] token when this Digimon is about to be deleted?

BT2-082.answer: A: No. this card's [All Turns] effect only takes effect when this Digimon is deleted. You can't activate it when a [Diaboromon] token is deleted.[1]
BT2-082.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect by deleting a [Diaboromon] token when this Digimon is about to be deleted?

BT2-082.answer: A: Yes. The token is considered a Digimon with the specified name, and is deleted.[1]
BT2-082.question: Q: I have this Digimon and a [Diaboromon] token in play in my battle area when my opponent uses [BT1-084 Omnimon]'s [On Evolution] effect to choose [Diaboromon]. Are this Digimon and my [Diaboromon] token both deleted due to having the same name?
Q: Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect when this Digimon is about to be deleted in a battle with an opponent's Security Digimon?

BT2-083.answer: A: No, this card's [On Deletion] effect only returns this card to play. Any cards that were in its digivolution cards go to the trash.[1]
BT2-083.question: Q: When playing this card from my trash using its [On Deletion] effect, do the cards it had as digivolution cards return to my battle area as well?

BT2-084.answer: A: This Tamer's effect becomes active once you declare your attack against another player. The +2000 DP bonus remains even if the target of attack changes due to ＜Blocker＞.[1]
BT2-084.question: Q: I attack my opponent with a Digimon, and suspend this Tamer. If my opponent blocks the attack, what happens to the +2000 DP bonus from this Tamer's effect?

BT2-085.answer: A: No, you can't. "Trash all of the digivolution cards of those Digimon" is an explanation of what happens to the digivolution cards of the Digimon when it returns to their hand. It doesn't count as trashing digivolution for the purposes of this card's effect.[1]
BT2-085.question: Q: You activate an effect that reads "Return 1 of your opponent's Digimon to their hand. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon" to return an opponent's Digimon to their hand. When your opponent's digivolution cards are trashed as a result, can you activate this card's effect?

BT2-088.answer: A: No, digivolving Digimon in your breeding area doesn't activate the effect that reduces digivolution cost by 1.[1]

BT2-090.answer: A: One "purple Digimon card" or "purple option card".[1]

BT2-094.question: Q: Can I use this card when my opponent has no digivolution cards to still get the +2000 DP?

BT2-096.answer: A: The digivolution cards get trashed at the same time the Digimon is returned to the hand. So it gets returned to hand before unsuspending a Digimon.
BT2-096.question: Q: When do the digivolution cards get trashed in the effect of [BT2-096 The Ray of Victory]? Does it get trashed before or after unsuspending a Digimon?

BT2-098.answer: A: No, this card's effect can only be activated against 1 of your opponent's Digimon. You can't use a single copy of this card to reduce the DP of multiple Digimon.[1]
BT2-098.question: Q: If I have 2 or more cards in hand when I use this effect, can I give 2 or more different Digimon -1000 DP?

BT2-099.answer: A: Yes, you can. Hoewver, it cannot be taken from your trash by BeeleStarmon's [On Play] effect even if you have 2 Tamers.
BT2-099.question: Q: If this card is in my hand, and I have exactly 2 Yellow Tamers. Can I play this card with [BT6-112 BeelStarmon]'s [On Play] effect?

BT2-099.answer: A: No, in that case, since the usage cost of [BT2-099 Glorious Burst] has been changed to 1, it is not considered that an option card with a usage cost of 2 or more was used, so it will not be demonstrated.
BT2-099.question: Q: If I use this card while I have 8 or more of my own yellow tamers and a [EX2-003 Viximon] in my Digimon's digivolution cards, will that card's inherited effect be triggered?

BT2-109.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete a Digimon in my breeding area?

BT2-111.answer: A: No, you can't use this card's effect to digivolve from an [Impmon] in your breeding area.[1]
BT2-111.question: Q: If I have 10 or more cards in my trash, can I digivolve one of my [Impmon] in the breeding area into this card?
Q: If I have 10 or more cards in my trash, can I digivolve one of my [Impmon] in the battle area into this card in the hand when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

BT2-112.answer: A: It refers strictly to your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP they control. The effect doesn't check the DP of your Digimon.[1]
BT2-112.question: Q: This card's [When Attacking] effect refers to "your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP." Does this strictly refer to my opponent's Digimon with the highest DP, or does it refer to when I attack an opponent's Digimon with the highest DP out of all Digimon in play, including my own?

BT2-112.answer: A: Yes. If your opponent has multiple Digimon tied for highest DP, attacking any of them allows you to unsuspend this Digimon.[1]
BT2-112.question: Q: My opponent has multiple Digimon tied for highest DP. If I attack any one of them, does this card's [When Attacking] effect let me unsuspend this Digimon?

BT2-112.answer: A: No, this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect only lets you unsuspend this Digimon when attacking your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP, regardless of whether it's suspended or not.[1]
BT2-112.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon with the highest DP is unsuspended. If I attack their unsuspended Digimon with the highest DP, can I unsuspend this Digimon?

BT20-006.answer: A: No, it cannot be activated. When a Digimon is deleted and the [On Deletion] effect of the Digivolved card is triggered, it is the Digimon card that had the Digivolved card that is waiting to be activated. If a Digimon card that is pending activation leaves the area before it is activated, its effect cannot be activated. In this situation, if "BT20-068 BAKEMON" is deleted and the [On Deletion] effect of its digivolved source is triggered, it is the "BT20-068 BAKEMON" card that is waiting to activate its effect. If the deleted "BT20-068 Bakmon" card leaves the trash, the [When Deletion] effect of the digivolved effect that was pending activation cannot be activated.[1]

BT20-006.answer: A: Yes, it activates. When a Digimon is deleted and the [On Deletion] effect of its Digivolved source is triggered, it is the Digimon card that had the Digivolved source that is waiting to be activated. If you return the BT20-063 Gosmon card to your hand, you can still activate the digivolution card BT20-063 Gosmon's digivolution effect.[1]
BT20-006.question: Q: When this card and "BT20-068 BAKEMON" with "BT20-063 GOSMON" as its digivolved source were deleted, the digivolved source effect of this card and the digivolved source effect of "BT20-063 GOSMON" triggered simultaneously. Before the Counter timing, the card's [On Play] and [When Digivolving] effects can be activated, but you cannot declare an attack during the attack, so you cannot attack even if you activate it.[1]

BT20-016.answer: A: No, they do not leave the Battle Area. DNA digivolves digivolve as a new Digimon, so it is a different Digimon than the one that leaves.[1]

BT20-019.answer: A: This effect is not affected by effects. For example, "Rest an opponent's Digimon." effect will not be rested, and "DP-3000 an opponent's Digimon." will not be minus DP.[1]

BT20-036.answer: A: No, you cannot attack with the effect of the second card. While attacking, you cannot declare a new attack. BT21-061.answer:
A: No. You perform ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) twice, not ＜De-Digivolve  2＞ (Trash up to 2 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.). 
When performing ＜De-Digivolve  2＞ (Trash up to 2 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.), the top 2 cards are considered to be trashed at the same time, but when performing ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) twice, the top 2 cards are trashed 1 at a time. 

For example, if using ＜De-Digivolve  2＞ (Trash up to 2 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) to simultaneously trash the top 2 cards of a suspended Digimon and the 2nd card trashed is BT15-047 [Kabuterimon], its effect won't activate. However, if performing ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) twice and the Digimon becomes BT15-047 [Kabuterimon] after the 1st instance of ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) trashes a card, it won't be affected by the 2nd instance of ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) and won't be trashed.[1]

BT21-092.question: Q: If I use this card's [Main] effect to place a Digimon's digivolution cards under 1 of my Tamers, can I choose the order the cards are placed?

BT21-092.answer: A: The card is placed on the bottom of the cards under the Tamer.[1]
BT21-092.question: Q: If I use this card's [Main] effect to place a card under a Tamer with cards under it, in what order do I place the card?

BT21-093.answer: A: The [Security] effect will activate first.Upon a security check, a [Security] effect will immediately activate without pending activation.[1]
BT21-093.question: Q: What order do an effect that triggers when a card is removed from a security stack and a [Security] effect on a checked card activate when they trigger simultaneously upon a security check?

BT21-095.question: Q: Is the "while you have no face-up security cards" condition met when I have 0 cards in my security stack?

BT21-095.answer: A: Yes, you can.In such cases, you can't add a card from your security stack to your hand, therefore you only place this card in your security stack.[1]
BT21-095.question: Q: Can I also activate this card’s [Main] effect when I have 0 cards in my security stack?

BT21-095.answer: A: They become face-up security cards that remain revealed.Other than rules that specify face-up security cards, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security cards.[1]
BT21-095.question: Q: What happens to cards placed face up in the security stack by effects?

BT21-095.answer: A: The check is performed with the card left revealed.Other than rules for cards left revealed, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security checks.[1]
BT21-095.question: Q: What happens upon a security check for a security card that is placed face-up?
Q: Does a card's [Security] effect trigger upon a security check with that card placed face-up?

BT21-095.answer: A: Any face-up cards are placed face down, then you shuffle the cards.After shuffling, all cards are left face-down.[1]
BT21-095.question: Q: What happens if I shuffle a security stack that includes security cards placed face-up?

BT21-096.answer: A: It causes that card to also be treated as a Digimon with X000 DP.For example, if a Tamer is treated as a Digimon, it will gain inherited effects. In addition, it will be able to attack.[1]
BT21-096.question: Q: What does an "is also treated as a Digimon with X000 DP" effect do, exactly?

BT21-096.answer: A: No, it is treated as both a Digimon and a Tamer.[1]
BT21-096.question: Q: If a Tamer is treated as a Digimon using an "is also treated as a Digimon with X000 DP" effect, is it no longer considered a Tamer?

BT21-096.answer: A: When it activates an effect, it is considered both a Digimon effect and a Tamer effect.[1]
BT21-096.question: Q: If a Tamer is treated as a Digimon using an "is also treated as a Digimon with X000 DP" effect and it activates an effect, is it treated as an effect of a Digimon or a Tamer?

BT21-096.answer: A: Yes, you can.When an effect is activated on a card that's treated as both a Digimon and a Tamer, the effect is treated as both a Digimon effect and a Tamer effect, therefore you can gain memory.[1]
BT21-096.question: Q: Can I gain memory using an effect on a Tamer that's treated as a Digimon with X000 DP due to an effect while my opponent has "your opponent can't gain memory other than by Tamer effects" activated?

BT21-097.question: Q: Can I use this card's ＜Delay＞ (By trashing this card after the placing turn, activate the effect below.) effect to link a card that doesn't have [Link]?

BT21-098.answer: A: It refers to a card that contains the specified text or icon in its name, traits, effects, inherited effects, (Rule), digivolution requirements, DNA digivolution, DigiXros requirements, burst digivolve, App Fusion, or Link.For example, a card with [Knightmon] in its text would include cards with the name [DarkKnightmon] and cards with the text [Knightmon] in their effects.[1]
BT21-098.question: Q: What does a card with "X in its text" refer to?

BT21-098.answer: A: No, you can't.If your opponent has a Digimon, you must choose that card and delete it.[1]

BT21-099.answer: A: It refers to a card that contains the specified text or icon in its name, traits, effects, inherited effects, (Rule), digivolution requirements, DNA digivolution, DigiXros requirements, burst digivolve, App Fusion, or Link.For example, a card with [Knightmon] in its text would include cards with the name [DarkKnightmon] and cards with the text [Knightmon] in their effects.[1]

BT21-099.answer: A: The card is placed on the bottom of the cards under the Tamer.[1]

BT3-002.answer: A: No. This card's Japanese name (チビモン) does not have "Vee" (ブイ) in its name.
BT3-002.question: Q: Does this card have [Vee] in its name?

BT3-004.answer: A: No, if you declared that you will be attacking your opponent, and your opponent decides to block your attack, resulting in a battle between Digimon, the effect does not activate.[1]
BT3-004.question: Q: I attacked my opponent with a Digimon with this card as one of its digivolution cards, and it was blocked. In this situation, does this card's effect activate?

BT3-008.answer: A: Yes, if you only reveal one or the other, you only get to add one card to your hand.[1]
BT3-008.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include only either [RagnaLoardmon] or cards with [Legend-Arms] in their types, can I only add 1 card to my hand?

BT3-008.answer: A: Yes, you may add them both to your hand.[1]
BT3-008.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include 2 [RagnaLoardmon] cards with [Legend-Arms] in their types, can I add both of those cards to my hand?

BT3-008.answer: A: No. If you have cards that are targets of this effect, you must add as many cards to your hand as possible.  However, if the revealed [RagnaLoardmon] has the [Legend-Arms] trait, that card will be treated as a card with the [Legend-Arms] trait. By adding it to your hand, you can return other cards with the [Legend-Arms] trait to the bottom of the deck without adding them to your hand, and if there aren't any other [RagnaLoardmon] revealed, you can add just 1 [RagnaLoardmon] to your hand.[1]
BT3-008.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include both a [RagnaLoardmon] card and a card with [Legend-Arms] in its type, do I only get to add 1 to my hand and have to return the rest to the bottom of my deck?

BT3-011.answer: A: No, it's treated as a normal Digimon once it comes into play.[1]
BT3-011.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon, is it treated as a Security Digimon even in my battle area?

BT3-011.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the battle's outcome, you get to play this Digimon at the end of the battle.[1]
BT3-011.question: Q: Can I play this Digimon with its [Security] effect even if it loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?

BT3-011.answer: A: This Digimon is played after the battle with the attacking Digimon, and before the next check is performed.[1]

BT3-014.answer: A: No, you can't. [Your Turn] effects don't activate from breeding areas, so the card isn't treated as a yellow card. You can't digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a yellow Digimon.[1]

BT3-014.answer: A: The DP value printed on a card is its original DP. This card's [When Digivolving] effect causes a target Digimon's DP, regardless of what's written on the card, to be temporarily treated as having 1000 DP.[1]
BT3-014.question: Q: What does "Original DP" mean?

BT3-014.answer: A: Your opponent's Digimon's DP will be overwritten as 1000, and if a -1000 DP effect is being applied to it, its DP becomes 0, causing the Digimon to be deleted.[1]
BT3-014.question: Q: If this card's [When Digivolving] effect is activated against an opponent's Digimon whose DP has been reduced by 1000 by an effect, what happens to that Digimon?

BT3-019.answer: A: No, you can choose whether or not to activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect.[1]

BT3-019.answer: A: No, even if the memory counter moves to 1 or greater on your opponent's side temporarily, if activating the effect moves the memory counter back to 0 or greater on your side, your turn continues.[1]

[BT3-111 Imperialdramon: Dragon Mode]'s effect is also compulsory, so both [BT3-027 Paildramon] and [BT3-111 Imperialdrmaon: Dragon Mode]'s effects cannot be used on the second attack.

BT3-030.answer: A: Yes, because the effect is only active during [Your Turn], the moment the Digimon becomes Level 5 or above, the effect no longer applies to the Digimon, and it will lose ＜Jamming＞.[1]

BT3-031.answer: A: No. You can't activate this effect when digivolving a card in your breeding area.[1]

BT3-034.answer: A: It's placed at the top of the security stack, face down.[1]

BT3-034.answer: A: No, you can only ＜Draw 1＞ if you add a security card to your hand.[1]

BT3-034.answer: A: Yes, the latter half of the effect, "Look at the top card of your security stack. You may add that card to your hand to trigger..." can still be activated even if you have 0 cards in your deck and ＜Draw 1＞ cannot be activated.[1]

BT3-058.answer: A: Yes, it does. This effect behaves the same way as an effect that reads "When this Digimon attacks one of your opponent's Digimon with 12000 DP or more". As such, the requirement for 12000 DP or more is checked at the time the attack is declared and determines whether or not the effect triggers. After the effect has triggered, this requirement does not impact the effect's activation.

BT3-058.answer: A: Yes, you can still use BanchoStingmon's effect if the attack target's DP decreases before BanchoStingmon's effect activates as long as it was 12000 DP when it was targeted for the attack.

BT3-088.question: Q: I use this card's inherited effect to delete an opponent's level 3 Digimon. Does this happen before or after activating the Option card?

BT3-088.answer: A: Yes, as long as the opponent's Digimon is level 3 at the time the Option card's effect activates, you can delete it with this card's inherited effect.[1]
BT3-088.question: Q: I use an Option card with ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.), like BT2-105 [Spider Shooter], to reduce an opponent's level 4 or greater Digimon to level 3. Can I then use this card's inherited effect to delete that Digimon?

BT3-090.question: Q: If I don't have a level 4 or lower purple or yellow Digimon card in my trash, do both players still trash the top card of their security stack from this card's [When Digivolving] effect?
Q: Do the [Security] effects on cards trashed by this card's [When Digivolving] effect activate?

BT3-090.answer: A: No, just because there are no security cards to trash doesn't mean you win the game.[1]
BT3-090.question: Q: If I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect when my opponent has an empty security stack, do I win the game?
Q: If either or both players have empty security stacks, can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to play a level 4 or lower purple or yellow Digimon card from my trash?
Q: Does this card's [When Digivolving] effect trash one of each other's security from the top, even if there is no purple or yellow Lv.4 or lower Digimon card in my trash?

BT3-090.answer: A: No, it does not activate.[2]
BT3-090.question: Q: Does the [When Digivolving] effect of this card activate the security effect that the card you trash has?

BT3-090.answer: A: No, just because you cannot trash a security card does not mean you win the game.[2]
BT3-090.question: Q: If this card's [When Digivolving] effect is activated when the opponent has 0 security, does it win the game?

Q: If this card's [When Digivolving] effect is activated when I or my opponent or both have 0 security, can I still play a purple or yellow Lv.4 or lower Digimon card from my trash without paying cost?

BT3-090.answer: A: One "Purple Lv.4 or lower Digimon card" or "Yellow Lv.4 or lower Digimon card".[3]

BT3-091.answer: A: You gain the memory after activating the Option card's effect.[1]
BT3-091.question: Q: Do I gain +2 memory from this card's [Your Turn] effect before or after activating the Option card's effect?

BT3-092.answer: A: Yes, both you and your opponent's Digimon were deleted, so you gain two memory.[1]
BT3-092.question: Q: I have this Digimon in play when one of my other Digimon attacks, deletes an opponent's Digimon, and is deleted in return. Do I gain two memory?

BT3-092.answer: A: No, Security Digimon aren't considered to be Digimon, so you don't gain any memory.[1]
BT3-092.question: Q: Do I gain 1 memory from this Digimon's effect when a Security Digimon is deleted?

BT3-092.answer: A: Yes, the +1 memory effect activates twice, earning you two memory.[1]
BT3-092.question: Q: When I had this Digimon, another of my Digimon attacked, and both my Digimon and my opponent's Digimon were deleted in the battle. Do I gain 2 memory at such times?

BT3-092.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the turn player gains a memory first, followed by the non-turn player gaining a memory, returning the memory gauge to its original position.[1]
BT3-092.question: Q: My opponent and I both have this Digimon in play. If another Digimon is deleted, what happens?

BT3-092.answer: A: No. This Digimon was deleted, so the [All Turns] effect doesn't activate.[1]
BT3-092.question: Q: If this Digimon attacks an opponent's Digimon and both Digimon end up being deleted, can I gain a memory off this card's effect?

BT3-093.answer: A: Yes, if you only reveal one or the other, you only get to add one card to your hand.[1]
BT3-093.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include only either a blue or green Digimon card, can I only add 1 card to my hand?

BT3-093.answer: A: Yes, you may add them both to your hand.[1]
BT3-093.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include 2 multi-coloured Blue-Green Digimon cards, can I add both of those cards to my hand?

BT3-093.answer: A: Yes, you can choose to add the Blue-Green Digimon as a Blue Digimon so that there are no other Green Digimon to add.[1]
BT3-093.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include both a Blue-Green Digimon card and a single-coloured Blue Digimon card, can I choose to add just 1 of them to my hand?

BT3-093.answer: A: Yes, you can choose to add the Blue-Green Digimon as a Green Digimon so that there are no other Blue Digimon to add.[1]
BT3-093.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include both a Blue-Green Digimon card and a single-coloured Green Digimon card, can I choose to add just 1 of them to my hand?

BT3-093.answer: A: One "Blue Digimon card" and one "Green Digimon card."[2]
BT3-093.question: Q: Which card is added to your hand by this card's [On Play] effect?

BT3-094.answer: A: No, Security Digimon aren't considered to be Digimon, so this Tamer's effect doesn't activate.[1]
BT3-094.question: Q: My green or blue Digimon deletes an opponent's Security Digimon in battle and survives. Can I suspend this Tamer to gain a memory?

BT3-094.answer: A: No, Security Digimon are not treated as Digimon, so this tamer cannot be activated.[2]

BT3-094.answer: A: It's either 'my green Digimon' or 'my blue Digimon.'[3]
BT3-094.question: Q: Can this card's [Your Turn] effect be activated when which card deletes it?

BT3-095.answer: A: No. No matter how many Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ you have, you only gain 1 memory from this Tamer's effect.[1]
BT3-095.question: Q: If I have multiple Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ in play, do I gain memory for each one?

BT3-096.answer: A: You gain the memory after activating the Option card's effect.[1]
BT3-096.question: Q: When do I gain a memory from this card's effect? Before I activate an Option card, or after?
Q: If I use an Option card through a "use an Option card" effect, can I activate this card's effect?

BT3-096.answer: A: No. Flipping over an Option card from your security stack isn't considered to be using an Option card.[1]
BT3-096.question: Q: During a security check, one of my Option cards with a [Security] effect is flipped over. Can I activate this card's effect?

BT3-096.answer: A: No. Activating the ＜Delay＞ effect on Option cards in your battle area isn't considered to be using an Option card.[1]
BT3-096.question: Q: I activate the ＜Delay＞ effect on an Option card placed in my battle area. Can I then activate this card's inherited effect?

BT3-097.answer: A: No, this card only prevents the [Security] effects on Option cards from being activated. [Security] effects on Digimon and Tamer cards activate as normal.[1]
BT3-097.question: Q: Does this card's effect prevent the [Security] effects on checked Digimon and Tamer security cards from activating?

BT3-099.question: Q: Does this card's effect prevent my Digimon from being deleted when it loses a battle against my opponent's Security Digimon?

BT3-099.answer: A: No, it only prevents Digimon from being deleted as a result of battle. [When Attacking] effects, other card effects, and being reduced to 0 DP will still delete Digimon as normal.[1]
BT3-099.question: Q: Does this card's effect prevent me from deleting an opponent's Digimon using a [When Attacking] effect?

BT3-100.answer: A: No, if you don't have a green Digimon in play when you activate the card's effect, you can't activate the part of the effect that suspends an opponent's Digimon.[1]

BT3-102.answer: A: Yes, your opponent chooses. If they decide not to trash any security cards, the player who used this card receives the benefits of the <Recovery +1 (Deck)> effect.[1]

BT3-102.answer: A: Yes, you can. Your opponent doesn't have a security card to trash, which means you get the <Recovery +1 (Deck)> effect automatically.[1]

BT3-103.answer: A: No, this card's effect only applies when digivolving a Digimon that's already green.[1]

BT3-103.answer: A: Yes, you can. As long as you're digivolving from a green Digimon, the effect applies.[1]

BT3-107.question: Q: I use this card on one of my opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 5 or more, and ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. BT3-111.answer: A: No. You can't activate this effect when digivolving a card in your breeding area.[1]

BT4-004.answer: A: This card's inherited effect is applied even during times where the Digimon can't activate <Digi-Burst>.[1]

BT4-032.answer: A: Yes. Since there's no color specified in the effect, it will work with any color tamer.[1]
BT4-032.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect work with any color of tamer?

BT4-034.answer: A: No. If you didn't trash any digivolution cards with the [When Attacking] effect, you don't get to trigger ＜Draw 1＞ or gain 1 memory.[1]
BT4-034.question: Q: When this Digimon attacked, my opponent didn't have any Digimon with digivolution cards, and I wasn't able to use the [When Attacking] effect to trash digivolution cards. Do I still get to trigger ＜Draw 1＞ and gain 1 memory?

BT4-035.question: Q: When I digivolved into this card, my opponent had 3 or less cards in their hand. Do I still gain memory from the [When Digivolving] effect?

BT4-035.answer: A: If you have a Digimon with this effect, your opponent's Digimon can't block against its attacks.[1]
BT4-035.question: Q: What exactly does "this Digimon is unblockable" mean?

BT4-035.answer: A: No. Attacking suspended Digimon isn't blocking, so you can attack them.[1]
BT4-035.question: Q: Does "this Digimon is unblockable" mean this Digimon can't attack my opponent's suspended Digimon?

BT4-037.answer: A: No. You don't have any security cards to trash, so you can't activate this effect.[1]
BT4-037.question: Q: If I have no cards left in my security stack, can I use this card's [On Play] effect to decrease the DP of 1 of my opponent's Digimon by 2000?

BT4-047.answer: A: No. The effect only trashes cards from your security stack and isn't the same as you taking an attack. If you have no cards left in your security stack at the end of your opponent's turn, you continue the game as normal.[1]
BT4-047.question: Q: Does this card's [At End of Opponent's Turn] effect mean that if I have no cards left in my security stack, at the end of my opponent's turn I lose the game?
Q: Do the [Security] effects on cards trashed by this card's [At End of Opponent's Turn] effect activate?
Q: If I have multiple copies of this Digimon in my battle area, do I trash multiple security cards at the end of my opponent's turn?

BT4-048.answer: A: No, you can choose not to.[1]
BT4-048.question: Q: Do I always have to activate this card's effect when I attack?

BT4-048.answer: A: No. If you can't add cards from your security stack to your hand, you can't activate the effect.[1]
BT4-048.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [When Attacking] effect if I have no cards left in my security stack?

BT4-048.answer: A: No. The effect has [Once Per Turn], so it doesn't activate on any attacks past the first one.[1]
BT4-048.question: Q: I attack with this Digimon, then activate its [When Attacking] effect to unsuspend it and give 1 of my opponent's Digimon -6000 DP. If I attack again on the same turn, can I give 1 of my opponent's Digimon an additional -6000 DP?

BT4-049.answer: A: Yes, Digimon played after the effect's activation also lose DP.
BT4-049.question: Q: Does [BT4-049 Varodurumon]'s ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect also decrease the DP of Digimon that were played after the activation of its effect?

BT4-052.question: Q: If this card is a digivolution card and is trashed by <Digi-Burst>, when does this card return to hand: before or after <Digi-Burst> activates?

BT4-054.answer: A: No. The effect targets "1 of your opponent's suspended Digimon," so you can't target unsuspended Digimon.[1]
BT4-054.question: Q: Can this card's effect be activated against my opponent's unsuspended Digimon?

BT4-058.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect on [Orochimon] itself?

BT4-059.answer: A: Yes, since there's no color specified.[1]
BT4-059.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect be activated no matter what color my Tamer is?

BT4-060.answer: A: Yes, as long as it's a level 4 or lower Digimon, you can suspend it -- including your own Digimon.[1]
