BT4-060.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to suspend one my own Digimon?

BT4-060.answer: A: No, digivolving doesn't count as the card being played, so you can't suspend it.[1]
BT4-060.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to suspend a level 4 Digimon when it Digivolves?

BT4-060.answer: A: No. Moving from the breeding area doesn't count as the card being played, so you can't suspend it.[1]
BT4-060.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to suspend a level 4 or lower Digimon when it moves from the breeding area to the battle area?

BT4-062.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to return Digimon that were already suspended to their owners' decks?

BT4-064.question: Q: If this card is a digivolution card and is trashed by <Digi-Burst>, when does this card return to hand: before or after <Digi-Burst> activates?

BT4-066.question: Q: Does this card's effect also activate for [BT4-66 Golemon] itself?

BT4-071.answer: A: No. The effects for both copies are triggered, but since the cards themselves have been deleted and sent to the trash, they're no longer in the battle area, which means their effects can't be activated.[1]
BT4-071.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this Digimon in my battle area, and both are deleted at the same time by an opponent's skill. Do both copies activate their [On Deletion] skills?

BT4-072.question: Q: Can I choose [BT4-072 Gogmamon] itself as the target for this card's effect?

BT4-074.answer: A: Yes. The order you return cards in is public information.
BT4-074.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to return multiple cards to my deck, do I need to tell my opponent the order I return the cards in?

BT4-075.answer: A: When this Digimon attacks, no matter what its target is, this effect allows your opponent to choose any of their unsuspended Digimon. If they do, this Digimon is forced to attack it instead.[1]
BT4-075.question: Q: What exactly does this card's [When Attacking] effect do?
Q: When attacking with this card, am I required to announce the target of attack?

BT4-075.answer: A: You can't announce that you're attacking an opponent's unsuspended Digimon, but your opponent can force this Digimon to attack one of their unsuspended Digimon if they choose to.[1]
BT4-075.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to attack my opponent's unsuspended Digimon?

BT4-075.answer: A: No, the player who is currently being attacked gets to decide whether or not to switch the target. If they choose not to, the attack proceeds as it was originally declared.[1]
BT4-075.question: Q: My opponent attacks with [BT4-075 Blastmon]. If I have an unsuspended Digimon in play, am I forced to switch the target of attack to it?

BT4-077.question: Q: If this card is a digivolution card and is trashed by <Digi-Burst>, when does this card return to hand: before or after <Digi-Burst> activates?

BT4-078.answer: A: No, you can only trash 1 Option card per attack, so you can only gain 1 memory.[1]
BT4-078.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to trash 2 Option cards in my hand to gain 2 memory?

BT4-084.answer: A: No. Even if your opponent suspends multiple Tamers simultaneously, this card's inherited effect treats all of it as a single timing instance, so you only gain 1 memory.[1]
BT4-084.question: Q: If my opponent uses the effect on a card like [BT2-041 ShineGreymon] to suspend 2 or more of their Tamers, does this card's inherited effect allow me to gain a memory for each Tamer suspended?

BT4-086.answer: A: No, this card's [On Play] effect can delete [Cerebusmon], which is a different card from [Cerberusmon: Werewolf Mode]. As such, you can't use it to delete this card itself.[1]
BT4-086.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] effect to delete this card itself to gain 9 memory?

BT4-086.answer: A: No, this card's [On Play] effect can delete [Cerebusmon], which is a different card from [Cerberusmon: Werewolf Mode]. As such, you can't use it to delete this card itself.[1]
BT4-086.question: Q: Can I use this card's [On Play] effect to delete one of my other [Cerberusmon: Werewolf Mode] cards to gain 9 memory?

BT4-087.question: Q: Do Digimon played from the trash with this card's [When Digivolving] effect also gain ＜Rush＞ from this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT4-087.answer: A: Yes, it does. Digimon that gain ＜Rush＞ from this card's effect keep it after Digivolving, and can attack the turn they come into play.[1]
BT4-087.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon from the trash, then digivolve that Digimon during the same turn, does that Digimon gain ＜Rush＞?

BT4-088.question: Q: You use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to trash a card in your opponent's security stack. Does that card's [Security] effect activate?

BT4-088.answer: A: Your opponent chooses the 2 cards to trash from their hand.[1]
BT4-088.question: Q: Which player chooses the cards to trash from your opponent's hand with this card's [On Deletion] effect?

BT4-088.answer: A: Yes, a card was removed from your security stack, so it activates.[1]
BT4-088.question: Q: While this Digimon is in my battle area, my opponent's Digimon checks my security stack and flips over [BT1-107 Holy Wave]. Its [Security] effect activates, adding a card to my security stack. I ended up with the same number of cards in my security stack, but does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect still activate?

BT4-088.answer: A: Yes, they both activate, trashing 2 of your opponent's security cards.[1]
BT4-088.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this Digimon in my battle area when an opponent's Digimon does a security check, removing a card from my security stack. Do the [Opponent's Turn] effects on both copies activate, trashing 2 of my opponent's security cards?
Q: If my opponent uses a card like [BT2-020 Gallantmon] to trash a card in my security directly, can I activate this card's effect?

BT4-090.answer: A: Yes, you can. It doesn't become your opponent's turn until the attack ends or you declare that you're not making an attack.[1]
BT4-090.question: Q: I pay memory to digivolve into this Digimon. Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to attack even though my memory gauge is now at 1 or greater on my opponent's side?

BT4-090.answer: A: No, this effect doesn't ignore the ironclad rule that Digimon can't attack the turn they came into play, so you can't attack.[1]
BT4-090.question: Q: I play a Digimon, then digivolve into this card on the same turn. Can I attack with it?

BT4-090.answer: A: No. You can activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect first and announce your attack, but you must activate all other effects before making the attack itself.[1]
BT4-090.question: Q: If I have other effects that activate on digivolution, can I attack before activating those effects after digivolving into this card?
Q: Can I attack my opponent's unsuspended Digimon with this card when not attacking through its [When Digivolving] effect?

BT4-091.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [When Digivolving] skill against the same Digimon twice in a row?
Q: Can I activate this card's [When Digivolving] skill once, take a different action, then activate it a second time?

BT4-092.answer: A: This Tamer will be able to attack in the same way as a Digimon, and will also receive effects that target Digimon. It will also be deleted in battles with Digimon or Security Digimon.
BT4-092.question: Q: How does this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect treat this Tamer as a Digimon?

BT4-092.answer: A: Yes, it will be deleted.
BT4-092.question: Q: If the DP of this card, which is treated as a Digimon due to the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, is reduced to 0 by an opponent's effect, will it be deleted?

BT4-092.answer: A: Yes, When this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] activates, this card is treated as both a Digimon and a Tamer, so when it is suspended, it is considered to meet the conditions "When this Tamer is suspended".
BT4-092.question: Q: When this card, treated as a Digimon due to the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, is suspended, this card's [Your Turn] effect of "When this tamer is suspended" activate because it's currently a Digimon?

BT4-092.answer: A: No, it does not. The effect of this card is only treated as a "Digimon", and when it is placed in the evolution source of another Digimon, it is treated as a Tamer card and the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect that was activated is lost.
BT4-092.question: Q: If this card, which is treated as a Digimon due to the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, is chosen for the effect of "Place 1 Digimon as a digivolution card of another Digimon". Does that count as "digivolving from this Digimon"?

BT4-094.answer: A: Yes, there's no color specified, so the +1000 DP is granted no matter what color your Digimon are.[1]
BT4-094.question: Q: Does this card's effect grant +1000 DP no matter what color my Digimon are?

BT4-095.answer: A: No, you can activate it when digivolving into any Digimon with <Digi-Burst>.[1]
BT4-095.question: Q: Can I only activate this card's [Your Turn] effect when digivolving into a Digimon with [When Digivolving] <Digi-Burst>?

BT4-096.answer: A: Yes. The order you return cards in is public information.
BT4-096.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to return multiple cards to my deck, do I need to tell my opponent the order I return the cards in?

BT4-097.answer: A: No, as long as there are attacks and effects that have triggered but haven't finished resolving yet, the attack continues regardless of the memory gauge's current position.[1]
BT4-097.question: Q: When my opponent's Digimon attacks and checks my security, I activate this card's effect to gain 1 memory, moving the memory counter to 1 on my side. Does the attack end, even if my opponent's Digimon has checks remaining from ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT4-097.answer: A: Yes, because a card was removed from your security stack.[1]
BT4-097.question: Q: While this Tamer is in my battle area, my opponent's Digimon checks my security stack and flips over [BT1-107 Holy Wave]. Its [Security] effect activates, adding a card to my security stack. The number of cards in my security stack remained the same, but can I still suspend this card to gain 1 memory?

BT4-097.answer: A: Yes, because a card was removed from your security stack.[1]
BT4-097.question: Q: While this Tamer is in my battle area, I use [BT1-087 Matt Ishida]'s effect to add a yellow card from my security stack to my hand, triggering <Recovery +1 (Deck)> and adding a card to my security stack. The number of cards in my security stack remained the same, but can I still suspend this card to gain 1 memory?
Q: If my opponent uses a card like [BT2-020 Gallantmon] to trash a card in my security directly, can I activate this card's effect?
Q: If I activate an effect like [BT4-104 Blinding Ray] to remove cards from my own security stack, can I activate this card's effect?

BT4-097.answer: A: "No, you can't. Since this card hasn't been played when it is revealed from your security, the condition for [When a card is removed from your security stack] can't be triggered, so this card's effect can't be activated."[1]
BT4-097.question: Q: If this card is played by its [Security] effect, can I suspend it to gain 1 memory?

BT4-098.answer: A: No, your opponent has to use ＜Blocker＞ to block the attack in order for you to gain 3 memory.[1]
BT4-098.question: Q: I use this card on one of my Digimon, which I use to attack an opponent's Digimon. Does this count as the Digimon being blocked? Do I gain 3 memory?

BT4-098.answer: A: Yes. The effect applies to all of your Digimon, including those that enter the battle area after the start of your turn.[1]
BT4-098.question: Q: I activate this card's [Security] effect. I move a Digimon from my breeding area to the battle area, then play a Digimon from my hand. Do these Digimon get ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card's effect?

BT4-100.question: Q: Can I use this card when my opponent doesn't have a Digimon with 6000 DP or less in play to play a Tamer card with a play cost of 4 or less from my hand without paying its memory cost?

BT4-101.answer: A: No, it's deleted by this card's effect, not by battle.  As such, effects that read, "deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives," and effects like ＜Retaliation＞ don't activate.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: I use this card to grant my Digimon this card's effect. I then use one of my Digimon to attack an opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards. Does my opponent's Digimon get deleted in battle?

BT4-101.answer: A: No. This card's effect deletes your Digimon before blocker timing.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: My opponent uses this card during their turn, then attacks one of my Digimon with no digivolution cards. Can I block with one of my other Digimon to prevent that Digimon from being deleted?

BT4-101.answer: A: Yes, you can. The Digimon that was a target of the attack will still be deleted by the effect of this card, but you can still block as counter timing and blocker timing will occur normally.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: My opponent uses this card during their turn, then attacks one of my Digimon with no digivolution cards. Can I block with one of my other Digimon to force it to attack that Digimon?

BT4-101.answer: A: No, the effect granted by this card will only delete the Digimon that was the target of the attack. If you block to force the target of attack to change, the blocking Digimon won't be deleted, and the battle will occur normally.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: My opponent uses this card during their turn, then attacks one of my Digimon with no digivolution cards. If I block with one of my other Digimon, will it be deleted by this card's effect?

BT4-101.answer: A: No, you can delete your opponent's Digimon with this card's effect before the battle begins. The attacking Digimon is not deleted.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: One of my Digimon has been granted the effect from this card. If I use it to attack an opponent's Digimon with higher DP, is my Digimon deleted after losing the battle?

BT4-101.answer: A: No, a Digimon with ＜Piercing＞ has to attack and delete an opponent's Digimon and survive the battle, but this card's effect deletes the opposing Digimon before the battle begins. As such, ＜Piercing＞ does not apply.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: I use this card, then attack an opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards using a Digimon with ＜Piercing＞. Does ＜Piercing＞ take effect?

BT4-101.answer: A: No, Dimension Scissor requires the Digimon to attack and delete an opponent's Digimon and survive the battle. This card's effect deletes the opposing Digimon before the battle begins, so the effect doesn't apply.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: I use [BT-112 Dimension Scissor], which allows 1 of my Digimon to unsuspend every time it deletes an opponent's Digimon. If I then use this card and attack an opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards, can I unsuspend my Digimon using Dimension Scissor's effect after deleting the opponent's Digimon using this card's effect?

BT4-101.answer: A: The opposing Digimon isn't deleted by the effect granted by this card. If the opponent's Digimon has 1 or more digivolution cards at the time you declare the attack, it can't be targeted by the effect granted by this card, even if it loses all of its digivolution cards later.[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: I use this card, then attack an opponent's Digimon with 1 digivolution card. If I use a [When Attacking] effect to trash the opposing Digimon's digivolution card, what happens?

BT4-102.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If your [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] is chosen as the target to return to the hand for this card's effect, it will ultimately be placed at the bottom of the Digi-Egg deck instead of the hand according to the rules, but it meets this card's "by returning 1 of your Digimon to the hand" condition. A card isn't actually added to the hand, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the hand" don't trigger.[1]
BT4-102.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to return my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] from the battle area to the hand, then return up to 2 of my opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to their owners' hands?

BT4-102.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If your token is chosen as the target to return to the hand for this card's effect, it will ultimately be removed from the game instead of being returned to the hand according to the rules, but it meets this card's "by returning 1 of your Digimon to the hand" condition. A card isn't actually added to the hand, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the hand" don't trigger.[1]
BT4-102.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to return my token that was played as a Digimon from the battle area to the hand, then return up to 2 of my opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to their owners' hands?

BT4-103.answer: A: No, this card's effect already returned the Digimon to their hand. The effect doesn't activate again, and the Digimon you chose remains in your opponent's hand.[1]
BT4-103.question: Q: My opponent has 7 cards in hand. I use this card to return their Digimon to their hand, resulting in them having 8 cards in hand. Does my opponent place that Digimon at the bottom of their deck?

BT4-104.answer: A: Yes. When your security stack is empty, you gain 2 memory.[1]
BT4-104.question: Q: If I use this card when my security stack is empty, do I gain 2 memory?

BT4-105.answer: A: It wasn't deleted, so [On Deletion] effects don't activate.[1]
BT4-105.question: Q: I use this card's effect to place a Digimon on top of my security stack. Does that Digimon's [On Deletion] effect(s) activate?

BT4-105.answer: A: No, you can't.  If your [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] is chosen as the target to place in the security stack, according to the rules it will be placed at the bottom of the Digi-Egg deck instead of the security stack.  A card isn't actually added to the security stack, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the security stack" don't trigger.[1]
BT4-105.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to place my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] on top of my security stack from the battle area?

BT4-105.answer: A: No, you can't.  If your token is chosen as the target to place in the security stack, according to the rules it's removed from the game instead of being placed in the security stack.  A card isn't actually added to the security stack, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the security stack" don't trigger.[1]
BT4-105.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to place my token that was played as a Digimon on top of my security stack from the battle area?

Q: If I choose my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] or token that is treated as a Digimon in the battle area as the target for this card's effect, it isn't placed in the security stack. In such cases, do "when a card is removed from the security stack" effects trigger because a card wasn't added to the security stack even though it normally should have been added?

BT4-108.question: Q: Can I use this card when I have no Digimon to suspend an opponent's Digimon, or when my opponent has no Digimon to unsuspend my own Digimon?

BT4-109.answer: A: Yes, it does. Even if the Digimon's original DP is less than 16000, if it becomes 16000 or greater after getting +3000 DP from this card's effect, it gains ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, and ＜Security A. +1＞.[1]
BT4-109.question: Q: I use this card's effect to give a Digimon +3000 DP. If that Digimon now has 16000 DP or more, does it gain ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, and ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT4-109.answer: A: No. Once the Digimon meets the conditions to gain ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, and ＜Security A. +1＞, it keeps them until the end of your opponent's next turn, even if its DP is reduced to 15000 or less.[1]
BT4-109.question: Q: I use this card's effect to give one of my Digimon ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, and ＜Security A. +1＞. If another effect reduces that Digimon to 15000 or less, does it lose ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, and ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT4-109.answer: A: No, it doesn't. The Digimon must have 16000 DP at the time this card's effect is activated for it to gain ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, and ＜Security A. +1＞.[1]
BT4-109.question: Q: I use this card's effect to give a Digimon +3000 DP, but it still has less than 16000 DP. If I then use another DP-boosting effect to raise its DP to 16000 or more, does it gain ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, and ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT4-110.question: Q: This card has an effect that reads, "For each of your Digimon with [D-Brigade] in its type, add +1 to the maximum play cost of the Digimon you can choose with this effect." What does this mean?

BT4-111.answer: A: No, Option cards go to the trash after their effects activate, so you still have 9 cards in your trash when the effect checks to see how many cards there are. You don't gain 1 memory.[1]
BT4-111.question: Q: If I use this card when I have 9 cards in my trash, does this card become the 10th card in my trash, allowing me to gain 1 memory?

BT4-114.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Attacking] effect on [AncientGarurumon] itself?
Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect target "BT4-114 Ancient Garurumon" itself?

BT4-114.answer: A: Up to two Digimons in total, either "my Digimon with 'Garurumon' in its name" or "my Digimon with 'Hybrid Body' in its trait".[3]
BT4-114.question: Q: Which card is activated by this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT5-003.answer: A: Yes, the Digimon this card is a digivolution card in counts towards the effect.[1]
BT5-003.question: Q: If this card is a digivolution card, does the Digimon it's part of count towards this card's inherited effect?

BT5-006.answer: A: No. The Digimon is reduced to 0 DP and deleted before this card's inherited effect activates.[1]
BT5-006.question: Q: This card is a digivolution card in one of my Digimon. An opponent's effect causes that Digimon and another one of my Digimon to reach 0 DP simultaneously. Does this card's inherited effect give the Digimon it's a part of +2000 DP, protecting it from being deleted?

BT5-007.answer: A: You can add one of the cards to your hand. As long as one of the Digimon cards revealed has either [Greymon], you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT5-007.question: Q: If the 3 cards revealed with this card's effect don't include both a Digimon card with [Greymon] and a Digimon card with [Omnimon], am I allowed to add one of the cards to my hand, or do both cards have to be present?

BT5-008.answer: A: It negates effects that read, "reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by X," like <Digisorption> and [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]. Even if your opponent activates effects like these, it won't reduce the memory cost of their digivolutions. They have to pay the digivolution cost on the card in order to digivolve.[1]
BT5-008.question: Q: What does this card's "can't reduce digivolution costs" effect do, exactly?
Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. If I activate <Digisorption> on a card in my hand, can I reduce digivolution costs with it?

BT5-008.answer: A: Yes. [BT2-111 Beelzemon]'s effect doesn't reduce digivolution costs--it allows you to ignore digivolution requirements and digivolve for a specific memory cost, so you can still activate it.[1]
BT5-008.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. Can I use effects like [BT2-111 Beelzemon]'s "digivolve into this card in your hand for a memory cost of X, ignoring this card's digivolution requirements" effect?

BT5-009.answer: A: You can add a card to your hand. As long as one of the Digimon cards revealed has either [Shoutmon] or ＜Blitz＞, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT5-009.question: Q: If the 5 cards revealed with this card's effect don't include both a Digimon card with [Shoutmon] and a Digimon card with ＜Blitz＞, am I allowed to add one of the cards to my hand, or do both cards have to be present?

BT5-009.answer: A: Yes, [BT5-019 ShoutmonDX] has [Shoutmon], and it also has ＜Blitz＞. The effect is looking for "1 Digimon card with [Shoutmon] and 1 Digimon card with ＜Blitz＞," which means you can add both to your hand.[1]
BT5-009.question: Q: If the 5 cards revealed with this card's effect include 2 copies of [BT5-019 ShoutmonDX], can I add both copies to my hand?

BT5-009.answer: A: No. Even if there was only one Digimon card with either "Shoutmon" in its name or a Digimon card with "Advancement", it will be added to your hand.[2]
BT5-009.question: Q: Does the effect of this card require both a Digimon card with "Shoutmon" in its name and a Digimon card with "Advance" in its name among the 5 cards revealed to be added to my hand?

BT5-009.answer: A: Yes, "BT5-019 Shoutmon DX" contains "Shoutmon" in its name and has "Advance", so you can put both cards in your hand as "a Digimon card containing "Shoutmon" in its name and a Digimon card with "Advance".[2]
BT5-009.question: Q: If there are two "BT5-019 Shoutmon DX" among the five cards revealed, can the effect of this card put both of those cards into my hand?

BT5-009.answer: A: One card with "Shoutmon" in its name and one card with "Advancement".[3]
BT5-009.question: Q: Which card is added to your hand by this card's [On Play] effect?

BT5-014.answer: A: No, you can't digivolve from a [Shoutmon] in your breeding area using this card's effect.[1]
BT5-014.question: Q: Can I digivolve into this card from a [Shoutmon] in my breeding area?

BT5-014.answer: A: No. As long as the Digimon this card is a digivolution card in has ＜Blitz＞, it gains ＜Security A. +1＞, regardless of whether it attacks or not.[1]
BT5-014.question: Q: Do I have to attack with ＜Blitz＞ to get ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card's inherited effect?
Q: Can I digivolve one of my [Shoutmon] in the battle area into this card in the hand when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

BT5-017.answer: A: No, the effect requires you to be currently attacking with ＜Blitz＞.
BT5-017.question: Q: If my Digimon has an effect "[When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞." but is not currently activating the effect of ＜Blitz＞. Is it possible to attack my opponent's unsuspended Digimon?

BT5-018.answer: A: The effect persists during the same turn, so the Digimon gains a total of +4000 DP.[1]
BT5-018.question: Q: I attack with this Digimon, and use its [When Attacking] effect to trash a red Digimon card with 3000 DP in my hand to give this Digimon +3000 DP. If I use an effect to attack again in the same turn and use this card's effect to trash a red Digimon with 1000 DP in my hand, does this Digimon gain a total of +4000 DP? Or does it go from getting +3000 DP to just +1000 DP?

BT5-019.question: Q: I digivolve a level 5 Digimon into this card. Can I place a red level 4 or lower Digimon card or level 7 Digimon card from my hand at the top of this card's digivolution cards?

BT5-019.answer: A: It becomes a level 3 Digimon. The digivolution cards placed below it remain, and their inherited effects can still be activated.[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to place a level 3 Digimon card at the top of its digivolution cards. This Digimon is then targeted with a ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) effect, trashing this card. What happens to the Digimon?

BT5-019.answer: A: The ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) effect trashes this card, and the Digimon becomes a level 3 Digimon. ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) can't be used to trash any more cards once the Digimon it's targeting becomes level 3, and the effect ends. Any digivolution cards placed below it remain, and their inherited effects can still be activated.[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to place a level 3 Digimon card at the top of its digivolution cards. This Digimon is then targeted with a ＜De-Digivolve  2＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 2 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) effect. What happens?

BT5-019.answer: A: No. If you activate ＜Blitz＞ first, after activating any [When Attacking] or [When a Digimon attacks] effects, you activate the other [When Digivolving] effect before the reaction timing occurs.[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: This card has 2 [When Digivolving] effects. If ＜Blitz＞ resolves first, does the other [When Digivolving] effect resolve after the attack ends?

BT5-019.answer: A: No. If you activate ＜Blitz＞ first, after activating any [When Attacking] or [When one of your Digimon attacks] effects, you activate the other [When Digivolving] effect before the counter timing occurs.[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: This card has 2 [When Digivolving] effects. If ＜Blitz＞ resolves first, does the other [When Digivolving] effect resolve after the attack ends?

BT5-019.answer: A: Yes, you can. [BT5-017 ZeigGreymon]'s inherited effect allows you to attack an opponent's unsuspended Digimon.[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to place [BT5-017 ZeigGreymon] at the top of its digivolution cards. If I then activate ＜Blitz＞ and attack, can I use [BT5-017 ZeigGreymon]'s inherited effect to attack an opponent's unsuspended Digimon?
Q: When a Lv.5 Digimon digivolved into this Digimon, can I put a red Lv.4 or lower or Lv.7 Digimon card from my hand on top of the digivolved card?

BT5-019.answer: A: It will be a Lv.3 Digimon. The digivolution card that was under it will remain stacked, and the digivolution card can still activate the inherited effect.[2]
BT5-019.question: Q: With this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect, I placed a Lv.3 Digimon card on top of the first Digivolution card. If this Digimon then receives the <De-Digivolve 1> effect and this card is trashed, what happens to the Digimon?

BT5-019.answer: A: ≪The effect of <De-Digivolve> causes this card to be trashed and become a Lv.3 Digimon. ≪Since <De-Digivolve 3> cannot be further trashed, <De-Digivolve> ends there. The digivolution card remains stacked and the inherited effect can be activated.[2]
BT5-019.question: Q: With this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect, I placed a Lv.3 Digimon card on top of the first Digivolution card. After that, when this Digimon receives the <De-Digivolve 2> effect, how is it handled?

BT5-019.answer: A: No. If you activate the [When Attacking] effect or the [When Digivolving] effect [When your Digimon attacks] first, the other [When Digivolved] effect will be activated before the Counter timing.[3]
BT5-019.question: Q: This card has two [When Digivolving] effects. If I resolve [When Attacking] first, do I resolve the other [When Digivolved] effect after finishing the attack?

BT5-019.answer: A: Yes, the digivolution card effect of "BT5-017 ZeigGreymon" can attack Digimon in active state.[2]
BT5-019.question: Q: With the [When Digivolving] effect of this card, I put "BT5-017 ZeigGreymon" on the top of the digivolution card. After that, if I activate the [Advance] effect and attack, can I attack the opponent's Digimon in the active state with the digivolution source effect of "BT5-017 ZeigGreymon"?

BT5-020.answer: A: You can add one of the cards to your hand. As long as one of the Digimon cards revealed has either [Garurumon], you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT5-020.question: Q: If the 3 cards revealed with this card's effect don't include both a Digimon card with [Garurumon] and a Digimon card with [Omnimon], am I allowed to add one of the cards to my hand, or do both cards have to be present?

BT5-021.answer: A: It negates effects that read, "reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by X," like <Digisorption> and [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]. Even if your opponent activates effects like these, it won't reduce the memory cost of their digivolutions. They have to pay the digivolution cost on the card in order to digivolve.[1]
BT5-021.question: Q: What does this card's "can't reduce digivolution costs" effect do, exactly?
Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. If I activate <Digisorption> on a card in my hand, will I be able to reduce digivolution costs with it?

BT5-021.answer: A: Yes. [BT2-111 Beelzemon]'s effect doesn't reduce digivolution costs--it allows you to ignore digivolution requirements and digivolve for a specific memory cost, so you can still activate it.[1]
BT5-021.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. Can I use effects like [BT2-111 Beelzemon]'s "digivolve into this card in your hand for a memory cost of X, ignoring this card's digivolution requirements" effect?

BT5-022.answer: A: No. When you return a Digimon to its owner's hand, the game doesn't treat the digivolution cards as being trashed, so you don't gain 1 memory.[1]
BT5-022.question: Q: When I use this card's inherited effect to return an opponent's Digimon to its owner's hand, can I gain 1 memory?

BT5-022.answer: A: No. Even if you trash the digivolution cards of 2 of your opponent's Digimon at the same time, you can only use this effect to gain 1 memory per turn.[1]
BT5-022.question: Q: When I use this card's inherited effect to trash the digivolution cards of 2 of my opponent's Digimon at the same time, can I gain 2 memory?

BT5-030.answer: A: Battle occurs as normal. This card's effect essentially means "this Digimon can't be chosen as a target of attack by your opponent," which means that if you block with this Digimon, the target of attack can still be switched to this Digimon.[1]
BT5-030.question: Q: This Digimon gains ＜Blocker＞ by an effect. If I block with this Digimon in response to an opponent's attack, what happens?
Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. Can I use [BT4-090 Chaosmon]'s [When Digivolving] effect to attack it?

BT5-030.answer: A: Yes, it can. If your opponent uses [Blastmon]'s effect to switch the target of attack, a battle occurs as if this Digimon was attacked normally.[1]
BT5-030.question: Q: I have this Digimon in play, unsuspended, when my opponent attacks with [BT4-075 Blastmon]. Can [Blastmon]'s effect be used to switch the target of attack to this Digimon?

BT5-031.answer: A: No, that Digimon does not have [On Deletion].
BT5-031.question: Q: If a Digimon has [On Deletion] has an inherited effect, can this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect target it?

BT5-031.answer: A: Yes, that Digimon was given [On Deletion] while in the battle area.
BT5-031.question: Q: If a Digimon was given [On Deletion] from its digivolution card's inherited effect, can this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect target it?

BT5-031.answer: A: Yes, that Digimon was given [On Deletion] while in the battle area.
BT5-031.question: Q: If a Digimon was given [On Deletion] from an Option card's effect, can this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect target it?

BT5-032.answer: A: Yes. If this card's [When Attacking] effect results in an opponent's Digimon having no digivolution cards, this card gains ＜Jamming＞.[1]
BT5-032.question: Q: I attack with this Digimon when my opponent has no Digimon in play with no digivolution cards. I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to trash the digivolution cards of an opponent's Digimon. If this results in my opponent having a Digimon card with no digivolution cards in play, can I activate ＜Jamming＞ on the same attack?

BT5-032.answer: A: No. You've already declared the attack, so even if your attacking Digimon loses its digivolution card, [Hexeblaumon]'s effect doesn't end the attack midway.[1]
BT5-032.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. I attack my opponent with a Digimon that has ＜Security A. +1＞, and flip over [BT1-101 Howling Crusher] from their security stack. If its [Security] effect results in the attacking Digimon having no digivolution cards, does the attack end immediately?

BT5-032.answer: A: No. This card's [When Attacking] effect has already finished resolving. Even if a Digimon with no digivolution cards enters play afterwards, this card doesn't gain ＜Jamming＞.[1]
BT5-032.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon, which has ＜Security A. +1＞, and flip over a Digimon card with a [Security] effect during the first security check. If this results in a Digimon with no digivolution cards entering my opponent's battle area, does this Digimon gain ＜Jamming＞ starting with the next security check?

BT5-033.answer: A: It negates effects that read, "reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by X," like <Digisorption> and [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]. Even if your opponent activates effects like these, it won't reduce the memory cost of their digivolutions. They have to pay the digivolution cost on the card in order to digivolve.[1]
BT5-033.question: Q: What does this card's "can't reduce digivolution costs" effect do, exactly?
Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. If I activate <Digisorption> on a card in my hand, will I be able to reduce digivolution costs with it?

BT5-033.answer: A: Yes. [BT2-111 Beelzemon]'s effect doesn't reduce digivolution costs--it allows you to ignore digivolution requirements and digivolve for a specific memory cost, so you can still activate it.[1]
BT5-033.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. Can I use effects like [BT2-111 Beelzemon]'s "digivolve into this card in your hand for a memory cost of X, ignoring this card's digivolution requirements" effect?

BT5-034.answer: A: You can have up to two yellow Digimon cards, one with "Warrior type" in its trait and the other with "Holy Knight type" in its trait.[1]
BT5-034.question: Q: Which card is added to your hand by this card's [On Play] effect?

BT5-035.answer: A: Yes, it does. This Digimon counts toward this card's effect.[1]
BT5-035.question: Q: Does this card's effect count this Digimon itself?

BT5-035.answer: A: No, you can't. The effect only targets 1 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT5-035.question: Q: I have 2 Digimon in play. Can I use this card's effect to give -1000 DP each to 2 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT5-035.answer: A: No, you can't. The [On Play] effect has already finished activating.[1]
BT5-035.question: Q: After playing this Digimon, I play another Digimon during the same turn. Since I now have more Digimon in play, can I give my opponent's Digimon an additional -1000 DP?

BT5-037.answer: A: It means you can look at all of the cards in your security stack, without revealing them to your opponent. When you choose a card in your security stack to add to your hand, reveal it to your opponent. The other cards should remain hidden.[1]
BT5-037.question: Q: What does "Look at your security stack" mean, exactly?

BT5-037.answer: A: <Security +1 (Deck)> doesn't occur. Shuffle your security stack, and the effect ends.[1]
BT5-037.question: Q: What happens if there are no cards in my security stack that can be added to my hand with this card?

BT5-038.answer: A: No. Even if a Security Digimon is reduced to 0 DP, it still battles with the Digimon performing the security check.[1]
BT5-038.question: Q: I flip over an opponent's Security Digimon during a security check, and this card's inherited effect reduces its DP to 0. Is the Digimon deleted on the spot, without a battle?
Q: This card's inherited effect reduces a Security Digimon's DP to 0, but it has a [Security] effect. What happens?

BT5-038.answer: A: No. It's no longer a Security Digimon once it enters play, so it doesn't have its DP reduced by this card's effect.[1]
BT5-038.question: Q: If a Security Digimon has its DP reduced by this card's inherited effect and is later played due to its [Security] effect, does it still have its DP reduced when it enters play?

BT5-041.answer: A: No. Even if a Security Digimon is reduced to 0 DP, it still battles with the Digimon performing the security check.[1]
BT5-041.question: Q: I flip over an opponent's Security Digimon during a security check, and this card's inherited effect reduces its DP to 0. Is the Digimon deleted on the spot, without a battle?
Q: This card's inherited effect reduces a Security Digimon's DP to 0, but it has a [Security] effect. What happens?

BT5-041.answer: A: No. It's no longer a Security Digimon once it enters play, so it doesn't have its DP reduced by this card's effect.[1]
BT5-041.question: Q: A Security Digimon has its DP reduced by this card's inherited effect. If that Security Digimon is later played by its [Security] effect, does it still have its DP reduced when it enters play?

BT5-044.answer: A: Yes, it activates during the breeding phase.[1]
BT5-044.question: Q: My opponent moves a Digimon from their breeding area to their battle area during the breeding phase. Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate?

BT5-044.answer: A: No. Even if a Security Digimon is reduced to 0 DP, it still battles with the Digimon performing the security check.[1]
BT5-044.question: Q: During a security check, my opponent's Security Digimon has its DP reduced to 0 by this card's [Your Turn] effect. Is the Security Digimon deleted on the spot, without a battle?
Q: This card's [Your Turn] effect reduces a Security Digimon's DP to 0, but it has a [Security] effect. What happens?

BT5-044.answer: A: No. It's no longer a Security Digimon once it enters play, so it doesn't have its DP reduced by this card's effect.[1]
BT5-044.question: Q: A Security Digimon has its DP reduced by this card's [Your Turn] effect. If that Security Digimon is later played by its [Security] effect, does it still have its DP reduced when it enters play?

BT5-045.answer: A: A "Yellow Lv.3 Digimon card" or a "Yellow Digimon card with "Warrior type" in its trait.[1]
BT5-045.question: Q: Which cards can be played by this card's [On Play] effect [When Attacking]?

BT5-047.question: Q: This card is being deleted. Can I use this card's effect to place it at the bottom of 1 of my green Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT5-047.answer: A: Yes, you can. The [On Deletion] effect is activated while treated as [Sukamon], but the name changing effect is lost when the card is deleted and placed in the trash, so you can treat this card as a [Palmon] card.[1]
BT5-047.question: Q: This card that was targeted by [BT11-043 KingSukamon]'s effect and had its name changed to [Sukamon] is deleted. If I have no other [Palmon] in the trash, can I place this same card at the bottom of the digivolution cards of one of my green Digimon from the trash with it's [On Deletion] effect?

BT5-056.question: Q: If I digivolve [BT5-056 Rafflesimon] on top of another [BT5-056 Rafflesimon]. Can I use the [Once Per Turn] effect of the new Rafflesimon if the old Rafflesimon used it before?

BT5-057.answer: A: Yes, this effect is applied as a Global Effect. If it satisfies the condition afterwards, it gains ＜Security A. +1＞.
BT5-057.question: Q: If after using this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect, one of my Digimon without ＜Digi-Burst＞ becomes a Digimon with ＜Digi-Burst＞, does that Digimon gain ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT5-057.answer: A: No, this effect is applied as a Global Effect. So if it no longer satisfies the condition then it no longer has the ＜Security A. +1＞.
BT5-057.question: Q: If after using this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect, one of my Digimon with ＜Digi-Burst＞ becomes a Digimon without ＜Digi-Burst＞, does that Digimon keep the ＜Security A. +1＞?

BT5-057.answer: A: Yes, as it has already resolved and applied a Global effect, the Global effect continues applying even after Rosemon leaves the battle area.
BT5-057.question: Q: If after using this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect, this card leaves the battle area does the ＜Security A. +1＞ continue being applied?

BT5-059.answer: A: You can add a card to your hand. As long as one of the cards revealed is either a Digimon card with [Unidentified] in its type or an [Arata Sanada] card, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT5-059.question: Q: If the 5 cards revealed with this card's effect don't include both a Digimon card with [Unidentified] in its type and an [Arata Sanada] card, am I allowed to add one of the cards to my hand, or do both cards have to be present?

BT5-059.answer: A: No. Even if there was only either a Digimon card with "race unknown" in its trait or "Arata Sanada", it will be added to your hand.[2]
BT5-059.question: Q: Does the effect of this card require both a Digimon card with "race unknown" in its trait and "Arata Sanada" among the 5 cards revealed to be added to my hand?

BT5-059.answer: A: One Digimon card with the trait "race unknown" and one card with the name "Arata Sanada".[3]
BT5-059.question: Q: Which card is added to your hand by this card's [On Play] effect?

BT5-060.answer: A: After checking the card, place it back on top of your deck face down.[1]
BT5-060.question: Q: I use this card's [On Play] effect to check the top card of my deck. What happens to that card?

BT5-063.answer: A: No, it can't. The Digimon loses ＜Rush＞ when its name changes, so it can't attack.[1]
BT5-063.question: Q: A Digimon has ＜Rush＞ thanks to this card's inherited effect. If that Digimon digivolves into a Digimon with a different name, can that Digimon attack the same turn it entered play?

BT5-065.answer: A: No, it's treated as a normal Digimon once it comes into play.[1]
BT5-065.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon, is it treated as a Security Digimon even in my battle area?

BT5-065.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the battle's outcome, you get to play this Digimon at the end of the battle.[1]
BT5-065.question: Q: Can I play this Digimon with its [Security] effect even if it loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?

BT5-065.answer: A: This Digimon is played after the battle with the attacking Digimon ends, and before the next check is performed.[1]
BT5-065.question: Q: This card is flipped over during a security check, but the attacking Digimon still has security checks remaining. Is this card played off its [Security] effect first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?

BT5-067.answer: A: No, you can't digivolve from a [Keramon] in your breeding area using this card's effect.[1]
BT5-067.question: Q: Can I digivolve into this card from a [Keramon] in my breeding area?

BT5-067.answer: A: Tokens are special cards that some effects put into play to represent Digimon or Tamers. This card's effect, for example, plays a token that's treated as a Digimon named [Diaboromon]. For a more detailed explanation of how tokens work, check the official rule manual.[1]
BT5-067.question: Q: What's a token?
Q: Can I digivolve one of my [Keramon] in the battle area into this card in the hand when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

BT5-070.answer: A: "If no Digimon was deleted by this effect" refers to times where, when <Digi-Burst> is activated, your opponent doesn't have a Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less in play, or an effect makes it so that there are no Digimon you can delete. Essentially, it means there was no Digimon in play that could be deleted by "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less."[1]
BT5-070.question: Q: This card's <Digi-Burst> effect reads, "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less. If no Digimon was deleted by this effect..." How does this effect work, exactly?

BT5-070.answer: A: No. If you use this card's <Digi-Burst> and your opponent has a Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less, you must target that Digimon when you activate the effect. If a valid target exists, you must choose it as part of the effect.[1]
BT5-070.question: Q: If my opponent has a Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less in play, can I activate this card's <Digi-Burst> and choose not to delete my opponent's Digimon in order to trash the top card of their security stack?

BT5-070.answer: A: Yes. Digimon with play costs of 6 or less are valid targets. If you choose it, the "can't be deleted by your opponent's effects" will prevent it from being deleted, allowing you to trash the top card of your opponent's security stack instead.[1]
BT5-070.question: Q: My opponent has 2 Digimon in play with play costs of 6 or less. One of them has an effect that reads, "This Digimon can't be deleted by your opponent's effects," while the other does not. If I activate this card's <Digi-Burst>, can I choose the Digimon that "can't be deleted by your opponent's effects" in order to trash the top card of my opponent's security stack?

BT5-071.answer: A: No. When a Digimon is deleted at 0 DP, it's deleted by the game rules, not a card effect, so the game doesn't treat it as if it was deleted by an effect.[1]
BT5-071.question: Q: This Digimon's DP is reduced to 0 by an opponent's effect. Does this card's [On Deletion] effect activate?

BT5-072.answer: A: No. This effect can't be used to return a level 3 Digimon card with an [On Deletion] inherited effect from your trash to your hand.[1]
BT5-072.question: Q: Can this card's effect be used to return a level 3 Digimon card with an [On Deletion] inherited effect from my trash to my hand?

BT5-082.question: Q: If I have another Digimon in play, can I choose any one of this card's three effects?

BT5-082.answer: A: The owner of the card gets to decide the order they activate in.[1]
BT5-082.question: Q: If I don't have another Digimon in play, what order do I activate this card's three effects in?

BT5-084.answer: A: A token is a special card played from an effect that is treated as a Digimon or Tamer. This card's effect can play tokens treated as Digimon named "Diaboromon." For detailed rules pertaining to tokens, check the rule manual.[1]
BT5-084.question: Q: What's a token?
Q: Do Diaboromon tokens meet the white color requirement?

BT5-085.question: Q: When playing this card, can I delete one of my [Diaboromon] tokens to reduce its play cost by 12?

BT5-085.answer: A: Depends on the timing. It can't be activated at the [When Digivolving] timing due to this card's effect. It can be activated at the [When Attacking] timing.[1]
BT5-085.question: Q: Can this card's [All Turns] effect prevent the activation of the [When Digivolving] [When Attacking] effect of [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)]?

BT5-086.answer: A: Yes. If you activate ＜Blitz＞ first, you declare the attack and suspend the Digimon at that point in time. If you then activate the "Unsuspend this Digimon" effect, you can unsuspend this Digimon itself.[1]
BT5-086.question: Q: When this card digivolves, can I activate ＜Blitz＞ first to attack, then use the "Unsuspend this Digimon" effect to unsuspend this Digimon?

BT5-086.answer: A: No. This card's [All Turns] effect prevents other effects from deleting this Digimon or returning it to its owner's hand or deck, so it isn't treated as being deleted by the game rules.[1]
BT5-086.question: Q: When this Digimon is deleted, I activate this card's [All Turns] effect to have this Digimon remain in the battle area. Does this cause "When another Digimon is deleted" effects to activate?

BT5-087.answer: A: Yes, you can. Any cards in your trash that are black and/or purple Digimon cards with play costs of 8 or less can be returned to your hand.[1]
BT5-087.question: Q: This [When Digivolving] effect returns up to 2 black and/or purple Digimon cards with play costs of 8 or less from my trash. Can I return cards that weren't trashed using this card's effect?

BT5-087.answer: A: Yes, a Digimon card with a play cost of 8 or less can be played with a black or purple Digimon card that was originally in the trash.[2]
BT5-087.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect play 2 black or purple Digimon cards of play cost 8 or less in my trash without paying the cost, even if they are not the cards I discarded with this effect?

BT5-087.answer: A: You can have up to two "Black Digimon cards with a play cost of 8 or less" or "Purple Digimon cards with a play cost of 8 or less" in total.[3]
BT5-087.question: Q: Which cards can be played by this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT5-088.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply even if my opponent only has 1 Digimon with no digivolution cards and the rest of their Digimon have digivolution cards?

BT5-088.answer: A: No, it doesn't check Digimon in the breeding area.
BT5-088.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?

BT5-088.answer: A: No, it doesn't. Your opponent has to have a Digimon in their battle area for it to activate.
BT5-088.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply when my opponent doesn't have any Digimon in their battle area?

BT5-088.answer: A: Yes, it is a "Do <X> to <Y> effect. As such, it follows the rules detailed in the Detailed Rules. (Found in Effect Resolution/Related Information#Costs)
BT5-088.question: Q: When my blue Digimon attacks, can I suspend this Tamer even if my opponent has no Digimon in the battle area?

BT5-089.answer: A: Yes, it does. [Start of Your Turn] effects activate before your unsuspend phase.[1]
BT5-089.question: Q: My opponent's suspended Digimon unsuspends during my unsuspend phase using ＜Reboot＞. Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect activate?

BT5-089.answer: A: No. The effect reads, "you may," so you can choose not to digivolve.[1]
BT5-089.question: Q: I attack with a green level 5 Digimon, and use this card's [Your Turn] effect to reveal a green level 6 Digimon card. Do I have to digivolve into that card?

BT5-089.answer: A: Yes, you get to choose which card to digivolve into.[1]
BT5-089.question: Q: This card's [Your Turn] effect revealed 2 or more green level 6 Digimon. Can I choose which card to digivolve into?
Q: I attack with a green level 5 Digimon, and use this card's [Your Turn] effect to digivolve it. Do I get to draw a bonus card from digivolving?
Q: This card's [Your Turn] effect revealed a non-green level 6 Digimon card. Can I digivolve into that card?

BT5-089.answer: A: "You can choose to activate this card's effect twice off a single attack, but you can't activate both effects simultaneously. Instead, you activate each Tamer's effect one at a time. First, activate the first Tamer's effect, reveal 3 cards from your deck, and choose whether or not to digivolve the attacking Digimon. From there, you can decide whether or not to activate the second Tamer's effect. Furthermore, if you digivolve into a card revealed from the first Tamer's effect, the card revealed from the second Tamer's effect must be a green level 6 card that can digivolve from a level 6 Digimon. (i.e. [BT5-056 Rafflesimon])"[1]
BT5-089.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this Tamer in play, and attack with a green level 5 Digimon. Can I suspend both Tamers, reveal 6 cards from my deck, and choose a card to digivolve into from among them?

BT5-089.answer: A: It activates immediately after you draw the bonus card for digivolving. Even if there are other [When Attacking] or "When one of your Digimon attacks" effects, the [When Digivolving] effect activates first as a newly triggered effect.[1]
BT5-089.question: Q: If I use this card's [Your Turn] effect to digivolve into a level 6 Digimon with a [When Digivolving] effect, when does that effect activate?

BT5-089.answer: A: No. The window for activating [When Attacking] effects has already passed, so the effect doesn't activate.[1]
BT5-089.question: Q: If I use this card's [Your Turn] effect to digivolve into a level 6 Digimon with a [When Attacking] effect, does that effect activate?

BT5-090.answer: A: Tokens are special cards that some effects put into play to represent Digimon or Tamers. This card's effect, for example, plays a token that's treated as a Digimon named [Diaboromon]. For a more detailed explanation of how tokens work, check the official rule manual.[1]
BT5-090.question: Q: What's a token?

BT5-091.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also give "[When Attacking] Lose 1 memory" to my level 3 Digimon?

BT5-091.answer: A: Yes. Each effect activates separately, resulting in you losing a total of 2 memory.[1]
BT5-091.question: Q: If I have 2 copies of this Tamer in play and attack with a level 3 Digimon, do I lose 2 memory?

BT5-092.answer: A: No, digivolving Digimon in your breeding area doesn't trigger the effect that reduces digivolution cost by 1.[1]
BT5-092.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon in my breeding area into a Digimon card with [Greymon], [Garurumon] or [Omnimon] in its name. Can I use this Tamer's effect to reduce the digivolution cost by 1?

BT5-092.answer: A: Yes, each copy of this Tamer may be be suspended to reduce the digivolution cost by 1 each.[1]
BT5-092.question: Q: Does the second effect of this Tamer stack if there are multiple copies in play in my battle area?

BT5-092.answer: A: No, [ST5-04 ToyAgumon] is not named [Agumon] or [Gabumon]. The effect to play a Digimon does not have "in its name" in the card text.[2]
BT5-092.question: Q: Can I play [ToyAgumon] or [Agumon Expert] with this card's [On Play] effect?

BT5-092.answer: A: This card is meant to have a [Your Turn] effect.[3]
BT5-092.question: Q: This card's printing in BT-05: Booster Battle Of Omni has [Main] as its effect and its RB-01: Reboot Booster Rising Wind printing uses [Your Turn]. Which version is correct?

BT5-094.question: Q: I have a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer card. Can I use this card's effect to place a red level 4 or lower Digimon card from my hand at the bottom of one of my Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer card?

BT5-094.answer: A: It remains stacked on top of the digivolution cards, but since it's no longer a Digimon, it can no longer activate inherited effects. If it digivolves back into a Digimon, it will be able to use inherited effects again.[1]
BT5-094.question: Q: I use this card's effect to place a Digimon card under one of my Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer card. If ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) causes that card to become a Tamer card again, what happens to the digivolution cards under it?

BT5-097.question: Q: When choosing which Digimon to trash a digivolution card from and which Digimon to return to its owner's deck with this card's effect, can I choose different cards for each one?

BT5-099.question: Q: If I have 2 Digimon in play, can I activate this card's effect to give an opponent's Digimon -3000 DP twice, for a total of -6000 DP?

BT5-101.answer: A: No. There are no security cards to trash, but this doesn't allow you to win the game.[1]
BT5-101.question: Q: If my opponent has a level 7 Digimon in play and I use this card when my opponent's security stack is empty, do I win the game?

BT5-103.answer: A: Yes, it's possible to attack your opponent's Digimon, which means you can perform checks off of ＜Piercing＞.[1]
BT5-103.question: Q: My opponent activates this card's [Security] effect. If I then attack with a Digimon that has ＜Piercing＞ and delete an opponent's Digimon in battle, do I check my opponent's security cards?

BT5-104.question: Q: My opponent doesn't have a Digimon I can target with ＜De-Digivolve  2＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 2 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) in play. Can I still use this card to create a [Diaboromon] token?
Q: I only have a [Diaboromon] token in my battle area. Can I use this card to create a new [Diaboromon] token?

BT5-105.question: Q: My opponent doesn't have a Digimon I can target with ＜De-Digivolve  3＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 3 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) in play. Can I still use this card to delete all of my opponent's Digimon with play costs of 3 or less?

BT5-107.answer: A: No. Your purple Digimon has already been deleted when [ChaosGallantmon] enters play, so it doesn't activate.[1]
BT5-107.question: Q: I use this card's effect to play a card like [BT5-081 ChaosGallantmon], which has an effect that reads, "delete 1 of your other Digimon to..." Does deleting the purple Digimon for this card's effect cause the "delete 1 of your other Digimon" effect to activate?

BT5-108.answer: A: Yes. As long as your opponent has either an unsuspended level 4 or level 5 in Digimon in play, you can activate this card's effect.[1]
BT5-108.question: Q: Can I activate this card's effect if my opponent doesn't have both an unsuspended level 4 and level 5 Digimon in play?

BT5-108.answer: A: No. It is activated even when only one of the opponent's Digimon is in active state, either Lv.4 or Lv.5.[2]
BT5-108.question: Q: Does this card have to have both Lv.4 and Lv.5 opponent's Digimon in active state for it to be effective?

BT5-108.answer: A: One Digimon of the opponent in the active state of Lv.4 and one Digimon of the opponent in the active state of Lv.5.[3]
BT5-108.question: Q: Which card is deleted by the [Main] effect of this card?

BT5-109.question: Q: After using this card, can I reduce the digivolution cost of my level 6 Digimon digivolving to level 7 when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

BT5-110.question: Q: Does this card's effect delete all of my Digimon and Tamers, too?

BT5-111.answer: A: No, you can't digivolve from a Digimon in your breeding area that has [Omnimon] using this card's effect.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: Can I digivolve into this card from a Digimon in my breeding area that has [Omnimon]?

BT5-111.answer: A: The target of attack is no longer in play, so the attack ends without a battle.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: I attack an opponent's Digimon with this Digimon, and use its [When Attacking] effect to delete the opposing Digimon. What happens to the attack?

BT5-111.answer: A: No. You didn't delete the opponent's Digimon in battle, so ＜Piercing＞ doesn't activate.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: I attack an opponent's Digimon with this Digimon, and use its [When Attacking] effect to delete the opposing Digimon. If this Digimon has ＜Piercing＞, can I check the opponent's security cards?

BT5-111.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you do, the blocking Digimon will battle this Digimon.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent attacks one of my Digimon with this Digimon, using its [When Attacking] effect to delete my Digimon. Can I use another Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ to block the attack?

BT5-111.answer: A: No. This effect is activated at counter timing, which means it only activates after the [When Attacking] effect has finished activating.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon attacks. Can this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect be used to to end the attack before the attacking Digimon's [When Attacking] effect activates?

BT5-111.answer: A: Yes. The [On Deletion] effect activates immediately after the deletion occurs, so it activates before this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon used a [When Attacking] effect to delete one of my Digimon with an [On Deletion] effect. If I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end the attack, does the [On Deletion] effect activate?
Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon. After activating my [BT1-082 Rosemon]'s effect, can I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end the attack?

BT5-111.answer: A: No. The battle has already concluded, which means the counter timing window for activating the effect has passed, so you can't activate this effect.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon. After comparing DP in battle, can I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end the attack?

BT5-111.answer: A: No. [When Attacking] effects will activate as normal.[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: If I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect, will the game treat the attack as if it never occurred?
Q: Can I digivolve one of my Digimon with [Omnimon] in the battle area into this card in the hand when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

BT5-112.answer: A: If this card is flipped over as a Security Digimon, it's played in its owner's battle area without battling the attacking Digimon. Even if the attacking Digimon has lower DP than this card, no battle occurs, and the attacking Digimon is not deleted.[1]
BT5-112.question: Q: What does "without battling" in this card's [Security] effect mean?

BT5-112.answer: A: After playing this Digimon, the remaining checks are performed.[1]
BT5-112.question: Q: This card is flipped over during a security check. If the attacking Digimon has extra security checks remaining from <Security Attack +>, what happens?
Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect be used to delete a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer?

BT6-001.answer: A: Yes. Even if the Digimon is blocked, if you declared an attack against your opponent, the effect activates.[1]
BT6-001.question: Q: I attack my opponent using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this Digimon's effect activate?

BT6-002.answer: A: No, you can’t.  Trash all of the digivolution cards of those Digimon"" is an explanation of what happens to the digivolution cards of the Digimon when it returns to their hand. It doesn't count as trashing digivolution for the purposes of this card's effect.[1]
BT6-002.question: Q: I activate an effect that reads "Return 1 of your opponent's Digimon to their hand. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon" to return an opponent's Digimon to their hand. When your opponent's digivolution cards are trashed as a result, can you activate this card's inherited effect?

BT6-004.answer: A: No, if you declared an attack against your opponent, this card's effect doesn't activate, even if they use another Digimon to block it.[1]
BT6-004.question: Q: I attack my opponent using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

BT6-006.question: Q: I activate an effect that reads “＜Draw 1＞ (Draw 1 card from your deck.) Then, trash 1 card in your hand.” Does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT6-007.answer: A: Yes. The effects on both Digimon activate, so you gain 2 memory.[1]
BT6-007.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this Digimon in my battle area. If I play a Tamer with [Tai Kamiya], can I activate the effects on both Digimon to gain a total of 2 memory?

BT6-007.answer: A: No. The turn doesn’t switch over until the attack completely finishes resolving.[1]
BT6-007.question: Q: I play a Tamer with [Tai Kamiya] from my security using its security effect. If this Digimon’s effect causes the memory gauge to move to 1 or greater on my side, does it immediately become my turn?

BT6-008.answer: A: Yes. As long as a Digimon with ＜Blitz＞ is in this card’s digivolution cards, ＜Draw 1＞ will activate even if you make a normal, non-＜Blitz＞ attack.[1]
BT6-008.question: Q: I make a normal, non-＜Blitz＞ attack with this Digimon. Can I use this card’s inherited effect to draw a card with ＜Draw 1＞?

BT6-009.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 2 copies of the same card with [Huckmon], [Jesmon], or [Sistermon] from the top of my deck. Can I add both copies to my hand?

BT6-011.answer: A: No. Even if you have multiple Digimon with [Sistermon] in play, you can only use this Digimon’s effect to delete 1 of your opponent’s Digimon.[1]
BT6-011.question: Q: If I have 2 Digimon with [Sistermon] in play, can I use this card’s effect to delete 2 of my opponent’s Digimon with 5000 DP or less?

BT6-013.answer: A: Yes. During your turn, this Digimon is treated as both a red and black Digimon, so it can digivolve into a Digimon with black digivolution requirements.[1]
BT6-013.question: Q: Can this Digimon digivolve into a Digimon with “Black/Level 5” digivolution requirements?

BT6-013.answer: A: No, you can't. [Your Turn] effects don't activate from breeding areas, so the card isn't treated as a black card. You can't digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a black Digimon.[1]
BT6-013.question: Q: This card is in my breeding area. Can I digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a black Digimon?

BT6-016.question: Q: I use this Digimon’s [When Attacking] effect to play a Digimon card with [Sistermon]. Does this Digimon’s [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT6-017.answer: A: Yes, you can choose not to use an Option card. If you don’t use one, you can delete 1 of your opponent’s Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[1]
BT6-017.question: Q: When this Digimon digivolves, can I intentionally choose not to use a 7-cost Option card in my hand to delete 1 of my opponent’s Digimon with 4000 DP or less?

BT6-018.question: Q: If I use this card’s [When Attacking] effect to delete 1 of my opponent’s Digimon with 13000 DP or less, can I use this card’s [Your Turn] effect to trash the top card of my opponent’s security stack?

BT6-019.answer: A: Yes. The effects on both Digimon activate, so you gain 2 memory.[1]
BT6-019.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this Digimon in my battle area. If I play a Tamer with [Matt Ishida], can I activate the effects on both Digimon to gain a total of 2 memory?

BT6-019.answer: A: No. The turn doesn’t switch over until the attack completely finishes resolving.[1]
BT6-019.question: Q: I play a Tamer with [Matt Ishida] from my security using its security effect. If this Digimon’s effect causes the memory gauge to move to 1 or greater on my side, does it immediately become my turn?

BT6-020.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when my opponent has no Digimon in play in their battle area?

BT6-021.answer: A: You can't use Option/Digimon card effects to gain memory, but you can still lose memory if a card effect specifies as such. At the end of the turn, you’ll lose memory as specified by each effect.[1]
BT6-021.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. What happens if an effect is activated that causes you to gain memory on activation and lose memory at end of turn? (i.e. [BT1-090 Gravity Crush], [BT1-021 MetalGreymon], [BT1-040 WereGarurumon], [BT1-058 Chirinmon], [BT1-075 Digitamamon], etc.)

BT6-021.answer: A: No, this Digimon prevents you from gaining memory from security effects.[1]
BT6-021.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. Can I gain memory from the security effect of [ST2-13 Hammer Spark]?

BT6-024.question: Q: Does this card’s effect activate when my opponent has no Digimon in play in their battle area?

BT6-027.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when my opponent has no Digimon in play in their battle area?

BT6-028.answer: A: If you attack with a Digimon, your opponent's Digimon can’t change the target of attack by blocking.[1]
BT6-028.question: Q: “Your Digimon can't be blocked by your opponent's Digimon this turn.” How does this effect work, exactly?

BT6-029.answer: A: Yes, it gains ＜Security A. +1＞ from its effect and updates its security attack value. You re-calculate its security attack and continue checking security based on its new security attack. (For more information see Attack Resolution)
BT6-029.question: Q: If my opponent has no Digimon in play but reveals a [ST8-06 Coredramon] from this card's security check, does this card check another Security card?

BT6-031.answer: A: It ends when the current turn ends.
BT6-031.question: Q: If this card's [On Deletion] effect is activated on my opponent's turn, when does the ＜Security A. -1＞ end?

BT6-032.answer: A: Yes. Both effects activate, so you can draw a total of 2 cards.[1]
BT6-032.question: Q: I have 2 Digimon with this card in their digivolution cards in my battle area, and a card is removed from my security stack. Do the inherited effects on both Digimon activate, activating ＜Draw 1＞ twice and drawing me 2 cards?

BT6-033.answer: A: No, this card’s [On Play] effect allows you to trash any number of cards, from zero cards, up to however many cards you need to trash for you to have 3 cards left in your security stack.[1]
BT6-033.question: Q: When I play this card, does its [On Play] effect force me to trash cards from my security stack until there are 3 cards left?

BT6-033.answer: A: You can’t trash any security cards, so the effect does nothing.[1]
BT6-033.question: Q: How does this card’s [On Play] effect work if I have 3 or fewer cards in my security stack?
Q: I have 5 cards in my security stack. Can I use this card’s [On Play] effect to only trash 1 security card and gain 1 memory?

BT6-034.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when a security card is removed from my security stack by one of my own effects?

BT6-040.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when a security card is removed from my security stack by one of my own effects?

BT6-041.answer: A: No. You must trash a card from your security stack in order to have one of your opponent’s Digimon get -5000 DP.[1]
BT6-041.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s effect when my security stack is empty?

BT6-044.answer: A: No, this card’s [When Digivolving] effect reads “you may,” so you can choose whether or not to trash the top card of your security stack.[1]
BT6-044.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect force me to trash the top card of my security stack?

BT6-044.answer: A: No. You must trash a card from your security stack in order to activate it.[1]
BT6-044.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect when my security stack is empty?
Q: I use this card’s [When Digivolving] effect to trash a card from my security stack. If there are 3 or fewer cards left in my security stack, does this card’s [All Turns] effect trigger?

BT6-044.answer: A: Fundamentally, this is possible. However, the effects don’t activate simultaneously, but one at a time in order. Once <Recovery> results in you having 4 cards in your security stack, any remaining copies of the effect don't activate.  Any [BT6-044 Dynasmon] whose effects don’t activate can still be activated later in the turn.[1]
BT6-044.question: Q: I have 2 or more copies of this Digimon in play. My opponent attacks with a Digimon, removing a card from my security stack. Do all of the effects on copies of this Digimon activate simultaneously, activating <Recovery +1 (Deck)> for each one?

BT6-044.answer: A: The [Security] effect activates first.   After the [Security] effect and any effects triggered by its activation have finished activating, this card’s [All Turns] effect activates.[1]
BT6-044.question: Q: An opponent’s Digimon performs a security check, flipping over a card with a [Security] effect. Which activates first: This card’s [All Turns] effect, or the [Security] effect?

BT6-047.answer: A: Yes, you can. As long as either a card with [Menoa Bellucci] or a Digimon card with [Eosmon] are among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT6-047.question: Q: I use this card’s effect to reveal 5 cards. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [Menoa Bellucci] or a Digimon card with [Eosmon], can I still add a card to my hand?

BT6-049.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]
BT6-049.question: Q: If this card has a tamer card as a digivolution card, does the [Security] effect of that tamer card become an inherited effect?
Q: Can this card digivolve on top of a Level 3 Digimon that meets its requirements instead of a tamer card?

BT6-049.answer: A: Yes, it is.   However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]
BT6-049.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to make a tamer card into a digivolution card, is that card affected by effects that say "trash digivolution cards"?

BT6-049.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.[1]
BT6-049.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT6-049.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]
BT6-049.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a tamer card?

BT6-049.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT6-049.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the tamer card?

BT6-050.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]
BT6-050.question: Q: If this card has a tamer card as a digivolution card, does the [Security] effect of that tamer card become an inherited effect?
Q: Can this card digivolve on top of a Level 3 Digimon that meets its requirements instead of a tamer card?

BT6-050.answer: A: Yes, it is.  However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]
BT6-050.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to make a tamer card into a digivolution card, is that card affected by effects that say "trash digivolution cards"?

BT6-050.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.[1]
BT6-050.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT6-050.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]
BT6-050.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a tamer card?

BT6-050.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT6-050.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the tamer card?

BT6-053.answer: A: Yes, Eldradimon's effect prevents the reduction of DP. But it does not prevent its original DP from being set to another number.
BT6-053.question: Q: Can [BT1-105 Blast Fire] to set the DP of Eldradimon?

BT6-053.answer: A: Yes, the new Digimon has -3000 DP.
BT6-053.question: Q: My opponent uses [BT3-101 Bifrost] and targets this card. Eldradimon is then hit by a ＜De-Digivolve＞. Does the new Digimon have the decreased DP?

BT6-053.answer: A: Yes, the new Digimon has -3000 DP.
BT6-053.question: Q: My opponent uses [BT3-101 Bifrost] and targets this card. I digivolve Eldradimon into a new Digimon. Does the new Digimon have the decreased DP?

BT6-056.answer: A: Yes, it activates at the end of the battle, regardless of outcome.[1]
BT6-056.question: Q: Does this card’s [Security] effect activate even if it loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?

BT6-056.answer: A: This Digimon’s [Security] effect activates after the battle with the attacking Digimon ends, and before the next check is performed.[1]
BT6-056.question: Q: This card is flipped over during a security check, but the attacking Digimon still has security checks remaining. Does this Digimon’s effect activate first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?

BT6-058.answer: A: No, it's treated as a normal Digimon once it comes into play.[1]
BT6-058.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon, is it treated as a Security Digimon even in my battle area?

BT6-058.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the battle's outcome, you get to play this Digimon at the end of the battle.[1]
