BT6-058.question: Q: Can I play this Digimon with its [Security] effect even if it loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?

BT6-058.answer: A: This Digimon is played after the battle with the attacking Digimon, and before the next check is performed.[1]
BT6-058.question: Q: This card is flipped over during a security check, but the attacking Digimon still has security checks remaining. Is this card played off its [Security] effect first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?

BT6-060.answer: A: Yes, you can. As long as either a Digimon card with [Three Musketeers] in its type or a 7-cost Option card are among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT6-060.question: Q: I use this card’s effect to reveal 4 cards. If the cards revealed only include either a Digimon card with [Three Musketeers] in its type or a 7-cost Option card, can I still add a card to my hand?
Q: Can I digivolve this Digimon in the battle area into a card with the [Three Musketeers] trait in the hand when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

BT6-061.answer: A: Yes. During your turn, this Digimon is treated as both a red and black Digimon, so it can digivolve into a Digimon with black digivolution requirements.[1]
BT6-061.question: Q: Can this Digimon digivolve into a Digimon with “Red/Level 5” digivolution requirements?

BT6-061.answer: A: No, you can't. [Your Turn] effects don't activate from breeding areas, so the card isn't treated as a red card. You can't digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a red Digimon.[1]
BT6-061.question: Q: This card is in my breeding area. Can I digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a red Digimon?

BT6-062.answer: A: Yes. As soon as your opponent no longer has an unsuspended Digimon in play, your attacking Digimon loses ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card’s inherited effect.[1]
BT6-062.question: Q: My opponent only has 1 unsuspended Digimon in play, and I attack with a Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards. When my opponent blocks and suspends their unsuspended Digimon, does my attacking Digimon immediately lose ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card’s inherited effect?

BT6-065.answer: A: No, this card’s [When Digivolving] effect reads “you may,” so you can choose whether or not to use the Option card.  If you don’t use it, you delete 1 of your opponent’s Digimon with a play cost of 4 or less.[1]
BT6-065.question: Q: I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to reveal cards from the top of my deck. If I reveal a 7-cost Option card, do I have to use it?

BT6-065.answer: A: Yes, it does. Reveal as many cards from your deck as you can, then perform the rest of the effect as normal.[1]
BT6-065.question: Q: If I have 4 or fewer cards in my deck, does this Digimon’s [When Digivolving] effect activate?

BT6-067.answer: A: The effect deletes your opponent’s Digimon with the lowest play cost. If multiple Digimon are tied for lowest, all of them are deleted.[1]
BT6-067.question: Q: What does “Delete all of your opponent's Digimon with the lowest play cost” mean, exactly?

BT6-067.answer: A: Yes. As soon as your opponent no longer has an unsuspended Digimon in play, your attacking Digimon loses ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card’s inherited effect.[1]
BT6-067.question: Q: My opponent only has 1 unsuspended Digimon in play, and I attack with this Digimon. When my opponent blocks and suspends their unsuspended Digimon, does my attacking Digimon immediately lose ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card’s effect?

BT6-068.answer: A: No, the effect reads “you may,” so you can choose whether or not to trash the card.  If you don't trash a card, you don’t get to return a Digimon card with [Seven Great Demon Lords] or [Three Musketeers] in its type from your trash to your hand.[1]
BT6-068.question: Q: When I play this card, do I have to trash 1 card in my hand?

BT6-072.answer: A: No. You must trash a card in your hand in order to activate it.[1]
BT6-072.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s effect when my hand is empty?

BT6-073.answer: A: No, the Digimon does not have its [Your Turn] effect at the time of trashing a card in the hand.
BT6-073.question: Q: If I digivolve this card into a Level 5 Digimon while under the effects of [EX1-071 Win Rate 60%]. Does the [Your Turn] effect of the Digimon on top of this card activate?

BT6-075.answer: A: No. This card’s [On Play] effect can only be used to place cards whose names match either [Kinkakumon] or [Ginkakumon] exactly, therefore you can't place [Ginkakumon Promote] in digivolution cards.[1]
BT6-075.question: Q: Can I use this card’s [On Play] effect to place a [Ginkakumon Promote] from my trash in this card’s digivolution cards?

BT6-075.answer: A: No, "You may place..." means that you can choose if you want to place them as digivolution cards or not. However, if you choose to place, you must place as many digivolution cards as possible. So, if you have both [Kinkakumon] and [Ginkakumon], you can't choose to place only one of them.[1]
BT6-075.question: Q: If I have both [Kinkakumon] and [Ginkakumon] in my trash, does this card’s [On Play] effect force me to place both cards in this card’s digivolution cards?

BT6-077.answer: A: No, you can't. Effects don't activate from breeding areas, so the card isn't treated as a black card. You can't digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a black Digimon.[1]
BT6-077.question: Q: This card is in my breeding area. Can I digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a black Digimon?

BT6-077.answer: A: No. You must trash a card in your hand in order to activate it.[1]
BT6-077.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s effect when my hand is empty?

BT6-078.answer: A: Yes, they both trigger at the same time. So you can choose which effect to activate first.
BT6-078.question: Q: If I digivolve my Level 5 Purple Digimon into [BT4-087 Anubismon] while under the effects of [EX1-071 Win Rate 60%], and trash this card from the hand. Can I use the [When Digivolving] effect of [BT4-087 Anubismon] before the "when this card is trashed from your hand" effect of SkullGreymon?

BT6-079.answer: A: Yes. The [On Deletion] effect activates after the card moves to your trash, meeting the requirement for you to have 10 cards in your trash.[1]
BT6-079.question: Q: I have 9 cards in my trash when this Digimon is deleted. If this results in my having 10 cards in my trash, does this card’s [On Deletion] effect activate?

BT6-081.answer: A: Yes. If possible, you must trash 1 card in your hand for this card’s effect. “Then, you may play 1 purple Level 4 or lower Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost” is phrased “you may,” so you can choose whether or not to play a card using the effect.
BT6-081.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect force me to trash 1 card in my hand when this card digivolves?
Q: Can I use this card’s [When Digivolving] effect to trash a purple Level 4 or lower Digimon card in my hand, then play it with this effect?
Q: I use this card’s [When Digivolving] effect to trash a card in my hand. Does this card’s [Your Turn] effect trigger?

BT6-081.answer: A: You can’t trash a card in your hand, but since you don’t need to trash a card to activate the second part of the effect, you can still play a purple Level 4 or lower Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost.
BT6-081.question: Q: When happens when this card’s [When Digivolving] effect activates while my hand is empty?

BT6-083.answer: A: No. Even if you choose not to play a Tamer, your opponent can still use this card’s effect to play a Tamer of their own.[1]
BT6-083.question: Q: If I don’t play a Tamer using this card’s [On Play] effect, does that prevent my opponent from playing a Tamer card, as well?

BT6-084.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that always treats it as if it also has the name [Sistermon Noir] and the [Virus] trait.[1]
BT6-084.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "Also treated as Name: [Sistermon Noir] and Trait: [Virus]" has been changed to "(Rule) Also treated as Name: [Sistermon Noir] and Trait: [Virus]")

BT6-085.answer: A: This is a specific rule that allows you to include up to 50 copies of cards with this card's card number in your deck.[1]
BT6-085.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "You can include up to 50 copies of cards with this card's card number in your deck" has been changed to "(Rule) You can include up to 50 copies of cards with this card's card number in your deck")

BT6-087.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If you do, trash as many cards from your security stack as you can.[1]
BT6-087.question: Q: I only have 1 or fewer cards left in my security stack. Can I activate this card’s [Main] effect?

BT6-087.answer: A: No, this card’s [Main] effect only affects cards whose names are [Agumon].[1]
BT6-087.question: Q: Can I use this card’s [Main] effect on cards with [Agumon] in their name? (For example, [Agumon Expert], [ToyAgumon], etc.)

BT6-087.answer: A: No. If you had 1 or more cards in your security stack at the time the effect finished activating, [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] will be deleted at the end of the turn, regardless of how many cards are in your security stack at that time.[1]
BT6-087.question: Q: I activated this card’s [Main] effect to digivolve into [Agumon - Bond of Bravery]. I had 1 or more cards in my security stack at the time of activation, but another effect causes my security stack to become empty later that same turn. Do I get to keep [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] in play at the end of the turn?

BT6-087.answer: A: The first copy’s effect was used to digivolve into [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] while your security stack had 1 or more cards in it, so [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] will be deleted at the end of the turn.  The second copy’s effect was used to digivolve into [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] while your security stack was empty, so [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] stays in play at the end of the turn.[1]
BT6-087.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this card in play. I use the first copy’s [Main] effect to digivolve a Digimon into an [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] while there are 1 or more cards in my security stack. I use the second copy’s [Main] effect to digivolve a different Digimon into [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] while my security stack is empty.    What happens to each [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] at the end of the turn?

BT6-088.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If you do, trash as many cards from your security stack as you can.[1]
BT6-088.question: Q: I only have 1 or fewer cards left in my security stack. Can I activate this card’s [Main] effect?

BT6-088.answer: A: No. If you had 1 or more cards in your security stack at the time the effect finished activating, [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] will be deleted at the end of the turn, regardless of how many cards are in your security stack at that time.[1]
BT6-088.question: Q: I activated this card’s [Main] effect to digivolve into [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship]. I had 1 or more cards in my security stack at the time of activation, but another effect causes my security stack to become empty later that same turn. Do I get to keep [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] in play at the end of the turn?

BT6-088.answer: A: The first copy’s effect was used to digivolve into [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] while your security stack had 1 or more cards in it, so [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] will be deleted at the end of the turn.  The second copy’s effect was used to digivolve into [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] while your security stack was empty, so [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] stays in play at the end of the turn.[1]
BT6-088.question: Q: "I have 2 copies of this card in play. I use the first copy’s [Main] effect to digivolve a Digimon into a [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] while there are 1 or more cards in my security stack. I use the second copy’s [Main] effect to digivolve a different Digimon into [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] while my security stack is empty.    What happens to each [Gabumon - Bond of Friendship] at the end of the turn?"

BT6-089.answer: A: No, this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect only activates “if you have fewer security cards than your opponent,” so if you and your opponent both have the same number of security cards, it won’t activate.[1]
BT6-089.question: Q: The number of cards in my security stack is equal to the number of cards in my opponent’s security stack. Does this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect activate?

BT6-091.question: Q: Does this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect allow me to gain 2 memory if my opponent has no Digimon in play in their battle area?

BT6-095.answer: A: If you have a Digimon with [Three Musketeers] in its type in play in your battle area, you can use this Option card even if you don’t have a red Digimon or Tamer in play.[1]

BT6-095.answer: A: The effect deletes your opponent’s Digimon with the lowest DP. If multiple Digimon are tied for lowest, all of them are deleted.[1]
BT6-095.question: Q: What does “all of your opponent's Digimon with the lowest DP” mean, exactly?

BT6-097.answer: A: No. This card’s effect is already activated, so the affected Digimon can’t attack or block until the effect ends.[1]
BT6-097.question: Q: I use this card’s effect to prevent one of my opponent’s Digimon with no digivolution cards from attacking or blocking. If that Digimon later gains a digivolution card, can it attack and block?

Q: I use this card’s effect to trash 2 digivolution cards from the bottom of 1 of my opponent’s Digimon. For the part of this card’s effect that reads “1 of your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards can't attack or block until the end of your opponent's next turn,” can I choose a different Digimon with no digivolution cards other than the one I trashed digivolution cards from using the first part of this card’s effect?

BT6-098.question: Q: My opponent has 3 Digimon in play. Can I choose to put a Level 6 or higher Digimon on the bottom of my opponent's deck?

BT6-099.answer: A: Yes, you can. The second half of the effect still occurs even if you don’t have a security card to trash.[1]
BT6-099.question: Q: Can I use this card if I have 0 cards left in my security stack?

BT6-100.answer: A: Yes. You're revealing cards from your deck, which means they’re public information until you choose one to place face down on top of your security stack. You must show the card you place in your security stack to your opponent first.[1]
BT6-100.question: Q: When using this card’s effect to place a card on top of my security stack, do I need to show it to my opponent?

BT6-100.answer: A: Yes, you can. Reveal as many cards from your deck as you can, then perform the rest of the effect as normal.[1]
BT6-100.question: Q: Can I use this card if I have 1 or fewer cards left in my deck?

BT6-102.answer: A: Your opponent loses 2 memory, which means you gain 2 memory.  If you use this card to give “[On Deletion] Lose 2 memory” to an opponent’s Digimon, you gain 2 memory when that Digimon is deleted.[1]
BT6-102.question: Q: I use this card’s effect to give “[On Deletion] Lose 2 memory.” to an opponent’s Digimon. What happens when that Digimon is deleted?

BT6-105.answer: A: If you have a Digimon with [Three Musketeers] in its type in play in your battle area, you can use this Option card even if you don’t have a black Digimon or Tamer in play.[1]
BT6-105.question: Q: "If you have a Digimon with [Three Musketeers] in its type in play, you may use this Option card without meeting its color requirements.” How does this effect work, exactly?

BT6-105.answer: A: Yes. Both your and your opponent delete all Digimon with play costs of 7 or less.[1]
BT6-105.question: Q: Does this card’s effect also delete all of my Digimon with play costs of 7 or less?

BT6-106.answer: A: The effect deletes your opponent’s Digimon with the highest play cost. If multiple Digimon are tied for highest, all of them are deleted.[1]
BT6-106.question: Q: What does “all of your opponent's Digimon with the highest play cost” mean, exactly?

BT6-107.answer: A: Yes, you can. The second half of the effect still occurs even if you don’t have a Digimon card to return from your trash.[1]
BT6-107.question: Q: Can I use this card if I don't have any Digimon cards in my trash?

BT6-109.answer: A: If you have a Digimon with [Three Musketeers] in its type in play in your battle area, you can use this Option card even if you don’t have a purple Digimon or Tamer in play.[1]
BT6-109.question: Q: "If you have a Digimon with [Three Musketeers] in its type in play, you may use this Option card without meeting its color requirements.” How does this effect work, exactly?

BT6-110.answer: A: Yes. If a DP-boosting effect activates when you play a Digimon, the Digimon’s modified DP value is referenced by this card’s effect. You can delete 1 of your opponent’s Digimon with DP less than or equal to [Eosmon]’s boosted DP.[1]
BT6-110.question: Q: I use this card while I have 1 [ST1-12 Tai Kamiya] in play, and play a [BT6-085 Eosmon] from my hand. [ST1-12 Tai Kamiya]’s effect gives [BT6-085 Eosmon] +1000 DP, bringing it up to a total of 7000 DP. Can I delete 1 of my opponent’s Digimon with 7000 DP or less?

BT6-111.answer: A: Yes, it activates at the end of the battle, regardless of outcome.[1]
BT6-111.question: Q: Does this card’s [Security] effect activate even if it loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?

BT6-111.answer: A: Even after using this card’s [Security] effect to prevent your opponent’s Digimon from attacking players, it only prevents them from declaring further attacks. The current attack proceeds normally.[1]
BT6-111.question: Q: If I use this card’s [Security] effect to prevent my opponent’s currently attacking Digimon from attacking players, does the attack end immediately, or does my opponent get to perform their remaining security checks?

Q: My opponent uses this card’s [Security] effect to prevent one of my Digimon with ＜Piercing＞ from attacking players. If that Digimon attacks and deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives, do I still get to perform security checks with ＜Piercing＞?

BT6-111.answer: A: Yes, it can.  This card’s [Security Effect] only affects Digimon that are in play at the time it’s activated.[1]
BT6-111.question: Q: I have 11 or fewer Digimon in play, and my opponent activates this card’s [Security] effect, preventing all of my Digimon from attacking players for the turn. If I later play a Digimon with ＜Rush＞ during that same turn, can that Digimon attack players?
Q: If this Digimon attacks and is deleted in battle, does its [End of Attack] effect activate at the end of the attack?

BT6-112.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore its color requirements.[1]
BT6-112.question: Q: When using this card’s [On Play] effect to use an Option card, can I use any 7-cost Option card, regardless of its color requirements?

BT6-112.answer: A: No, you can’t. Since those options are cards that have effects that “reduce the cost by…” or “its memory cost is equal to…” when they would be used, their cost has not actually changed when activating this card’s [On Play] effect, so they can’t be used with this card’s effect. However, since [BT2-099 Glorious Burst] always has the effect of reducing its use cost when used from the hand, if you have 2 yellow Tamers, it can be used with this card’s effect as its use cost will be 7.[1]
BT6-112.question: Q: Can I use option cards that can change their cost to 7 on certain conditions such as [BT7-100 Qualialise Blast] or [BT11-108 DG Dimension] with this card’s [On Play] effect?

BT7-001.answer: A: Yes. No color is specified, so you can activate the effect of any Tamer, regardless of color.[1]
BT7-001.question: Q: Do Tamers of any color make the effect of this card active?

BT7-003.question: Q: Which activates first: This card’s inherited effect, or the effect that activates when you trash this card with <Digi-Burst>?

BT7-005.answer: A: No. When a Digimon digivolves, even if it happens due to an effect, it is not counted as an effect placing digivolution cards under that Digimon.[1]
BT7-005.question: Q: When one of my effects digivolves a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT7-005.answer: A: No. Even if multiple cards are added to the Digimon’s digivolution cards, if they were added by a single effect, you only draw 1 card.[1]
BT7-005.question: Q: If one of my effects places 2 or more cards at the same time under a Digimon that has this card's inherited effect, can I draw that many cards?

BT7-006.answer: A: Yes. You can choose whether or not to reveal cards from your deck, but if any Tamer cards are revealed among the cards, you must trash 1 of them.[1]
BT7-006.question: Q: If there are Tamer cards among the cards revealed with this card's inherited effect, do I have to trash 1 of them?

BT7-011.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]

Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-011.answer: A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.[1]
BT7-011.question: Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?

BT7-011.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.[1]
BT7-011.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT7-011.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]
BT7-011.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-011.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT7-011.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-013.answer: A: No. If you play this card with no Tamers in play, you only get to play 1 red Tamer card from your hand.[1]

BT7-013.answer: A: No. Even if multiple Digimon are deleted, if they were deleted by a single effect, you only gain 1 memory.[1]
BT7-013.question: Q: If I delete 2 or more of my opponent’s Digimon at the same time, does this card’s inherited effect allow me to gain 1 memory for each Digimon deleted?

BT7-014.answer: A: Yes. All [Security] effects on non-Option cards activate normally.[1]
BT7-014.question: Q: When a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards performs a security check, if the checked card is a Digimon card or a Tamer card, does its [Security] effect activate?

BT7-015.answer: A: No, its play cost is reduced by the total number of Option cards in both you and your opponent's trashes.[1]
BT7-015.question: Q: Is this card’s play cost reduced by 1 for each Option card in ONLY my trash or my opponent’s trash?

BT7-015.answer: A: The player who activated the effect decides the order in which their cards and their opponent's cards are returned to the bottom of each player's decks.[1]
BT7-015.question: Q: I use this card’s [On Play] effect to return cards from both players’ trashes to the bottom of their owners’ decks. Who decides which order the cards are placed in?

BT7-016.answer: A: The [Your Turn] effect is activated immediately after this Digimon is blocked and it's attack target is changed. So, since the effect is triggered by your opponent blocking this Digimon, it will finish resolving before the battle against the blocking Digimon.[1]
BT7-016.question: Q: I attack with this Digimon, and it is blocked by an opponent's Digimon at the blocker timing. At what timing does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT7-017.question: Q: Can I place 1 red or black level 5 card with [Cyborg] in its traits from my hand or trash on top of this Digimon's digivolution cards with this card's [When Digivolving] effect even if my opponent has no Digimon with 6000 DP or less in play?

BT7-022.question: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-022.answer: A: Yes, it is.  However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]
BT7-022.question: Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?

BT7-022.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.[1]
BT7-022.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT7-022.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]
BT7-022.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-022.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT7-022.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-023.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]
BT7-023.question: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-023.answer: A: Yes, it is.  However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]
BT7-023.question: Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?

BT7-023.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.[1]
BT7-023.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT7-023.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]
BT7-023.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-023.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT7-023.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-023.answer: A: No. Once a Digimon is targeted by this card's [When Digivolving] effect, it becomes unable to attack or block until the end of your opponent’s turn, even if it gains a digivolution card.[1]
BT7-023.question: Q: When this card's [When Digivolving] effect prevents a Digimon from attacking or blocking, if that Digimon gains a digivolution card afterwards, can it attack or block?

BT7-026.answer: A: No. If you play this card with no Tamers in play, you only get to play 1 blue Tamer card from your hand.[1]
BT7-026.question: Q: If I play this card while I have no Tamers in play, and play a blue Tamer from my hand with this card's effect, do I then also gain 2 memory from this effect since I now have a Tamer in play?

BT7-027.question: Q: This card's [On Play] effect places a Digimon card from my hand under 1 of my Digimon. Can I place it under this Digimon?

BT7-027.answer: A: No. It enters play as a new Digimon, unsuspended. Additionally, it does not carry over any effects on the source Digimon.[1]
BT7-027.question: Q: This card's [On Play] effect plays a level 3 Digimon card from the digivolution cards of a suspended Digimon. Does the level 3 Digimon enter play suspended?

BT7-028.answer: A: No. Having a digivolution card become a Digimon as a result of ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) does not count as playing that card, so this card's [Your Turn] effect does not trigger.[1]
BT7-028.question: Q: One of my Digimon with digivolution cards is targeted by my opponent’s ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.), resulting in it becoming one of the Digimon in its digivolution cards. When this happens, can I return 1 of my opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to its owner's hand with this card's [Yout Turn] effect?

BT7-029.answer: A: It means the effect can be activated both [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking].  You can activate it as a [When Digivolving] effect when you digivolve this Digimon, then activate it again on following turns as a [When Attacking] effect by attacking with this Digimon.[1]
BT7-029.question: Q: This card has an effect that activates at both [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking] timings. What does this mean, exactly?

BT7-029.answer: A: No. No matter which timing the effect is triggered at, it is still the same effect and can only be activated [Once Per Turn]. If the effect has been triggered at [When Digivolving] and activated, it can not be activated again on the same turn, even if it's triggered [When Attacking].[1]
BT7-029.question: Q: This card has a [When Digivolving][When Attacking][Once Per Turn] effect, but can I activate it twice in the same turn by both digivolving and attacking?

BT7-031.answer: A: Return this card to its owner’s hand after <Digi-Burst> activates.[1]
BT7-031.question: Q: I trash this card from a Digimon's digivolution cards to activate <Digi-Burst>. Do I return this card to its owner's hand before or after the <Digi-Burst> effect activates?

BT7-035.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]

BT7-036.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-037.question: Q: I have a suspended Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ and this card in its digivolution cards, and my opponent attacks me with a Digimon. I unsuspend the Digimon with this card's inherited effect. Can I now block the opponent’s Digimon?

BT7-039.question: Q: I use <Digi-Burst> to trash this card from a Digimon’s digivolution cards. Which activates first: This card’s inherited effect, or the effect that activates when you trash this card with <Digi-Burst>?

BT7-040.answer: A: The digivolution cost is equal to the number of cards in your security stack minus the amount reduced by the effect.  If you have 4 security cards and activate an effect that reduces digivolution costs by 2, the final digivolution cost will be 2. (4 minus 2.)[1]
BT7-040.question: Q: When digivolving into this card from my hand, I activate an effect on another card that reduces digivolution costs. What happens to this card’s digivolution cost?

BT7-040.answer: A: Yes, you can. This card's <Digi-Burst up to 4> allows you to choose any number of digivolution cards to trash, from 1 to 4. If you have 3 or fewer digivolution cards, you can activate the effect as long as you can trash 1 or more of them.[1]
BT7-040.question: Q: This card’s <Digi-Burst> reads “up to 4.” Can I activate the effect if I have 3 or fewer digivolution cards?

BT7-040.answer: A: No, this effect can only target 1 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT7-040.question: Q: I trash 2 digivolution cards to activate this card's <Digi-Burst>. Can I have 2 of my opponent's Digimon both get -3000 DP?

BT7-041.answer: A: No. If you digivolve into this card while at 2 or fewer security cards, you only go up to 3 security cards with <Recovery>.[1]
BT7-041.question: Q: I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect when I have 2 or fewer security cards to go up to 3 security cards with <Recovery>. Do I now gain 2 memory for being at 3 or more security cards?

BT7-046.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]
BT7-046.question: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-046.answer: A: Yes, it is.  However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]

BT7-046.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]

BT7-046.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT7-046.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-046.answer: A: Yes. Even if you revealed only a card with [Hybrid] in its traits or [J.P. Shibayama], you still add that card to your hand.[1]
BT7-046.question: Q: I reveal 5 cards with this card's [When Digivolving] effect. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [Hybrid] in its traits or [J.P. Shibayama], can I still add a card to my hand?

BT7-047.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]
BT7-047.question: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-047.answer: A: Yes, it is.  However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]

BT7-047.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.[1]

BT7-047.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]
BT7-047.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-047.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT7-047.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-049.answer: A: No. It is too late to trigger those [When Attacking] effects because it did not have them when the attack was declared.[1]
BT7-049.question: Q: I digivolve into a green level 6 Digimon with this card's [When Attacking] effect. Can I activate that Digimon’s [When Attacking] effects?

BT7-049.answer: A: Yes, the effect is mandatory. You reveal as many cards as you can, up to 3.[1]
BT7-049.question: Q: When attacking, do I have to reveal 3 cards from my deck with this card’s [When Attacking] effect?

BT7-049.answer: A: No. The effect reads, “You may digivolve,” so you can choose not to.[1]
BT7-049.question: Q: If a green level 6 Digimon card is among the cards revealed with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, do I have to digivolve into it?

BT7-049.answer: A: Yes, you can digivolve into the Digimon of your choosing.[1]
BT7-049.question: Q: If 2 or more green level 6 Digimon cards are among the cards revealed with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, can I choose either card to digivolve into?
Q: When digivolving with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, do I draw a card as a digivolution bonus?

BT7-051.answer: A: No. The effect reads, “This Digimon can digivolve,” so you can choose not to.[1]
BT7-051.question: Q: I have a card with [Hybrid] or [Insectoid] in its traits in this Digimon's digivolution cards. Does this card’s [When Attacking] effect force me to digivolve this Digimon into a Digimon card with [Insectoid] or [Ten Warriors] in its traits in my hand?

BT7-051.answer: A: The attack continues. The turn doesn’t switch over just yet. If the memory gauge is still at 1 or more on your opponent’s side after the attack ends and any effects triggered by it finish activating, only then does the turn switch over.[1]
BT7-051.question: Q: When digivolving with this card's [When Attacking] effect, paying the digivolution cost moves the memory gauge to 1 or more on my opponent’s side. What happens to the attack?

BT7-051.answer: A: No, it is too late to trigger this card's [When Attacking] effect, since the Digimon didn't have it when the attack was declared.[1]
BT7-051.question: Q: I attack with [EX1-035 Kabuterimon] and digivolve into this card with its [When Attacking] effect. Can I then digivolve again on the same attack with this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT7-051.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore its digivolution requirements.[1]
BT7-051.question: Q: When digivolving into a Digimon card in my hand with [Insectoid] or [Ten Warriors] in its traits with this card's [When Attacking] effect, can I ignore that card's digivolution requirements?

BT7-053.question: Q: Using this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I prevent my opponent's Digimon from becoming unsuspended during my opponent's next unsuspend phase by applying this effect to it while it's suspended?

BT7-055.answer: A: No. Your opponent must trash 1 card in their hand for each Digimon they unsuspend.[1]
BT7-055.question: Q: My opponent unsuspends 2 or more of their Digimon. Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect allow my opponent to unsuspend all of their Digimon by trashing 1 card in their hand?

BT7-055.answer: A: No. The [Opponent's Turn] effect cannot force the opponent to trash cards in their hand. However, no matter how the Digimon would become unsuspended, whether from an effect or your opponent's unsuspend phase, the Digimon cannot unsuspend unless the opponent trashes a card in their hand.[1]
BT7-055.question: Q: If an effect would cause an opponent’s Digimon to unsuspend, does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect force my opponent to trash a card in their hand?

BT7-055.answer: A: No, you can choose which of your Digimon to unsuspend, and trash a card in your hand for each one.  Digimon will not unsuspend unless you choose to trash a card in your hand, so even if you have fewer cards in hand than suspended Digimon in play, you can still choose to unsuspend specific Digimon.[1]
BT7-055.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. If I have 3 suspended Digimon in play, do I need to have 3 or more cards in hand during my unsuspend phase in order to unsuspend my Digimon?

BT7-055.answer: A: No. This effect only affects Digimon. Your opponent can unsuspend their Tamers normally, without trashing cards in their hand.[1]
BT7-055.question: Q: Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect require my opponent to trash cards in their hand to also unsuspend their Tamer cards?

BT7-055.answer: A: Yes. Your opponent’s Digimon now have two copies of “[Your Turn] You must trash 1 card in your hand to unsuspend this Digimon” on them, which means they have to trash 2 cards in their hand to unsuspend 1 of their Digimon.[1]
BT7-055.question: Q: I have two of these Digimon in play. Does my opponent have to trash 2 cards in their hand for each Digimon they want to unsuspend?

BT7-056.answer: A: Yes. Even if you revealed only a card with [X Antibody] in its traits or [Kota Domoto], you still add that card to your hand.[1]
BT7-056.question: Q: I reveal 3 cards with this card's [On Play] effect. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [X Antibody] in its traits or [Kota Domoto], can I still add a card to my hand?

BT7-056.answer: A: No. When a Digimon digivolves, even if it happens due to an effect, it is not counted as an effect placing digivolution cards under that Digimon.[1]
BT7-056.question: Q: When one of my effects digivolves a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT7-056.answer: A: No. Even if multiple cards are added to the Digimon’s digivolution cards, you only gain 1 memory.[1]
BT7-056.question: Q: f one of my effects places 2 or more cards at the same time under a Digimon that has this card's inherited effect, do I gain that much memory?

BT7-056.answer: A: Yes, it activates.  This card's inherited effect is a [Your Turn] effect, so it can be activated when this card becomes a digivolution card under a Digimon in the battle area. Therefore, when this card itself is added, the effect is triggered as an inherited effect.[1]
BT7-056.question: Q: When this card is placed in one of my Digimon’s digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT7-058.answer: A: Yes, you can choose a [DeadlyAxemon] with no digivolution cards with this effect.[1]
BT7-058.question: Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect place one of my [DeadlyAxemon] with no digivolution cards at the bottom of this Digimon’s digivolution cards?

BT7-058.answer: A: Yes, you can. In that case, [DeadlyAxemon] becomes a different Digimon, so the [BT9-109 X Antibody] in its digivolution cards is send to the trash according to the rules.[1]
BT7-058.question: Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect place one of my [DeadlyAxemon] with [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards at the bottom of this Digimon’s digivolution cards?

BT7-060.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]

BT7-061.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]

BT7-061.answer: A: Yes, it is.  However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]

BT7-061.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]

BT7-061.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]
BT7-061.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-063.answer: A: Yes. You don't have to place both a [SkullKnightmon] and a [DeadlyAxemon]. You can also place either of them on their own from either your hand or trash in this Digimon's digivolution cards.[1]
BT7-063.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect place cards in this Digimon's digivolution cards if I don’t have both a [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] in either my hand or trash?

BT7-063.answer: A: Yes. You can mix and match [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] from both your hand and trash to place in this Digimon’s digivolution cards.[1]
BT7-063.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect place a [SkullKnightmon] in my hand and a [DeadlyAxemon] in my trash in this Digimon’s digivolution cards?

BT7-063.answer: A: No. The effect reads, “you may,” so you can choose whether to play them. However, if both [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] are in digivolution cards, you must choose to either play both of them or play none of them.[1]
BT7-063.question: Q: If I have both [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] in this Digimon’s digivolution cards, does this card’s [All Turns] effect require me to play both?

BT7-063.answer: A: The [All Turns] effect triggers and activates immediately prior to the Digimon being deleted. In this way, the [All Turns] effect has the same timing as effects that say, “when this Digimon would be deleted”.[2]
BT7-063.question: Q: When does the [All Turns] effect of the Digimon trigger?

BT7-063.answer: A: No. Even if you only had either "Skull Knightmon" or "Deadly Axmon", you can still place them on the digivolution card.[3]
BT7-063.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect be placed in the digivolving card unless I have both "Skull Knightmon" and "Deadly Axmon" in my hand or trash?

BT7-063.answer: A: Yes, you can put "Skull Knightmon" and "Deadly Axmon" from both hand and trash to digivolution card.[3]
BT7-063.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect put "Skull Knightmon" from my hand and "Deadly Axmon" from my trash to digivolving card respectively?

BT7-063.answer: A: No, it is "can appear" and you can choose whether or not to have it play. However, if you have both "Skull Knightmon" and "Deadly Axmon" as digivolution cards, you can either play both of them or none of them.[4]
BT7-063.question: Q: For this card's [All Turns] effect, if there are both "Skull Knightmon" and "Deadly Axmon" as digivolves, do I always have to play both?

BT7-064.answer: A: No. This card's Japanese name (ドルグレモン) does not have "Greymon" (グレイモン) in its name.

BT7-070.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may,” so you can choose not to activate it. However, after revealing a card from your deck, you must perform the rest of the effect to the best of your ability.[1]
BT7-070.question: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect when digivolving?

BT7-070.answer: A: Yes. Once you choose to reveal cards, you must trash all Tamer cards you reveal.[1]

BT7-071.answer: A: No, Tamer cards' [Security] effects aren't inherited effects. Some Tamer cards do have inherited effects, and those can be activated when such cards are placed in digivolution cards.[1]

BT7-071.answer: A: Yes, it is.  However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.[1]

BT7-071.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.[1]

BT7-071.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.[1]
BT7-071.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-071.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.[1]

At such times, does this card still have "this Digimon can't be blocked for the turn"?

You must perform the “placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck” part of the effect before the digivolution takes place, so you must reveal the card from your hand first.[1]

BT7-112.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may digivolve,” so you can choose not to.  If you choose not to digivolve, this card is trashed after you reveal it.  Note that the game will not view this as you trashing a card in your hand.[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s “placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck” effect but choose not to digivolve this card?

BT7-112.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In this case, you can’t digivolve even after performing the actions described by the effect. After revealing this card, it is trashed.  Note that the game will not view this as you trashing a card in your hand.[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s “placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck” effect when I have no Tamers in play?

BT8-003.answer: A: No, it can't. This effect can't be used on Digimon in the breeding area.[1]

BT8-006.answer: A: No, cards revealed from the top of your deck aren't considered to be “trashed from your deck,” so this card’s inherited effect doesn’t activate.[1]

BT8-012.answer: A: The effect has already been activated, so the +3000 DP effect persists for the turn.[1]

BT8-019.answer: A: Your opponent chooses 1 of their Digimon. Next, delete all Digimon in play, from both you and your opponent, except for this Digimon and the Digimon your opponent chose. Then you gain 1 memory for every Digimon that was deleted by this effect.[1]
BT8-019.question: Q: How does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect work, exactly?

BT8-019.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas cannot be affected by effects, so they aren't deleted.[1]
BT8-019.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect delete Digimon in breeding areas, too?

BT8-019.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas cannot be affected by effects, so they can't be chosen. Additionally, note that this effect doesn't delete Digimon in breeding areas, regardless of whether they could be chosen or not.[1]
BT8-019.question: Q: For this card’s [When Digivolving] effect, can my opponent choose a Digimon in their breeding area?

BT8-019.answer: A: All of your other Digimon besides this one are deleted, and you gain 1 memory for each Digimon deleted in this way.[1]
BT8-019.question: Q: How does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect work if my opponent has no Digimon in play?

BT8-020.answer: A: At the end of your turn, this effect allows you to DNA digivolve a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, along with one of your other Digimon, into a Digimon in your hand that has [DNA Digivolution]. Note that this happens before it becomes your opponent’s turn.[1]
BT8-020.question: Q: How does this card’s inherited effect work, exactly?

BT8-020.answer: A: No. You can't ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn't have [DNA Digivolution].[1]

BT8-020.answer: A: No. You can’t ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve using Digimon that aren’t specified in [DNA Digivolution].[2]

BT8-024.answer: A: Yes, this card's effect reads "when this Digimon would digivolve", so it activates. In that case, the effect activates even if the digivolution fails, so the <Recovery +1 (Deck)> activates.[1]
BT8-024.question: Q: If I have 3 or fewer security cards and this Digimon would digivolve, but the digivolution cost can no longer be paid due to the inherited effect of my opponent's [EX3-016 SnowAgumon], [EX3-019 Paledramon] or other cards and the digivolution fails, can this card's <Recovery +1 (Deck)> activate?

BT8-026.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-026 Halsemon] can digivolve from [Hawkmon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. BT8-026.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Hawkmon]>", written in the text for [BT8-026 Halsemon], as an effect? Can [BT8-026 Halsemon] digivolve from [Hawkmon] in the breeding area?

BT8-028.answer: A: No, digivolving doesn't count as playing a card, so the effect doesn't activate.[1]
