BT8-029.question: Q: If my opponent has a Digimon with digivolution cards in their breeding area, can this Digimon attack?
Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when my opponent activates <Digi-Burst>?

BT8-032.question: Q: If both blue and green cards are in this card’s digivolution cards, do I activate both parts of this card’s [When Attacking] effect?
Q: If a single blue and green multicolor card is in this card’s digivolution cards, do I activate both parts of this card’s [When Attacking] effect?

BT8-033.question: Q: Can I use this card’s effect to add a two-color Option card to my hand if one of its colors is yellow?

BT8-033.answer: A: No. Effects don't activate for cards revealed from your deck.[1]
BT8-033.question: Q: Can this card’s effect add a card with a "this Digimon is also treated as yellow" effect to my hand?

BT8-036.question: Q: If the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself blue, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT8-038.answer: A: The effect has already been activated, so the DP boost persists for the turn.[1]
BT8-038.question: Q: After I use this card’s [When Digivolving] effect to gain +2000 DP for each card with [Armor Form] in its traits in my trash, I use ＜Armor Purge＞ to trash this card. What happens to the DP boost?

BT8-039.answer: A: No. No matter how many Tamers you have in play, the effect gives -5000 DP to up to 3 of your opponent's Digimon.[1]
BT8-039.question: Q: If I have 2 Tamers in play, can this card's [When Digivolving] effect give up to 6 of my opponent's Digimon -5000 DP?

BT8-040.answer: A: Yes, the Digimon is now treated as having two colors, so you ＜Draw 2＞.[1]
BT8-040.question: Q: This card's effect trashes a red card in my hand. Does this make this Digimon a red/yellow 2-color Digimon, allowing me to ＜Draw 2＞?

BT8-040.answer: A: Yes, the Digimon is now treated as having three colors.[1]
BT8-040.question: Q: This card's effect trashes a blue/green multicolor card in my hand. Does this make this Digimon a yellow/blue/green 3-color Digimon?

BT8-043.answer: A: Yes. The effect activates for each Tamer you have in play, and you can choose a different target for each activation.[1]
BT8-043.question: Q: If I have multiple Tamers in play, can this card's [On Play][When Digivolving] effect give <Security Attack -2> to a different one of my opponent’s Digimon for each Tamer I have in play?

BT8-043.answer: A: No, it’s treated as a single timing.[1]
BT8-043.question: Q: When I activate this card’s [On Play][When Digivolving] effect multiple times, is each activation treated as its own timing?

BT8-044.answer: A: No, it doesn't. This Digimon's [Your Turn] effect only triggers when your other Digimon digivolve.[1]
BT8-044.question: Q: I digivolve one of my suspended Digimon into this Digimon. Does this card's [Your Turn] effect let me unsuspend this Digimon itself?

BT8-048.answer: A: No. Once a Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ is targeted by this card's [When Digivolving] effect, it becomes unable to attack or block until the end of your opponent’s next turn, even if it loses ＜Blocker＞.[1]
BT8-048.question: Q: If I choose an opponent's Digimon for this card's [When Digivolving] effect, and that Digimon loses ＜Blocker＞ due to digivolving, ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.), or some other reason, can that Digimon now attack and block again?

BT8-050.question: Q: With this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I suspend this Digimon itself in order to suspend 1 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT8-051.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-051 Digmon] can digivolve from [Armadillomon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-051.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Armadillomon]>", written in the text for [BT8-051 Digmon], as an effect? Can [BT8-051 Digmon] digivolve from [Armadillomon] in the breeding area?

BT8-053.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-053 Lighdramon] can digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-053.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Veemon]>", written in the text for [BT8-053 Lighdramon], as an effect? Can [BT8-053 Lighdramon] digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area?

BT8-055.answer: A: Yes, you can. Digimon with ＜Reboot＞ unsuspend at the same time as the current player's turn. This effect activates "if this Digimon is unsuspended", so it activates immediately after.[1]
BT8-055.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [Your Turn] effect before my opponent's Digimon unsuspends in the unsuspend phase due to ＜Reboot＞?

BT8-057.answer: A: No. You already used the Option cards and activated their effects, so this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect can’t negate them.[1]
BT8-057.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. During my turn, I use an Option card like [BT1-109 Smashed Potatoes] or [EX1-071 Win Rate: 60%!] which has an effect that activates “the next time one of your Digimon digivolves”. After that, all of my opponent’s Digimon become suspended.  If I then digivolve one of my Digimon, are the effects from the Option cards I used earlier negated?

BT8-057.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Activating ＜Delay＞ on Option cards that are already in your battle area doesn't count as using an Option card.[1]
BT8-057.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. If I have an Option card with ＜Delay＞ that I used from my hand earlier, can I activate its ＜Delay＞ effect?

BT8-059.answer: A: This effect prevents all players from digivolving with effects that say "ignoring digivolution requirements" or otherwise digivolving from Digimon without meeting digivolution requirements.[1]
BT8-059.question: Q: How does this card’s effect work, exactly?

BT8-059.answer: A: No. Those effects don't mention “ignoring digivolution requirements,” and require you to follow the specified digivolution requirements when digivolving a Tamer as if they were a Digimon.[1]
BT8-059.question: Q: Does this card's effect also prevent the effects on [Hybrid] cards like "You may digivolve this card from your hand onto one of your red Tamers as if the Tamer is a level 3 red Digimon"?

BT8-059.answer: A: No. DNA and special digivolutions are treated as a card’s digivolution requirements, so you can still perform both as normal.[1]
BT8-059.question: Q: Does this card’s effect prevent DNA and special digivolutions?

BT8-059.answer: A: Yes. The effect doesn't ignore digivolution requirements―it just lets you skip paying the memory cost―so you can activate it as normal.[1]
BT8-059.question: Q: If this Digimon is in play, can I activate an effect that reads, “you may digivolve...without paying its memory cost”?

BT8-059.answer: A: This effect prevents digivolves from ignoring digivolution requirements. This effect affects both players.[2]
BT8-059.question: Q: What is the effect of "neither party can ignore digivolution requirements?"

BT8-059.answer: A: Yes, it can be DNA digivolves or burst digivolutions.[2]
BT8-059.question: Q: Can I DNA digivolve or burst digivolve while the "neither of us can ignore the digivolution requirements" effect is active?

BT8-059.answer: A: Yes, it can digivolve. If you digivolve without paying the cost, you are not ignoring the digivolution requirements.[2]
BT8-059.question: Q: Can I digivolve without paying the cost while the "each other can't ignore digivolution requirements" effect is active?

BT8-059.answer: A: No, you cannot ignore any part of the digivolution requirements to digivolve.[2]
BT8-059.question: Q: While the "Mutual cannot ignore digivolution requirements" effect is activated, can I ignore some of the digivolution requirements, such as the "Ignore Lv.
Q: Can I use the [When Attacking] effect of "BT10-067 Justimon: Critical Arm" to digivolve it while the "Mutually cannot ignore digivolution requirements" effect is activated?

BT8-059.answer: A: Yes, it can digivolve. The effect of digivolving a card with additional information is not an effect that ignores the digivolution requirements.[2]
BT8-059.question: Q: Can I use the first effect of BT4-011 Agunimon to digivolve from tamers while the "Mutually cannot ignore digivolution requirements" effect is activated?

BT8-061.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that always treats it as if it also has the [Mamemon] name.[1]
BT8-061.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "The name of this card/Digimon is also treated as [Mamemon]" has been changed to "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [Mamemon].")

BT8-062.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that always treats it as if it also has the [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] names.[1]
BT8-062.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "The name of this card/Digimon is also treated as [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon]" has been changed to "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon].")

BT8-064.question: Q: If the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself red, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT8-065.answer: A: Yes, you can add up to 4 cards in any combination from your hand and/or trash.[1]
BT8-065.question: Q: Can this card's effect add a total of up to 4 Digimon cards with [Mamemon] from both my hand and/or trash to the top of my deck?

BT8-066.answer: A: No. Digivolution requirements cannot be ignored unless an effect explicitly instructs you to ignore them.[1]
BT8-066.question: Q: Can this card's [Your Turn] effect digivolve it into any Digimon card regardless of digivolution requirements, so long as it has [X Antibody] in its traits?

BT8-068.answer: A: You can reveal 3 cards, then trash all of them.  Note that the effect reads, “you may,” so you can choose whether or not to activate the effect when digivolving, regardless of whether or not your opponent has any Digimon in play. If you choose not to activate it, you don't reveal or trash any cards.[1]
BT8-068.question: Q: How does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect work if my opponent has no Digimon in play?
Q: What does “memory cost of 10 or less” refer to?

BT8-070.question: Q: If this card has both red and black digivolution cards, can this card's [When Digivolving] effect delete both Digimon and Tamers?

BT8-070.answer: A: No. The total play costs of the chosen Digimon and Tamers must add up to 6 or less.[1]
BT8-070.question: Q: If this card has both red and black digivolution cards, can this card's [When Digivolving] effect delete both 6 play cost worth of my opponent’s Digimon, and 6 play cost worth of my opponent’s Tamers?
Q: If a single red and black multicolor card is in this card’s digivolution cards, can I activate both parts of this card’s [When Digivolving] effect?

BT8-071.answer: A: It prevents effects that reduce play costs. Even if you or your opponent activates an effect that reduces play costs, the cost that is paid cannot actually be reduced. Players must pay the full play cost printed on cards.[1]
BT8-071.question: Q: How does this card’s “Players can’t reduce play costs” effect work, exactly?

BT8-071.answer: A: Yes. Effects that play cards without paying their memory costs are skipping the costs entirely, not reducing them.[1]
BT8-071.question: Q: If this Digimon is in play, can I activate an effect that reads, “play <a card>...without paying its memory cost”?

BT8-071.answer: A: No, they can't be reduced. This card's effect does not target Digimon, so even if your opponent's [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6] is in the breeding area, its effect to reduce play costs can't be activated.[1]
BT8-071.question: Q: Can the play cost of a Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait be reduced due to the [Your Turn] effect of my opponent's [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6] if this Digimon is in play?

BT8-071.answer: A: That's correct. Such effects can no longer reduce play costs.  This card's effect also prevents play cost-reducing effects from activating when Tamer cards are played.[1]
BT8-071.question: Q: When I have this Digimon, can my opponent no longer use [BT14-046 Togemon]'s [Your Turn] effect or inherited effect to reduce the play cost of green Tamer cards?

BT8-072.answer: A: No. This card’s effect can only trash purple Digimon cards.[1]
BT8-072.question: Q: If I reveal a non-purple Digimon card with this card’s [On Play] effect, can I trash it?

BT8-074.answer: A: No, cards revealed from the top of your deck aren't considered to be “trashed from your deck,” so this card’s effect doesn’t trigger.[1]
BT8-074.question: Q: Is this card’s effect triggered by the activation of an effect that reads, “Reveal the top X cards of your deck... Trash the remaining cards.”?

BT8-079.answer: A: No, cards revealed from the top of your deck aren't considered to be “trashed from your deck,” so this card’s effect doesn’t trigger.[1]
BT8-079.question: Q: Is this card’s inherited effect triggered by the activation of an effect that reads, “Reveal the top X cards of your deck... Trash the remaining cards.”?

BT8-082.question: Q: If both purple and yellow cards are in this card’s digivolution cards, can I activate both parts of this card’s [When Digivolving] effect?
Q: If a single purple and yellow multicolor card is in this card’s digivolution cards, can I activate both parts of this card’s [When Digivolving] effect?

BT8-084.answer: A: The effect allows this card to be treated as both white (its original color), and as the colors of its digivolution cards.  For example, if a red card and green card are in this card’s digivolution cards, this card is treated as a 3-color white/red/green card.[1]
BT8-084.question: Q: How does this card’s [Your Turn] effect work, exactly?

BT8-085.answer: A: No. The effect can only be activated if the Digimon itself has 2 or more colors.[1]
BT8-085.question: Q: This card has an effect that reads, “When one of your Digimon with 2 or more colors attacks”―does this include the colors of the attacking Digimon’s digivolution cards?

BT8-087.answer: A: No. The effect only triggers when your opponent chooses one of your blue Digimon as a target of attack.[1]
BT8-087.question: Q: Is this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect triggered when I block an opponent’s attack with one of my blue Digimon?

BT8-088.question: Q: Can I activate both parts of this card’s [Start of Your Main Phase] effect if I have both a blue Digimon and green Digimon in play?
Q: If I have a single blue and green multicolor Digimon in play, can I activate both parts of this card’s [Start of Your Main Phase] effect?

BT8-089.answer: A: No. The effect can only be activated if the Digimon itself has 2 or more colors.[1]
BT8-089.question: Q: This card has an effect that reads, “When one of your Digimon with 2 or more colors attacks”―does this include the colors of the attacking Digimon’s digivolution cards?

BT8-094.question: Q: Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect activate when an effect from a card like [BT1-089 Mimi Tachikawa] moves a level 3 Digimon from your opponent's breeding area to their battle area outside of their breeding phase?

BT8-094.answer: A: No, the main phase doesn't take place and the turn ends.[1]
BT8-094.question: Q: During the breeding phase, I move a Digimon from the breeding area to the battle area and due to this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect of my opponent, and the memory gauge moves to 1 or more on my opponent's side. In this case, do I have a main phase?

BT8-096.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  The effect is looking for a Digimon with a digivolution card that has 2 or more colors.[1]
BT8-096.question: Q: Does this card’s “If you have a Digimon in play with...2 or more colors in one of its digivolution cards” count a Digimon that has both a red card and a blue card in its digivolution cards?

BT8-096.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  Effects that grant additional colors don't do anything as digivolution cards, so the card is only treated as a single color.[1]
BT8-096.question: Q: Does this card’s “If you have a Digimon in play with...2 or more colors in one of its digivolution cards” count a Digimon with a card like [BT3-040 Shakkoumon]’s “This Digimon is also treated as blue” in its digivolution cards?

BT8-097.answer: A: No. It just reduces the cost of the card to 0.  Note that in general, costs can’t be reduced to less than 0.[1]
BT8-097.question: Q: If my opponent has 7 or more Digimon in play, does this card’s effect get reduced to negative 1, effectively gaining me a memory for using it?

BT8-097.answer: A: After the battle between the attacking Digimon and Security Digimon, the effect prevents the Digimon from being played, so it's placed in the trash.[1]
BT8-097.question: Q: I use this card, then attack my opponent. During the security check, I flip over a Digimon card with the effect, “[Security] At the end of the battle, play this card without paying its memory cost.”  What happens to this Security Digimon?

BT8-097.answer: A: Yes, they can't be played.  This card's [Main] effect was changed to "Your opponent can't play Digimon by effects until the end of their turn. Delete all of your opponent's Digimon with 6000 DP or less." Therefore, first the effect that prevents playing Digimon is applied, then Digimon with 6000 DP or less are deleted.  Please see the notices regarding changes to the rules/rulings on the official website.[1]
BT8-097.question: Q: My opponent used this card on my [BT7-063 DarkKnightmon].  [DarkKnightmon]'s [All Turns] effect is a "when this Digimon would be deleted" effect that interrupts deletion when it activates, but can I use this card's "your opponent can't play Digimon by effects until the end of their turn" effect to prevent [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] from being played from [DarkKnightmon]'s digivolution cards?

BT8-098.answer: A: No, you can't.  You can only specify Digimon that can't attack or block at the time this card’s effect is activated.[1]
BT8-098.question: Q: I use this card, but my opponent has no Digimon without digivolution cards in play, so I can't specify any Digimon that can't attack or block.  If my opponent later plays a Digimon without digivolution cards to their battle area, can I make that Digimon unable to attack or block?

BT8-100.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  The effect is looking for a Digimon with a digivolution card that has 2 or more colors.[1]
BT8-100.question: Q: Does this card’s “If you have a Digimon in play with...2 or more colors in one of its digivolution cards” count a Digimon that has both a red card and a blue card in its digivolution cards?

BT8-100.answer: A: No, it doesn't.  Effects that grant additional colors don't do anything as digivolution cards, so the card is only treated as a single color.[1]
BT8-100.question: Q: Does this card’s “If you have a Digimon in play with...2 or more colors in one of its digivolution cards” count a Digimon with a card like [BT3-040 Shakkoumon]’s “This Digimon is also treated as blue” in its digivolution cards?

BT8-101.question: Q: If I have 1 card with [Armor Form] in its traits in my trash, can I use this card's effect to give an opponent's Digimon -4000 DP, and then give it an additional -1000 DP with the second part of the effect?

BT8-102.answer: A: No. You can choose 1 of your opponent’s suspended Digimon or Tamers with this card's effect, but if you didn't use this effect to suspend that card, the “can't unsuspend until the end of their next turn” part of the effect doesn't apply.[1]
BT8-102.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to prevent 1 of my opponent's suspended Digimon or Tamers from unsuspending until the end of their turn?

BT8-105.answer: A: You can choose any number of your opponent's Digimon, as long as the play costs of the chosen Digimon add up to 15 or less. For example, you could choose 1 Digimon with a play cost of 3 and 1 Digimon with a play cost of 12, or 1 Digimon with a play cost of 2 and 2 Digimon with play costs of 6.[1]
BT8-105.question: Q: What does “Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose play costs add up to 15 or less” mean, exactly?

BT8-105.answer: A: Yes. As long as the total play costs of the chosen cards is less than 15, you can choose as many or as few cards as you like. However, note that you must choose a minimum of 1 Digimon with a play cost of 15 or less.[1]
BT8-105.question: Q: Can I choose fewer cards than possible, even if the play costs of the chosen cards add up to less than 15?

BT8-105.answer: A: No. Regardless of how a Digimon was played, only the play cost printed on the card is counted for this card’s effect.[1]
BT8-105.question: Q: My opponent uses effects to reduce play costs or play Digimon for free. Are Digimon played with these effects counted as having reduced play costs or play costs of 0 by this effect?

BT8-106.answer: A: Yes. As long as the total play costs of the chosen cards is less than 15, you can choose as many or as few cards as you like.[1]
BT8-106.question: Q: Can I choose fewer cards than possible, even if the play costs of the chosen cards add up to less than 15?
Q: This card's effect reads, "Digimon with a memory cost of 6 or less," but which cost is this referring to?

BT8-107.question: Q: If my opponent has no Digimon in play or no Digimon with a level less than or equal to one of my Digimon, can I still use this card’s effect to delete 1 of my Digimon?

BT8-109.answer: A: No, even though it will have 0 DP the Digimon will not be deleted until the effect of Flame Hellscythe is over. As such, you cannot play a Digimon via the effect of Flame Hellscythe. (Rules Processing)
BT8-109.question: Q: If my opponent has [BT9-047 Pomumon] or [BT9-033 Pillomon] in play. If I target that Digimon with the -6000 DP effect of this card. Can I still play a Digimon?

BT8-110.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you do, only the Digimon you chose to digivolve will unsuspend.[1]
BT8-110.question: Q: I use this card to trash the top card of 1 of my Digimon with [Armor Form] in its traits. Can I then digivolve one of my other Digimon into a Digimon card in my hand with [Armor Form] in its traits?

BT8-110.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you choose this option, however, no Digimon will be unsuspended with this effect.[1]
BT8-110.question: Q: I use this card to trash the top card of 1 of my Digimon with [Armor Form] in its traits. Can I then choose NOT to digivolve one of my other Digimon into a Digimon card in my hand with [Armor Form] in its traits?

BT8-110.answer: A: No. Digivolution requirements cannot be ignored unless an effect explicitly instructs you to ignore them.[1]
BT8-110.question: Q: When using this card’s effect to digivolve into a Digimon  in my hand with [Armor Form] in its traits, can I ignore its digivolution requirements?

BT8-111.answer: A: No. Even if you trash more than 4 cards with the effect, you can only play 1 level 5 or lower purple Digimon card.[1]
BT8-111.question: Q: If this card's [When Digivolving] effect trashes 8 cards from the top of my deck, can I play 2 level 5 or lower purple Digimon cards from my trash without paying their memory costs?

BT8-111.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “For every 10 cards in your trash,” so if you have 20 cards in your trash, you would trash the top 6 cards of your opponent’s deck and get +6000 DP.[1]
BT8-111.question: Q: If I have 20 cards in my trash, does this card's [When Attacking] effect trash the top 6 cards of my opponent’s deck and give this Digimon +6000 DP?

BT8-112.answer: A: This effect will activate in both timing [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking]. When you digivolving into this Digimon, it will activate as a [When Digivolving] effect, and for the following turns when this Digimon attacks, it will then activate again as a [When Attacking] effect.
BT8-112.question: Q: This card's effect has 2 timing, [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking]. What does that mean?

BT8-112.answer: A: No, you cannot. If you do not do <X> you cannot do the rest of the effect. (See more in Effect Structure#Optional and Mandatory Effects
BT8-112.question: Q: This card has "you may <X> to <Y>. Then, <Z>" If I do not do <X>, am I still allowed to do <Z>?

BT9-002.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when an effect returns one of my Digimon to my hand?
Q: I activate an effect that reads “＜Draw 1＞. Then, trash 1 card in your hand.” Even though I trashed a card in my hand, does the ＜Draw 1＞ allow me to activate this card’s inherited effect?

BT9-003.question: Q: I activate an effect that reads, “Add 1 card from your security to your hand. Then, <Recovery +1 (Deck)>.” Even though I lost a card from my security, does the <Recovery +1 (Deck)> allow me to activate this card’s inherited effect?

BT9-008.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a card with [Greymon] or [X Antibody] is among the cards revealed, you add it to your hand.[1]
BT9-008.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 3 cards. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [Greymon] or [X Antibody], do I still add a card to my hand?

BT9-008.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 card [...] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible. In this case, you must add both 1 card with [Greymon], and 1 [X Antibody] to your hand.[1]
BT9-008.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 3 cards. If both a card with [Greymon] and [X Antibody] are among the cards revealed, can I choose to add only one of them to my hand, and place the remaining card at the bottom of my deck?

BT9-009.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[1]
BT9-009.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

BT9-009.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[1]
BT9-009.question: Q: If "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activating, can the maximum be increased for an effect such as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP" that references a Digimon's DP for deletion?

BT9-011.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[1]
BT9-011.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

BT9-011.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[1]
BT9-011.question: Q: If "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activating, can the maximum be increased for an effect such as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP" that references a Digimon's DP for deletion?

BT9-012.answer: A: No. This effect requires you to trash two cards in this Digimon’s digivolution cards that are the same level as each other. The level of this Digimon doesn't matter.  For example, if there are two level 5 cards in this Digimon’s digivolution cards, you can trash both to prevent this Digimon from being deleted or returned to your hand or deck.[1]
BT9-012.question: Q: This card’s inherited effect reads, “you may trash 2 cards of the same level”. Does this mean I have to trash 2 cards that are the same level as this card?
Q: This card’s inherited effect reads, “you may trash 2 cards of the same level”. If this card is in this Digimon’s digivolution cards, can I include it as one of the trashed cards?

BT9-012.answer: A: No. When a Digimon is deleted after its DP is reduced to zero, it's considered to be deleted by the game rules, not an effect. This card’s effect only activates when the card is deleted by an effect, so it won't activate in this instance.[1]
BT9-012.question: Q: An opponent’s effect reduced this Digimon’s DP to zero, deleting it. Does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT9-013.answer: A: No. This effect specifies a card name, so you must have a card whose name is either [OmniShoutmon] or [X Antibody] in this Digimon’s digivolution cards. Having a card with [X Antibody] in its traits doesn't count.[1]
BT9-013.question: Q: This card’s effect reads, “While this Digimon has [OmniShoutmon] or [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards”. Does having a card with [X Antibody] in its traits count?

BT9-014.answer: A: No. This effect specifies a card name, so you must have a card whose name is either [WarGrowlmon] or [X Antibody] in this Digimon’s digivolution cards. Having a card with [X Antibody] in its traits doesn't count.[1]
BT9-014.question: Q: This card’s effect reads, “if [WarGrowlmon] or [X Antibody] in this Digimon’s digivolution cards”. Does having a card with [X Antibody] in its traits count?

BT9-015.answer: A: No. If a [MetalGreymon] or [X Antibody] isn’t in this Digimon’s digivolution cards at the time its [When Digivolving] effect activates, it doesn’t gain +3000 DP from its effect.[1]

BT9-016.answer: A: No. This effect specifies a card name, so you must have a card whose name is either [WarGreymon] or [X Antibody] in this Digimon’s digivolution cards. Having a card with [X Antibody] in its traits doesn't count.[1]

BT9-016.answer: A: Performing the check causes a card to be removed from your opponent’s security stack, causing this card’s [All Turns] effect to trigger. If you flip over a card with a [Security] effect, however, the [Security] effect will trigger afterwards, which means it will activate first.  After that, if there are no other triggered effects, you'll gain 1 memory before the battle with the Security Digimon.[1]
BT9-016.question: Q: I attack my opponent and perform a security check. Does this card’s [All Turns] effect cause me to gain 1 memory first, before the [Security] effect of the card I flipped over activates, or before the battle with my opponent's Security Digimon occurs?

BT9-017.answer: A: If no Digimon was deleted by this effect” refers to a state in which, when resolving this Digimon’s [When Digivolving] effect, your opponent doesn't have a Digimon in play, or you try to delete an opponent's Digimon that can't be deleted with the effect. Essentially, if you didn't delete a Digimon with the effect “Delete 1 of your opponent’s Digimon with the lowest DP,” follow the instructions listed after “If no Digimon was deleted by this effect...[1]
BT9-017.question: Q: This card’s [When Digivolving] effect reads, “Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with the lowest DP.” What situations does “If no Digimon is deleted by this effect” refer to, specifically?

BT9-017.answer: A: No. This effect reads, “Delete,” not “You may delete,” so if there’s a valid target in play, you must choose it with the effect. You can't choose to NOT activate the effect.[1]

BT9-017.answer: A: Yes. When there are multiple Digimon tied for lowest DP, you can choose any of them. This means you can choose the Digimon with the effect preventing deletion to get the “if no Digimon was deleted by this effect” part of the effect.[1]

Since the Digimon that activated ＜Blocker＞ was deleted, no battle occurs, and the attack ends.[1]

BT9-018.answer: A: Yes you can, as long as they are simultaneously suspended.[1]

BT9-018.answer: A: Yes, memory +1 for the number of tamers on the opponent.[2]

BT9-018.answer: A: After blocking, the target of the attack is changed to the blocked Digimon because it is deleted by the card's effect. Since the blocked Digimon has been deleted, no battle takes place and the attack is over.[3]

BT9-018.answer: A: Yes, it can be deleted.[4]

BT9-020.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 card [...] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible. In this case, you must add both 1 card with [Garurumon], and 1 [X Antibody] to your hand.[1]
