BT9-080.question: Q: If I have 1 or fewer security cards, can I still play a purple or yellow Digimon card with 6000 DP or less from my trash with this card’s [On Play] effect?
Q: If I have 1 or fewer security cards and activate this card’s [On Play] effect to play a level 6 or lower Digimon card with [Angel] or [Fallen Angel] in its traits, do I play it from my trash?

BT9-081.question: Q: If this card is in my trash, is it counted as a card with [Dex] by this card’s [On Deletion] effect?
Q: If there are 5 or more cards with [Dex] in my trash, can I still activate this card’s [On Deletion] effect to play a purple or black level 3 Digimon card from my trash?

BT9-082.answer: A: No, only this card itself is returned to play. Any digivolution cards it had are placed in your trash.[1]
BT9-082.question: Q: When playing this card from my trash with this card’s [On Deletion] effect, does it return to the battle area with any digivolution cards it had prior to being deleted?

BT9-082.answer: A: No. It’s treated as a new Digimon that just entered play. Any effects it had prior to being deleted are not carried over.[1]
BT9-082.question: Q: When playing this card from my trash with this card's [On Deletion] effect, do any effects it had prior to being deleted persist once it re-enters play?

BT9-083.answer: A: The player who controls this card decides.[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: When placing cards from my opponent's trash at the bottom of their deck with this card’s [When Digivolving] effect, who gets to decide the order of the cards?

BT9-083.answer: A: Digi-Egg cards in your opponent’s trash can be chosen as part of the effect, but they’re returned to the bottom of your opponent’s Digi-Egg deck instead of their normal deck.[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect let me place Digi-Egg cards from my opponent's trash at the bottom of their deck?

BT9-083.answer: A: No. Even if you have multiple cards with [Mega] in their traits, this effect will only place 10 cards from your opponent's trash at the bottom of their deck.[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: If there are 2 cards with [Mega] in their traits in this Digimon’s digivolution cards, do I get to place 20 cards from my opponent’s trash at the bottom of their deck with this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT9-083.answer: A: Yes, it does. Place as many cards as you can at the bottom of your opponent’s deck.[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: If my opponent has 9 or fewer cards in their trash, does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect still activate?

BT9-083.answer: A: No, you can't.  You must activate this effect at the start of your turn.[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect to avoid trashing any cards?

BT9-083.answer: A: Yes, it does.  While there are no cards in your opponent’s security stack to trash, you still perform the part of the effect that reads, “Trash the top card of this Digimon.”[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: Does this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect activate even when my opponent’s security stack is empty?

BT9-083.answer: A: No. When there are no digivolution cards, you can't perform "trash the top card of this Digimon," so it doesn't activate.[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect activate when this card has no digivolution cards?

BT9-083.answer: A: No. The [Start of Your Turn] effect on the [BT9-083 Omnimon: Merciful Mode] that was a digivolution card isn't yet in a state where it can activate at the start of your turn, therefore it doesn't trigger.[1]
BT9-083.question: Q: My turn starts when I have this card with [BT9-083 Omnimon: Merciful Mode] as its top digivolution card. If I use this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect to trash this card, then activate the [Start of Your Turn] effect on the [BT9-083 Omnimon: Merciful Mode] that was a digivolution card, can I trash a total of 2 cards from my opponent's security stack?

BT9-084.answer: A: Yes, you gain 2 memory if both of the conditions are met.[1]
BT9-084.question: Q: Do I gain 2 memory for this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect if both me and my opponent have 3 or fewer security cards?

BT9-085.answer: A: Yes, you gain 2 memory if both of the conditions are met.[1]
BT9-085.question: Q: Do I gain 2 memory for this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect if both me and my opponent have 8 or more cards in hand?
Q: Can I also activate this card’s [Your Turn] effect when one of my blue or red Digimon becomes unsuspended during the unsuspend phase?

BT9-087.answer: A: Yes, you gain 2 memory if both of the conditions are met.[1]
BT9-087.question: Q: Do I gain 2 memory for this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect if both me and my opponent have a level 5 or higher Digimon?

BT9-088.answer: A: Yes, you gain 2 memory if both of the conditions are met.[1]
BT9-088.question: Q: Do I gain 2 memory for this card’s [Start of Your Turn] effect if both me and my opponent have a suspended Digimon?

BT9-090.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a card with [Tapirmon] or a 2-color black card is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT9-090.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 3 cards. If the cards revealed only include either a [Tapirmon] or a 2-color black card, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT9-090.answer: A: No. Effects don't activate for cards revealed from your deck.[1]
BT9-090.question: Q: If a black Digimon with an effect such as "this Digimon is also treated as red" that treats it as a different color is among the cards revealed for this card's effect, can I add that card to my hand?

BT9-092.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a Digimon card with the [X Antibody] trait or an Option card with the [X Antibody] trait is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
BT9-092.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 3 cards. If the cards revealed only include a Digimon card with the [X Antibody] trait or an Option card with the [X Antibody] trait, can I still add a card to my hand?

BT9-092.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 [...] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible. In this situation, you must add both 1 Digimon card with the [X Antibody] trait and 1 Option card with the [X Antibody] trait to your hand.[1]
BT9-092.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 3 cards. If both a Digimon card with the [X Antibody] trait and an Option Card with the [X Antibody] trait are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the other at the bottom of my deck?

BT9-093.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore digivolution requirements when using this card's effect.[1]
BT9-093.question: Q: Can this card's [Main] effect digivolve a Digimon that doesn't meet the digivolution requirements into a Digimon card with [Shoutmon] in my hand?

BT9-094.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to delete my opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 11000 or less with an "add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect?

BT9-095.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's effect doesn't let you attack with a Digimon that's in a state where it can't attack.[1]
BT9-095.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to attack my opponent with 1 of my Digimon with [Greymon] that is suspended or was played in the same turn?

BT9-095.answer: A: No. [X Antibody] in this effect's text refers to the card name, therefore only a card with [X Antibody] as its card name will meet the condition. It doesn't refer to the [X Antibody] trait.[1]
BT9-095.question: Q: If a digivolution card has the [X Antibody] trait, does it meet this card's "if you have a Digimon with [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards in play" condition?
Q: When I use this card's [Main] effect to attack, does the attacking Digimon's [When Attacking] effect activate?

BT9-095.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's effect only allows you to attack a player.[1]
BT9-095.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to have one of my opponent's Digimon attack when one of my Digimon with [Greymon] has a "this Digimon can also attack your opponent's unsuspended Digimon" effect?

BT9-097.answer: A: No. [X Antibody] in this effect's text refers to the card name, therefore only a card with [X Antibody] as its card name will meet the condition. It doesn't refer to the [X Antibody] trait.[1]
BT9-097.question: Q: If a digivolution card has the [X Antibody] trait, does it meet this card's "if you have a Digimon with [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards in play" condition?

BT9-100.answer: A: No, you can't.  This card's effect doesn't let you attack with a Digimon that's in a state where it can't attack.[1]
BT9-100.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to attack an opponent's Digimon with my Digimon with the [Insectoid] trait that was played that turn?
Q: Can I attack one of my opponent's unsuspended Digimon with this card's effect?
Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to attack an opponent's Digimon with a "this Digimon can't be attacked" effect?

BT9-101.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you activate as many of the effects as possible.[1]
BT9-101.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect when my opponent only has a suspended Digimon or a Tamer?

BT9-102.answer: A: Yes. The effect applies to all of your Digimon that meet the conditions, therefore this effect will also affect Digimon that later enter the battle area as long as they meet the conditions.[1]
BT9-102.question: Q: After using this card, do level 6 Digimon with the [Machine] trait that are newly played or digivolved in the same turn gain ＜Rush＞ and ＜Blitz＞ from this card's effect?

BT9-103.answer: A: No. Cards can't be added to security stacks by your opponent's effects regardless of the card type or level (the effects will activate, but cards still can't be added to security stacks). The "your opponent's Digimon with play costs of 7 or less" refers to the "can't attack players" effect.[1]
BT9-103.question: Q: Does this card's "cards can't be added to security stacks by your opponent's effects" mean that effects that add cards to security stacks on "your opponent's Digimon with play costs of 7 or less" can't be activated?

BT9-103.answer: A: Due to this card's effect, cards can't be placed in security stacks, therefore [ST10-14 Chaos Degradation]'s "place 1 of your opponent's Digimon face down at the top or bottom of your opponent's security stack" can't be activated, and the target Digimon will be left as-is.[1]
BT9-103.question: Q: What happens if my opponent activates this card's effect and I use [ST10-14 Chaos Degradation]?

BT9-103.answer: A: Yes, the rest are placed in the security stack.  When returning cards that were revealed from a private area such as the deck or security stack by an effect, it isn't considered adding cards to such areas, therefore this card's effect doesn't apply.[1]
BT9-103.question: Q: While my opponent has this card's effect activated, I used [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)]'s effect to reveal all of my opponent's security cards.  After choosing and trashing 1 card among them, can the rest be placed in the security stack?

BT9-104.answer: A: No, this effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card that meets the digivolution requirements.[1]
BT9-104.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to digivolve into any of the cards revealed from my deck as long as they have the [X Antibody] trait?

BT9-105.question: Q: When choosing the target for "then, place 1 card with [X Antibody] in its traits from your trash under 1 of your Digimon with [X Antibody] in its traits as its bottom digivolution card" can I choose a card with the [X Antibody] trait that was revealed from my deck and trashed for this card's effect?

BT9-106.answer: A: No, this effect does not allow ignoring digivolution requirements, so you can only digivolve into a card from your trash that meets the digivolution requirements and has [Dex].[1]
BT9-106.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect to digivolve into any Digimon card from my trash as long as it has [Dex]?

BT9-106.answer: A: Yes, as long as the activation conditions are met.[1]
BT9-106.question: Q: Can I activate an effect that reduces the digivolution cost when digivolving using this card's [Main] effect?

BT9-107.answer: A: No, you can't.  This effect only activates ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) on 1 of your opponent's Digimon. For the part of the effect after "then," you can also choose a Digimon other than the target Digimon for ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.).[1]
BT9-107.question: Q: If I use this card's [Main] effect to trash 2 cards in my hand, can I activate ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) on 2 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT9-107.answer: A: ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) activates twice, ＜De-Digivolve  2＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 2 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) doesn't activate once.  Even if a Tamer card or Option card becomes the top card after trashing the top card, ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) can trash a card regardless of its card category, therefore you go on to trash the 2nd card. However, if a card with an "isn't affected by effects" becomes the top card after the first ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.), it won't be affected by the second ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) and won't be trashed.[1]
BT9-107.question: Q: When I use this card's [Main] effect to trash 2 cards in my hand, does ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) activate twice or does ＜De-Digivolve  2＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash up to 2 cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) activate once?

BT9-109.answer: A: Yes. This card's [Main] effect can place it in a Digimon’s digivolution cards, and it has inherited effects.  As with Digi-Egg cards and Digimon cards, this card's inherited effects can activate while it's placed in a Digimon’s digivolution cards.[1]
BT9-109.question: Q: Does this card have inherited effects even though it's an Option card?

BT9-109.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore digivolution requirements when using this card's effect.[1]
BT9-109.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect digivolve a Digimon that doesn't meet the digivolution requirements into a Digimon card with [X Antibody] in its traits in my hand?

BT9-109.answer: A: Yes, as long as the activation conditions are met.[1]
BT9-109.question: Q: Can I activate an effect that reduces the digivolution cost when digivolving using this card's inherited effect?

BT9-109.answer: A: No. Trashing by <Digi-Burst> is also trashing by an effect.[1]
BT9-109.question: Q: Can this card be trashed by <Digi-Burst> effects on Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards?

BT9-109.answer: A: As with Digimon without DP, this card can't exist in the battle area as the top card, therefore it's trashed. This isn't considered deletion.  If this card has other digivolution cards under it, they are also trashed.[1]
BT9-109.question: Q: What happens if this card becomes the top card after a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is affected by ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.)?

BT9-109.answer: A: Effects can't trash this card, therefore only the digivolution card on top of this card is trashed.[1]
BT9-109.question: Q: What happens if a "trash the bottom 2 digivolution cards of your opponent's Digimon" effect activates on a Digimon with this card as its bottom digivolution card?

BT9-109.answer: A: It can activate in such cases if you declare to trash 8 cards and then trash 7 cards except for [BT9-109 X Antibody].[1]
BT9-109.question: Q: There are 8 digivolution cards under [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper], and this card is the bottom card. Does the "you may trash 7 or more digivolution cards from the bottom of 1 of your [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper]s to set this Digimon's play cost to 0" effect activate when my [EX2-055 Reaper] is played?

BT9-110.question: Q: Does this card's "if there are 3 or more Digimon in play" refer to 3 or more total Digimon in play by both me and my opponent?

BT9-110.answer: A: No, you can't.  When there are 3 or more Digimon in play, you must delete all Digimon without [X Antibody] in their traits.[1]
BT9-110.question: Q: Can I activate just the "delete 1 Digimon without [X Antibody] in its traits" effect when there are 3 or more Digimon in play?

BT9-111.answer: A: No. In this case, your turn simply continues without switching over.[1]
BT9-111.question: Q: If this card’s [End of Your Turn] effect gains me enough memory to bring the memory gauge to 0 or greater on my side, does it briefly become my opponent’s turn before switching back to my turn again?

BT9-111.answer: A: Yes. You're not trashing it, so there’s nothing preventing you from returning it to your deck.[1]
BT9-111.question: Q: If [BT9-109 X Antibody] is in this card’s digivolution cards, can this card’s [End of Your Turn] effect return [BT9-109 X Antibody] from this card’s digivolution cards to the bottom of my deck?

BT9-112.answer: A: No, you reduce its memory cost by 3 based on the total number of Digimon and Tamer cards your opponent has in play.  For example, if your opponent has 2 Digimon and 1 Tamer, this adds up to 3 cards total, which means you get to reduce the play cost by 9.[1]
BT9-112.question: Q: When playing this card, do I reduce its memory cost by 3 for each pair of Digimon and Tamer cards my opponent has in play?

EX1-001.answer: A: No, you can only add one or the other.[1]
EX1-001.question: Q: If a Digimon card with [Agumon] and a Tamer card are among the cards revealed with this card’s inherited effect, can I add both to my hand?
Q: Can I add a non-red Digimon card with [Agumon] or a non-red Tamer card to my hand off this card’s inherited effect?

EX1-002.answer: A: Yes, it does.   [When Attacking] effects activate before your opponent gets to activate ＜Blocker＞.[1]
EX1-002.question: Q: I attack my opponent with a Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

EX1-003.answer: A: Yes, it does.   [When Attacking] effects activate before your opponent gets to activate ＜Blocker＞.[1]
EX1-003.question: Q: I attack my opponent with a Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

EX1-004.answer: A: No, this card's inherited effect can only play cards specifically named [Tai Kamiya].[1]
EX1-004.question: Q: Can I play cards that include [Tai Kamiya], like [BT5-093 Tai Kamiya & Matt Ishida], with this card's inherited effect?

EX1-005.answer: A: No. This card’s effects aren't activated when you reveal it from your deck with an effect. As such, the card isn't considered to be a green Digimon card, and can’t be added to your hand.[1]
EX1-005.question: Q: When this card is revealed from my deck with an effect like the one on [ST4-03 Tentomon], can I add it to my hand as if it was a green Digimon?

EX1-005.answer: A: If it’s your turn, then yes, you can.[1]
EX1-005.question: Q: If this Digimon is in my battle area, can I digivolve it into a Digimon with “Green/Level 4” digivolution requirements?

EX1-005.answer: A: No, you can't. Effects don't activate from breeding areas, so this Digimon isn't treated as green, and you can't digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a green level 4 Digimon.[1]
EX1-005.question: Q: If this Digimon is in my breeding area, can I digivolve it into a Digimon with “Green/Level 4” digivolution requirements?

EX1-006.answer: A: Yes, it does.   [When Attacking] effects activate before your opponent gets to activate ＜Blocker＞.[1]
EX1-006.question: Q: I attack my opponent with a Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

EX1-008.answer: A: Yes. ＜Piercing＞ has already activated. Perform the additional check, assuming your Digimon still has ＜Security A. +1＞.[1]
EX1-008.question: Q: I have a Digimon that gained ＜Security A. +1＞ from another card’s effect, and which also gained ＜Piercing＞ from this card’s inherited effect. I attack an opponent's Digimon with it, and perform a security check with ＜Piercing＞. The first card checked has a ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) [Security] effect, which trashes the top card of my attacking Digimon, turning it into a Digimon without [Machine] or [Dragonkin].   This causes the Digimon to also lose ＜Piercing＞. Do I still perform the second check?

EX1-008.answer: A: Yes, it does.   [When Attacking] effects activate before your opponent gets to activate ＜Blocker＞.[1]
EX1-008.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

EX1-009.answer: A: Yes, it does.   [When Attacking] effects activate before your opponent gets to activate ＜Blocker＞.[1]
EX1-009.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?
Q: If an opponent's Digimon gains ＜Blocker＞ from an effect or as an inherited effect from one of its digivolution cards, can I delete that Digimon with this card's effect?

EX1-010.answer: A: Yes, it does.   [When Attacking] effects activate before your opponent gets to activate ＜Blocker＞.[1]
EX1-010.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

EX1-011.answer: A: No, you can only add one or the other.[1]
EX1-011.question: Q: If a Digimon card with [Gabumon] and a Tamer card are among the cards revealed with this card’s inherited effect, can I add both to my hand?
Q: Can I add a non-blue Digimon card with [Gabumon] or a non-blue Tamer card to my hand off this card’s inherited effect?

EX1-013.answer: A: No. The Digimon is already unsuspended, so this card’s inherited effect doesn’t activate. The Digimon must go from suspended to unsuspended for the effect to activate.[1]
EX1-013.question: Q: During my main phase, I have an unsuspended Digimon in play with this card in its digivolution cards. If one of my effects unsuspends that Digimon, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

EX1-015.answer: A: No, this card's inherited effect can only play cards that are named [Matt Ishida].
EX1-015.question: Q: Can I play card with [Matt Ishida] in its name like [Tai Kamiya & Matt Ishida] with this card's effect?

EX1-019.answer: A: If you attack with a Digimon that has this inherited effect while the effect is active, your opponent's Digimon can't change the target of the attack by blocking.[1]
EX1-019.question: Q: This card’s inherited effect reads, “This Digimon can't be blocked.” How does this effect work, exactly?
Q: I have a Digimon with [Imperialdramon] and this card in its digivolution cards. Can it attack an opponent’s suspended Digimon?

EX1-019.answer: A: No, you can't. If your Digimon has the "...can't be blocked" effect, your opponent's Digimon can't block or suspend to block. [1]
EX1-019.question: Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon with [Imperialdramon] and this card in its digivolution cards. Even though I can't block it, can I still try to block with my Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ just to suspend my Digimon?

EX1-021.question: Q: If I have 5 cards in hand when activating this card’s [When Digivolving] effect, how much memory do I gain?
Q: If an opponent's Digimon gains an [On Deletion] effect from an effect or as an inherited effect from one of its digivolution cards, can this card's [When Attacking] effect target that Digimon?

EX1-022.answer: A: No. “For each color” refers to unique colors.   Blue is a single color, so the effect only grants +1000 DP.[1]
EX1-022.question: Q: If I have 4 blue cards in my digivolution cards, does this card’s [Your Turn] effect grant +4000 DP?

EX1-026.answer: A: No. So long as you had 3 or more security cards at the time you activated this card’s inherited effect, the -2000 DP will persist until the end of the turn, even if you end up with 2 or fewer security cards.[1]
EX1-026.question: Q: An opponent's Digimon gets -2000 DP from this card's inherited effect. During the same turn, I end up with 2 or fewer cards in my security stack. Does the -2000 DP granted by this card’s inherited effect go away?

EX1-027.answer: A: Yes. Flipping this card from your security stack reduces your total security cards from 4 to 3, so the effect activates.[1]
EX1-027.question: Q: I have 4 security cards left. My opponent attacks me with a Digimon, and flips this card from my security stack during their security check. Does <Recovery +1 (Deck)> activate off this card’s [Security] effect?

EX1-028.answer: A: No. So long as you had 3 or more security cards at the time you activated this card’s inherited effect, the +1000 DP will persist until the end of your opponent’s next turn, even if you end up with 2 or fewer security cards.[1]
EX1-028.question: Q: My Digimon gets +1000 DP from this card's inherited effect. During the same turn, I end up with 2 or fewer cards in my security stack. Does the +1000 DP granted by this card’s inherited effect go away?

EX1-029.answer: A: Yes. <Recovery +1 (Deck)> added a card to your security, so you gain 1 memory.[1]
EX1-029.question: Q: I have a Digimon in play with this card in its digivolution cards. [BT1-087 T.K. Takaishi]’s effect adds a yellow card from my security stack to my hand, and adds a card to my security stack with <Recovery +1 (Deck)>. The number of cards in my security stack ultimately remained the same, but can I still gain 1 memory from this card’s inherited effect?

EX1-029.answer: A: No. So long as you had 3 or more security cards at the time you activated this card’s inherited effect, the effect will persist until the end of your opponent’s next turn, even if you end up with 2 or fewer security cards.[1]
EX1-029.question: Q: This Digimon gets +4000 DP from its effect. During the same turn, I end up with 2 or fewer cards in my security stack. Does the +4000 DP granted by this card’s effect go away?

EX1-030.answer: A: Yes. The effect gives “all of your opponent’s Security Digimon -3000 DP for the turn,” so every Security Digimon flipped over for the duration of the turn gets -3000 DP.[1]
EX1-030.question: Q: This Digimon’s attack ends and I attack my opponent with another Digimon. Does this card’s [When Attacking] effect still give my opponent’s Security Digimon -3000 DP?

EX1-030.answer: A: No. So long as you had 3 or more security cards at the time you activated this card’s effect, the effect will persist until the end of the turn, even if you end up with 2 or fewer security cards.[1]
EX1-030.question: Q: After giving 1 of my opponent’s Digimon and all of my opponent’s Security Digimon -3000 DP, I end up with 2 or fewer security cards. Does this card’s -3000 DP effect go away?

EX1-032.question: Q: I digivolve this card while it’s unsuspended. Can I still trash the top card of my security stack with this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

EX1-033.answer: A: When any one of your Digimon digivolves, as long as it meets the requirements, the memory cost of the digivolution is reduced by 1.[1]
EX1-033.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect reduce the digivolution costs of my other Digimon, or just the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards?

EX1-033.answer: A: No. As long as it’s the same turn, the effect will persist until you digivolve into a Digimon card with [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in its traits.[1]
EX1-033.question: Q: I activate this card’s inherited effect, then digivolve into a Digimon without [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in its traits. Does this waste the inherited effect?

EX1-033.answer: A: Yes. Reduce the digivolution cost by 1 for each time that Digimon attacked during the same turn. However, once you digivolve into a Digimon card that has [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in its traits, the accumulated digivolution cost reductions from this effect will be reset.[1]
EX1-033.question: Q: If a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards somehow attacks 2 or more times in the same turn, does the -1 digivolution cost reduction stack?

EX1-033.answer: A: No, you can't reduce the memory cost of digivolutions performed in your breeding area with this card's inherited effect.[1]
EX1-033.question: Q: Can I reduce the memory cost of digivolutions in my breeding area with this card's inherited effect?

EX1-033.answer: A: No, it only reduces the memory cost by 1 when digivolving one of your Digimon into a Digimon card in your hand with [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect].[1]
EX1-033.question: Q: If I digivolve a Digimon with [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in my battle area into another Digimon, does this card’s inherited effect reduce the memory cost of that digivolution by 1?

EX1-035.answer: A: No, the time to trigger [When Attacking] effects has already passed, so the effect doesn't activate.[1]
EX1-035.question: Q: I digivolve using this card’s [When Attacking] effect. If the Digimon I digivolve into has a [When Attacking] effect, does that effect activate?

EX1-035.answer: A: The attack continues. The turn doesn’t switch over until the attack has ended.[1]
EX1-035.question: Q: When digivolving with this card's [When Attacking] effect, paying the digivolution cost moves the memory gauge to 1 or more on my opponent’s side. What happens to the attack?

EX1-038.answer: A: No, ＜Piercing＞ has already activated. Perform the additional check, assuming your Digimon still has ＜Security A. +1＞.[1]
EX1-038.question: Q: I have a Digimon that gained ＜Security A. +1＞ from another card’s effect, and which also gained ＜Piercing＞ from this card’s inherited effect. I attack an opponent's Digimon with it, and perform a security check with ＜Piercing＞. The first card checked has a ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ nocategory of your opponent's Digimon. (Trash the top card. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) [Security] effect, which trashes the top card of my attacking Digimon, turning it into a Digimon without [Free] in its traits or [Imperialdramon].   This causes the Digimon to also lose ＜Piercing＞. Do I still perform the second check?

EX1-040.answer: A: The attack continues, but the turn doesn't switch over yet.   If the memory gauge is still at 1 or more on your opponent’s side after the attack has ended and all effects triggered by it have been activated, only then does the turn end.[1]
EX1-040.question: Q: When digivolving with this card's [When Attacking] effect, paying the digivolution cost moves the memory gauge to 1 or more on my opponent’s side. What happens to the attack?

EX1-040.answer: A: No, the time to trigger [When Attacking] effects has already passed, so the effect doesn't activate.[1]
EX1-040.question: Q: I attack with [EX1-035 Kabuterimon] and digivolve into this card with its [When Attacking] effect. Can I then digivolve again during the same attack with this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

EX1-040.answer: A: No. The effect reads, “This Digimon can digivolve,” so you can choose not to.[1]
EX1-040.question: Q: If I have a card in hand with [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in its traits, does this card’s [When Attacking] effect force me to digivolve when attacking?

EX1-040.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore its digivolution requirements.[1]
EX1-040.question: Q: When digivolving into a Digimon card with [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in its traits in my hand with this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect, can I ignore that card's digivolution requirements?

EX1-043.answer: A: Yes. It doesn't matter which of your Digimon is the one deleting the opponent's Digimon in battle and surviving. As long as it has [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in its traits, you can unsuspend this Digimon.[1]
EX1-043.question: Q: Can this Digimon's effect unsuspend this Digimon when any of my Digimon with [Insectoid] or [Ancient Insect] in their traits deletes an opponent's Digimon in battle and survives?

EX1-044.answer: A: No. It’s not referring to this card’s name, but the name of the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards.[1]
EX1-044.question: Q: Does “the same name as this Digimon” refer to Digimon with the name [Keramon]?

EX1-046.answer: A: No. It’s not referring to this card’s name, but the name of the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards.[1]
EX1-046.question: Q: Does “the same name as this Digimon” refer to Digimon with the name [Kurisarimon]?

EX1-048.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may,” so you can choose not to activate it.   However, after revealing cards from the top of your deck, you must perform the rest of the effect to the best of your ability.[1]
EX1-048.question: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect when digivolving?

EX1-049.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may,” so you can choose not to activate it.   However, after revealing cards from the top of your deck, you must perform the rest of the effect to the best of your ability.[1]
EX1-049.question: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect when digivolving?

EX1-050.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may,” so you can choose not to activate it.   However, after revealing cards from the top of your deck, you must perform the rest of the effect to the best of your ability.[1]
EX1-050.question: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect when digivolving?

EX1-051.answer: A: No, the effect doesn't count Digimon in breeding areas.[1]
EX1-051.question: Q: Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect activate when an opponent’s Digimon in their breeding area digivolves into a level 5 or higher Digimon?

EX1-051.answer: A: No. It’s not referring to this card’s name, but the name of the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards.[1]
EX1-051.question: Q: Does “the same name as this Digimon” refer to Digimon with the name [Infermon]?

EX1-051.answer: A: No, this Digimon is deleted before its effect can activate.[1]
EX1-051.question: Q: My opponent digivolves one of their Digimon into a level 5 or higher Digimon, and deletes this Digimon with its [When Digivolving] effect. Do I gain 1 memory from this Digimon's [Opponent's Turn] effect?

EX1-052.answer: A: No, the effect doesn’t activate for Digimon in breeding areas.[1]
EX1-052.question: Q: This Digimon is in my breeding area. If I digivolve it into a Digimon card with [Etemon] in my hand, is the memory cost of the digivolution reduced by 1?

EX1-055.answer: A: No. Even if multiple Digimon are deleted simultaneously, you can't draw more than 1 card per turn with this card's inherited effect.[1]
EX1-055.question: Q: If a single effect deletes 2 of my opponent’s Digimon, do I draw 2 cards with this card's inherited effect?

EX1-056.answer: A: Yes, it can attack your opponent.[1]
EX1-056.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack my opponent when I don't have a Digimon with [Myotismon] in play?

EX1-056.answer: A: This card’s [Your Turn] effect only prevents you from declaring an opponent's Digimon as the target of the attack. If this Digimon is blocked, conduct the battle between the two Digimon as normal.[1]
EX1-056.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon while I don't have a Digimon with [Myotismon] in play, and it’s blocked by an opponent’s Digimon. What happens?

EX1-058.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect return this card to its owner's hand?

EX1-058.answer: A: Yes, you must return a card to your hand.[1]
EX1-058.question: Q: When activating this card’s inherited effect, am I required to return a level 4 or lower Digimon card from my trash to my hand?

EX1-060.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may,” so you can choose not to activate it.[1]
EX1-060.question: Q: Can I choose not to activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect when digivolving?

EX1-061.answer: A: No, the effect doesn’t activate for Digimon in breeding areas.[1]
EX1-061.question: Q: This Digimon is in my breeding area. If I digivolve it into a Digimon card with [Myotismon] in my hand, is the memory cost of the digivolution reduced by 1?

EX1-062.answer: A: No. This card is no longer in play at the end of the attack, so the [End of Attack] effect doesn't activate.[1]
EX1-062.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon and flip over [BT2-105 Spider Shooter] during the security check. The ＜De-Digivolve  nocategory＞ (Trash up to nocategory cards from the top. You can't trash past level 3 cards.) trashes this card. Does this card’s [End of Attack] effect activate?

EX1-062.answer: A: No, this card’s [On Deletion] effect can only play cards whose names are specifically [Agumon].[1]
EX1-062.question: Q: Can this card's [On Deletion] effect play an [Agumon Expert] or an [Agumon - Bond of Bravery] from my trash?

EX1-063.question: Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect play a purple level 4 or lower Digimon card with ＜Retaliation＞ as its inherited effect from my trash?

EX1-064.answer: A: No. Even if multiple Digimon are deleted simultaneously, you can't draw more than 1 card per turn with this card's inherited effect.[1]
EX1-064.question: Q: This Digimon's [On Play] effect deletes 4 of my opponent's Digimon. Does this Digimon’s [Your Turn] effect cause me to draw 4 cards?

EX1-065.answer: A: No. If your [Diaboromon] was deleted by a [When Attacking] effect, your [Diaboromon] Token will have already lost ＜Blocker＞ by the time you reach blocker timing.[1]
EX1-065.question: Q: I have this Digimon and a [Diaboromon] Token in my battle area. My opponent attacks with a Digimon, and deletes this Digimon with a [When Attacking] effect. Can I block the attack with my [Diaboromon] Token?

EX1-065.answer: A: Yes. The [Security] effect activates as soon as the card is flipped during the security check, which means you can play the Token regardless of the battle's outcome.[1]
EX1-065.question: Q: Can I play a Token with this card’s [Security] effect at the end of the battle even if this card loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?

EX1-065.answer: A: The Token is played first. Once all [Security] effects and effects triggered by battle have been activated, proceed to the next security check.[1]
EX1-065.question: Q: This card is flipped over during a security check, but the attacking Digimon still has security checks remaining. Is the Token played off this Digimon’s [Security] effect first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?

EX1-066.answer: A: Yes, you can. You can't hatch a Digi-Egg card, however.[1]
EX1-066.question: Q: One of my level 5 or higher Digimon with a digivolution card is deleted. Can I suspend this Tamer and gain 1 memory with this card's [All Turns] effect even if my breeding area isn't empty?

EX1-067.answer: A: No, it deletes a single Digimon that fulfils both conditions.
EX1-067.question: Q: Does this card delete 1 Digimon that has both ＜Blocker＞ and 1 Digimon with 6000 DP or less each?

EX1-068.answer: A: Your opponent loses the 2 memory. The memory marker will be moved 2 spaces towards you every time your opponent attacks with a Digimon.[1]
EX1-068.question: Q: If I use this card, do I lose 2 memory every time my opponent attacks with a Digimon?

EX1-068.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “All of your opponent’s Digimon,” so any Digimon that enter the battle area after you use this card are still affected.[1]
EX1-068.question: Q: I use this card. During my opponent’s next turn, if they play a new Digimon or move a Digimon from their breeding area to their battle area, will those Digimon have “[When Attacking] Loses 2 memory” from this card’s effect?

EX1-068.answer: A: Yes. Even if you have 1 or more memory, the attack with ＜Blitz＞ still takes place during your opponent's turn, which means that this card's effect is still active, and your opponent still loses 2 memory.[1]
EX1-068.question: Q: I use this card. During my opponent’s next turn, they attack me with their Digimon's ＜Blitz＞ effect while I have 1 or more memory. Does my opponent still lose 2 memory?

EX1-071.answer: A: You can trash a red Digimon card to reduce the digivolution cost.   The card you can trash with this effect must match the color of the Digimon performing the digivolution in your battle area.[1]
EX1-071.question: Q: After using this card, I digivolve a red Digimon into a white Digimon card. What color card can I trash from my hand to reduce the memory cost of the digivolution?

EX1-071.answer: A: No, this effect can't reduce digivolution costs of Digimon in breeding areas.[1]
EX1-071.question: Q: I’m digivolving a Digimon in my breeding area. Can I reduce the digivolution cost by 4 with this card's effect?

Q: During the turn I use this card, if I have a blue Digimon in my battle area with an effect that reads, “This Digimon is also treated as red,” can I trash a red Digimon card in my hand to reduce the digivolution cost by 4?

EX1-071.answer: A: No, you can't.  You don't trash the card in your hand with this effect until you digivolve. [BT7-085 Takuya Kanbara]’s [Main] effect reads, “You may place 5 cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from your trash under this Tamer in any order,” and is used to digivolve into [EmperorGreymon]. As such, you place the cards under [Takuya Kanbara] before you begin digivolving, at which point you can trash a card in your hand with this card's effect.[1]
EX1-071.question: Q: After using this card, I activate [BT7-085 Takuya Kanbara]’s [Main] effect. Can I use this card's effect specifically to trash cards with [Hybrid] in their traits from my hand, so that I can place them under [Takuya Kanbara] using its effect?

EX1-071.answer: A: The card you trash can match any one of the Digimon’s colors.   For example, when digivolving a blue/green Digimon, you can trash either a blue or a green card.[1]
EX1-071.question: Q: When digivolving from a multicolor Digimon, what color cards can I trash with this card’s effect to reduce the digivolution cost?

EX1-071.answer: A: Yes, you can.  The card you trash can match any of the colors of either Digimon. For example, when DNA digivolving a blue Digimon and green Digimon, you can trash either a blue or green card.[1]
EX1-071.question: Q: Can I reduce the memory cost of a DNA digivolution with this card's effect?   If I can, what color cards can I trash with this card’s effect?

Q: After using this card, can I reduce the digivolution cost of my digivolving Digimon by trashing 1 Digimon card in the hand with the same color when an effect to digivolve one of my Digimon is activated?

EX1-072.answer: A: Yes. An Option card’s [Security] effect is not considered to be the same thing as using an Option card, so it activates normally.[1]
EX1-072.question: Q: I use this card, then attack my opponent. If an Option card with a [Security] effect is flipped over during the security check, does its effect activate?

EX1-072.answer: A: Yes. Activating ＜Delay＞ on an Option card that was already placed in your battle area is not considered to be the same thing as using an Option card, so it activates normally.[1]
EX1-072.question: Q: My opponent uses this card and passes the turn back to me. Can I activate ＜Delay＞ on an Option card that was already placed in my battle area?

EX1-073.answer: A: Cards that meet all of the conditions below and have unique card numbers can be placed in this card’s Digivolution cards with this card's [On Play] effect. -The cards must be in your hand or trash. -The cards must have [Cyborg] in their traits. -The cards must be red or black Digimon cards. -The cards must be level 5 Digimon cards.[1]
EX1-073.question: Q: Can you explain in detail which cards I can place in this card’s digivolution cards with this card’s [On Play] effect?

EX1-073.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may trash,” so you can choose not to trash any cards.[1]
EX1-073.question: Q: When this card is deleted, can I choose not to trash 2 of its digivolution cards?

EX2-003.answer: A: No. [BT2-099 Glorious Burst]’s cost has been changed to 1, so using it isn’t considered to be using an Option card with a cost of 2 or more.[1]
EX2-003.question: Q: I have 8 or more yellow Tamers in play, and use [BT2-099 Glorious Burst]. Can I activate this card's inherited effect?

EX2-003.answer: A: Yes. When you use [BT7-100 Qualialise Blast]’s effect, it changes the cost paid to the number of cards in your security stack, but doesn't change the cost of the card itself. As such, the game considers you to have used an Option card with a cost of 5, allowing you to activate this card’s inherited effect.[1]
EX2-003.question: Q: I have 1 card in my security stack. If I use [BT7-100 Qualialise Blast], can I activate this card’s inherited effect?

EX2-003.answer: A: Yes. Effects that use Option cards without paying their costs are skipping the costs entirely, not changing them.[1]
EX2-003.question: Q: I use an Option card with a cost of 2 or more by an effect that reads, “Use an Option card without paying its cost.” Can I activate this card’s inherited effect?

EX2-004.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when my opponent suspends a Digimon by blocking?

EX2-007.answer: A: This card is a Digi-Egg card, so it goes in your Digi-Egg deck.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: Does this card go in my deck, or my Digi-Egg deck?

EX2-007.answer: A: It’s placed in your breeding area as a level-less Digimon.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: When I hatch this card during my breeding phase, do I place it in my breeding area, or my battle area?

EX2-007.answer: A: No. Cards that don't have levels can't be digivolved from. (Other than through special digivolutions.)[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: This card doesn't have a level. Can I still digivolve it into other cards?

EX2-007.answer: A: It can be moved from your breeding area to your battle area like any other Digimon.  Level 2 Digimon don't have DP, and therefore can't be moved to your battle area. This card has DP, which means it can be moved to your battle area without digivolving it.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: If this card is in my breeding area, how do I move it to my battle area?

EX2-007.answer: A: No, you can’t activate effects in the breeding area.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: If this card is in my breeding area, can I activate its [Main] effect to place my [ADR-02 Searcher] in its digivolution cards?

EX2-007.answer: A: Yes, it can.  “This Digimon can also attack unsuspended Digimon” is an effect that only affects the Digimon that has it, so this card's “This Digimon [...] isn't affected by your opponent’s effects” effect can’t be used to prevent the attack.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: If this card is in my battle area, can it be attacked by my opponent’s Digimon with an effect that reads “This Digimon can also attack unsuspended Digimon”?

EX2-007.answer: A: Yes, this card can be deleted as a result of battle.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: This card is in my battle area. If an opponent’s Digimon attacks it, and this card’s DP is less than or equal to the opponent’s Digimon, is this card deleted?

EX2-007.answer: A: Yes, this card is affected by effects you activate. [1]
EX2-007.question: Q: Is this Digimon affected by effects like “Delete 1 of your Digimon,” or “Suspend 1 of your Digimon” that I activate?

EX2-007.answer: A: Yes, you can. However, since this card is a Digi-Egg card, note that if this card would be moved to your hand, deck, or security stack, it’s instead placed at the bottom of your Digi-Egg deck face down.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: If this card is in my battle area, can my own effects delete it or move it to my hand/deck/security stack?
Q: If I play two cards with [D-Reaper] in their traits, can I choose not to activate this card’s [Your Turn] effect for the first card, and activate it for the second?

EX2-007.answer: A: No. [BT8-071 Psychemon]’s effect doesn’t target Digimon themselves, so you can’t activate this card's effect to reduce the play cost of cards.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: My opponent has [BT8-071 Psychemon] in play. Can this Digimon’s [Your Turn] effect still reduce the play cost of cards with [D-Reaper] in their traits when I would play them?

EX2-007.answer: A: No. This card is a Digi-Egg card, so if it would be moved to your security stack, it’s instead placed at the bottom of your Digi-Egg deck face down.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: If I use [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] on this card, can I place it on top of my security stack face down?
Q: Can I specify my opponent’s [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] as the target of an effect?

EX2-007.answer: A: No. It’s only this Digimon that isn't affected. The other Digimon will be affected as normal.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: If an effect that targets multiple Digimon is also targeting my opponent's [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper], is the effect canceled, preventing it from affecting the other targeted Digimon?

EX2-007.answer: A: No. You will only place the topmost [ADR-02 Searcher] in this Digimon’s digivolution cards. All of [ADR-02 Searcher]’s digivolution cards are trashed.[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: I have an [ADR-02 Searcher] with 1 or more digivolution cards in play. If I place it in this Digimon's digivolution cards with this card's [Main] effect, do I also get to place [ADR-02 Searcher]’s digivolution cards under it as well?

EX2-007.answer: A: It can activate in such cases if you declare to trash 8 cards and then trash 7 cards except for [X Antibody].[1]
EX2-007.question: Q: There are 8 digivolution cards under this card, and [BT9-109 X Antibody] is the bottom card. Does the "you may trash 7 or more digivolution cards from the bottom of 1 of your [Mother D-Reaper]s to set this Digimon's play cost to 0" effect activate when my [EX2-055 Reaper] is played?

EX2-008.answer: A: Yes, as long as either a card with [Growlmon] or [Takato Matsuki] is among the cards revealed, you can add it to your hand.[1]
EX2-008.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 4 cards. If the cards revealed only include either a card with [Growlmon] or [Takato Matsuki], can I still add a card to my hand?

EX2-008.answer: A: No. This card's effect reads “Add 1 card [...] and 1 [Takato Matsuki] among them to your hand,” so you must add as many cards to your hand as possible. In this case, you must add both 1 card with [Growlmon], and 1 [Takato Matsuki] to your hand.[1]
EX2-008.question: Q: This card’s effect reveals 4 cards. If both a card with [Growlmon] and [Takato Matsuki] are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining card at the bottom of my deck?

EX2-010.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[1]
EX2-010.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

EX2-010.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[1]
EX2-010.question: Q: If "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activating, can the maximum be increased for an effect such as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP" that references a Digimon's DP for deletion?

EX2-010.answer: A: It adds 1000 to the maximum DP you can choose with all of your effects.[1]
EX2-010.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect add 1000 to the maximum DP I can choose with other effects, or just the effects on the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards?

EX2-011.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[1]
EX2-011.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

EX2-011.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[1]
EX2-011.question: Q: If "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activating, can the maximum be increased for an effect such as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP" that references a Digimon's DP for deletion?

EX2-011.answer: A: Yes, it is.  If you have a red Tamer in play, you can choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 8000 or less.[1]
EX2-011.question: Q: Is this card’s [When Attacking] “Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 6000 or less and delete them” effect also affected by its “add 2000 to the maximum DP you can choose with DP-based deletion effects” effect?
Q: Does this card's “add 2000 to the maximum DP you can choose with DP-based deletion effects” effect also raise the maximum DP I can choose with other deletion effects besides those on this card?

EX2-012.answer: A: If no Digimon was deleted by this effect” refers to a state in which, when resolving this Digimon’s [When Digivolving] effect, your opponent doesn't have a Digimon with 10000 DP or less in play, or you try to delete an opponent's suitable Digimon can't be deleted with the effect. Essentially, if you didn't delete a Digimon by “Delete 1 of your opponent’s Digimon with 10000 DP or less,” follow the instructions listed after “If no Digimon was deleted by this effect...[1]
EX2-012.question: Q: This card’s [When Digivolving] effect reads “Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 10000 DP or less. If no Digimon was deleted by this effect...” What situations does “If no Digimon was deleted by this effect” refer to, specifically?

EX2-012.answer: A: No. If there’s a valid target in play, you must choose it with the effect.  You can't choose to NOT activate the effect.[1]
EX2-012.question: Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 10000 DP or less in play. Can I choose not to delete my opponent’s Digimon with this card’s [When Digivolving] effect so we both trash the top 5 cards of our deck?

EX2-012.answer: A: Yes. You can choose your opponent’s Digimon with 10000 DP or less as a target, even if the chosen Digimon has an effect that prevents it from being deleted, in order to get the “if no Digimon was deleted by this effect” part of the effect.[1]
EX2-012.question: Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 10000 DP or less and an effect that reads, “This Digimon can't be deleted by your opponent’s effects,” and another Digimon with 10000 DP or less but no effect. As such, the condition is satisfied for "if no Digimon was deleted by this effect," and both players will trash the top 5 cards of their decks.[1]

EX2-070.answer: A: No, those effects are only active when the digivolution is taking place, which means they reduce the digivolution cost after a player has announced a digivolution. As such, at the time this card's effect is activated, the digivolution cost hasn't been reduced, and you can't choose the card with this card’s effect.[1]

EX2-070.answer: A: No. Even if the card has a digivolution requirement with a cost of 3, if you want to digivolve off the requirement with a cost of 4, you can’t use this card to digivolve.[1]

EX3-024.answer: A: When this Digimon is suspended effects and the [When Attacking] effect are triggered by a single effect, therefore they are considered to trigger simultaneously. EX3-024.question: Q: I used this card's [Start of Opponent's Main Phase] to suspend my [EX3-044 Breakdramon] or [EX3-074 Examon] and had my opponent attack. EX4-058.question: Q: Do I or my opponent choose the card to be trashed from their hand when I activate this card's [On Deletion] effect?

EX4-059.question: Q: This card's [When Digivolving] effect gave my level 5 Digimon the "[On Deletion] You may play this card without paying the cost" effect. If it later digivolves, becomes level 6 or higher, and is then deleted, does this [On Deletion] effect activate?

EX4-060.answer: A: This effect is a ""would"" effect, so its activation comes first and interrupts [BT11-109 Astral Snatcher]'s effect that places this card in digivolution cards. Therefore, you play 1 [BlitzGreymon] and 1 [CresGarurumon] from the digivolution cards without paying the costs, then place this Digimon at the bottom of your security stack face down. [BT11-109 Astral Snatcher]'s effect that places a card as the bottom digivolution card under another Digimon will fail because its target has been removed.[1]
EX4-060.question: Q: When [BT11-109 Astral Snatcher]'s effect places this card in another Digimon’s digivolution cards, does this card’s [All Turns] effect activate?

EX4-062.answer: A: Yes. If you and your opponent have a total of 2 or more Digimon in play, the effect activates.[1]
EX4-062.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect activate if there are 2 or more Digimon in the battle areas including my opponent's Digimon, rather than just my Digimon?

EX4-062.answer: A: No, you can't. Even if you have multiple Tamers with cards under them, you can only use 1 card from under 1 of them when you choose cards for a DigiXros.[1]
EX4-062.question: Q: If I have multiple Tamers with cards under them, can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to perform a DigiXros for each of my Tamers using a card from under each one?

EX4-062.answer: A: This is a special rule for this card that always treats it as if it also has the [Kiriha Aonuma] and [Nene Amano] names.[2]
EX4-062.question: Q: What does this card's (Rule) mean, exactly?  (*This card's "The name of this card/Tamer is also treated as [Kiriha Aonuma]/[Nene Amano]" has been changed to "(Rule) Name: Also treated as [Kiriha Aonuma] and [Nene Amano].")

EX4-068.answer: A: Yes. This [Main] effect activates again for each color your Digimon have, and you get to choose the target for each activation.[1]

EX4-068.answer: A: No, they're treated as activating at the same timing.[1]

EX4-068.answer: A: No, multiple instances of the same color count as 1 color. Therefore, for the situation stated in your question, red, blue, and black would count as 3 colors, so the effect would activate four times.[1]
EX4-068.question: Q: If I have a red/blue Digimon and a red/black Digimon, do they count as 4 colors and make this card's [Main] effect activate five times?

EX4-068.answer: A: Yes, this effect activates multiple times, so you can choose different targets each time it activates.[1]

EX4-069.answer: A: The player that uses this card chooses.[1]

EX5-048.answer: A: The effects trigger at the same time at the start of your opponent's main phase, and an attack is only performed for the effect that activated first. In this case, your opponent's Digimon was level 4 when this card's [All Turns] effect triggered, therefore you can play a level 4 or lower Digimon.[2]

EX5-070.question: Q: If a Digimon has this card in its digivolution cards, does that mean that it isn't treated as "1 of your Digimon without [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards"?

EX5-070.answer: A: No, it activates even if only this card is in the digivolution cards.[1]
EX5-070.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect only activate if both [X Antibody] and a Digimon card are in the digivolution cards?

Q: If a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards would be deleted other than by one of my effects, then an effect such as ＜Decoy (nocategory)＞ (When your other nocategory Digimon would be deleted by an opponent's effect, you may delete this Digimon to prevent 1 of those Digimon's deletion.) prevents it from being deleted, does this card's inherited effect activate?

EX5-070.answer: A: No, you can't.  If digivolution isn't performed using this card's effect, you can't place this card in digivolution cards.[1]
EX5-070.question: Q: Can I use this card and then place this card in digivolution cards without digivolving 1 of my Digimon without [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards?

Q: If I use this card's effect to reveal an Option card with the [Deva] or [Four Sovereigns] trait from my deck, can I place that card as the bottom digivolution card of my Digimon?

EX5-072.question: Q: Does "when this card would be used, reduce the cost by 1 for each [Deva] or [Four Sovereigns] trait card with a different name in your trash" include this card itself when I use it?

EX5-073.answer: A: No, it doesn’t.  If this effect is activated [When Attacking], only "delete 1 of their Digimon with as many or fewer digivolution cards as this Digimon" activates.[1]
EX5-073.question: Q: If this Digimon attacks after DNA digivolving, does "if DNA digivolving, trash any 8 digivolution cards from your opponent's Digimon" in this card's [When Attacking] effect activate?
Q: Does "then, delete 1 of their Digimon with as many or fewer digivolution cards as this Digimon" in this card's [When Digivolving][When Attacking] effect activate even when not DNA digivolving?

EX5-073.answer: A: No, as many as possible are trashed.[1]
EX5-073.question: Q: If my opponent's Digimon have less than 8 digivolution cards when this card's [When Digivolving][When Attacking] effect activates, does that mean that those digivolution cards can't be trashed?

EX5-074.answer: A: Yes, it can.  ＜Raid＞ and “this Digimon can also attack unsuspended Digimon” effects affect the attacking Digimon itself, so such effects aren't affected by "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effects.[1]
EX5-074.question: Q: Can this Digimon be attacked by my opponent’s Digimon with ＜Raid＞ or a “this Digimon can also attack unsuspended Digimon” effect?

EX5-074.answer: A: Yes, it isn't affected.  [Security] effects on Security Digimon are treated as Digimon effects, so the "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effect prevents such effects from affecting this Digimon.[1]
EX5-074.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect prevent [Security] effects on my opponent's Security Digimon from affecting this Digimon?

At such times, is a card considered to be added to my security stack, allowing "when a card is added to your security stack" effects to activate?

At such times, is a card considered to be removed from my security stack, allowing "when a card is removed from your security stack" effects to activate?

EX6-006.answer: A: Yes, you must delete them.[1]

EX6-007.answer: A: No, you can't.  The activation conditions include paying 1 cost and placing this card as 1 of your [Legend-Arms] trait or 1 of your level 3 Digimon's bottom digivolution card, therefore the effect can't be activated just by paying 1 cost.[1]

EX6-042.answer: A: At the start of your opponent's main phase, the effects gained from this card's effect are triggered at the same time, and your opponent determines which one activates first. EX8-055.answer: A: No, you can't.  A "by doing X" condition can't be met if only some of the required actions are performed.  The conditions for this [When Digivolving] [When Attacking] effect require you to trash the specified number of digivolution cards.[1]
EX8-055.question: Q: Can I trash just 2 digivolution cards for the conditions of this card's [When Digivolving] [When Attacking] effect?
Q: Can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to place Digi-Egg cards with the [Mineral] or [Rock] trait from my trash as digivolution cards?

EX8-055.answer: A: No, you can't.  If this card's [End of Your Turn] effect activates, you must place at least 1 card in digivolution cards.  However, if you choose to not activate this effect, it won't activate and you don't place any cards in digivolution cards.[1]
EX8-055.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [End of Your Turn] effect but choose to not to place cards with the [Mineral] or [Rock] trait from my trash as this Digimon's bottom digivolution cards?

EX8-060.question: Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect trigger when this card itself is played?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect trigger when a card digivolves into this card itself?

EX8-060.answer: A: No, it can't attack. A new attack declaration can't be made during an attack.[1]
EX8-060.question: Q: This card attacks, and I use its [When Attacking] effect to play an [NSo] trait Digimon.  If I then use this card's [Your Turn] effect to DNA digivolve using 2 of my Digimon, can I use that Digimon to attack?

EX8-060.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the player can choose the activation order.[1]
EX8-060.question: Q: I used this card's [Your Turn] effect to DNA digivolve, then I attacked using that Digimon.  At such times, in what order can I activate that Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect and [When Attacking] effect?

EX8-061.answer: A: It refers to when the memory gauge is at 1 or further to the left on your side.[1]
EX8-061.question: Q: What position on the memory gauge does "if you have 1 or more memory" refer to?

EX8-061.answer: A: It can play 1 level 4 or lower Digimon card with the [DS] trait, 1 level 4 or lower Digimon card with the [Mollusk] trait, or 1 level 4 or lower Digimon card with the [Crustacean] trait.[1]
EX8-061.question: Q: What cards can be played using this card's [When Attacking] effect?

EX8-061.answer: A: It can play 1 level 4 or lower Digimon card with the [DS] trait, 1 level 4 or lower Digimon card with the [Mollusk] trait, or 1 level 4 or lower Digimon card with the [Crustacean] trait.[1]
EX8-061.question: Q: What cards can be played using this card's inherited effect?

EX8-062.question: Q: Can I use "・1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -2000 DP for the turn" in this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to give the same Digimon -2000 DP multiple times?
Q: Can I use "・1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -2000 DP for the turn" in this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to give different Digimon -2000 DP?

EX8-062.answer: A: No, it isn't deleted yet.  This card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect activates "・1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -2000 DP for the turn" 4 times, then all Digimon with 0 DP are deleted at the same timing.[1]
EX8-062.question: Q: I activated "・1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -2000 DP for the turn" in this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect once, and the DP of the opponent's Digimon was reduced to 0.  Is that Digimon deleted before the effect activates 3 more times?

EX8-064.answer: A: Yes, it triggers.  Even if you use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to reduce the DP of an opponent's Digimon to 0, it isn't yet deleted at that time. After you play EX8-062 [Piedmon ACE] from your trash and this effect is resolved, then all Digimon with 0 DP are deleted at the same timing.  Digimon with a DP of 0 are deleted after playing EX8-062 [Piedmon ACE], then EX8-062 [Piedmon ACE]'s [All Turns] effect will trigger.[1]
EX8-064.question: Q: I used this card's [When Digivolving] effect to reduce the DP of an opponent's Digimon to 0, then I played EX8-062 [Piedmon ACE].  Does that EX8-062 [Piedmon ACE]'s [All Turns] effect trigger at such times?

EX8-065.answer: A: EX8-014 [MasterTyrannomon]'s [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect activates first.  As soon as your [Tyrannomon] attacks, the [Your Turn] effects on the 2 copies of this card trigger simultaneously.  The effect on the 1st copy of this card is used to digivolve into EX8-014 [MasterTyrannomon], then EX8-014 [MasterTyrannomon]'s [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect is newly triggered, therefore that effect activates first due to the derived triggering rule.[1]
EX8-065.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this card in the battle area.  My [Tyrannomon] attacks, and I activate the effect on the 1st copy of this card to digivolve it into EX8-014 [MasterTyrannomon].  At such times, does the [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect on the 2nd copy of this card or EX8-014 [MasterTyrannomon] activate first?

EX8-067.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Your Turn] effect to place Digi-Egg cards with the [Mineral] or [Rock] trait from my trash as digivolution cards?

EX8-068.question: Q: Is the "while you have no face-up security cards" condition met when I have 0 cards in my security stack?

EX8-068.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you can't add a card from your security stack to your hand, therefore you only place this card in your security stack.[1]
EX8-068.question: Q: Can I also activate this card’s [Main] effect when I have 0 cards in my security stack?

EX8-068.answer: A: It refers to when the memory gauge is at 1 or further to the left on your side.[1]
EX8-068.question: Q: What position on the memory gauge does "if you have 1 or more memory" refer to?

EX8-068.answer: A: They become face-up security cards that remain revealed.  Other than rules that specify face-up security cards, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security cards.[1]
EX8-068.question: Q: What happens to cards placed face up in the security stack by effects?

EX8-068.answer: A: The check is performed with the card left revealed.  Other than rules for cards left revealed, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security checks.[1]
EX8-068.question: Q: What happens upon a security check for a security card that is placed face-up?
Q: Does a card's [Security] effect trigger upon a security check with that card placed face-up?

EX8-068.answer: A: Any face-up cards are placed face down, then you shuffle the cards.  After shuffling, all cards are left face-down.[1]
EX8-068.question: Q: What happens if I shuffle a security stack that includes security cards placed face-up?

EX8-068.answer: A: Yes, it is not deleted.  This card's [All Turns] effect will activate as soon as you have 1 or more memory, therefore none of your Digimon with the [DS] trait will be deleted in battle.[1]
EX8-068.question: Q: I have this card placed face-up in my security stack.  An opponent's Digimon digivolved, and I now have 1 or more memory.  If my opponent's digivolved Digimon activates an effect and my Digimon with the [DS] trait attacks at such times, can this card's [All Turns] effect prevent my Digimon from being deleted in that battle?

EX8-069.question: Q: Is the "while you have no face-up security cards" condition met when I have 0 cards in my security stack?

EX8-069.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you can't add a card from your security stack to your hand, therefore you only place this card in your security stack.[1]

EX8-069.answer: A: They become face-up security cards that remain revealed.  Other than rules that specify face-up security cards, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security cards.[1]
EX8-069.question: Q: What happens to cards placed face up in the security stack by effects?

EX8-069.answer: A: The check is performed with the card left revealed.  Other than rules for cards left revealed, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security checks.[1]
EX8-069.question: Q: What happens upon a security check for a security card that is placed face-up?
Q: Does a card's [Security] effect trigger upon a security check with that card placed face-up?

EX8-069.answer: A: Any face-up cards are placed face down, then you shuffle the cards.  After shuffling, all cards are left face-down.[1]
EX8-069.question: Q: What happens if I shuffle a security stack that includes security cards placed face-up?

EX8-069.answer: A: Even ＜Alliance＞ is lost, the ＜Security A. +1＞ and added DP remain.[1]
EX8-069.question: Q: I have just this card placed face-up in my security stack.  I used my Digimon with the [NSp] trait to attack, and I activated the ＜Alliance＞ gained from this card's [All Turns] effect.  If this card is then trashed by the 1st [All Turns] effect on my opponent's BT18-055 [AncientTroymon], what happens to the ＜Security A. +1＞ and added DP gained from ＜Alliance＞?

EX8-071.question: Q: Is the "while you have no face-up security cards" condition met when I have 0 cards in my security stack?

EX8-071.answer: A: Yes, you can.  In such cases, you can't add a card from your security stack to your hand, therefore you only place this card in your security stack.[1]

EX8-071.answer: A: They become face-up security cards that remain revealed.  Other than rules that specify face-up security cards, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security cards.[1]
EX8-071.question: Q: What happens to cards placed face up in the security stack by effects?

EX8-071.answer: A: The check is performed with the card left revealed.  Other than rules for cards left revealed, the rules apply in the same manner as standard security checks.[1]
EX8-071.question: Q: What happens upon a security check for a security card that is placed face-up?
Q: Does a card's [Security] effect trigger upon a security check with that card placed face-up?

EX8-071.answer: A: Any face-up cards are placed face down, then you shuffle the cards.  After shuffling, all cards are left face-down.[1]
