EX8-073.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the player can choose the activation order.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: Multiple effects trigger when this card digivolves. In what order do they activate?

EX8-073.answer: A: No, you can't.  If your opponent has a Digimon with 10000 DP or less, you must choose that card and delete it.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 10000 DP or less.  Can I meet the "if this effect didn't delete" condition in this card's [When Digivolving] [End of Attack] effect by not choosing a card to delete?

Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 10000 DP or less.  Can I meet the "if this effect didn't delete" condition in this card's [When Digivolving] [End of Attack] effect by choosing an opponent's Digimon with 10000 DP or less and an effect that prevents deletion?

EX8-073.answer: A: It refers to when the memory gauge is at 0 or further to the right.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: What position on the memory gauge does "while you have 0 or less" memory refer to?

EX8-073.answer: A: This effect prevents Digimon from being affected by effects.  For example, your Digmon won't suspend if it's chosen for a "suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon" effect, and its DP won't be reduced if it's chosen for a "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -3000 DP" effect.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: What does "isn't affected by [...] effects" mean, exactly?

EX8-073.answer: A: Yes, it can be chosen.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: Can a card that has an "isn't affected by [...] effects" effect be chosen for an effect?

EX8-073.answer: A: Yes, it can.  However, it won't be affected by it.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: Can a card that has an "isn't affected by [...] effects" effect be given an effect?

EX8-073.answer: A: As soon as it gains the "isn't affected by [...] effects" effect, it will no longer be affected.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: If a card is affected by an effect, then it later gains an "isn't affected by [...] effects" effect, what happens to the effect that was affecting it?

EX8-073.answer: A: It will be affected by the effect as soon as it can be affected by effects.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: If a card has an "isn't affected by [...] effects" effect, it gains an effect, then it later loses the "isn't affected by [...] effects" effect, what happens to the effect that it gained?

EX8-073.answer: A: No, it doesn’t trigger.  If an effect is given to a Digimon that isn't affected by effects, it won't trigger.[1]
EX8-073.question: Q: A card that has an "isn't affected by [...] effects" effect was given an effect that triggers at a timing such as [When Attacking].  Will the effect trigger if that card later meets the trigger conditions?

EX8-074.answer: A: Yes, you can suspend either player's Digimon.[1]
EX8-074.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to suspend either my Digimon or my opponent's Digimon?

EX8-074.answer: A: No, you can't.  A "by doing X" condition can't be met if only some of the required actions are performed.  The conditions for this card's 1st effect require you to suspend the specified number of Digimon.[1]
EX8-074.question: Q: Can I use the conditions for this card's 1st effect to just suspend 1 Digimon?
Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect trigger when this card itself is played?
Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect trigger when either my Digimon or my opponent's Digimon is played?

LM-002.answer: A: No, you can't.  At the start of your main phase, the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect on 2 of this Digimon simultaneously trigger, then the player determines the activation order. However, because your hand increases to 8 cards from ＜Draw 1＞ on the 1st Digimon, the effect's conditions aren't met for the 2nd Digimon, so the effect doesn't activate. As a result, you only draw 1 card.[1]
LM-002.question: Q: If there are 7 cards in my hand and I have 2 of this Digimon at the start of my main phase, can I draw a total of 2 cards from both instances of this card's effect?

LM-002.answer: A: No, you can't.  Upon the attack declaration, the inherited effects on the 2 copies of this card simultaneously trigger, then the player determines the activation order. However, because your hand increases to 8 cards from ＜Draw 1＞ on the 1st card, the effect's conditions aren't met for the 2nd card, so the effect doesn't activate. As a result, you only draw 1 card.[1]
LM-002.question: Q: If I have 7 cards in my hand upon an attack by my Digimon with 2 of this card in its digivolution cards, can I draw a total of 2 cards from both instances of this card's effect?

LM-003.answer: A: Yes, it is not deleted.[1]
LM-003.question: Q: Does this card's [When Attacking] effect prevent deletion in battles against Security Digimon?

LM-003.answer: A: No. Deletion by ＜Retaliation＞ is deletion by an effect, not deletion in battle.[1]
LM-003.question: Q: Does this card's [When Attacking] effect prevent deletion even when my opponent's deleted Digimon has ＜Retaliation＞?

LM-003.answer: A: No, you can't.  Upon the attack declaration, the inherited effects on the 2 copies of this card simultaneously trigger, then the player determines the activation order. However, because your hand increases to 8 cards from ＜Draw 1＞ on the 1st card, the effect's conditions aren't met for the 2nd card, so the effect doesn't activate. As a result, you only draw 1 card.[1]
LM-003.question: Q: If I have 7 cards in my hand upon an attack by my Digimon with 2 of this card in its digivolution cards, can I draw a total of 2 cards from both instances of this card's effect?

LM-005.question: Q: If I trash 2 blue cards in my hand, can I use this card's [When Digivolving] [When Attacking] effect to trash 1 card under each of 2 of my opponent's Digimon/Tamers?

Q: If this card's [When Attacking] effect activates once from an attack, then this Digimon is unsuspended by an effect, attacks again, and the effect activates again in the same turn, does this Digimon gain 2 total instances of ＜Security A. +1＞, resulting in 2 additional security checks?

LM-006.answer: A: Yes, it can now attack.  This card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect targets "none of their Digimon with no digivolution cards," therefore Digimon that no longer meet the conditions can no longer be effect targets.[1]
LM-006.question: Q: My opponent activated this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect. If my Digimon without digivolution cards then gains digivolution cards by digivolving or other method, can it now attack?

LM-007.answer: A: Yes. If this Digimon is in the battle area at the end of an attack, you must activate the effect.[1]
LM-007.question: Q: Do I have to activate this card's [End of Attack] effect?

LM-009.answer: A: No, you can't.  The digivolution cost is only reduced by 2 when it would digivolve into a card with [Angoramon] in its text.[1]
LM-009.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Your Turn] effect to reduce the digivolution cost by 2 when my Digimon with [Angoramon] in its text would digivolve into a Digimon card without [Angoramon] in its text?

LM-009.answer: A: No, you can't.  As soon as the digivolution is complete, this card becomes a digivolution card, and its effects can no longer activate.[1]
LM-009.question: Q: When this Digimon would digivolve into a Digimon card with the [Angoramon] in its text, I used this card's effect to suspend this Digimon and reduce the digivolution cost by 2. At such times, can I use this card's "when this Digimon becomes suspended" effect to give this Digimon ＜Rush＞?

LM-011.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect give 1 on my Digimon ＜Blocker＞ even when my opponent has no Digimon?

LM-013.answer: A: The top card is returned to the hand and all of the cards under it are trashed.[1]
LM-013.question: Q: I used this card's [When Attacking] effect to play a Digimon card with [Angoramon] in its text. What happens if it digivolves and has a card on top of it at the end of my opponent's turn?

LM-019.question: Q: Can I use this card's [All Turns] effect to delete this Digimon and prevent my Digimon with [Gammamon] in its text from leaving the battle area when this Digimon and my Digimon with [Gammamon] would leave the battle area at the same time due to a single effect?

LM-020.answer: A: It refers to the four card categories: Digi-Egg cards, Digimon cards, Tamer cards, and Option cards.  You declare 1 of these categories at the start of your opponent's turn for this card's effect, your opponent reveals the top card of their deck, and if the revealed card is in the declared category, this Digimon will be unaffected by effects from cards in the declared card category.[1]
LM-020.question: Q: What does "declare 1 card category" in this card's [Start of Opponent's Turn] effect mean, exactly?

LM-020.answer: A: Yes, it can be declared.[2]
LM-020.question: Q: Can this card's [Start of Opponent's Turn] effect declare card categories that do not go into the deck, such as Digi-Egg cards?

LM-020.answer: A: No, it's affected by such effects.  Inherited effects on Tamer cards in digivolution cards of Digimon are treated as Digimon effects.[1]
LM-020.question: Q: I declared Tamer cards for this card's [Start of Opponent's Turn] effect, and a Tamer card was revealed from the deck.  In such cases, is this Digimon unaffected by inherited effects on Tamer cards in digivolution cards of my opponent's Digimon?

LM-020.answer: A: Yes, it isn't affected.  [Security] effects on Security Digimon are treated as Digimon effects, so the "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effect prevents such effects from affecting this Digimon.[1]
LM-020.question: Q: I declared Digimon cards for this card's [Start of Opponent's Turn] effect. If a Digimon card is revealed from the deck, is this Digimon unaffected by [Security] effects activated by Security Digimon?

LM-020.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If your [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] is chosen as the target to place in the security stack, it will ultimately be placed at the bottom of the Digi-Egg deck instead of the security stack according to the rules, but it meets this card's "by placing 1 Digimon on top of its owner's security stack" condition. A card isn't actually added to the security stack, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the security stack" don't trigger.[1]
LM-020.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to return my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] from the battle area to the security stack, reveal all cards in my opponent's security stack, and place 1 card among them at the top of my opponent's deck?

LM-020.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If your token is chosen as the target to place in the security stack, it will ultimately be removed from the game instead of being placed in the security stack according to the rules, but it meets this card's "by placing 1 Digimon on top of its owner's security stack" condition. A card isn't actually added to the security stack, therefore effects such as "when a card is added to the security stack" don't trigger.[1]
LM-020.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to return my token played as a Digimon from the battle area to the hand, reveal all cards in my opponent's security stack, and place 1 card among them at the top of my opponent's deck?

Q: If I choose my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] or token that is treated as a Digimon in the battle area as the target for this card's [When Digivolving] effect, it isn't placed in the security stack. In such cases, do "when a card is removed from the security stack" effects trigger because a card wasn't added to the security stack even though it normally should have been added?

LM-020.answer: A: No. It gains inherited effects.[2]
LM-020.question: Q: Due to this card's [Start of Opponent's Turn] effect, this card no longer gets Digimon effects. At this time, does it no longer get the inherited effects of Digimon cards in this card's digivolution sources?

LM-020.answer: A: Yes, it is not affected by them.[2]
LM-020.question: Q: Due to this card's [Start of Opponent's Turn] effect, this card is no longer affected by Digimon effects. At this time, is this card not affected by the effects of my other Digimon?

LM-021.answer: A: No, this is a standard digivolution requirement for a Digimon card.  It references the number of your security cards, but it's not an effect.[1]
LM-021.question: Q: Is "[Digivolve] While you have 2 or fewer security cards, [Agumon]: Cost 3" a digivolution requirement added by an effect while I have 2 or fewer security cards?

LM-021.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Digivolution is possible as long as you have 2 or fewer security cards when you use <Blast Digivolve>.[1]
LM-021.question: Q: Can I use <Blast Digivolve> to digivolve my [Agumon] into this card in the hand when I have 2 or fewer security cards and an opponent's Digimon attacks?

LM-021.answer: A: No, it can't.  Digivolution from [Agumon] isn't possible because the digivolution requirements aren't met when you use <Blast Digivolve>.[1]
LM-021.question: Q: If an opponent's Digimon attacks when I have 2 or fewer security cards, then an effect adds a card to my security stack so my security stack has 3 or more cards when I use <Blast Digivolve>, can my [Agumon] digivolve into this card in the hand?

LM-021.answer: A: Yes, it can.  Digivolution from [Agumon] is possible as long as the digivolution requirements are met when you use <Blast Digivolve>.[1]
LM-021.question: Q: If an opponent's Digimon attacks when I have 3 security cards, then an effect removes a card from my security stack so my security stack has 2 or fewer cards when I use <Blast Digivolve>, can my [Agumon] digivolve into this card in the hand?
Q: If I use an effect such as P-103 [Offense Training]'s ＜Delay＞ that digivolves a Digimon, can my [Agumon] digivolve into this card in the hand when I have 2 or fewer security cards?

LM-021.answer: A: This effect allows you to choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to the same as this Digimon's DP or less, then you delete all of them.  For example, if this Digimon has 14000 DP when its [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect activates, you can choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose DP adds up to a total of 14000 or less, such as 1 with 10000 DP and 1 with 4000 DP, or 2 of their Digimon with 7000 DP each, then you delete them.[1]
LM-021.question: Q: What does "[On Play] [When Digivolving] Delete your opponent's Digimon up to a total DP equal to this Digimon's DP" mean, exactly?

LM-021.answer: A: Yes, you can choose any targets as long as their total DP adds up to a value less than or equal to this Digimon's DP. However, you must choose at least 1 of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP is equal to or less than this Digimon's DP.[1]
LM-021.question: Q: Can I intentionally choose targets whose total DP adds up to a lower value than this Digimon's DP?

LM-022.answer: A: No, this is a standard digivolution requirement for a Digimon card.  It references the number of your security cards, but it's not an effect.[1]
LM-022.question: Q: Is "[Digivolve] While you have 2 or fewer security cards, [Gabumon]: Cost 3" a digivolution requirement added by an effect while I have 2 or fewer security cards?

LM-022.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Digivolution is possible as long as you have 2 or fewer security cards when you use <Blast Digivolve>.[1]
LM-022.question: Q: Can I use <Blast Digivolve> to digivolve my [Gabumon] into this card in the hand when I have 2 or fewer security cards and an opponent's Digimon attacks?

LM-022.answer: A: No, it can't.  Digivolution from [Gabumon] isn't possible because the digivolution requirements aren't met when you use <Blast Digivolve>.[1]
LM-022.question: Q: If an opponent's Digimon attacks when I have 2 or fewer security cards, then an effect adds a card to my security stack so my security stack has 3 or more cards when I use <Blast Digivolve>, can my [Gabumon] digivolve into this card in the hand?

LM-022.answer: A: Yes, you can.  Digivolution from [Gabumon] is possible as long as the digivolution requirements are met when you use <Blast Digivolve>.[1]
LM-022.question: Q: If an opponent's Digimon attacks when I have 3 security cards, then an effect removes a card from my security stack so my security stack has 2 or fewer cards when I use <Blast Digivolve>, can my [Gabumon] digivolve into this card in the hand?
Q: If I use an effect such as P-103 [Offense Training]'s ＜Delay＞ that digivolves a Digimon, can my [Gabumon] digivolve into this card in the hand when I have 2 or fewer security cards?

LM-023.answer: A: No, you can't.  Option cards that reduce the cost upon use don't change the card's original cost, therefore you can't use this card's effect to place such a card on top of your security stack.[1]
LM-023.question: Q: When I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to place a card on top of my security stack, can I place an Option card with an original cost of 6 or more that has its cost reduced upon use?

LM-023.answer: A: Yes, you can.  If the cost of an Option card consistently changes when it's in the hand and becomes 5 or less due to that card's effect, you can use this card's effect to place it on top of your security stack.[1]
LM-023.question: Q: When I use this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to place an Option card on top of my security stack, can I place an Option card that had its cost reduced to 5 or less by a "reduce the cost of this card in the hand by 1" effect on a card such as BT2-099 [Glorious Burst] or BT8-097 [Crimson Blaze]?

LM-024.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, do I activate both "suspend 1 Digimon, and 1 of your Digimon gets +3000 DP until the end of your opponent's turn" and the "return 1 of your opponent's suspended Digimon to the bottom of the deck" effect when activating this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

LM-024.answer: A: Yes, it isn't affected.  [Security] effects on Security Digimon are treated as Digimon effects, so the "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effect prevents such effects from affecting this Digimon.[1]

LM-026.answer: A: Such effects increase the maximum value shown for DP-based deletion effects.  For example, while "[Your Turn] Add 1000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activated, "[When Digivolving] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less" will allow you to delete an opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.[1]
LM-026.question: Q: What does an "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" effect do?

LM-026.answer: A: No, it can't be increased.  You can't increase the maximum of a DP-based deletion effect that doesn't show a numerical value.[1]
LM-026.question: Q: If "add X000 to the maximum your DP-based deletion effects can delete" is activating, can the maximum be increased for an effect such as "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with DP less than or equal to this Digimon's DP" that references a Digimon's DP for deletion?

LM-026.answer: A: This effect adds the upper limit of the value texted in the DP deletion effect. For example, while "[On Opponent's Turn] Upper limit of DP deletion effect you activate +1000." is active, "[When Digivolving] Delete an opponent Digimon with a DP of 3000 or less." will cause the opponent Digimon with a DP of 4000 or less to be deleted.[2]
LM-026.question: Q: What does "DP deletion effect limit +X000" mean?

LM-026.answer: A: No, it cannot be added. You cannot add the upper limit of a DP deletion effect for which no numerical value is texted.[2]

P-143.answer: A: No, they can't.  Digimon in breeding areas can't be chosen as attack targets.[2]
P-143.question: Q: Can my opponent declare an attack with this Digimon as the target when this Digimon is suspended in the breeding area?

P-144.question: Q: If a Digimon card with the [X Antibody] trait is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, can this Digimon attack?

P-145.answer: A: No, it doesn’t activate.  [EX5-070 X Antibody Proto Form]'s inherited effect will trigger/activate "when this Digimon would leave the battle area other than by one of your effects," but since [EX5-070 X Antibody Proto Form] isn't in this Digimon's digivolution cards at the time of activation of the [On Deletion] effect because it's placed in your security stack before this Digimon is deleted, the "if [X Antibody] was in this Digimon's digivolution cards" condition isn't met, so the effect doesn't activate.[1]
P-145.question: Q: If [EX5-070 X Antibody Proto Form] is in this Digimon's digivolution cards, this Digimon would be deleted, and [EX5-070 X Antibody Proto Form]'s inherited effect places it on top of my security stack, does this Digimon's [On Deletion] effect activate?

P-146.question: Q: If my Digimon with 2 copies of this card in its digivolution cards would be deleted, can I activate both instances of this card's inherited effect and place both copies at the bottom of my security stack?
Q: If my Digimon with ＜Barrier＞ and this card in its digivolution cards would be deleted, can I activate both this card's inherited effect and ＜Barrier＞?

P-147.answer: A: No, you can't.  This effect requires you to activate a [When Digivolving] effect if present on the placed Digimon card.[1]
P-147.question: Q: Can I choose to not activate a [When Digivolving] effect on the placed Digimon card for this card's [When Attacking] effect?
Q: Can I use this card’s [When Attacking] effect to place 1 level 4 card with [Pulsemon] in its text that doesn't have a [When Digivolving] effect as a digivolution card?

P-150.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in my security stack, can I activate both the "suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon or Tamers" effect and the "1 of their Digimon or Tamers can't unsuspend until the end of their turn" effect when activating this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

P-151.answer: A: Yes, you can.  You can activate the part of the effect after "then" regardless of whether or not you could add a card with the [LIBERATOR] trait to your hand.[1]
P-151.question: Q: If the 3 cards revealed for this card's [Main] effect don't include a card with the [LIBERATOR] trait, can I still play 1 card with the [LIBERATOR] trait and a play cost of 3 or less from my hand without paying the cost?

P-152.answer: A: This card can digivolve from [Shoutmon] with a play cost of 4 or less or a [Dorulumon] with a play of cost 4 or less for a cost of 0.[1]
P-152.question: Q: When is digivolution possible with this card's digivolution requirements?

P-154.answer: A: No, only the Digimon where this card was placed as the bottom digivolution card is prevented from leaving the battle area.[1]

P-155.answer: A: This effect trashes an Option card that was placed by a "place this card in the battle area" effect.[1]

P-156.answer: A: It refers to a card that has 1 of the same colors as the specified card.[1]
P-156.question: Q: What colors of cards does "the same color" as the specified card refer to?

Q: If I choose a red and blue 2-color Tamer for this card's [Main] effect, can I play a single-color red or blue Digimon card?

P-160.answer: A: The effects trigger simultaneously, so the player can choose the activation order.[1]
P-160.question: Q: Multiple effects trigger when this card attacks. In what order do they activate?

P-160.answer: A: No, you can't.  If an effect is lost while it's pending activation, it can no longer be activated.[1]

P-165.answer: A: It isn't deleted at this timing, it's deleted at the end of your opponent's next turn.[1]

Then, if this card was checked upon that Digimon's attack and this card was played using its [Security] effect, when do I delete the [Familiar] Token that was played by this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect?

P-166.answer: A: This card's effect reduces the digivolution cost by 2, and the total digivolution cost reduction when combined with BT3-103 [Hidden Potential Discovered!]   is 7.[1]
P-166.question: Q: I used BT3-103 [Hidden Potential Discovered!],   then I played this card.  I then used this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to suspend 1 other Digimon.  If I use BT3-103 [Hidden Potential Discovered!]'s   effect to suspend one of my Digimon other than this card when I use the part of the effect after "then" to digivolve this card, how much is the digivolution cost reduced by this card's effect?

P-169.answer: A: This effect will trigger when a card is trashed from the digivolution cards of your Digimon with the [Mineral] trait or your Digimon with the [Rock] trait.  It doesn't require a specific card to be trashed from digivolution cards.[1]

P-170.answer: A: It refers to cards with the specified word or icon included in "name, trait, effect, inherited effect, <Overflow X>, jogress, digivolution requirements, burst digivolution". For example, a card with the text "Knightmon" refers to a card whose name is "Dark Knightmon" or whose effect says "Knightmon".[1]

P-172.answer: A: No, they will not be deleted at that time. After all of this card's [On Play] and [On Deletion] effects are resolved, all Digimon with DP 0 at that time will be deleted at the same time.[1]

P-183.answer: A: You can give that effect to such Digimon, but Digimon that aren't affected by effects won't be affected by it, therefore the gained effect won't trigger.[1]

P-187.answer: A: Yes, you can place it as the top or bottom security card.[1]

A deck may not have more than 4 total copies of this and [P-009]" has been changed to "(Rule) Card Number: Also treated as [P-009]. A deck may not have more than 4 total copies of this and [P-009].")

RB1-005.answer: A: No, it doesn’t. You can only reference the top card among stacked cards for ""XX in its text."" Therefore, this card will not be the top card when it is a digivolution card, and you can't reference its own text.[1]

RB1-005.answer: A: No. If you have cards that are targets of this effect, you must add as many cards to your hand as possible. RB1-005.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck for this card's [On Play] effect include both a [Hiro Amanokawa] with [Gammamon] in its text and a non-[Hiro Amanokawa] card with [Gammamon] in its text, can I choose to only add one of them to my hand, and place the remaining cards at the bottom of my deck?

Therefore, [When Digivolving] effects are gained and will trigger.[1]

RB1-009.answer: A: Yes, if the memory gauge is now at 1 or greater on your opponent's side, you can activate ＜Blitz＞ .[1]

RB1-010.answer: A: Yes, you can. This card's [Your Turn] effect reads ""you may unsuspend."" Therefore, if you don't unsuspend this Digimon, it means you haven't yet used this [Once Per Turn] effect, and you can activate it when you delete an opponent's Digimon upon a different timing.[1]

RB1-023.answer: A: No, this card's [All Turns] effect and inherited effect don't affect the inherited effects of digivolution cards with [Gammamon].[1]

RB1-025.answer: A: No, you can't. At the end of your turn, all of these cards' [End of Your Turn] effects will trigger at the same time, but after you choose the activation order, declare the attack for the 1st Digimon, and effects such as [When Attacking] effects and ""when one of your Digimon attacks"" effects have finished activating, then the timing will occur for the activation of the [End of Your Turn] effects on the 2nd and other copies of this card that were pending activation. However, since the 1st Digimon is already attacking, you can't declare another attack and the effect activation will fail.  As a result, only the copy that activated first will attack.[1]

RB1-025.answer: A: Yes, you can. At the end of your turn, this card and [RB1-034 Ruli Tsukiyono]'s effects trigger at the same time, so you can attack if you first activate [RB1-034 Ruli Tsukiyono]'s effect and then unsuspend this card.[1]
RB1-025.question: Q: I used my [RB1-034 Ruli Tsukiyono]'s [End of Your Turn] effect to unsuspend this card while it was suspended.  In such cases, can I use this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to attack?

RB1-034.question: Q: I used this card's [End of Your Turn] effect to unsuspend my [RB1-025 Diarbbitmon] while it was suspended.  In such cases, can I use [RB1-025 Diarbbitmon]'s [End of Your Turn] effect to attack?

RB1-035.answer: A: Yes, you can. However, Lv.- Digimon don't have a level, so the "gain 1 memory if that Digimon is level 4 or higher, and ＜Draw 1＞ if it is level 3" effect doesn't activate.[1]

RB1-035.answer: A: Both of the conditions are fulfilled, so you gain both 1 memory and ＜Draw 1＞.[1]

RB1-035.answer: A: No, you don't. You only ＜Draw 1＞ once even if multiple level 3 Digimon are played, and you similarly only gain 1 memory even if multiple level 4 or higher Digimon are played.[1]

ST1-15.answer: A: They are sent to their owner's trash.[1]

ST10-02.answer: A: At the end of your turn, this effect allows you DNA digivolve a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, along with one of your other Digimon, into a Digimon in your hand that has [DNA Digivolution]. Note that this happens before it becomes your opponent’s turn.[1]
ST10-02.question: Q: How does this card’s inherited effect work, exactly?

Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate when an attack target is switched for a Digimon other than a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards?

ST15-14.answer: A: Yes. Blocking causes the attack target to be switched, so the effect activates.[1]

ST15-15.answer: A: Yes, it can be blocked. ＜Blocker＞ is an effect that allows the Digimon with the effect to block, so it isn't affected by "isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effects.[1]
ST15-15.question: Q: When my Digimon with [Greymon] isn't affected by my opponent's Digimon's effects from this card's [Main] effect, can it be blocked by an opponent's Digimon?

ST15-15.answer: A: No, it isn't affected.  [Security] effects on Security Digimon are treated as Digimon effects, so the "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon" effect prevents such effects from affecting this Digimon.[1]
ST15-15.question: Q: When my Digimon with [Greymon] isn't affected by my opponent's Digimon's effects from this card's [Main] effect, is it affected by [Security] effects on my opponent's Digimon?

ST15-16.answer: A: Yes, you can. However, in such cases, the attack isn't performed due to the "this Digimon can't attack" effect.[1]
ST15-16.question: Q: Can I choose an opponent's Digimon with a "this Digimon can't attack" effect as the target for "[Start of Your Main Phase] Attack with this Digimon" when I activate this card's [Main] effect?

ST15-16.answer: A: At the start of your opponent's main phase, the effects gained from this card's effect are triggered at the same time, and your opponent determines which one activates first. After effects such as [When Attacking] have activated, and before the counter timing occurs, it is time to activate the effect of the 2nd Digimon that was pending activation. However, since the 1st Digimon is already attacking, the effect ends without an attack made. As a result, only the Digimon whose effect was activated first can attack.[1]
ST15-16.question: Q: What happens if I use this card twice and 2 of my opponent's Digimon gain the "[Start of Your Main Phase] Attack with this Digimon" effect?

ST15-16.answer: A: Yes, you can. In such cases, as soon as it becomes your opponent's turn, the target opposing Digimon loses the "this Digimon isn't affected by your opponent’s effects" effect, and the attack occurs at the start of the main phase by this card's effect.[1]
ST15-16.question: Q: Can I choose an opponent's Digimon with an "[Opponent's Turn] This Digimon isn't affected by your opponent’s effects" effect as the target for "[Start of Your Main Phase] Attack with this Digimon" when I activate this card's [Main] effect?

ST16-03.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding areas aren't checked by this effect.[1]

ST16-05.answer: A: No. Even if this Digimon is blocked, the effect doesn't activate if you declared an attack against your opponent.[1]

You can't trash past level 3 cards.)?

ST17-08.answer: A: No, it doesn't unsuspend.  The target Digimon is unaffected by this card's effect during the turn it activated, but the "this Digimon isn't affected by the effects of your opponent’s Digimon until the end of your opponent's turn" effect is lost when the turn switches, and then this card's effect prevents it from unsuspending.[1]

ST20-15.answer: A: Any face-up cards are placed face down, then you shuffle the cards.After shuffling, all cards are left face-down.[1]

ST21-02.answer: A: With this effect, your opponent's memory will no longer increase by any effects except Tamer effects. This effect affects the opponent player.[1]

ST3-07.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if this Digimon's attack effect causes your memory to move to 1 or greater on your opponent's side, it doesn't become your opponent's turn until the end of the attack.[1]

ST3-08.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to target one of my opponent's Digimon with 1000 DP or less and delete it?

ST3-08.answer: A: No battle occurs, and the attack ends. If there are other effects to activate (When Attacking effects, etc.), the attack ends after activating them.[1]
ST3-08.question: Q: A Digimon with this card as a digivolution card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then that Digimon's DP is reduced to 0 and deleted by this card's inherited effect. What happens to the attack?

ST3-08.answer: A: No, blocking can only be performed in the blocker timing that occurs after all [When Attacking] effects finish resolving. As such, once a block has been declared, the window for activating this card's inherited effect has already passed, so it can't be activated.[1]
ST3-08.question: Q: A Digimon with this card as a digivolution card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then the opponent blocks with a Digimon that has ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's inherited effect to reduce the DP of the blocking Digimon to 0 and delete it?

ST3-09.answer: A: Yes, you do. This effect behaves the same way as an effect that reads "If you have 3 or fewer security cards", so the condition is checked when the effect would be activated.
ST3-09.question: Q: I digivolve into this card while I have 4 or more security cards. While this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect is pending activation, one of my other effects reduces my security cards to 3 or fewer. Do I?

ST3-11.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to target one of my opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less, reduce its DP to 0, and delete it?

ST3-11.answer: A: No battle occurs, and the attack ends. If there are other effects to activate (When Attacking effects, etc.), the attack ends after activating them.[1]
ST3-11.question: Q: This card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then that Digimon's DP is reduced to 0 and deleted by this card's effect. What happens to the attack?

ST3-11.answer: A: No. ＜Blocker＞ and other effects that activate when an opponent's Digimon attacks only activate during the reaction timing window that occurs after When Attacking effects, etc. finish activating. As such, once a block has been declared, the window for activating this card's inherited effect has already passed, so it can't be activated.[1]
ST3-11.question: Q: This card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then my opponent blocks with a Digimon that has ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's effect to reduce the DP of the blocking Digimon to 0 and delete it?

ST3-12.answer: A: Yes. It doesn't affect normal Digimon.[1]

ST3-15.answer: A: That Digimon can't perform security checks, so the battle ends. Even if your opponent has no cards in their security stack, you would not win the game by attacking with that Digimon.[1]

ST3-15.answer: A: It would still check 0 cards. In order to check 1 or more security cards, that Digimon would need to gain <Security Attack +3> or higher.[1]

ST4-11.answer: A: No, this effect only trashes the top card of your opponent's security stack. It doesn't win you the game if it's empty.[1]

ST4-12.answer: A: Yes. The effect simply prevents the Digimon from attacking or blocking. You can still attack it.[1]

ST4-12.answer: A: No, the effect persists, even if they digivolve.[1]

ST4-12.answer: A: The effect preventing it from attacking takes priority. Your opponent's Digimon still can't attack.[1]

ST5-04.answer: A: No, it doesn't. They attacked this turn, so the effect doesn't apply.[1]

ST6-12.answer: A: Even if the Digimon digivolves or degenerates, the effect it received is inherited, so the <Digivolve> is still given.[2]

ST6-13.question: Q: I use this card's <Digi-Burst> to trash a purple level 3 Digimon card in the Digimon with <Digi-Burst>'s digivolution cards. Can I immediately use the <Digi-Burst> effect to play that Digimon without paying its memory cost?

ST6-15.answer: A: No. You must fully activate this card's effect, then activate the [When Deleted] effect.[1]

ST6-15.answer: A: They activate at the same time, which means the turn player resolves their effect first.[1]

ST6-16.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you only have a level 3 or level 4 purple Digimon card in your trash, you can play it.[1]

ST6-16.answer: A: Yes, you can use it. If there is only one Digimon card, either the purple Lv.3 or Lv.4 Digimon card, only the one in trash will be played.[2]
ST6-16.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect even if I have only one purple Lv.3 or Lv.4 Digimon card in my trash?

ST6-16.answer: A: One "Purple Lv.3 Digimon card" and one "Purple Lv.4 Digimon card".[3]

ST7-03.answer: A: No. This card is placed in your trash before the effect can activate. It’s no longer in your battle area, so it doesn't activate.[1]

ST7-06.answer: A: No, it's treated as a normal Digimon once it comes into play.[1]

ST7-06.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the battle's outcome, you get to play this Digimon at the end of the battle.[1]

ST7-06.answer: A: This Digimon is played before your opponent's next security check.   Likewise, this Digimon’s [On Play] effect activates before your opponent’s next checks.[1]

Once the battle ends, the attacking Digimon still has security checks remaining. Is this card played off its [Security] effect first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?   Also, when does this Digimon’s [On Play] effect activate?

ST7-09.answer: A: “If you don't” refers to a state such as in which, when resolving this Digimon’s [When Attacking] effect, your opponent doesn't have a Digimon with 4000 DP or less in play, or your opponent has a Digimon that can't be deleted with the effect. Essentially, if your opponent doesn't have a Digimon that can be deleted by “Delete 1 of your opponent’s Digimon with 4000 DP or less,” follow the instructions listed after “If you don't”.[1]
ST7-09.question: Q: This card’s [When Attacking] effect reads, “Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less. If you don't...” What does “If you don't” refer to?

ST7-09.answer: A: No. If you activate this card’s [When Attacking] effect and your opponent has a Digimon with 4000 DP or less in play, you must choose that Digimon as the target of the effect. If a valid target exists, you must choose it.[1]
ST7-09.question: Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 4000 DP or less in play. Can I choose not to delete my opponent’s Digimon so that this Digimon gets +3000 DP?

ST7-09.answer: A: Yes. If you chose your opponent’s Digimon with 4000 DP or less as a target, it counts for this card’s effect, even if the chosen Digimon has an effect that prevents it from being deleted.[1]
ST7-09.question: Q: My opponent has a Digimon with 4000 DP or less and an effect that reads, “This Digimon can't be deleted by your opponent’s effects,” and another Digimon with 4000 DP or less but no effect. Can I intentionally choose the Digimon with the effect preventing deletion to have this Digimon gain +3000 DP?

ST7-11.answer: A: No. If the number of cards in your security stack is less than or equal to your opponent’s at the time you use this card, the effect doesn't go away, even if your opponent loses security cards later.[1]
ST7-11.question: Q: I use this card, and my opponent and I both have the same number of cards in our security stacks. Later, my opponent loses a security card. When this happens, do I remove ＜Security A. +1＞ from this card’s effect?

ST7-12.answer: A: You can choose any number of your opponent's Digimon, as long as the DP of the chosen Digimon adds up to 8000 or less. For example, you could choose 1 Digimon with 3000 DP + 1 Digimon with 5000 DP, or 2 Digimon with 2000 DP + 1 Digimon with 3000 DP.[1]
ST7-12.question: Q: What does “Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 8000 or less” mean, exactly?

ST7-12.answer: A: Yes. As long as the total DP of the chosen cards is 8000 DP or less, you can choose as many or as few cards as you like. However, note that you must choose a minimum of 1 Digimon with 8000 DP or less.[1]
ST7-12.question: Q: Can I choose fewer cards than possible, even if the DP of the chosen cards adds up to less than 8000?

ST7-12.answer: A: No. When [Golemon] is deleted, reducing the DP of your opponent’s Digimon, this card’s effect will have already finished activating. As such, you cannot choose additional Digimon with this card’s effect midway.[1]
ST7-12.question: Q: My opponent has a [BT4-066 Golemon] in play. If [BT4-066 Golemon] is chosen as part of this card’s effect, [BT4-066 Golemon]’s deletion will cause my opponent’s black Digimon to each receive -1000 DP. Can I choose more of my opponent’s Digimon with this card’s effect to cover the gap to reach 8000 DP?

ST8-01.answer: A: Yes. The inherited effect activates as soon as you have 8 cards in your hand, so the Digimon gets +1000 DP for the rest of the attack.[1]
ST8-01.question: Q: I have 7 cards in my hand. I attack with a Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards, and ＜Draw 1＞ from the [When Attacking] effect. I now have 8 cards in my hand. Is this card played off its [Security] effect first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?   Also, when does this Digimon’s [On Play] effect activate?

ST8-08.answer: A: Yes. The inherited effect activates as soon as you have 8 cards in your hand, so the Digimon gets ＜Security A. +1＞ for the rest of the attack.[1]
ST8-08.question: Q: When I had 7 cards in my hand, I attacked with a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, and ＜Draw 1＞ activated from a [When Attacking] effect. I now have 8 cards, so does that attack perform a security check with this card's inherited effect of ＜Security A. +1＞?

ST8-09.answer: A: If you attack with this Digimon, your opponent's Digimon can't change the target of attack by activating ＜Blocker＞.[1]

ST8-10.answer: A: Yes. If you have this card’s effect activate after ＜Draw 1＞, you'll have 8 cards in your hand at the time of activation, allowing you to unsuspend this Digimon.[1]
ST8-10.question: Q: I have 7 cards in my hand. I attack with this Digimon, and ＜Draw 1＞ from its [When Attacking] effect. I now have 8 cards in my hand. Does this card’s effect cause this Digimon to become unsuspended?

ST9-01.answer: A: Yes, if a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself blue, the effect activates.[1]

ST9-02.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, "Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck," so if possible, you must reveal 3 cards. If you have fewer than 3 cards left in your deck, reveal as many as you can.[1]
ST9-02.question: Q: Does this card’s [On Play] effect force me to reveal 3 cards from the top of my deck?

ST9-02.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “Add 1 card...to your hand,” so if you reveal a card that meets the requirements, you must add it to your hand.[1]
ST9-02.question: Q: This card's [On Play] effect reveals cards from the top of my deck. If I reveal a card with [Free] in its traits, do I have to add it to my hand?

ST9-04.answer: A: Yes, if a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself green, the effect activates.[1]
ST9-04.question: Q: If the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself green, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

ST9-05.answer: A: Yes, if a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself green, the effect activates.[1]
ST9-05.question: Q: If the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself green, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

ST9-06.answer: A: No. The effect reads, “you may,” so you can choose whether to play them.　However, if you choose to play them, you must play as many cards as possible.  If there are both a level 4 or lower blue Digimon card and a level 4 or lower green Digimon card in the digivolution cards, you can't choose to only play one of them.[1]
ST9-06.question: Q: If there’s both a level 4 or lower blue Digimon card and a level 4 or lower green Digimon card in this Digimon’s digivolution cards, does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect require me to play both of them?

ST9-07.answer: A: No. The [When Attacking] effect activates before reaction timing, which is when ＜Blocker＞ triggers. By the time reaction timing occurs, this Digimon no longer has ＜Blocker＞, so it cannot block.[1]
ST9-07.question: Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon and deletes my only blue Digimon with its [When Attacking] effect. I have no other blue Digimon in play, but can I still block the attack with this Digimon?

ST9-08.answer: A: At the end of your turn, this effect allows you DNA digivolve a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, along with one of your other Digimon, into a Digimon in your hand that has [DNA Digivolution]. Note that this happens before it becomes your opponent’s turn.[1]
ST9-08.question: Q: How does this card’s inherited effect work, exactly?

ST9-08.answer: A: No. You can’t ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn’t have [DNA Digivolution].[1]
ST9-08.question: Q: With this card's inherited effect, can I DNA digivolve into a Digimon card in my hand that doesn’t have [DNA Digivolution]?

ST9-08.answer: A: No. You can’t ignore the digivolution requirements, so you can’t DNA digivolve using Digimon that aren’t specified in [DNA Digivolution].[2]
ST9-08.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect allow me to DNA digivolve into a card other than the Digimon specified by [DNA Digivolution] in the hand?

ST9-09.answer: A: Yes, if a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself blue, the effect activates.[1]
ST9-09.question: Q: If the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is itself blue, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

ST9-10.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the battle's outcome, you get to play this Digimon at the end of the battle.[1]
ST9-10.question: Q: Can I play this Digimon with its [Security] effect even if it loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?
Q: Does this card’s [On Play] effect activate when played with this card’s [Security] effect?

ST9-10.answer: A: This Digimon is played after the battle with the attacking Digimon, and before the next check is performed.  Likewise, this Digimon’s [On Play] effect activates before your opponent’s next check.[1]
ST9-10.question: Q: This card is flipped over during a security check, but the attacking Digimon still has security checks remaining. Does this Digimon’s effect activate first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?

ST9-11.answer: A: When performing a non-DNA digivolution, only the “Suspend 1 of your opponent’s Digimon” part of the effect activates. The part of the effect that reads, “that Digimon doesn't unsuspend during its owner’s next unsuspend phase” only activates when DNA digivolving.[1]
ST9-11.question: Q: Does this card’s [When Digivolving] effect activate when performing a non-DNA digivolution?

ST9-11.answer: A: No, only the colors of the top card are counted. If the card is a mono-colored Digimon card, it will be counted as a single color, even if its digivolution cards are different colors.[1]
ST9-11.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect also count the colors of its digivolution cards?

ST9-14.question: Q: I use this card’s effect to suspend 1 of my opponent’s Digimon. Can I then use this effect to return a different suspended Digimon to its owner’s hand?

ST9-15.question: Q: I use this card’s effect to give 1 of my Digimon +2000 DP. Can I then use this effect to give another Digimon ＜Piercing＞?
